unique_selling_points: ["Community-led conservation of cenotes","Exploration of virgin jungle and wildlife","Authentic regional meal with community host","Visit to three uniquely shaped cenotes"]
one_line_summary: Explore pristine cenotes and virgin jungle with community-led conservation in Chemuyil
bussines_description:
Supplier: Bejil Ha
General Description: Title: The Ancestral Waters of Chemuyil | Description: Today you will arrive at the community of Chemuyil, where your local guide will be waiting to welcome you. This project was started by five young people from the community of Chemuyil who seek to raise awareness and preserve the cenotes where they used to live and play during their childhood. Their initiative allows visitors to explore virgin jungles, discover wildlife and be one with nature.

This experience of approximately 7 hours combines transportation in a vehicle with a walk through the jungle. You will visit three cenotes of different shapes and sizes. This adventure invites you to connect, observe and enjoy the magic and tranquility of these sites. You will appreciate from a different perspective all the gifts that nature offers us. Before heading back, you will take a break and enjoy a snack of seasonal fruits and water. To end the excursion, you will visit the home of a community host to enjoy a delicious regional meal.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Las Aguas Ancestrales - 6h - SPA | serviceDescription: Las Aguas Ancestrales | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Quintana Roo
Location: address: Chemuyil, Quintana Roo, México https://goo.gl/maps/sPu44g5EoCQ2taSM8 | locations: Chemuyil

unique_selling_points: ["Interconnected cenotes with crystal waters","Snorkeling in the 'second eye' for tranquility","Exploration of the 'Bat Cave' with midwater hallway","Educational experience on Riviera Maya history and legends"]
one_line_summary: Explore Quintana Roo's stunning interconnected cenotes and underwater caves in a 4-hour snorkeling &
bussines_description:
Supplier: Turquesa tours
General Description: Title: Dos Ojos: Quintana Roo’s wonders in snorkeling | Description: Today, your local guide in English will pick you up to join a group of travelers to take you on a tour of approximately four hours to learn about the Dos Ojos Cenote, which has two interconnected cenotes of crystal waters. On your way to the cenotes, there will be an explanation concerning the Riviera Maya history, legends, and land particularities. Once at your destination, there will be an introduction to this place’s facilities (services, showers, etc.) along with the snorkeling explanation in the “second eye” since in the first one, you will only enjoy the tranquility of this place as long as you refresh and relax; snorkeling will let you observe geological formations and the transparency of the water, home for freshwater fish. If you like adventure, you will enter a midwater hallway to access the famous “Bat Cave”; finally, you will appreciate stalactites and stalagmites in a dry cave.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Snorkel in 1 cenote: 2 ojos - 4h - ENG | serviceDescription: Snorkel in 1 cenote: 2 ojos | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Quintana Roo
Location: address: Playa del Carmen, Quintana Roo, México | locations: Playa del Carmen, Cozumel, Puerto Morelos

unique_selling_points: ["Exploration of Mérida's historic streets","Visit to the first cathedral in Continental America","Murals depicting Yucatán's history by Fernando Castro Pacheco","Architectural gem Casa Montejo Museum"]
one_line_summary: Explore Mérida's historic streets, architecture, and rich cultural heritage in a 4-hour guided tour.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Xóchitl del Rosario
General Description: Title: Walking tour of the historic centre of Mérida | Description: Today, you will embark on a walking tour of approximately four hours with your English-speaking local guide. Together, you will explore the streets of Mérida, known as the White City, built on the ancient Mayan city of Ichcaanzihó, also called T|Hó. The first stop will be the Lucas de Gálvez Market, where you can observe the daily life of the locals as you wander through this vibrant space. Next, you will visit the Cathedral of San Ildefonso, built in 1562, the first cathedral in Continental America and a symbol of the region’s historical and architectural richness.

As the tour continues, you will head to the Government Palace, home to a series of monumental murals by the artist Fernando Castro Pacheco, depicting the history of Yucatán from pre-Hispanic times to the struggle for social justice. The final stop will be the Casa Montejo Museum, a Renaissance plateresque architectural gem from the 16th century, built between 1542 and 1549 by order of Francisco de Montejo. At the end of the tour, you can choose to continue exploring the city with your guide|s recommendations or return to your hotel on your own.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Walking tour of Merida's historic center - 4h - ENG | serviceDescription: Walking tour of Merida's historic center | serviceType: Guía | destinationName: Yucatan
Location: address: Mérida, Yucatán, México | locations: Mérida

unique_selling_points: ["UNESCO World Heritage Site","Rich natural and cultural history","Spectacular semi-arid landscape","Ancient columnar cacti and salt hills"]
one_line_summary: Full-day tour exploring Tehuacán Biosphere Reserve's stunning landscapes and history
bussines_description:
Supplier: Unlimited experiences
General Description: Title: Tehuacán Biosphere Reserve Tour | Description: Today, your transportation and Spanish-speaking local guide will pick you up for a 13-hour tour of the Tehuacán Biosphere Reserve. The tour will begin in the municipality of Tehuacán, approximately 2 hours away from Puebla. The first stop will be at the Museum of Evolution, which houses a collection of fossils, replicas, and archaeological artefacts that showcase the region's rich natural and cultural history. Here, you will learn about the evolution of species, local flora and fauna, and the importance of conservation and environmental protection. Afterwards, you will visit the Zocalo of Tehuacán and the Church of Carmen.


Next, you will return to the transportation and head to the Tehuacán Biosphere Reserve, which is less than 50 minutes away by transport. This protected area covers approximately 490,186 hectares and has been recognized as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. During the journey, you will have the opportunity to admire ancient columnar cacti and salt hills. Once in reserve, you will embark on a tour to enjoy the impressive landscape, including mountains, canyons, ravines, xerophilous shrubs, and species adapted to the semi-arid conditions of the region. After the tour, you will return to your hotel.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Tehuacan Biosphere Reserve - 13h - SPA | serviceDescription: Tehuacan Biosphere Reserve | serviceType: Operadora local, Transporte | destinationName: Puebla Area
Location: address: Av. Don Juan de Palafox y. Mendoza entre calle Ayuntamiento y Calle 2 Norte, Centro histórico de Puebla, 72000 Heroica Puebla de Zaragoza, Pue. | locations: Puebla

unique_selling_points: ["Sunrise kayaking experience in Xochimilco","Birdwatching with native species","Scenic views of hills and volcanoes","Expert guide for species identification"]
one_line_summary: Kayak at sunrise through Xochimilco’s wetlands with birdwatching and scenic views
bussines_description:
Supplier: OlinTlalli
General Description: Title: Sunrise in Xochimilco | Description: On this tour, you will have the opportunity to paddle a kayak through the canals of Xochimilco just before sunrise. The calm and serenity of the reserve will envelop you as you navigate towards the Apatlaco canal. In addition, you will enjoy a view of the hills and volcanoes in the distance, all illuminated by the first rays of daylight.

As you paddle the kayak, you will be surrounded by a myriad of birds that begin to wake up and fly around the area. Your English-speaking guide will help you identify and learn about the species that inhabit the Xochimilco Ecological Reserve. During the three-hour tour, you will be able to admire the great variety of flora and fauna that inhabit the wetlands.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Xochimilco at sunrise by kayak - 3h - ENG | serviceDescription: Xochimilco at sunrise by kayak | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Mexico Area
Location: address: Xochimilco, CDMX, México | locations: Mexico City

unique_selling_points: ["Interactive workshop on Tzompantli history","Create a personalized skull offering","Experience traditional Mexican cuisine"]
one_line_summary: Learn and create a Tzompantli skull mosaic celebrating Mexican heritage
bussines_description:
Supplier: Sensaciones Turísticas
General Description: Title: Day of the Dead: Tzompantli Workshop | Description: Today you will experience an approximately 3-hour activity related to the Day of the Dead celebration. Along with your local English-speaking guide, you will participate in a workshop where the meaning of Tzompantli will be explained. Tzompantli was a kind of altar or platform where the skulls of victims were displayed as a symbol of power and to honor the gods. This historical event precedes the current Day of the Dead festival.

After the explanation, you will move to the working area to decorate a clay mosaic representing a skull. You can dedicate this skull as an offering to one of your departed loved ones. The skull will be placed on the wall of the Tzompantli. At the end of the workshop, you will enjoy a tasting of local dishes and a traditional pan de muerto (bread of the dead) accompanied by a delicious hot chocolate.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Tzompantli workshop - 1.5h - ENG | serviceDescription: Tzompantli workshop | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Jalisco
Location: address: Guadalajara, Jalisco, México | locations: Guadalajara

General Description: Title: Hot air balloon ride in Teotihuacan | Description: Today your English speaking local guide will meet you at your hotel and together with your fellow travellers you will head out of Mexico City to the valley of Teotihuacan to begin your 5 hour experience. Upon arrival, you will have breakfast and then board a hot air balloon for a 40 minute ride to appreciate a panoramic view of this emblematic place, where you will appreciate the City of the Gods and your guide will tell you about its history and all the mysteries of this ancient civilization, where you will see buildings such as the Pyramid of the Sun and the Pyramid of the Moon.  At the end of the designated time your transportation will take you back to Mexico City, where your tour will end.

one_line_summary: Learn traditional hammock weaving with Mayan artisans in Yaxunah.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Parador Turístico Yaxunah
General Description: Title: Hammock Warping Workshop in Yaxunah | Description: Take part in this experience of approximately 1 hour. In this hammock weaving workshop, you will be able to witness the hammock making process, learning about the different techniques used. You will even have the opportunity to actively participate and follow the rhythm of the artisans. The women who make up this workshop are members of the Káanbal Kuxtal group, whose name in Mayan means learning to live. The income generated by the sales of their creations contributes to the education of their children, thus strengthening the community.

unique_selling_points: ["Authentic mole preparation in traditional clay pots","Use of locally sourced ingredients from Puebla region","Guided by an English-speaking chef with detailed recipe booklet","Includes tasting of finished dish and aguas frescas"]
one_line_summary: Learn to make authentic Mole Poblano in a traditional Puebla culinary workshop
bussines_description:
Supplier: Teoxintle Taller
General Description: Title: Learn to prepare the traditional Mole Poblano in a gastronomic workshop | Description: Today, you will have the opportunity to learn how to prepare one of Mexico"s most traditional dishes: the famous Mole Poblano. This culinary experience will take place in a location in Cautlancingo, Puebla. For approximately two and a half hours, you can enjoy this activity that will begin with a tasting of delicious coffee. The English-speaking chef will accompany you and provide you with a detailed recipe booklet, allowing you to follow each step of the preparation.

Using locally sourced ingredients from the region and small local producers, the chef will guide you in preparing the mole, explaining the history behind each ingredient. All of this will be done in clay pots, adding an authentic touch to the culinary experience. At the end, you will have the opportunity to taste your creation, accompanied by refreshing aguas frescas.

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to the UNESCO World Heritage Site of Palenque with iconic Maya structures","Experience at Misol-Ha Waterfall with photo opportunities and tranquility","Explore the stunning Agua Azul waterfalls with vibrant blue waters and natural pools"]
one_line_summary: Full-day tour exploring Maya ruins, waterfalls, and natural beauty of Chiapas
bussines_description:
Supplier: Consultora Turística de Chiapas
General Description: Title: Tour of Palenque and the Milso-Ha and Agua Azul Waterfalls | Description: Today, you will embark on a tour of approximately 10 hours to explore the treasures of the Maya world. You will meet early with your guide, who speaks Spanish, and a group of travellers to visit the archaeological site of Palenque, also known as Lakamha (place of the great waters). You will discover emblematic structures such as the Temple of the Skull, the Tomb of the Red Queen, the Temple of Inscriptions, the Palace, the aqueduct, the Group of the Crosses, the Ball Game, and the Bath of the Queen. The adventure continues at the Misol-ha Waterfall, a magnificent 35-meter water drop, perfect for taking pictures and enjoying the tranquility and beauty of the place. Next, you will visit the Agua Azul waterfalls, formed by the limestone bed of the Tulijá River, which descends in steps, creating waterfalls and natural pools of an intense blue. You can walk along the riverbank, swim in its waters, enjoy the breeze, appreciate the surrounding vegetation, or listen to the relaxing sound of the water. Your day will end with the return transport to Palenque.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Palenque AS, Agua Azul & Misol Ha - 8h - SPA | serviceDescription: Palenque AS, Agua Azul & Misol Ha | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Chiapas
Location: address: Palenque, Chiapas, México | locations: Palenque

unique_selling_points: ["Night kayaking under the stars","Bioluminescent sea experience","Search for constellations and shooting stars","Swim in illuminated waters","Guided by Spanish-speaking expert"]
special_occasions: ["romantic evening","special night out","adventure for nature lovers"]
one_line_summary: Kayak under stars and witness bioluminescence in Holbox's magical sea
bussines_description:
Supplier: VIP Holbox
General Description: Title: Bioluminescence and constellations kayak tour. | Description: Today, you will join a group of travelers for a 2 hour adventure. You will meet your Spanish speaking guide at the established point at 12am and then board the kayaks to begin the tour. You will start paddling a short and easy route (no experience is necessary) and then feel the immensity of the sea and the sky around you, where you will be able to look for constellations, clusters and galaxies and if you are lucky, a shooting star will cross your field of vision. After having appreciated the sky, you will continue with the sea in search of bioluminescence caused by the plankton that makes the sea light up. You will have the opportunity to get out of the kayak and enjoy the environment, even swim if you prefer. At the end of the experience, you will return to your hotel.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Kayaking under the stars - 2h (after 12:00am) - SPA | serviceDescription: Kayaking under the stars | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Quintana Roo
Location: address: Av Damero, Centro, 77310 Holbox, Q.R. | locations: Isla Holbox

Together, you will head to the macaw roosting area to observe this emblematic species. These birds commonly move around in groups or pairs, allowing you to see more than one bird and their vivid colours. In addition, you can observe other types of fauna such as parrots, toucans, and variations of plants. At the end of the observation, you will return to the ecotourism centre and your experience will be over.

unique_selling_points: ["Participatory cooking with community members","Traditional Mayan dishes like cochinita and chicken pibil","Cultural immersion through music and local atmosphere","Embroidery workshop showcasing local craftsmanship","Authentic community experience in Nuevo Durango"]
one_line_summary: Participate in a traditional Mayan gastronomic and embroidery experience in Nuevo Durango
bussines_description:
Supplier: Nuevo Durango
General Description: Title: Gastronomic Tour & embroidery workshop | Description: Today, you will have an adventure in Nuevo Durango; a small community characterized by being a traditional Mayan village that has managed to maintain its cultural identity both in language and customs and has been driven by activities such as ecotourism and organic food production. Your local guide in English will be waiting for you at the established point for a gastronomic workshop with a duration of approximately  5 hours. 
Here you will have the opportunity, not only to enjoy a traditional meal (depending on the season), but you will be part of the whole process, from collecting fresh ingredients from the garden such as onions, tomatoes, avocado, lemons, oranges and everything you need to cook with members of the community some of their typical dishes among which we can find the cochinita and chicken pibil. Afterwards, you can enjoy the food and an atmosphere of music and songs representative of Mexico and the Mayan culture and at the end, you can return to your hotel.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Gastronomic Tour & embroidery workshop - 6h - ENG | serviceDescription: Gastronomic Tour & embroidery workshop | serviceType: Centro Ecoturístico | destinationName: Quintana Roo

one_line_summary: Experience authentic Mexican lucha libre with VIP seats and local flavors in Puebla.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Unlimited experiences
General Description: Title: Mexican wrestling night | Description: Today, your transportation and local guide in Spanish will take you on a tour of approximately 5 hours to experience the excitement of Mexican wrestling. You will start at the Parian (craft market) where you can enjoy Mexican street food, such as chalupas. Then, you will walk to the pulquería Santos Remedios to taste this traditional beverage and receive a wrestler mask. There, you will learn a bit about the history associated with the mask you have been given.


Next, you will head to the Puebla Arena, where wrestlers perform their show. You will have VIP seats to enjoy the spectacle. During this time, your guide will provide you with more information about lucha libre, and you can immerse yourself in the thrilling atmosphere of the arena. Don"t forget to cheer for your favourite wrestler. You will be taken back to your hotel at the end of the show.


Please note: This experience is only available on Mondays.

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to historic tequila distillery Casa Sauza","Hands-on experience in making a traditional Cantarito","Insight into agave cultivation and tequila production process"]
one_line_summary: Discover tequila's heritage with a hands-on tour at Casa Sauza, including a Cantarito workshop.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Casa Sauza
General Description: Title: Experience the Casa Sauza tour and learn all about the tequila process | Description: Today, you will meet your local guide in Spanish and a group of travelers at Casa Sauza, one of the oldest distilleries in the magical town of Tequila. For approximately 2 hours you will immerse yourself in the fascinating world of tequila. You will begin by exploring the Agave Fields, where you will learn about the importance of this plant and its relationship to tequila production. You will also witness a demonstration of jima, the traditional process of cutting the agave leaves. Then you will visit the Bodega, where you will learn about the tequila maturation process and how it influences its flavor and quality. You will continue with a visit to the Distillery to observe the tequila distillation process and discover the secrets behind its artisanal elaboration. Finally, you will have the opportunity to prepare your own Cantarito learning how to mix the traditional ingredients and create a delicious refreshing drink.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Casa Sauza Tour - 2h - SPA | serviceDescription: Casa Sauza Tour | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Jalisco
Location: address: Luis Navarro #70 Tequila, Jalisco 46400, México. | locations: Tequila

unique_selling_points: ["Authentic Mayan culinary experience","Hands-on traditional craft workshops","Visit to ancient archaeological site","Cenote swim in community setting"]
one_line_summary: Full-day authentic Mayan community tour with cooking, crafts, archaeology, and cenote
bussines_description:
Supplier: Parador Turístico Yaxunah
General Description: Title: A day in the community | Description: Today, you will meet your Spanish-speaking guide at the meeting point to begin your approximately 7-hour experience. You will participate in the preparation of cochinita pibil, a typical Mayan food cooked in an oven under the ground and wrapped in banana leaves, and you will also be able to make some tortillas by hand in this activity. Next, you will visit a sustainable cornfield, and accompanied by Don Francisco, a local expert, you will learn about the tasks of cleaning, planting and harvesting and enjoy a demonstration of the corn-based drinks known as pozoles and atoles. You will then take part in two workshops, the hammock weaving workshop, where you will observe the different techniques used to make these traditional objects, and the bull horn workshop, where experts from the community will show you how to prepare the material for carving, polishing and sanding accessories such as bull horn, earrings and necklaces. At lunchtime you will taste the cochinita pibil you made earlier and then visit the archaeological zone of Yaxunah, which houses buildings such as the enormous Acropolis, the Ball Game and various architectural complexes. Finally, you will visit the cenote located in the heart of the community, a cenote with a depth of at least 30 metres and a water mirror of 40 metres in diameter. You will be able to access it by means of a wooden ladder that will take you to a small platform that will lead you to the cenote. At the end of the designated activity time your experience will be over.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Whole day in the community - 7h - SPA | serviceDescription: Whole day in the community | serviceType: Centro Ecoturístico | destinationName: Yucatan
Location: address: Yaxunah, Yaxcabá, Yucatán, México | locations: Yaxunah

Start your hike from the foothills of the Nevado de Toluca and choose your final destination: the town of Amanalco or the Monarch Butterfly Sanctuary.

After a day full of exploration, a night in the mountains of Corral de Piedra awaits you. You can choose between a cabin or a campsite where you can enjoy the warmth of a campfire. With a total distance of 40 km, this trail presents a high level of difficulty, challenging but rewarding.

one_line_summary: Experience Day of the Dead with art, mezcal, and local traditions in Oaxaca
bussines_description:
Supplier: Etnoturística
General Description: Title: Day of the Dead: Art and Mezcal, 3rd of November | Description: Today you will live a 6-hour experience. Together with another group of travelers and with your local guide in English, you will go to the community of San Bartolo Coyotepec to visit the workshop of Carlo Magno, a local artist who has dedicated much of his work to representing the traditions of the town through of skeletons and devils of black clay, which have been awarded on several occasions. Afterwards, they will head to Santa Catarina Minas to visit a mezcal palenque (a place where mezcal is produced, fermented and distilled) using ancestral techniques, which involve the use of clay pots. After the explanation, they will have a tasting and will conclude with the food served on site. At the end, they will return to Oaxaca.

unique_selling_points: ["Hiking to the summit of active volcanoes","Panoramic views of the Valley of Mexico","Legend of the volcanoes explained by a local guide"]
one_line_summary: Full-day adventurous hike to active volcanoes with stunning valley views
bussines_description:
Supplier: Unlimited experiences
General Description: Title: Hike to the Izta-Popo | Description: Today your transportation will pick you up from your hotel in Puebla and, accompanied by a local English-speaking guide, you will head to the Iztaccihuatl - Popocatepetl National Park on a 12-hour tour. Upon arrival at the park, located at an altitude of 3,500 metres, your guide will provide you with detailed information about the national park and the legend of the volcanoes. From this point, you will be able to enjoy views of the volcanoes, Popocatepetl being one of them, still listed as an active volcano. After checking in, you will head by transport to La Joyita, the last available car park to start the hike along the route of the portillos where the altitude will be 3,900 meters. It is at this point that the exciting hike begins, which will take you through different portillos, reaching a maximum altitude of 4,524 metres. From there, you will be able to appreciate the impressive valley of Mexico and marvel at the nature that surrounds both volcanoes. After enjoying the panoramic views, you will begin your descent back to the meeting point where your transport will be waiting to take you back to your hotel.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Hike to the  Izta Popo National Park - 7h - ENG | serviceDescription: Hike to the  Izta Popo National Park | serviceType: Operadora local, Transporte | destinationName: Puebla Area
Location: address: Av. Don Juan de Palafox y. Mendoza entre calle Ayuntamiento y Calle 2 Norte, Centro histórico de Puebla, 72000 Heroica Puebla de Zaragoza, Pue. | locations: Puebla

You will then head to the Lacanjá Ruins, which is a Mayan archaeological site that is still largely unexcavated and unrestored. At the end, you will return to the starting point of the tour and with that, your experience will be over.

bussines_description:
Supplier: San Pablo Etla
General Description: Title: The Dragon Trail & Experience | Description: Today you will have a 6 hour private experience. You will meet your Spanish-speaking guide at the meeting point for a hike along the La Vidriería-La Peña trail, also known as the dragon trail, which is located at the top of the mountain and leads to the Peña Boluda, a very important natural scenic feature of the Central Valleys. This hike consists of a 1 km walk with an approximate duration of 2 hours. At the end of the walk you will be able to participate in a talk about the huautli, better known as amaranth, its cultivation process and the elaboration of alegrías and tzoalli. Remember that at the end you will be able to make and taste some of these, and with that, your experience will be over and you will be able to return to your hotel on your own.

one_line_summary: 7-hour scenic Baja California Sur hike with local cheese tasting and conservation insights
bussines_description:
Supplier: Rancho Cacachilas
General Description: Title: El Ciruelo walk in Baja California Sur | Description: Today, your local guide in Spanish will wait for you at the meeting point to join a group of travelers and go on a walk filled with flora, fauna, and the bay’s panoramic views for approximately seven hours. In this 4.5-mile walk, you will lead to a curve near a ranch to hypnotize you with the magic that The Sierra Cacachilas hides in every corner of its isolated island. After the walk, you will taste artisanal goat cheeses made on the ranch; you will meet a goat named Paty and an essential supplier in the high-quality milk processing with which the cheeses previously mentioned are made. When you finish a quiet walk through an organic garden, you will learn about conservation and advice on how-to-manage limited water resources. Finally, you will enjoy a delicious lunch prepared by the in-house chef; he will offer you a tempting fusion of traditional and exotic flavors.

unique_selling_points: ["UNESCO World Heritage Site","Visit to Casa de la Conspiración - birthplace of Mexico's independence","Historic monuments and colonial architecture"]
one_line_summary: Explore the historic and cultural treasures of San Miguel de Allende with expert guides.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Coyote Canyon Adventures
General Description: Title: Tour of the historic center of San Miguel de Allende. | Description: Located in the heart of Mexico, the city of San Miguel de Allende stands out as one of the most beautiful colonial cities in the country. Declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 2008, the city has a special magic that captures the visitor from the moment he/she arrives. 

Accompanied by your local English-speaking guide and a group of travelers, you will take a 1 hour and 30 minute tour through the streets full of magic and history of San Miguel de Allende. You will visit some of the most important monuments of the historic center such as the Parish of San Miguel Archangel and the house of Captain Ignacio Allende. Then you will visit the Temple of the Immaculate Conception and its ancient cloister, the Angela Peralta Theater, the old Plaza de la Soledad and the Paso del Camino Real. Finally, you will learn how Mexico's independence was forged at the Casa de la Conspiración.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Historic Center of San Miguel de Allende - 2h - ENG | serviceDescription: Historic Center of San Miguel de Allende | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Guanajuato Area

unique_selling_points: ["Exploration of virgin jungles and cenotes","Community-led initiative","Swimming in multiple cenotes","Observation of endemic Yucatan birds"]
one_line_summary: Bike and swim through pristine cenotes in Yucatan's lush jungle.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Bejil Ha
General Description: Title: The Waterway Experience | Description: Today, your local English speaking guide will meet you at your hotel in Akumal with a group of other travellers to begin your 5 and a half hour experience, together you will head to the community of Chemuyil.  In the company of your guide and pedalling a bicycle, you will get to know the jungle and the cenotes. This is a project initiated by 5 young people from the community, who want to make known and preserve the place where they used to live and play during their childhood. The initiative allows visitors to explore virgin jungles, discover the fauna and become one with nature. The bike ride is short, it is important that you enjoy swimming in the cenotes. The first one is known locally as La Cuevita; an enclosed cenote where your guide will tell you anecdotes and stories about the place. Next, you will go to an open cenote where you will enjoy some relaxing moments surrounded by the abundant nature where, with a bit of luck, you will be able to observe some of the endemic birds of the Yucatan Peninsula. Finally, you will visit an open cenote of spectacular beauty. All of them are part of a system fed by the largest underground river in the world. At the end of the designated time for the activity, your experience will be over.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Camino del agua - 5.5h - ENG | serviceDescription: Camino del agua | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Quintana Roo

unique_selling_points: ["Panoramic hot air balloon ride over Teotihuacan","Guided tour of the City of the Gods with historical insights","Bicycle route through ancient murals and natural observatories","Visit to artisan family home and obsidian craft demonstration","Tasting of pulque and local cactus products"]
one_line_summary: Exciting full-day tour with hot air balloon, biking, and cultural insights at Teotihuacan
bussines_description:
Supplier: Teotihuacan en bici
General Description: Title: Hot air balloon ride and guided tour of Teotihuacan | Description: Today your English-speaking local guide will pick you up from your hotel and head out of Mexico City to the Teotihuacan Valley to begin your approximately 11-hour experience. Upon arrival, you will board a hot air balloon for an approximately 40-minute ride for a panoramic view of this iconic site. Afterwards, you will take a walking tour of the City of the Gods, your guide will tell you about its history while you walk along the Calzada de los Muertos. He will also tell you all about the mysteries of this ancient civilisation, where you will find buildings such as the Pyramid of the Sun and the Pyramid of the Moon. The second part of the tour will be by bicycle, on a route of approximately 10 km, you will visit the route of the Murals, an ancient natural observatory and the impressive views of the City of the Gods. You will close your day with a visit to the home of a family of artisans, where you will learn more about the obsidian process and how it is transformed into handicrafts. You will also have a tasting of pulque and products derived from xoconostle, a cactus fruit very representative of the area. At the end of the designated time, you will enjoy a local lunch and your transportation will take you back to Mexico City, where your tour will end.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Balloon flight & biking tour - 11h - ENG | serviceDescription: Balloon flight & biking tour | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Mexico Area
Location: address: Teotihuacan, Méx., México | locations: Teotihuacan, Mexico City

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to historic Hacienda San Luis Carpizo with agricultural and military history","Sea turtle nesting site at Punta Xen with pristine beaches"]
one_line_summary: Explore Campeche's historic hacienda and sea turtle nesting site in a full-day cultural tour
bussines_description:
Supplier: El Tucan Tours
General Description: Title: Tour of Hacienda San Luis Carpizo and Turtle Bay. | Description: Today your transportation will pick you up and you will meet you local guide in Spanish who will go along with you on an 8 hour tour. The first stop will be at Hacienda San Luis Carpizo, which was formerly dedicated to agriculture and cattle ranching, where palo de tnte and henequen (a plant of resisitant fiber) were cultivated. Today the Hacienda houses the prestigious Marine Infantry School.
Later you will visit the Turtle Bay at Punta Xen, whose name reflects its fame as a sea turtle nesting site, the gentle waves and turquoise blue sea await you, along with white sand where you can walk and eat. At the end, your transportation will take you back to your hotel.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Turtle Bay - 9.5h - SPA | serviceDescription: Turtle Bay | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Campeche Area
Location: address: Campeche, Camp., México | locations: Campeche

bussines_description:

General Description: Title: Tasting and tour of the Cuna de Tierra Vineyard. | Description: Today your Spanish-speaking guide will accompany you on a 3-hour shared experience at the Cuna de Tierra Vineyard, which has more than 30 hectares where different grape varieties are cultivated for the production of 6 red wines and 1 white wine, and has won several awards due to the architectural design of the winery. Your tour will begin with a visit to the Torre de Tierra viewpoint where you will be able to contemplate the vines, then you will go to the production area, followed by the barrel room where around 200 French, American and Hungarian oak barrels rest, contributing their characteristics to the wines under development. At the end of this tour you will taste 4 wines with 4 course meal.

unique_selling_points: ["Climb the tallest pyramid at Calakmul for panoramic jungle views","Experience the ancient Maya city amidst pristine jungle","Wildlife sightings including toucans, spider monkeys, and deer"]
one_line_summary: Explore the ancient Maya city of Calakmul in its lush jungle setting.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Calakmul Travel
General Description: Title: Visit to the Archaeological Zone of Calakmul, the Hidden City | Description: Today, you will visit the archaeological zone of Calakmul, an impressive city in the midst of the jungle, named a UNESCO World Heritage Site. On a approximately 5-hour tour, you will meet your Spanish-speaking guide at the meeting point at kilometer 0 towards the Archaeological Zone, a 60-kilometer journey where the road itself deserves all your attention because, with a bit of luck, you may spot white-tailed deer, pheasants, peacocks with iridescent plumage, or toucans hidden among the trees.

You will arrive at the archaeological zone where you will visit the tallest pyramid on the site, standing at 45 meters in height, and you will climb to the top to enjoy the incredible view. You will see structures adorned with reliefs and engravings depicting daily life, rituals, and deities revered by the ancient Maya. You will observe the jungle resembling an endless green sea of trees, spider monkeys moving among branches as they traverse, or woodpeckers playing their wooden melody in search of insects. After completing the scheduled time, you will bid farewell to your guide and return to your hotel on your own.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Visit to the Archaeological Site of Calakmul - 6h - SPA | serviceDescription: Visit to the Archaeological Site of Calakmul | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Campeche Area
Location: address: Campeche, Camp., México | locations: Calakmul

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to the City of the Gods with detailed archaeological insights","Experience of local artisan family and obsidian craftsmanship","Tasting of traditional pulque and xoconostle products","Combination of walking tour, cultural learning, and local gastronomy"]
one_line_summary: Explore Teotihuacan's mysteries, crafts, and flavors in a full-day cultural tour
bussines_description:
Supplier: Teotihuacan en bici
General Description: Title: Walking tour in Teotihuacan | Description: Today you will meet at the meeting point with your Spanish-speaking local guide to begin your approximately 6-hour experience. Together you will tour the City of the Gods. As you walk along the Causeway of the Dead, your guide will tell you all about the mysteries of this ancient civilisation, where you will find buildings such as the Pyramid of the Sun and Pyramid of the Moon. Afterwards, you will board your transport that will take you on a tour of the route of the Murals, an ancient natural observatory and the impressive views of the City of the Gods. You"ll close your day with a visit to the home of a family of artisans, where you"ll learn more about the obsidian process and how it is transformed into handicrafts. You will also have a tasting of pulque and products derived from xoconostle, a cactus fruit very representative of the area. At the end of the designated time, you will enjoy a local lunch and your experience will be over.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Teotihuacán Walking Tour - 6h - SPA | serviceDescription: Teotihuacán Walking Tour | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Estado de Mexico
Location: address: Teotihuacan, Méx., México | locations: Teotihuacan, Mexico City

bussines_description:
Supplier: Sensaciones Turísticas
General Description: Title: Learn about the cocoa tradition in Tlaquepaque | Description: Today, your local guide in English will take you on a sensory experience of approximately one hour and a half through the Mexican cocoa tradition. You will travel from bitter to sweet using the tasting of the flavors provided by four cocoa seeds, each seed different in texture, flavor, and scent; some of these took part in international competitions. Besides, you will taste them already turned into chocolate, and you could appreciate their pairing with different food and drinks. This tasting is once-and-for-all since every seed and every product used in this experience is meticulously selected for those cocoa and Mexican chocolate lovers.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: The magic of cacao: traditional tasting - 1.5h - ENG | serviceDescription: The magic of cacao: traditional tasting | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Jalisco
Location: address: Guadalajara, Jalisco, México | locations: Guadalajara

unique_selling_points: ["Authentic Day of the Dead ceremonies at Mitla","Participation in traditional offerings and rituals","Visit to local families with cultural storytelling","Experience of regional food, bread, and mezcal","Deep cultural immersion in Zapotec traditions"]
one_line_summary: Immersive Day of the Dead celebration visiting Zapotec sites and local families
bussines_description:
Supplier: Etnoturística
General Description: Title: Day of the Dead: Farewell to the Deceased, 2nd of November | Description: Today, you will experience approximately 11 hours. Alongside another group of travelers and your local English-speaking guide, you will gather at the meeting point to head towards Mitla, a Zapotec ceremonial site that translates to place of the dead. You will visit the archaeological area that was once the seat of religious power. Later, around noon, you will visit the Mitla cemetery, where families bring offerings for their deceased. Afterwards, you will proceed to Teotitlán del Valle, where a local family will welcome you and have a traditional meal prepared for you. Together with them, you will make the final offering to the departed before heading to the village cemetery.

Before concluding the day and returning to Oaxaca, you will stop in another locality to witness how they bid farewell to their departed ones, bringing fruits, tamales, tortillas, bread, beer, mezcal, and music. In this locality, another local family will offer you some seasonal chocolate and bread.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Day 3 November 2: Day of the dead - 11h - ENG | serviceDescription: Day 3 November 2: Day of the dead | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Oaxaca
Location: address: Oaxaca, Centro, Oaxaca de Juárez, Oaxaca, México | locations: Oaxaca de Juárez

one_line_summary: Explore colonial Bernal and Peña de Bernal’s rich history and culture in a 2-hour guided tour
bussines_description:
Supplier: Peña Tours
General Description: Title: Bernal, Querétaro: colonial Mexico’s home | Description: Today, your local guide in Spanish will take you on a tour of approximately two hours through Bernal, a magical village with so much colonial history and architecture reflected in its cobbled streets and well-preserved colonial mansions and houses. Within Bernal’s historic center, you will find many handicraft stands and San Sebastián church, the main tourist attraction in the city.

Visit El Castillo, a 17th-century building simulating a medieval castle, besides the Museo del Dulce, where you will taste regional and traditional candies. Finally, walk and get to know Peña de Bernal more closely; it is a 433-meter monolith considered one of the tallest in the world. Enjoy handmade wine in Museo del Cuarzo but do not forget to visit this magical village.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Traditional and magical Bernal - 2h - SPA | serviceDescription: Traditional and magical Bernal | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Queretaro Area

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to the mystical Island of the Dolls with local legend","Demonstrative chinampa farming technique","Biodiversity conservation project with axolotl refuge","Authentic experience aboard traditional trajinera"]
one_line_summary: Explore Xochimilco's mystic Island of the Dolls and learn traditional chinampas farming
bussines_description:
Supplier: OlinTlalli
General Description: Title: The legend of the Island of the Dolls and the ancestral technique of chinampería in Xochimilco | Description: In this tour of approximately 3 hours, aboard a conventional trajinera, you will tour the canals of the Ecological Reserve of Xochimilco, while enjoying the views of the chinampas and the biodiversity of the area. Your local Spanish-speaking guide will share stories and legends about Xochimilco, as well as knowledge about the flora and fauna that inhabit the area.

The visit to the mythical Isla de las Muñecas (Island of the Dolls) and the talk by the guardian of the place add a touch of mysticism and culture to the tour. In addition, the stop at the Olintlalli chinampa will allow you to learn firsthand the ancestral agricultural technique used by the chinampa masters. The experience culminates with an explanation of the Biofiltro and axolotl refuge, an important project for the conservation of local biodiversity.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Island of dolls and demonstrative chinampa - 3h - SPA | serviceDescription: Island of dolls and demonstrative chinampa | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Mexico Area
Location: address: Xochimilco, CDMX, México | locations: Mexico City

unique_selling_points: ["Authentic Mayan cooking experience in community setting","Preparation of traditional cochinita in pib oven","Interaction with local women from Yaxunah"]
one_line_summary: Participate in a traditional Mayan cochinita cooking workshop in Yaxunah
bussines_description:
Supplier: Parador Turístico Yaxunah
General Description: Title: Gastronomic workshop in Yaxunah | Description: In the morning you will participate in a two-hour gastronomic experience in the company of Spanish-speaking women from the Yaxunah community. Today you will prepare the traditional cochinita, a typical Mayan meal cooked in the PIB oven underground and wrapped in banana leaves (a vegetarian option can be substituted). 

First, you will prepare the recado, a seasoning based on achiote, pepper, and other spices, helping to grind the ingredients in a metate. Then add the seasonings to the pork and proceed to introduce the food into the pit with hot stones. The pot is completely covered with leaves and earth so that it cooks slowly. While it is cooking, you can participate in the preparation of the dessert and tortillas or enjoy a walk and come back at lunchtime to enjoy the delicious cochinita.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Preparation & degustation of pig in pib oven - 2.5h - SPA | serviceDescription: Preparation & degustation of pig in pib oven | serviceType: Centro Ecoturístico | destinationName: Yucatan
Location: address: Yaxunah, Yaxcabá, Yucatán, México | locations: Yaxunah

unique_selling_points: ["Authentic local food experience in Playa del Carmen","Guided tour exploring street art and local culture","Includes traditional dishes like huitlacoche, cochinita pibil, and mole"]
one_line_summary: Authentic Mexican food tour exploring Playa del Carmen's street art and local flavors
bussines_description:
Supplier: Eating with Carmen Food Tours
General Description: Title: Authentic Mexican Food in Playa del Carmen | Description: Today, your local guide in Spanish will wait for you at the meeting point to join a group of travelers and take you to the most well-known gastronomic tour in Playa del Carmen of approximately three hours, where you will immerse yourself in this place’s history, gastronomy, street art, and local culture. You will stroll through one of the local arteries of the city as long as you delight yourself with the flavors and smells of street stands and restaurants that the locals frequent. Get ready to explore the boundaries of your comfort zone with an expert guide of the area and Mexican cuisine before you return to your hotel (this experience does not include transportation for your return).

NOTE: The 10 a.m. tour includes sopes (thick, wide tortillas), fresh water, huitlacoche (a type of fungus), fruits, fresh juices, cochinita pibil (a kind of stew), carnitas (pork meat), mole (mixture of spicy Mexican sauces), etc. The 5 p.m. tour includes tamales (corn dough wrapped in a banana or corn leaf), fresh water, huitlacoche, fruits, fresh juices, sorted meat tacos (tacos with portions of various cuts of meat), pastor (a variety of tacos), mole and vegetarian options.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Playa del Carmen Authentic Local Experience - 3h - SPA | serviceDescription: Playa del Carmen Authentic Local Experience | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Quintana Roo
Location: address: Quintana Roo, México | locations: Playa del Carmen, Tulum, Mérida

one_line_summary: Explore the ancient Mayan city of Ek Balam with expert guides and climb the Acropolis for stunning J
bussines_description:
Supplier: Coop Guias De Ek Balam
General Description: Title: Explora el misterioso yacimiento arqueológico de Ek Balam | Description: Explore the archaeological site of Ek Balam, whose meaning in Mayan language is Black Jaguar. It is one of the few archaeological sites that still allows you to climb up to the Acropolis, from where you will have a splendid view of the rest of the site and the Mayan jungle. Accompanied by a specialized Spanish-speaking guide, you will tour the site for approximately one hour visiting its most important monuments, such as the Acropolis, where the kings lived, the Observatory, where scientists, astronomers and mathematicians lived, and the ball game, a sacred and religious practice.

bussines_description:
Supplier: Nuevo Durango
General Description: Title: Enjoy the incredible experience of weaving in the hammock workshop | Description: Today you will learn about the art of hammock weaving and blouse embroidery from the women of the community. You will meet your local Spanish-speaking guide at the established point to learn about the art of hammock weaving and blouse embroidery, as well as the importance within their traditions. The demonstration lasts approximately 1 hr and you will have the opportunity to learn about the techniques, the use of colors to distinguish the weaving, the stitches and some styles among them, Watermelon or Zebra. You can try to keep up with them and practice choosing the colors of your choice. Once the activity is over, you can return to your hotel.

one_line_summary: Participate in a seasonal vegetarian cooking class on a historic Xochimilco chinampa
bussines_description:
Supplier: OlinTlalli
General Description: Title: Cooking class on a Xochimilco chinampa | Description: Today, you will have the opportunity to participate in a cooking class located on a chinampa in Xochimilco, lasting approximately 4 hours (including transport on the trajinera). To get there, you will meet your local guide, who speaks Spanish, at the Cuemanco jetty. From there, you will board a traditional trajinera that will take you to the chinampa. This island, situated on a lake, has been used since pre-Hispanic times for farming. Upon arrival, you will explore the crops to harvest the ingredients you will use in the cooking class. Afterwards, you will head to the kitchen, where your instructor will teach you the techniques to transform the harvest into exquisite dishes. The type of dishes will vary according to the season and what is ready to be harvested. Once you have finished eating, the experience will conclude, and you will return on the trajinera to the initial meeting point.

unique_selling_points: ["Visit two interconnected cenotes with crystal waters","Explore a cenote famous for wedding ceremonies","Guided snorkeling and exploration in lush jungle setting"]
one_line_summary: Explore stunning cenotes with snorkeling and jungle exploration in Quintana Roo
bussines_description:
Supplier: Turquesa tours
General Description: Title: Dos Ojos and Taak Bi Ha: cenotes to visit in Quintana Roo | Description: Today, your local guide in English will pick you up to join a group of travelers to learn about the Dos Ojos Cenote, which has two interconnected cenotes of crystal waters. There, you will observe geological formations and the transparency of the water, home for freshwater fish. Next, you will go to Taak Bi Ha (which means “Hidden Road of Water”), a cenote hidden in the depths of the jungle and famous because of being considered as the number one for wedding ceremonies; before beginning the snorkeling and the walk in this place, there will be an introduction concerning the cenote. Do not miss this experience of approximately six hours and let yourself be amazed by what this site's views, formations, and exploration areas within and out of the water have to provide; take pictures to remember this event and make shared memories that last for many generations.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Snorkel in 2 cenotes: 2 ojos & Taak Bi Ha - 6h - ENG | serviceDescription: Snorkel in 2 cenotes: 2 ojos & Taak Bi Ha | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Quintana Roo

unique_selling_points: ["Scenic canyon views and caves","Visit to Ojito de Agua spring","Suspension bridge experience","Authentic local village stay"]
one_line_summary: Two-day adventure exploring Sierra Norte's forests, canyon, and local villages
bussines_description:
Supplier: Expediciones Sierra Norte
General Description: Title: Visiting Sierra Norte in Oaxaca | Description: Today, your local guide in Spanish will take you from Oaxaca City to Sierra Norte, across the Tlacolula Valley to Llano Grande, for a two-day and one-night experience. Once at the place, you will start walking through the “Cueva de la Iglesia” route, an internal path in San Miguel del Valle territory having natural landscapes and viewpoints. You will continue until reaching Cuajimoloyas village, where you will lead to one of the local dining rooms to eat and check-in in the cottages; you will have free time until dinner.

The next day, you will prepare your luggage and meet your local guide in the dining room to eat breakfast before the walk to the “Cañón del coyote” begins. You will immerse yourself in the pine-oak forests characteristic of the region; you will visit “Ojito de Agua”, where the water borns among the cracks of a high rock; and you will continue through the path until arriving at the canyon, where you will admire its caves. Here, you will observe the mountain landscape. Finally, you will eat before returning to the city. You will also visit the suspension bridge of Cuajimoloyas. You will have free time for those who want to go to the zipline (additional cost).
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Sierra norte not to be missed - 2days, 1 night - SPA | serviceDescription: Sierra norte not to be missed - 2days, 1 night | serviceType: Centro Ecoturístico | destinationName: Oaxaca
Location: address: Pueblos Mancomunados, Calle Alamos, Reforma, Oaxaca de Juárez, Oax., México | locations: Sierra Norte de Oaxaca

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to one of the most important Mayan archaeological sites in the world","Exploration of lesser-known jungle trails with historical insights","Natural waterfalls and crystal-clear pools in Chiapas jungle"]
one_line_summary: Explore Mayan ruins and waterfalls on an adventurous full-day tour in Chiapas
bussines_description:
Supplier: Consultora Turística de Chiapas
General Description: Title: Visit the archaeological site of Palenque and the waterfalls of Roberto Barrios. | Description: Today, together with a group of travellers and your Spanish-speaking guide, you will enjoy an adventure of approximately 9 hours in Chiapas. You will begin by exploring the Archaeological Zone of Palenque, an ancient Mayan city that today is one of the most important sites in the world. Immersing yourself in little known trails in the middle of the jungle, you will learn about its history, myths, rituals, beliefs and the life of its people in the past, visiting emblematic buildings such as the Temple of the Skull and the Temple of the Inscriptions, which houses the tomb of King Pakal. Then, you will head to the waterfalls of Roberto Barrios, a natural paradise in the Chiapas jungle. You will be able to explore the site, admire the impressive waterfalls and enjoy the natural pools of crystal clear water, especially during the dry season (March to July). After this experience, you will have free time for lunch before returning to Palenque by transport.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Palenque AS & Roberto B. waterfalls - 6h - SPA | serviceDescription: Palenque AS & Roberto B. waterfalls | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Chiapas
Location: address: Palenque, Chiapas, México | locations: Palenque

unique_selling_points: ["Spectacular waterfalls including Velo de Novia, Mexico's second largest","Ecologically important Montebello Lakes with diverse flora and fauna","Traditional raft trip to Orchid Island","Community-managed ecotourism experience"]
one_line_summary: Explore waterfalls and turquoise lakes in Chiapas with community-led ecotourism.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Consultora Turística de Chiapas
General Description: Title: El Chiflón and Lagos de Montebello | Description: Today, you will live a unique experience of approximately nine hours accompanied by your local guide in Spanish and a group of travelers. You will begin the two hour and thirty minute tour to reach the Chiflón ecotourism center, a place managed by families from the neighboring ejido who have worked for nearly 25 years to maintain it and make its attractions known. There you will be able to walk quietly for 2 hours along a trail surrounded by the most spectacular nature of the region, with a turquoise blue river and a series of impressive waterfalls, including the Velo de Novia waterfall, the second largest in Mexico. During the hike, you will see a great variety of birds, butterflies and, if you are lucky, some reptiles.

Afterwards, the tour will take you to the Montebello Lakes for a ninety minute drive where you will take a break for lunch. Montebello is a national park of great ecological importance due to its more than 157 species of orchids and 93 species of fungi, besides being a high conservation area for birds. Here, you will have the opportunity to visit the most emblematic lakes, each with a unique shade of turquoise blue, and explore the orchid island on a traditional raft. You will also be able to take pictures, enjoy traditional handicrafts and food and, if time permits, visit the international lake, which divides Mexico and Guatemala.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: El Chiflón waterfalls & Montebello Lakes - 12h | serviceDescription: El Chiflón waterfalls & Montebello Lakes | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Chiapas
Location: address: Palenque, Chiapas, México | locations: Palenque

unique_selling_points: ["Hiking through waterfalls and pools","Swimming behind the main waterfall","Natural jacuzzi in river","Authentic regional meal with tortillas"]
one_line_summary: Exciting waterfall hike with natural pools and regional cuisine in Huatulco
bussines_description:
Supplier: Huatulco Salvaje
General Description: Title: Get to know the Copalitilla waterfalls in Huatulco | Description: Today, your local guide in English will pick you up for a 9-hour tour to take you to Río Copalitilla, where you can experience the natural and cultural richness of the region. You will hike through trails that cross waterfalls and pools until you reach the main waterfall, where you will have the opportunity to challenge yourself by going behind it and ending up in a natural jacuzzi. On your way back, you will test your bravery by swimming in the deep areas of the river, and you will also visit the Hollow Waterfall and the family swimming area.

To finish off, you will enjoy a typical region meal, which includes freshly made tortillas and cool water.

unique_selling_points: ["Hiking near active volcano Popocatépetl","Panoramic views of Mexico Valley","Guided tour with local expert"]
one_line_summary: Full-day challenging hike to Iztaccíhuatl and Popocatépetl volcanoes with expert guide
bussines_description:
Supplier: Unlimited experiences
General Description: Title: Hiking the Iztaccíhuatl - Popocatépetl National Park | Description: Today, your transportation will pick you up at your hotel, and accompanied by a local Spanish-speaking guide, you will head to the Iztaccíhuatl - Popocatépetl National Park on a 12-hour tour. Upon arrival at the park, situated at an altitude of 3,500 meters, your guide will provide you with detailed information about the national park and the legend of the volcanoes. From this point, you can enjoy views of the volcanoes, with Popocatépetl being one of them, still classified as an active volcano.

After completing the registration process, you will be transported to La Joyita, the last available parking area to begin the hike along the Portillos route, where the altitude will be 3,900 meters. It is at this moment that the exciting hike begins, taking you through different portillos and reaching a maximum altitude of 4,524 meters. From there, you can appreciate the impressive Mexico Valley and marvel at the nature surrounding both volcanoes. After enjoying the panoramic views, you will start the descent to return to the meeting point where the transportation awaits to take you back to your hotel.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Hike to the Izta Popo National Park - 9h - SPA | serviceDescription: Hike to the Izta Popo National Park | serviceType: Operadora local, Transporte | destinationName: Mexico Area

unique_selling_points: ["Community-based ecotourism cooperative","Mysterious archaeological site of Muyil","Floating experience through mangroves","Traditional meal included","Conservation-focused experience"]
one_line_summary: Float through mangroves and explore Muyil's natural and archaeological wonders
bussines_description:
Supplier: Community Tours Sian Ka’an
General Description: Title: Float in the Muyil Sian Ka'an Biosphere Reserve | Description: Today you will visit the Sian Ka'an Biosphere Reserve, which in Mayan means place where the sky is born. Your transportation will pick you up and take you to the Muyil community center (approx. 25 minutes from Tulum) where you will have a light snack and join a group of travelers and your local Spanish-speaking guide to begin the approximately 5-hour excursion. This community-based ecotourism cooperative focuses on the conservation and preservation of ecosystems by promoting unique experiences with a commitment to responsible tourism.
Your first stop will be at the little known and mysterious archaeological site of Muyil, which you will reach at the end of an interpretative trail surrounded by jungle. You will walk to the shore of the Chunyaxche lagoon and its wonderful turquoise color, where you will take a small boat to pass through a channel of crystalline waters with mangroves on each side, arriving at a small dock. From there, you will jump into the river, a relaxing experience in contact with nature! It is a moment of reconnection, as you float slowly through the channels you will feel the tranquility of your surroundings with the sounds of local birds and the gentle current of water that will make you live a unique moment.
At the end, you will return to the community center walking along a trail. You will be welcomed with a traditional meal to complete the excursion. At the end of the tour, your shared transportation will take you back to Tulum.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Muyil Forest & Float - 8h -  SPA | serviceDescription: Muyil Forest & Float | serviceType: Centro Ecoturístico | destinationName: Quintana Roo
Location: address: Community tours Sian Ka'an Muyil, Chunyaxché, Quintana Roo, México | locations: Tulum

unique_selling_points: ["Community-led eco-tourism experience","Exploration of virgin jungles and cenotes","Discovery of endemic Yucatan birds","Support for local youth initiative"]
one_line_summary: Bike and swim through pristine cenotes in Chemuyil, supporting local community efforts.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Bejil Ha
General Description: Title: Bejil-Ha - The path of water, the cenotes of Chemuyil | Description: This experience of approximately five hours begins in the community of Chemuyil. A local guide in Spanish will be waiting for you along with a group of travelers to start the adventure.  In the company of your guide and pedaling a bicycle, you will get to know the jungle and the cenotes. This is a project initiated by 5 young people from the community who seek to make known and preserve the place where they used to live and play during their childhood. The initiative allows visitors to explore virgin jungles, discover the fauna and become one with nature.
 
The bike ride is short, it is important that you enjoy swimming in the cenotes. The first one is known locally as La Cuevita; a closed cenote where your guide will tell you anecdotes and stories of the place. Next, you will go to an open cenote where you will enjoy a few moments of relaxation surrounded by the abundant nature where, hopefully, you will be able to observe some of the endemic birds of the Yucatan Peninsula. Finally, you will visit an open cenote of spectacular beauty. All of them are part of a system fed by the largest subway river in the world.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: El Camino del Agua - 4h - SPA | serviceDescription: El Camino del Agua | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Quintana Roo
Location: address: Chemuyil, Quintana Roo, México https://goo.gl/maps/sPu44g5EoCQ2taSM8 | locations: Chemuyil

one_line_summary: Explore pristine cenotes and jungle by bike in Chemuyil, guided by local community initiative
bussines_description:
Supplier: Bejil Ha
General Description: Title: The Waterway Experience | Description: Today, your local Spanish speaking guide will meet you at your hotel in Tulum with a group of other travellers to begin your approximately 5 and a half hour experience, together you will head to the community of Chemuyil.  In the company of your guide and pedalling a bicycle, you will get to know the jungle and the cenotes. This is a project initiated by 5 young people from the community, who want to make known and preserve the place where they used to live and play during their childhood. The initiative allows visitors to explore virgin jungles, discover the fauna and become one with nature. The bike ride is short, it is important that you enjoy swimming in the cenotes. The first one is known locally as La Cuevita; an enclosed cenote where your guide will tell you anecdotes and stories about the place. Next, you will go to an open cenote where you will enjoy some relaxing moments surrounded by the abundant nature where, with a bit of luck, you will be able to observe some of the endemic birds of the Yucatan Peninsula. Finally, you will visit an open cenote of spectacular beauty. All of them are part of a system fed by the largest underground river in the world. At the end of the designated time for the activity, your experience will be over.

unique_selling_points: ["Immersive experience into Frida Kahlo's life and work","Visit to her intimate spaces and personal objects","Peaceful courtyard garden with symbolic plants and sculptures"]
one_line_summary: Discover the life and art of Frida Kahlo at Casa Azul, a cultural icon in Mexico City.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Pablo Yuichi
General Description: Title: Explore the Casa Azul Museum | Description: Step inside the Casa Azul and be captivated by the legacy of Mexican painter Frida Kahlo on this approximately 3-hour tour. Your experience begins when your English-speaking guide picks you up and takes you to this museum, which invites you to immerse yourself in the life of the painter and her work through a collection of paintings, photographs and personal items. 

As you continue your tour, you will see the kitchen, bedroom and other intimate spaces that housed the daily lives of Frida Kahlo and Diego Rivera. You will observe personal objects, such as her wardrobe and jewelry, that reveal intimate details of her personality and style. Don"t forget to explore the courtyard garden, a peaceful space where Frida used to find inspiration. Its plants, fountains and sculptures transport you to a world full of symbolism.

*NOTE: Extensive explanations given by external guides are not allowed inside the house, only in the gardens. If a detailed guided tour is required, it must be requested in advance.

Location: address: Ciudad de México, CDMX, México | locations: Mexico City

unique_selling_points: ["Interaction with endangered species","Honey tasting from sacred Mayan bees","Conservation-focused eco-tour"]
one_line_summary: Learn about endangered species and honey tasting at a conservation center in Quintana Roo.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Nuevo Durango
General Description: Title: Learn the species in recovery at UMA | Description: Today, you will have a tour lasting approximately 1,5 hours, your local Spanish-speaking guide will be waiting for you at the Nuevo Durango Cabins to take you to learn about the species in recovery, among them the white-tailed deer, the ocellated turkey and the melipona bees better known as the sacred Mayan bee where especially, you will have the opportunity to be in contact with them and taste the honey reserves.
This Environmental Management Unit created in 2006 by a family from Nuevo Durango, is a conservation project in favor of the animals of the region that are in danger of extinction, where they are in charge of protecting them, their reproduction, feeding and care, to later release them and relocate them in protected areas where hunting is prohibited. Once this adventure is over, you can return to your hotel.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Visit to the UMA  - 1.5h - SPA | serviceDescription: Visit to the UMA | serviceType: Centro Ecoturístico | destinationName: Quintana Roo

one_line_summary: Discover Puerto Vallarta's history and flavors with city tour and tequila tasting
bussines_description:
Supplier: Ecotours Vallarta
General Description: Title: Historic and gastronomic fusion: tequila tasting | Description: Today, your local guide in Spanish will wait for you at the meeting point to join a group of travelers and go to a Puerto Vallarta tour of approximately five hours, where you will learn more about the monuments and history of the city; you will visit the Malecón, look up to the Seahorse sculpture, and walk through the city center until arriving to a jewelry shop in the romantic zone. Enjoy any of the three drinks offered, including the “margarita”, besides the Fire Opal history explanation.

Carry on the tour to Los Arcos de Mismaloya viewpoint to reach Rancho Verano restaurant, where you will glimpse this magical experience: tequila tasting. Mainly, the explanation of the production process of this drink will be the main topic of the tour, followed by its tasting and accompaniment, which can be the dish of your choice from the restaurant menu; return with heavy bellies to your destination and continue discovering what Puerto Vallarta can provide.

one_line_summary: Participate in the vital conservation activity of releasing baby turtles in Oaxaca's La Escobilla.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Centro ecoturístico Escobilla
General Description: Title: Release of baby turtles in La Escobilla | Description: With your local Spanish-speaking guide and a group of travellers, you will live a turtle release experience that lasts approximately 60 minutes, depending on the nature. Your adventure begins with a brief tour, where the hatching pen is shown, and the conservation project is explained; the incubation, hatching, emergence and release of the baby turtles. The problem of looting and why it is necessary to incubate them in a guarded place. Finally, you will be able to participate in the release of the hatchlings that will have just hatched in protection with the visitors. It is an experience of life and reflection to see how the turtles seek their way to the sea. This activity depends entirely on nature.

unique_selling_points: ["Authentic trajinera boat experience in Xochimilco","Visit to iconic Casa Azul of Frida Kahlo","Walk through picturesque Coyoacán neighborhood"]
one_line_summary: Discover Mexico City's cultural gems: Xochimilco, Coyoacán, and Casa Azul in one full-day tour.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Pablo Yuichi
General Description: Title: South of Mexico City: Xochimilco, Coyoacán and Casa Azul | Description: Your English-speaking guide will pick you up to visit the southern area of Mexico City. Your first stop will be one of the most emblematic areas of the capital: the canals of Xochimilco, a word that in Nahuatl means Field of Flowers and that are the last memory of the rivers that crossed the valley of the ancient Tenochtitlan. You will board a traditional trajinera, a colorfully painted wooden boat, and while you sail you will learn about the history of the place, its famous chinampas or floating gardens, and the famous ajolotes.  

You will continue your day in the bohemian neighborhood of Coyoacán, one of the most picturesque in the city and characterized by its cobblestone streets and colonial architecture. During your walk you will see churches, squares and beautiful gardens. We suggest you taste the typical desserts of the neighborhood, such as the delicious churros and ice cream. Finally you will visit the Casa Azul, a space dedicated to the Mexican painter Frida Kahlo, you will see paintings, photographs and personal objects that belonged to her and her partner Diego Rivera, as well as her studio, kitchen, bedroom and, of course, the beautiful courtyard garden. 

* External guides are not allowed in Casa Azul/ Frida Kahlo Museum if you want a guided visit, you will have to hire a guide at the entrance (not included)
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Trajinera in Xochimilco, Coyoacan & Casa Azul - 6.5h - ENG | serviceDescription: Trajinera in Xochimilco, Coyoacan & Casa Azul | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Mexico Area

bussines_description:
Supplier: Coyote Aventuras
General Description: Title: Hierve El Agua Hike & Mezcal Experience | Description: Today at 6 a.m. you will meet your Spanish-speaking guide and other travelers at the meeting point to begin your 12-hour (approx.) experience. Afterwards, you will head to the community of San Isidro Roaguía, near Hierve el Agua, where you will have breakfast near a waterfall. After breakfast, you will have the opportunity to visit the waterfall and swim in the natural pools.  Afterwards, you will take an intermediate level hike of 7 km with an approximate duration of 2 hours, to visit a secret waterfall where you can swim again, explore the place and enjoy some snacks. Afterwards, you will start your journey to Unión Zapata, where you will visit a local family at their mezcal distillery. They will show you the mezcal production process and you will have the opportunity to enjoy some tastings. Finally, the team will drop you off at the meeting point so you can make your own way back to your hotel.

one_line_summary: Discover San José del Cabo's culture, history, and flavors in a relaxed 3.5-hour tour
bussines_description:
Supplier: Rancho Tours
General Description: Title: Luxury Tour of San José del Cabo | Description: Today, you will enjoy a unique experience of approximately three and a half hours, discovering a paradise of relaxation: San José del Cabo. In the afternoon, your transportation and guide will pick you up to begin the experience. You will head to the marina of this iconic town to visit a native fishing community called “La Playita,” where you will learn about its operations and development. Next, you will explore the historic center, strolling through its colorful streets, admiring its colonial architecture, immersing yourself in its fascinating artistic scene, and enjoying the serene atmosphere. You will visit the Mission of San José del Cabo, an emblematic church of the town, and have free time to shop, taste traditional tequila, and/or continue discovering the charms of this beautiful place. To conclude, you will enjoy a Mexican dinner at a restaurant located in the heart of the city. Finally, your transportation will take you back to your hotel, marking the end of this unforgettable experience.

unique_selling_points: ["Immersive Day of the Dead celebration in Puebla","Visit to iconic Catrinas figures and floral decorations","Exploration of local squares and community altars","Guided tour with English-speaking expert","Cultural insight into Mexican traditions and symbolism"]
one_line_summary: Explore Puebla's vibrant Day of the Dead traditions and iconic Catrinas
bussines_description:
Supplier: Puebla de ensueño
General Description: Title: Catrinas Valley Experience | Description: Today, your English-speaking guide will pick you up at your hotel to begin your approximately 6.5-hour experience. Together, you will embark on a tour of the Valley of the Catrinas for the Day of the Dead. You will start with a short walk to visit squares and streets adorned with altars and offerings created by the local community and merchants. Next, you will visit the Magic Garden, an iconic place known for its floral decorations that vary according to the season. Here, you will be able to see a variety of flowers and plants characteristic of the region. Afterward, you will admire the impressive Catrinas, personifications of death in Mexican culture that symbolize the way the transition to the afterlife is embraced and celebrated. These figures are often colorful and elegant skeletons dressed in traditional clothing. At the end, your guide will take you back to your hotel, marking the conclusion of your experience.
