one_line_summary: Exciting speedboat tour exploring Cabo Catoche's marine life and pristine beaches
bussines_description:
Supplier: VIP Holbox
General Description: Title: Holbox: Tour of Cabo Catoche by 29' speedboat | Description: Today you will meet your local Spanish-speaking guide at the meeting point, where you will set sail to the northern area of Cabo Catoche, a place of communion between the Caribbean Sea and the Gulf of Mexico, an area of beautiful landscapes, pristine beaches and unparalleled marine life. This experience lasts approximately 6 hours. 

The captain will choose the perfect spot to fish, he and your guide will advise you and transmit the traditional fishing techniques to catch fish of sufficient size to prepare a delicious ceviche. Afterwards you will head to the Cuevones: an area with 2 meters deep, ideal for swimming and snorkeling with an endless number of fish and corals. This area keeps a secret under its rocks, where you can find cat sharks and, if you are lucky, hawksbill turtles, octopus and lobsters. Finally, you will make a stop at a virgin beach where you will enjoy the delicious ceviche with the catch of the day and, if the tide is high, you will return through the mangroves to reach Holbox on the other side of the island.

one_line_summary: Experience traditional Maya cane juice and henequen fiber extraction firsthand.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Kíichpam Kaax Selva Bonita
General Description: Title: Cane Juice Extraction and Henequen Spinning at Chunhuhub | Description: Delve into the world of artisanal production of cane juice and henequen spinning, and discover the ancient methods used by the Mayan culture. Accompanied by your local Spanish-speaking guide, you will have the opportunity to take an active part in the extraction of these products using traditional manual instruments, such as the emblematic trapiche to extract the sweet and refreshing cane juice, and the ancestral pakche to obtain the valuable henequen fibers.

During this approximately 2-hour experience, you will be able to appreciate first-hand the importance of these products in the daily life of Maya families, both in the preparation of food and in the elaboration of various utensils. You will discover how the cane juice is used to sweeten beverages and food, and how the sisal fibers are transformed into hammocks, ropes and bags that have been fundamental in the history and traditions of the Mayan culture.

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to UNESCO World Heritage historic center of Puebla","Tour of Talavera pottery factory","Climb to the Sanctuary of Our Lady of Remedies with panoramic views","Explore the oldest inhabited city in America, Cholula","Visit to the Cholula archaeological site and tunnels"]
one_line_summary: Discover Puebla’s colonial charm and Cholula’s ancient mysteries in a full-day cultural tour
bussines_description:
Supplier: Puebla de ensueño
General Description: Title: Tour of the magical town of Cholula and the colonial city of Puebla | Description: Today, along with your local Spanish-speaking guide, you will enjoy an approximately 7-hour experience. You will start with the historic center of Puebla, declared a World Heritage Site by UNESCO. You will admire the impressive cathedral of the city, of Herrerian style and built between the 16th and 17th centuries. You will continue with a visit to the Palafoxiana Library, center of universal knowledge and one of the first libraries in the American continent. Then you will visit a Talavera factory to learn about this traditional craft. During this tour, you will also visit other emblematic places such as the Barrio del Artista, the Barrio de Los Sapos, as well as the El Parián Crafts Market and the Calle de Los Dulces where you will have the opportunity to taste typical sweets from Puebla.

You will then continue to the magical town of Cholula, the oldest city in America inhabited without interruption since its origins. Here you will visit the Museum of the Cholula Site, where you will learn about the pre-Hispanic history of the place through its tunnels and the Great Main Basement, which is now completely covered. Then, you will climb to the top of this settlement to visit the famous Sanctuary of Our Lady of Remedies and appreciate its Baroque-style architecture and decoration, as well as enjoying beautiful views of the city.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Cholula + Puebla - 7h - SPA | serviceDescription: Cholula + Puebla | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Puebla Area
Location: address: C. 4 Sur 310, Centro histórico de Puebla, 72000 Heroica Puebla de Zaragoza, Pue. | locations: Puebla

unique_selling_points: ["Visit two significant Mayan archaeological sites in Quintana Roo","Expert English-speaking guide providing cultural insights","Includes transportation from Bacalar to the archaeological sites","Explore majestic structures surrounded by lush nature","Learn about Mayan history, architecture, and iconography"]
one_line_summary: Discover the majestic Mayan cities of Dzibanché and Kohunlich in a full-day archaeological tour.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Bacalar Escape
General Description: Title: Explore and discover the Mayan cities of Dzibanché and Kohunlich. | Description: Today, you will go on a 6 hour tour with a group of travelers, your English speaking guide will pick you up at your hotel to take you to the first stop; Dzibanché whose name is a Mayan word that means writing on wood, referring to the carved wooden lintels that were found in one of the temples built here, it also consists of 4 groups of monumental architecture. Then you will go to Kohunlich, an ancient Mayan city surrounded by nature and made up of majestic housing, civic and religious complexes, among which stands out the Temple of the Masks that is decorated with molded figures, whose iconography represents real characters, dressed with attributes related to the sun. At the end of this experience, transportation will take you back to your hotel.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Dzibanche & Kohunlich tour - 6h - ENG | serviceDescription: Dzibanche & Kohunlich tour | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Quintana Roo
Location: address: Calle 30 entre avenidas 5 y 7. Colonia Mario Villanueva , Bacalar, Mexico | locations: Bacalar

one_line_summary: Explore Monte Albán and craft your own alebrije in Oaxaca
bussines_description:
Supplier: Etnoturística
General Description: Title: Monte Albán and the alebrijes workshop: an unforgettable experience | Description: Today, you will have an exciting 6-hour adventure in which you will explore the archaeology, history, and crafts of the region. Your local English-speaking guide will pick you up, and you will begin a tour of Monte Albán, a great Zapotec city located on top of a hill in the center of the Central Valleys of Oaxaca. This city had a significant influence on the development of Mesoamerica and has been declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site. You will enjoy an impressive landscape of mountains and valleys as you explore the main structures of the complex, including the North Platform and the Grand Plaza. You will pay special attention to the Gallery of the Dancers and the ball court, among other impressive buildings, during the two-hour visit.

Afterward, you will be transported to the community of Arrazola. The transfer to the city will take 20 minutes, where you will visit the Alebrijes Workshop at Don Mario Jiménez's House, an alebrijes artisan. His son, Isaías, will explain the history of the workshop, and the artisans will give you a wooden carved piece for you to paint with the colors you prefer. This is a unique experience that will allow you to learn more about the traditions and culture of the region. Finally, you will return to your hotel to rest.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Monte Alban & Workshop: Paint your alebrije - 6h - ENG | serviceDescription: Monte Alban & Workshop: Paint your alebrije | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Oaxaca
Location: address: Oaxaca, Centro, Oaxaca de Juárez, Oaxaca, México | locations: Oaxaca de Juárez

unique_selling_points: ["UNESCO World Heritage Site","Spectacular cliffside location overlooking Caribbean Sea","Access to Playa Ruinas for swimming"]
one_line_summary: Explore the iconic Mayan ruins of Tulum with a guided tour and seaside views
bussines_description:
Supplier: Armando Alcántara
General Description: Title: Visit the archaeological site of Tulum | Description: Explore Tulum, one of Mexico's most iconic archaeological sites declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Together with your local Spanish-speaking guide, you will take a tour of approximately 45 minutes to learn about why these ruins played a particularly important role in the maritime and overland trade of the Mayan region, as well as serving as an astronomical observatory and defensive system. You will have the opportunity to observe the different buildings and murals, including El Castillo, the tallest structure in Tulum. This Mayan city is located amidst a mangrove ecosystem and on a cliff overlooking the beautiful Caribbean Sea, making it a unique and spectacular place. From the archaeological site, you have access to the Playa Ruinas (Ruins Beach). Don't hesitate to take a swim and refresh yourself.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Guided visit to the AS of Tulum - 45min - SPA | serviceDescription: Guided visit to the AS of Tulum | serviceType: Guía | destinationName: Quintana Roo
Location: address: Tulum, Quintana Roo, México | locations: Tulum

one_line_summary: Learn about coffee production and taste fresh Chiapas coffee at Argovia Farm
bussines_description:
Supplier: Hotel Argovia Finca Resort
General Description: Title: Coffee Tour at Argovia Farm | Description: Today, you will experience a tour of approximately one hour to thoroughly understand the coffee-making process. You will meet a group of travellers in the hotel reception alongside your local guide, who speaks Spanish, and together you will head to the estate's coffee processing facility. This estate, with a 140-year history in coffee cultivation, has recently evolved to dedicate not only 100% to the coffee industry but also to promote experiences that encourage environmental regeneration through sustainable techniques. During the tour, you will be shown the process that Arabic coffee beans must undergo from their harvesting to becoming the beverage you probably enjoy in your breakfast. After explaining each stage, from the arrival of the beans at the facility to their roasting, you will have the opportunity to participate in a coffee tasting to complete the experience.

unique_selling_points: ["Authentic Day of the Dead celebration in Oaxaca","UNESCO recognized cultural event","Immersive street exploration with local guide","Traditional altars and offerings experience","Evening celebration with dinner"]
one_line_summary: Experience authentic Day of the Dead celebrations in Oaxaca with a guided street tour.
bussines_description:
Supplier: México Kan Tours
General Description: Title: Walking Tour: Day of the Dead | Description: Today, you will experience an authentic Mexican tradition during a five-hour journey through the streets of Oaxaca, immersing yourself in one of the country's most iconic celebrations: Day of the Dead. This festivity, held annually on November 1st and 2nd, commemorates the temporary return of departed loved ones to Earth, honoring their lives and legacy. Recognized by UNESCO as an Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity, this celebration is a vibrant tribute to memory and tradition.
In the afternoon, you will meet your guide at the designated meeting point to begin the experience. You will visit the iconic Plaza de Santo Domingo, where the church and the former convent will be beautifully decorated for the occasion. Then, you will explore the colorful neighborhood of Jalatlaco, observing the creation of altars and the placement of offerings in an atmosphere of joy and festivity. As night falls, you will enjoy a delicious dinner, concluding this picturesque and unforgettable immersion into Mexican tradition.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Walking tour: Day of the dead - 5h - ENG | serviceDescription: Walking tour: Day of the dead | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Oaxaca
Location: address: Avenida Tulum S/N. Entre Orion y, C. Centauro Sur, Centro, 77760 Tulum, Q.R. | locations: Tulum, Oaxaca de Juárez

unique_selling_points: ["Authentic community-based corn to tortilla process","Hands-on experience with traditional planting and cooking techniques","Participation in cultural and agricultural practices of Nahua community","Learning from native cooks and elders","Crafting souvenirs from totomoxtle (corn husk)"]
one_line_summary: Immersive community experience in Tlaxcala: from planting corn to making tortillas
bussines_description:
Supplier: Turismo Biocultural Yoloaltépetl
General Description: Title: Gastronomic Experience: From Corn to Tortilla | Description: Today you will have a community experience in San Pedro Tlalcuapan, in the state of Tlaxcala, for 6 hours. Once you arrive, you will be welcomed in a Nahua house with over 100 years of history. Depending on the season, you will have the opportunity to connect with the land and participate in the corn planting process with Mario, Ismael, and their family. You will learn how to handle the yurta (plow) and harvest various products from the milpa, such as corn, pumpkins, edible flowers, beans, peas, and much more.

Afterwards, you will learn the technique of subir el Nixcomitl, which is the process of cooking corn, and you will also learn how to use the metate, just like the grandmothers do. You will cook authentic dishes based on corn, guided by the native cooks from the community. To conclude, you will participate in a handicraft workshop using totomoxtle (dry corn husk), so that you can take a souvenir from this community experience.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: From corn to tortilla - 6h - SPA | serviceDescription: From corn to tortilla | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Tlaxcala Area
Location: address: Calle Diego Martin s/n San Pedro Talcuapan, Chiautempan, Tlaxcala, México

one_line_summary: Explore Mayan crafts and traditions in a scenic jungle community near Xpujil.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Visit Calakmul
General Description: Title: Visit to the workshops of the 20 de Noviembre Community. | Description: Today you will start your visit at 9 am to the Community 20 de Noviembre, located 20 minutes from downtown Xpujil, your local guide in Spanish will go along with you in your stay of 2 hours and 30 minutes in this picturesque and quiet village of Mayan origin that is located in the jungle and highlights the past and present through crafts that merge the traditions of the community. Among the workshops you can take are the elaboration of textile embroidery, wood crafts, the weaving (machining) of the 4-wire hammock and stone carving/sculpture, you will also learn the history behind the workshop of your choice. To complete this experience you will make your own handicrafts and finally you will be able to walk back to Xpujil.
Note: 
1 You will be able to choose the workshop of your preference.
2 You can use transportation for the tour at an extra cost.

Together, you"ll take a tour through the streets of Guanajuato, where you"ll learn about the culture and lifestyle of the city through street art. In addition, your guide will explain in detail about the history and architecture of one of Mexico"s most popular states for its irregular urban design and narrow streets. unique_selling_points: ["Three generations of tequila craftsmanship","Artisanal distillation process","Exclusive three-course meal with traditional beverage"]
one_line_summary: Explore tequila's heritage with a 3-generation tour and tasting at Casa Sauza.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Casa Sauza
General Description: Title: Experience the 3 generations tour at Casa Sauza and learn all about the tequila process | Description: Today, you will meet your local English-speaking guide and a group of travelers at Casa Sauza, one of the oldest distilleries in the magical town of Tequila. For approximately 4 hours you will immerse yourself in the fascinating world of tequila. You will begin by exploring the Agave Fields, where you will learn about the importance of this plant and its relationship to tequila production. You will also witness a demonstration of jima, the traditional process of cutting the agave leaves. Then you will visit the Bodega, where you will learn about the tequila maturation process and how it influences its flavor and quality. You will continue with a visit to the Distillery to observe the tequila distillation process and discover the secrets behind its artisanal elaboration. As part of the tour, a professional tasting of a selection of tequilas produced by Casa Sauza will take place. Expert tasters will guide you through a tasting experience, revealing the unique nuances and flavors of each tequila variety.

Finally, you will enjoy an exquisite three-course meal at La Cueva de Don Cenobio restaurant. This exclusive menu includes specially selected dishes, accompanied by a refreshing prepared cantarito, a traditional Mexican beverage.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Tres Generaciones Tour - 4h - ENG | serviceDescription: Tres Generaciones Tour | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Jalisco
Location: address: Luis Navarro #70 Tequila, Jalisco 46400, México. | locations: Tequila

bussines_description:
Supplier: Teotihuacan en bici
General Description: Title: Hot air balloon ride in Teotihuacan | Description: Today you will meet your Spanish-speaking local guide and fellow travellers at the meeting point to begin your approximately 3-hour experience. Upon arrival, you will have breakfast and then board a hot air balloon for a 40 minute ride to appreciate a panoramic view of this emblematic place, where you will appreciate the City of the Gods and your guide will tell you about its history and all the mysteries of this ancient civilization, where you will see buildings such as the Pyramid of the Sun and Pyramid of the Moon.  At the end of the designated time your experience will be over.

unique_selling_points: ["Authentic Maya daily life experience","Close observation of protected melipona bees","Hands-on activities like hammock weaving and food tools"]
one_line_summary: Experience authentic Maya daily life and learn about traditional crafts and bees in Quintana Roo
bussines_description:
Supplier: Kíichpam Kaax Selva Bonita
General Description: Title: Living like the Mayas at Chunhuhub | Description: Immerse yourself in an adventure that will transport you back in time and allow you to experience the daily life of the ancient Maya for approximately 2 hours. Accompanied by your local Spanish-speaking guide, discover the importance of traditional home construction as you immerse yourself in a world full of ancestral knowledge. You will learn about the tools used to make food, the art of hammock weaving and many other activities that were part of the daily life of the Maya.

During this experience, you will have the opportunity to observe up close a special species that maintained a close relationship with the Mayas: the melipona bees. These bees are distinguished by their lack of sting and are a protected and preserved species in this ecotourism center. You will appreciate their importance in the Mayan culture and their contribution to the biodiversity of the region.

unique_selling_points: ["Close encounter with humpback whales","Snorkeling among coral reefs","Visit to Crab Island with colorful crabs","Combination of marine wildlife and cultural exploration"]
one_line_summary: Exciting whale watching and snorkeling adventure in Nayarit's Coral Island
bussines_description:
Supplier: Nayarit Adventures
General Description: Title: Whale Watching and Snorkeling at Coral Island | Description: Your day will begin with a light breakfast before heading to Rincón de Guayabitos (approximately 1 hour away). Accompanied by your local guide, who speaks English, you will board a boat in search of humpback whales. During the whale watching experience, you will have the opportunity to admire adult and young whales, whale pairs in courtship, and even whale calves with their mothers - a fascinating experience. You will then continue to Coral Island, where you will snorkel among rocky coral reefs, and later arrive at Crab Island to admire a multitude of colorful crabs from the boat. Upon returning, a delicious seafood-based meal will be waiting for you. Finally, you will head to the historic and stately city of Compostela for a 40-minute walking tour before returning to Tepic.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Whale watching & snorkeling in Coral Island - 11.5h - ENG | serviceDescription: Whale watching & snorkeling in Coral Island | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Nayarit
Location: address: Sebastián Lerdo de Tejada Pte. 23, Centro, 63000 Tepic, Nay. | locations: Puerto Vallarta

General Description: Title: Calakmul tour | Description: Today you will join a group of travelers for a Calakmul experience, your local English-speaking guide will pick you up at your hotel and you will begin your journey to the largest city in the Mayan world. The archaeological zone of Calakmul extends over 70 km2 and contains more than 6,000 structures, which are in an admirable state of preservation and offer a vivid picture of what ancient life was like in this capital city. You will be able to walk through the surrounding jungle and then go up to temple 2 from where you will be able to observe the jungle and the structures from the top. Finally, transportation will take you back to your hotel.

one_line_summary: Kayak at sunrise in Bacalar Lagoon with starry sky and mangrove exploration
bussines_description:
Supplier: Bacalar Sunrise
General Description: Title: Kayaking in the Bacalar Lagoon | Description: Immerse yourself in an experience in one of the most spectacular places in Bacalar. From the moment you start this adventure of approximately 4 hours, you will be accompanied by your English-speaking guide and a group of travelers. The journey begins paddling towards the pirates' channel, while watching the starry sky. If you are lucky enough to witness a shooting star, it will be a magical moment. Crossing the pirates channel will allow you to contemplate the sunrise of Bacalar. Afterwards, we will visit the mariscal lagoon, where you can immerse yourself in the tranquility of the mangroves and marvel at the native flora and fauna.

Paddling is a fun and easy activity that you will enjoy. At the end of our trip, we will bid you farewell with a breakfast that includes fresh bread, local fruits and coffee to energize you and start a new day.

General Description: Title: Visiting the streets of Izamal, Yucatán | Description: Today, your local guide in English will take you on a walking tour of approximately two hours through the most significant places of Izamal, one city that combines history, colonial architecture, and Mayan traditions. First, you will visit the San Antonio de Padua Convent, one of the leading tourist attractions in the zone and one of the biggest convents in Latin America. Finally, before returning to your hotel, you will learn about the prehispanic Kinich Kakmó Pyramid, a relevant archeological site known for its cobbled streets and yellow-painted houses. During this tour, you will listen to a brief explanation about each place visited.

unique_selling_points: ["Cycling through authentic Mayan communities","Visit to Chamula's main church and rituals","Exploration of Zinacantán's vibrant market and floral church","Hands-on experience with traditional textile techniques","Tasting authentic Mexican coffee de olla"]

bussines_description:
Supplier: El Refugio
General Description: Title: Cycling through the Chamula and Zinacantán communities | Description: Today you will join a cycling excursion of approximately five hours and thirty minutes, cycling through the communities of Chiapas. You will meet your Spanish-speaking guide at the agreed meeting point to begin the 12-kilometre ascent to the Mayan/Tzotzil community of Chamula. There, the main church awaits you, a beacon of the customs and traditions practised by the local community. You will have time to discover these rituals before cycling to the village of Zinacatán, where you will be greeted by a vibrant local market and a church adorned with a diversity of flowers and colours. The journey continues at La Casa de las Tejedoras, where you will be immersed in textile techniques and lifestyles, culminating in a tasting of an authentic café de olla. This cultural experience concludes with the return to the starting point.

one_line_summary: Explore Puebla's historic center, UNESCO site, with cultural sights and local crafts
bussines_description:
Supplier: Puebla de ensueño
General Description: Title: Walking tour of the historic center of Puebla | Description: Today, together with your local English-speaking guide, you will enjoy a 3-hour walking tour of the historic center of Puebla, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. You will begin by admiring the City's impressive cathedral, built in the Herrerian style between the 16th and 17th centuries. You will continue with a visit to the Palafoxiana Library, a center of universal knowledge and one of the first libraries of the American continent. 
Its variety and bibliographic wealth earned it the title of Memory of the World by UNESCO, a true jewel of Puebla. Afterwards you will visit a Talavera factory to learn about this traditional craft. During this tour you will also visit other emblematic places such as the Barrio del Artista, the Barrio de Los Sapos, as well as the El Parián Handicrafts Market, and the Calle de Los Dulces where you will have the opportunity to taste typical sweets of Puebla.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Puebla City Tour - 3h - ENG | serviceDescription: Puebla City Tour | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Puebla Area
Location: address: C. 4 Sur 310, Centro histórico de Puebla, 72000 Heroica Puebla de Zaragoza, Pue. | locations: Puebla

On arrival to the community where the waterfalls are, you will walk a few meters as long as the calm and peace that nature will provide you surround you until you reach the crystal water pits formations, where you can refresh and relax. To finish the experience, you will taste this region's typical dishes, accompanied by butter rice, handmade tortillas, and pot beans.

bussines_description:
Supplier: Manialtepec
General Description: Title: Oaxacan Mezcal Tasting | Description: Today your local Spanish speaking guide will be waiting for you at the meeting point to take you on a 1 hour tasting experience of the most representative mezcals of the State of Oaxaca, accompanied with the gastronomic products of the region; salt of worm, cheese press, chapulines, quesillo and tostadas with carrizos. All this next to the beach, while enjoying the sunset.
Mezcal is a drink of ceremonies and rituals used in the past for massages and healing as well as to bless the corn harvest; made from the agave plant, specifically with the heart (called piña because of its shape). 
Finally you can return to your hotel.

unique_selling_points: ["Hands-on preparation of iconic Mexican dish","Use of regional ingredients sourced from local producers","Detailed recipe book provided","Learn about the history and origins of Taco al Pastor","Cooking guided by an English-speaking chef"]
one_line_summary: Learn to make authentic Taco al Pastor in a Puebla culinary workshop
bussines_description:
Supplier: Teoxintle Taller
General Description: Title: Learn to Prepare Taco al Pastor in a Culinary Workshop | Description: Today, you'll have the opportunity to prepare one of Mexico's most well-known dishes: the famous Taco al Pastor. This gastronomic experience will take place in a location in Cautlancingo, Puebla. The chef, who speaks English, will accompany you and provide you with a detailed recipe book so you can follow each step of the preparation. This approximately two-and-a-half-hour experience will begin with an introduction to the origins and history of this iconic Mexican dish.

Using ingredients from the region and sourced from small local producers, the chef will guide you in preparing the marinade. Subsequently, you'll learn about the essential components of a good taco, such as pineapple, salsa, onion, and cilantro. Finally, you'll have the opportunity to plate your creation and savor it, accompanied by refreshing fresh waters. Immerse yourself in the rich culinary culture of Mexico as you enjoy this culinary journey!
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Taco al pastor workshop - 2.5h - ENG | serviceDescription: Taco al pastor workshop | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Puebla Area

one_line_summary: Explore Mexico's rich indigenous heritage at the National Museum of Anthropology.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Pablo Yuichi
General Description: Title: Visit the National Museum of Anthropology | Description: Today you will take a guided tour of approximately 4 hours to one of the most important museums in Latin America and the world. It was built in the 1960's by architect Pedro Ramirez Vasquez and has 22 rooms designed to preserve Mexico's rich indigenous heritage. Accompanied by your English-speaking guide, you will tour the museum's main collections while learning about the history of pre-Hispanic cultures and appreciating some of the most important pieces of pre-Columbian Mexico such as the Aztec Calendar, the Olmec Colossal Head, and the famous Mask of Pakal.

Location: address: Ciudad de México, CDMX, México | locations: Mexico City

At the end of your exploration of this ancient Mayan city, transportation will take you back to your hotel.

bussines_description:
Supplier: Parador Turístico Yaxunah
General Description: Title: Visit to Lol Ha cenote in Yaxunah | Description: Today, you will have the opportunity to visit with your Spanish-speaking guide the Lol-Ha cenote, also known as Flower of Water. This cenote has great historical importance for the Yaxunah community, as it was where the first inhabitants of the area used to get water. This cenote has become a popular tourist destination thanks to its crystal clear blue waters. You can enjoy a refreshing swim in its 30-meter-deep waters, with easy access. Additionally, if you wish, you can try the delicious dishes offered by the local community.

unique_selling_points: ["Walk along historic stone roads linking Zapotec cities","Immersive community visits in Sierra Norte","Biodiversity-rich pine-oak forests","Authentic local gastronomy experience","Multi-day trekking with cultural insights"]
one_line_summary: Multi-day trek exploring Sierra Norte’s historic roads, forests, and indigenous culture
bussines_description:
Supplier: Expediciones Sierra Norte
General Description: Title: Oaxaca’s royal roads | Description: Today, you will leave from Oaxaca City to Sierra Norte, across the Tlacolula Valley to Tlacolula village, for a three-day and two-night experience. On arrival, you will meet your local guide in Spanish to start the connecting walk to the Latuvi community, also known as the land of the “rolled leaf”. You will visit the pine-oak forests through the path of La Cucharilla until reaching your destination, enjoy your food, and check-in in the cottages. The next day, you will prepare your backpack and eat breakfast in the dining room, then start your walk to Amatlán village across the “Camino Real”.

On the path, you will observe remains of the original stone road that linked the Central Valleys Zapotec cities with the Gulf of Mexico and the flora biodiversity. After arriving at your destination, you will taste the local gastronomy in a dining room, rest, visit the community museum, and continue to Amatlán village, where you will spend the night. Next morning, you will prepare your luggage, eat breakfast, and make a connecting walk to Calpulálpam, across the hot land area. Finally, you will move to Parque los Molinos, where you will taste trout before finishing this experience and returning to Oaxaca.

unique_selling_points: ["Witnessing sea turtles in their natural nesting process","No captivity involved, observing wild behavior","Community-guided experience in Oaxaca","Conservation reflection opportunity"]
one_line_summary: Night turtle monitoring at Oaxaca: witness nesting in the wild, promote conservation
bussines_description:
Supplier: Centro ecoturístico Escobilla
General Description: Title: Night turtle monitoring at Escobilla | Description: Today you will embark on an adventure with your Spanish-speaking community guide in search of sea turtles as they nest on the beach. This approximately 1 hour experience will immerse you in the world of these creatures and allow you to witness a completely natural process. 

It is important to note that all the turtles that are sighted are in complete freedom, since there are no specimens in captivity. Therefore, the sighting is subject to natural factors, which means that the possibility of seeing one, several, hundreds or no turtles will depend on various elements that influence their behavior. This sighting is an invitation to admire the beauty of wildlife and to reflect on our responsibility as human beings in the conservation of these endangered species.

bussines_description:
Supplier: Blue Beach Surf School
General Description: Title: Explore the Fascinating Night Magic in Puerto Escondido | Description: Join him on a trip to the lagoon to witness the magical bioluminescence in a tour of approximately 2.5 hours. It is recommended to do it on a moonless night to have the opportunity to marvel at this natural phenomenon. You will sail to the houseboats located in the lagoon, where you can witness how the water is illuminated with bright flashes.

You will depart at 8:00 pm and return at approximately 10:30 pm, giving you plenty of time to swim and enjoy the bioluminescence for approximately 1 hour and 30 minutes. The lagoon is conveniently located just 30 minutes from the north side of Puerto Escondido, ensuring easy access to this natural spectacle. Transportation and the tour will be guided by your local guide and an expert team so you can immerse yourself in the experience without worry.

unique_selling_points: ["Luxury trimaran tour in Bacalar","Visit to Stromatolites and mangroves","Snorkeling at Pirate Canal and Black Cenote","Bird sanctuary observation","Deep exploration of Cenote Esmeralda"]
one_line_summary: Luxury Bacalar cenote tour by trimaran with snorkeling and nature exploration
bussines_description:
Supplier: Veleando Ando
General Description: Title: Bacalar cenotes in a trimarán in Quintana Roo | Description: Today, your local guide in Spanish will wait for you at the meeting point to go on a tour of approximately four hours, where you will board a trimaran for two or up to ten people that will lead you to the south of Lake Bacalar and enjoy snacks and fruit water or beer. During your trip, you will connect with nature, observe and learn about stromatolites and the mangrove importance, and swim in the turquoise blue waters of Lake Bacalar. Next, you will visit The Pirate Canal, where you can swim and practice snorkeling; you will navigate through the Witch’s Cenote, also known as Black Cenote, to dive into the waters and enjoy the different colors of the depths. Besides, you will learn about Bird Island, a place locally declared as a sanctuary, where you will observe birds and the different colors of Lake Bacalar. Finally, you will go deeper into the Cenote Esmeralda, an outstanding beauty area where crystal and clean water flow into the lake.

In this walk of approximately six hours, you will discover not only a wide variety of plants but also a part and a tangible reminder from the past of mining history’s extensive ruins, whose importance captures its economic development and cultural-architectural influence. Finally, you will finish your day with a delicious lunch from the farm to your table, awaiting you in Rancho Las Canoas.

one_line_summary: Explore Uxmal, snorkel in cenotes, and enjoy a Mayan cultural experience in Yucatan
bussines_description:
Supplier: Mayan Ecotours
General Description: Title: Cultural Immersion in Yucatan: Archaeological Zone, Cenote and Mayan House | Description: Embark on this approximately 8-hour experience as you explore an important archaeological site with your certified English-speaking local guide and a group of travelers. You will begin when your shared transportation picks you up at your hotel to visit the thrice built archaeological site of Uxmal, the beauty of this ancient city is distinguished by its low, horizontal palaces arranged around ornate courtyards and quadrangles. These spaces are created from thousands of small stones polished and assembled with precision, giving life to geometric mosaics. 

Afterwards, dive into the crystalline waters of one of the cenotes in the Abalá area, where you can snorkel. To culminate this tour, you will enjoy a meal in an authentic Mayan house. Here, you will have the opportunity to immerse yourself in the culture and traditions of the Maya, while learning about their way of life and familiarizing yourself with some Mayan words.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Uxmal, cenote and lunch in a mayan house - 10h - ENG | serviceDescription: Uxmal, cenote and lunch in a mayan house | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Yucatan

unique_selling_points: ["Authentic neighborhood taqueria specializing in volcanes","Private artisanal mezcal tasting with a local chef","Lively cantina experience exploring Mexico City's drink culture","Small group for personalized experience"]
one_line_summary: Explore Narvarte's vibrant street food, mezcal, and local drink culture in a lively evening tour
bussines_description:
Supplier: Eat México
General Description: Title: Shared Experience: Tacos, Chelas & Mezcal in Narvarte | Description: Tonight you will meet your local Spanish-speaking guide and a small group of travelers at the meeting point for a gastronomic experience of approximately 3 hours in the streets of the Aztec capital. Narvarte is known throughout Mexico City for its tacos.

You'll begin the tour with a visit to a neighborhood taqueria that specializes in volcanes, a type of crispy tortilla cooked over a charcoal flame, topped with cheese and poblano peppers. From there, you'll sample tacos al pastor (imagine a large outdoor rotisserie, flames lit) and suadero tacos from vendors who have been in the neighborhood for decades. You'll visit a lively cantina to learn more about Mexico City's cantina culture, where you'll sip a cold beer or cocktail if you wish. You'll continue on to sample a flight of small-batch artisanal mezcals at a cozy neighborhood restaurant as part of a private mezcal tasting led by a local chef and expert.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Narvarte at night: Tacos, chelas and mezcal - 3h - SPA | serviceDescription: Narvarte at night: Tacos, chelas and mezcal | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Mexico Area

bussines_description:
Supplier: Luis Miguel
General Description: Title: Connect with Nature in the Cloud Forest of San José del Pacífico | Description: Enjoy a peaceful hike through the forest of San Jose del Pacifico, a picturesque mountain village in Oaxaca. Accompanied by a local Spanish-speaking guide, explore this natural region's rich flora and fauna and admire magnificent viewpoints along the way. Thanks to the high altitude of this village, you'll have the opportunity to hike through impressive trails in the cloud forest and enjoy unparalleled views. The hike lasts approximately 3 hours and is perfect for those seeking a relaxing natural activity.

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to four historic taverns with traditional drinks","Live performance by estudiantina musical group","Participation in local legends and boot contest"]
one_line_summary: Explore Puebla's historic taverns, enjoy local drinks, and experience vibrant nightlife.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Unlimited experiences
General Description: Title: Pub crawl in Puebla | Description: Today, your transportation and local guide in english will take you on a 5-hour tour to visit 4 historic taverns in the historic centre of Puebla. The first tavern to visit will be La Terminal, known since 1963 for serving the famous Sangria, a mix of liquors that gives it a reddish colour. You will then continue to La Opera tavern, which has offered its traditional drink Menyul since 1980. The third tavern is called La Pasita and offers a homonymous beverage, a raisin liqueur served with a piece of goat cheese. Lastly, you will visit the Nevados tavern, where since 1921, they have prepared cocktails characterized by being cold, sweet, and citrusy in flavour.


After the tavern tour, you will be transferred to the city's main square, the Zocalo, to join an “estudiantina”, a traditional student musical group. You will stroll through the narrow streets, listen to local legends, and end up at the Parian (craft market) to participate in the famous boot contest, where the person who drinks the most wins. After such a special night, you will return to your hotel.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Cantinas tour - 5h - ENG | serviceDescription: Cantinas tour | serviceType: Operadora local, Transporte | destinationName: Puebla Area
Location: address: Av. Don Juan de Palafox y. Mendoza entre calle Ayuntamiento y Calle 2 Norte, Centro histórico de Puebla, 72000 Heroica Puebla de Zaragoza, Pue. | locations: Puebla

A motorboat will board you on the research for dolphins in freedom, from females with their newborn creatures to groups of dolphins gathered in the same place.

You could watch them swim, jump, play bowling, or even they could give you a show; you will join them in the water if the circumstances allow it. unique_selling_points: ["Hands-on cheese-making with local expert","Visit to desert garden and water projects","Authentic regional cuisine lunch"]
one_line_summary: Interactive handmade cheese workshop with regional cuisine in Baja California Sur
bussines_description:
Supplier: Rancho Cacachilas
General Description: Title: Handmade cheese workshop in Baja California Sur | Description: Today, your local guide in Spanish will wait for you at the meeting point to join a group of travelers and go on a dynamic and cultural experience of approximately six hours. You will make fresh cheese and acquire all the necessary knowledge about the handmade cheese-making process during this experience. Firstly, you will meet goats and discover what sets them apart, what they enjoy, and how they typically spend their daily lives. You will also learn how to milk and handle them properly, guided by a skilled goat charmer who will provide personal instruction. Next, you will meet one of the leading cheese makers, who will explain the step-by-step procedure for transforming milk into cheese.

While the milk gets processed, you will visit one of the leading gardens, where you will get the secrets to having a garden like this in the desert. Besides, you will learn about some of the most relevant projects in erosion control and water management. Once the milk finishes processing, you will make the handmade fresh cheese under the guidance of a female expert. As long as it rests, you will taste other cheeses ranch-made in a tasting. After the process finishes, you will take it to your home. Finally, as lunch, you will eat the dishes prepared by the in-house chef; he brings together the knowledge of regional cuisine and takes it to another level.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Artisanal cheese workshop - 6h - SPA | serviceDescription: Artisanal cheese workshop | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Baja California Sur

bussines_description:
Supplier: Nuevo Durango
General Description: Title: Gastronomy workshop in the Mayan community of Nuevo Durango | Description: Today, you will have an adventure in Nuevo Durango; a small community characterized by being a traditional Mayan village that has managed to maintain its cultural identity both in language and customs and has been driven by activities such as ecotourism and organic food production. Your local guide in Spanish will be waiting for you at the established point for a gastronomic workshop with a duration of approximately 5 hours. 
Here you will have the opportunity, not only to enjoy a traditional meal (depending on the season), but you will be part of the whole process, from collecting fresh ingredients from the garden such as onions, tomatoes, avocado, lemons, oranges and everything you need to cook with members of the community some of their typical dishes among which we can find the cochinita and chicken pibil. Afterwards, you can enjoy the food and an atmosphere of music and songs representative of Mexico and the Mayan culture and at the end, you can return to your hotel.

unique_selling_points: ["Exploration of one of the world's largest underground river systems","Guided tour with geological explanations","Swimming and walking through flooded caves","Traditional regional buffet lunch"]
one_line_summary: Explore stunning underground caves and rivers at Rio Secreto in Riviera Maya.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Río secreto
General Description: Title: Rio Secreto: The Mayan underworld | Description: Today, your transport will pick you up in Playa del Carmen to join a group of travellers. You will experience 7 hours (including transport time) at Rio Secreto, a natural reserve located just minutes away from Playa del Carmen, in the heart of the Riviera Maya. Your local guide, who speaks English, will be waiting for you at the meeting point to explore one of the world's largest underground river systems, where the history of our planet is written in thousands of geological formations. Floating in its clear, freshwater is an experience you will remember for a lifetime.

Your guide will explain everything about the walls and formations of this wonderful geological library as you explore various flooded caves, some of which you can walk through and others where you will need to swim. Once the tour is concluded, a traditional buffet lunch awaits you with a variety of regional dishes. After the meal is finished, your transport will take you back to your hotel in Playa del Carmen.

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to Monte Albán, the Zapotec civilization cradle","Authentic Day of the Dead celebrations in local communities","Participation in traditional dance and music","Dinner with local family in community setting"]
one_line_summary: Full-day immersive Day of the Dead celebration in Oaxaca with archaeological, cultural, and local体验
bussines_description:
Supplier: Etnoturística
General Description: Title: Day of the Dead: The celebration begins, 1st of November. | Description: Today, you will live an experience of approximately 12 hours. Alongside another group of travelers, you will meet your local English-speaking guide at 8:30 am at the meeting point to begin the experience. First, you will visit the archaeological site of Monte Albán, the cradle of the Zapotec civilization, built on a mountain at an altitude of 1900 meters. After finishing the visit, you will head to the city center of Oaxaca for a tour to discover the main buildings, as well as to see the decorations of houses and public spaces related to the celebration of the Day of the Dead.

After this tour, you will have free time for lunch (not included) and to explore on your own. Later, you will reunite with your group and your guide to head towards the community of Soledad Etla, where you will witness the comparsa or muerteada, a traditional dance of the communities. Here, you can join in the rhythm of the music and dance with the locals. To conclude, you will head to another community where a local family will prepare a typical festive dinner for you. Afterwards, you will move to the family's courtyard and continue with the muerteada dance.

This place is home to one of the most impressive coral reefs of the Oaxacan coast, offering a unique snorkeling experience. Before diving, you will head to a restaurant recommended by your guide, where you can safely leave your belongings and begin your aquatic adventure.

Once equipped with the snorkeling equipment and life jackets included, you will dive into the underwater world of San Agustin Bay. Throughout the tour, you will have the opportunity to enjoy snorkeling in different areas of the bay. After this exciting activity, you will enjoy a delicious lunch at the restaurant, where you can recharge your batteries while enjoying the natural beauty that surrounds the bay of San Agustin.

bussines_description:
Supplier: Cabo Pulmo Water Sports
General Description: Title: Cabo Pulmo National Park Scuba Diving Class | Description: Today, you will join a group of travelers for a 1 hour adventure in Cabo Pulmo National Park, you will meet your Spanish speaking guide at the established meeting point. The Discovery Scuba Divers program is for people who have never dived before or are not certified. To begin with, you will have a theory class of approximately 30 minutes where you will learn the basic information for the activity, as well as three skills to develop underwater. Afterwards you will be provided with the complete diving equipment, while you board a boat that will take you to a shallow spot where you will learn what you have learned, followed by a diving tour.
This park is home to the only reefs in the Gulf of California and Sea of Cortez, as well as a great diversity of species. Cabo Pulmo is a protected natural area designated a natural world heritage site by UNESCO, important for the conservation of oceans and hard coral reefs.

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to San Angel's art galleries and historic convents","Exclusive tour of Diego Rivera's Anahuacalli Museum","Insight into Mexico City's colonial and modern architecture"]
one_line_summary: Explore San Angel's art scene, historic convents, and Diego Rivera's museum in Mexico City.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Pablo Yuichi
General Description: Title: Tour of galleries, former convents and architectural gems in San Angel and the Anahuacalli Museum. | Description: Today you will experience approximately 5hrs in San Angel and the Anahuacalli Museum. Your Spanish-speaking guide will pick you up at your hotel to take you to your first stop; the San Angel area, where you will discover a small square full of art galleries exhibiting the talent of different urban artists. You will observe the works on display, which reflect the diversity and creativity of the local art scene. You will also have the opportunity to explore the Ex-Conventos del Carmen and San Jacinto, where you will be given an explanation of their history. As you tour San Angel, you will enjoy a variety of dining options. From cafes to upscale restaurants offering Mexican and international cuisine. To continue this adventure, you will head to the Diego Rivera Anahuacalli Museum, an architectural gem. Here, you will witness a permanent collection of pre-Hispanic art representing the diverse cultures that flourished in Mesoamerica and were collected by Diego Rivera throughout his life. You will have the opportunity to observe the architecture, design and construction in volcanic stone, which evokes the energy of the ancient pre-Hispanic houses known as teocallis. At the end of the tour, transportation will take you back to your hotel.

Your local guide in Spanish will wait for you at the meeting point to join a group of travelers and go on a tour of approximately six hours. You will begin with a visit to La Ventanilla, a community of more than twenty-five families committed to preserving the mangrove's life and its rich biodiversity. Next, you will visit the cosmetics factory, where you will learn from processes with sustainable development. Finally, you will discover Zipolite, the first nudist beach in Mexico.

unique_selling_points: ["Impressive pyramid climb with panoramic jungle views","Authentic Maya archaeological site in dense jungle","Chance to observe native wildlife like toucans and spider monkeys"]
one_line_summary: Explore the ancient Maya city of Calakmul amid lush jungle and rich wildlife.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Calakmul Travel
General Description: Title: Visit to the Archaeological Zone of Calakmul, the Hidden City | Description: Today, you will visit the archaeological site of Calakmul, an impressive city in the middle of the jungle, named a UNESCO World Heritage Site. On an approximately 8-hour tour, your local English-speaking guide will meet you at the meeting point to begin a 60 km journey from the entrance of the archaeological zone into the interior of the jungle that separates Calakmul from the rest of the world. The road, although paved, deserves your full attention. Along with your local guide and a bit of luck, you may spot white-tailed deer, pheasants, peacocks with iridescent plumage, or toucans hidden among the trees.

Finally, you will arrive at the archaeological zone. Here, you will visit the tallest pyramid of the site, standing at 45 meters high, and climb to the top to enjoy the incredible view. You will see structures adorned with reliefs and carvings that depict daily life, rituals, and the deities worshipped by the ancient Maya. You will observe the jungle, resembling an endless green sea of trees, with spider monkeys moving branches as they travel and woodpeckers playing their wooden melody in search of insects.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Visit to the Archaeological Site of Calakmul - 11h - SPA | serviceDescription: Visit to the Archaeological Site of Calakmul | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Quintana Roo
Location: address: Campeche, Camp., México | locations: Calakmul

Accompanied by a Spanish-speaking guide, you will immerse yourself in a two-kilometer hike through the jungle, where the grandeur of the trees and the diversity of birds and wild boars will surround you. The trail will take you to a lake inhabited by lizards and fish, culminating with the sight of a ten-meter waterfall, a natural spectacle of sound and movement. It is important to note that this experience is not available during the months of March, April, May and June and is recommended for ages 12 and older due to the nature of the terrain and the length of the hike.

The Cabo Pulmo reef is a UNESCO protected marine park, here besides being home to 226 species of fish and marine life, it has living corals that form reefs in the Sea of Cortes, it is a refuge for endangered species such as the mero of the gulf, which you will be able to see in this experience. At the end of this activity your experience will be over.

You will begin with a horseback ride of approximately 20 minutes through the immediate surroundings of the hacienda, where the little ones will be able to enjoy the sensation of riding a horse. In addition, the children will be able to visit our ranchito, where they will take a pony cart ride and meet other horses, ponies and even a donkey. You will also go on a truck safari to OVINUS, where you will learn about the different breeds of sheep, their diet and interact with the goats. Finally, the little ones will enjoy Yucatecan snacks and refreshing natural beverages. To ensure the safety of the children, each child must be accompanied by a responsible adult.

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to two of Chiapas' most iconic waterfalls","Opportunity to swim in the blue waters of Agua Azul","Scenic journey through lush vegetation and limestone formations","Professional English-speaking guide","Comfortable transportation included"]
one_line_summary: Full-day tour exploring Chiapas' stunning waterfalls and natural pools
bussines_description:
Supplier: Consultora Turística de Chiapas
General Description: Title: Agua Azul and Misol Ha | Description: Today, you'll enjoy an exciting 10-hour journey visiting the breathtaking Agua Azul and Misol-Ha waterfalls. In the early morning, your English-speaking local guide will pick you up from your hotel in San Cristóbal de las Casas. After a couple of hours on the road, you'll make a stop for a delightful breakfast. After a bit more time on the road, you'll arrive at the Tulijá River, which meanders through its limestone bed, forming a series of impressive waterfalls and natural pools enclosed by limestone barriers, known as the Agua Azul waterfalls. You'll have approximately two hours to explore the riverbank, take a refreshing dip in its blue waters, enjoy the breeze and the lush surrounding vegetation, or simply listen to the relaxing sound of the water, making this place one of Chiapas' most spectacular spots.

After this experience, you'll continue the journey for approximately an hour until you reach the Misol-Ha waterfall, with a 35-meter drop. You'll have about fifty minutes to take photographs or simply appreciate the tranquility and beauty of the surroundings. At the end of your visit, your transport will comfortably take you to your hotel in Palenque.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Misol Ha & Agua Azul - 10h - ENG | serviceDescription: Misol Ha & Agua Azul | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Chiapas

You will start with a boat tour to enjoy nature; passing by springs and untouched beaches, where you will have the opportunity to swim. You will also be able to appreciate the diversity of fauna that enriches this place, such as the pink flamingo, ducks that migrate from Canada, pelicans, among others. Finally, you will enjoy a relaxing traditional exfoliating bath before returning to the meeting point to make your own way back to the hotel.

one_line_summary: Explore Tzimol's traditions with a tuk tuk tour, tastings, and craft making in a scenic village
bussines_description:
Supplier: Las 3 Tzimoleras
General Description: Title: Tuk tuk tuk tour, posh tasting and mat making in Tzimol | Description: Today, in Tzimol, Mexico, you will join a group of travellers for an approximately 4-hour experience. You will meet your Spanish-speaking guide at the set meeting point to explore this picturesque village, nestled in a valley surrounded by hills and sugar cane fields. Tzimol is known for its traditional industries such as the production of panela or piloncillo made from cane sugar, petates (woven palm mats) and posh (an alcoholic drink also made from cane sugar). You will have the opportunity to taste these products and participate in their production. You will also visit the Ojo de Agua, where the river that runs through the Tzimol valley and feeds the waterfalls of Las 3 Tzimoleras is born, where you can take a break. During the tuk tuk (motorbike taxi) tour, you will learn about the history of the village, take pictures and enjoy the interactive murals that show the daily life of its inhabitants.

bussines_description:
Supplier: Nuevo Durango
General Description: Title: The experience of knowing the gastronomic and medicinal uses of the Huerta | Description: Today, accompanied by your local Spanish-speaking guide, you will take a 1 hour and 50 minute tour of the community garden, managed by 6 local families who grow organic vegetables, tubers and fruit trees. Don Damian Poot Zul will teach you the seasons of each one, their gastronomic and medicinal uses and the use of natural fertilizers and repellents to take care of the crops, it is an excellent way to learn about the agricultural techniques of the Mayan people that have passed from generation to generation. At the end of the tour, you can return to your hotel.

unique_selling_points: ["Recreation of ancient Mayan trade routes","Boat navigation through mangroves and lagoons","Wildlife observation including manatees and crocodiles","Community-based ecotourism promoting conservation"]
one_line_summary: Explore ancient Mayan canals, wildlife, and pristine lagoons in Sian Ka'an
bussines_description:
Supplier: Community Tours Sian Ka’an
General Description: Title: The Ancient Canal Experience in Sian Ka'an Biosphere Reserve | Description: Today you will visit the Sian Ka'an Biosphere Reserve, which in Mayan means place where the sky is born to live The Ancient Canal Experience which is a recreation of a Mayan trade route that consisted of arriving from the Caribbean Sea through a system of lagoons connected by canals through natural waters. Your shared transportation will pick you up to take you to the Muyil Community Center (approximately 25 minutes from Tulum) and join a group of travelers to begin the 8-hour tour with a local Spanlish-speaking guide. This community-based ecotourism cooperative focuses on the conservation and preservation of ecosystems by promoting unique experiences with a commitment to responsible tourism. You will be transferred to the Muyil dock where you will take a boat to navigate through the reserve visiting the Muyil and Chunyaxche lagoons until you reach the Xlapac dock. Once there, enjoy a serene swim in the water. It is a moment of reconnection with mother earth, as you float slowly through the crystal clear canals surrounded by mangroves and the soft sounds of birds and other local animals. 

After this magical experience, you will visit the Capelchén Lagoon where with a little luck you will be able to observe manatees and crocodiles in their natural habitat, to finish the tour you will visit the coast of Boca Paila beach to observe the difference between the water of the lagoon system and the water of the beach. Return to Muyil where you will be welcomed with a traditional lunch and finally your shared transportation will take you back to Tulum.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Sian Kaan Ancient Canal Morning - 7h - SPA | serviceDescription: Sian Kaan Ancient Canal Morning | serviceType: Centro Ecoturístico | destinationName: Quintana Roo
Location: address: Community tours Sian Ka'an Muyil, Chunyaxché, Quintana Roo, México | locations: Tulum

Together with your guide and an English-speaking interpreter, you will go around the community to collect firewood and stones to make the oven. You will also go to the orchard to get banana leaves, which are very important for this preparation. You will go to a rustic kitchen to prepare the oven and start the preparation; the banana leaves will be roasted and the ingredients will be cooked such as corn paste, weededed chicken, natural dye anatto (red recado) with which you can make the preparation of your own traditional tamale.

unique_selling_points: ["Authentic pulque tasting with a local guide","Educational experience on pre-Hispanic origins","Hands-on pulque making with seasonal flavors","Exploration of Cholula's cultural heritage"]
one_line_summary: Discover Puebla's rich pulque tradition with a guided tasting and making experience
bussines_description:
Supplier: Puebla de ensueño
General Description: Title: Traditional Pulque Tasting | Description: Today, your Spanish-speaking guide will pick you up at your hotel to start your approximately 5-hour experience. Together, you will take a pulque tour, exploring this ancestral and emblematic Mexican beverage. Your guide will explain the rich history of this drink in the magical town of Cholula, from its pre-Hispanic origins to its current relevance. You will learn about its production process and the basic ingredients of pulque: aguamiel, which is the nectar of the agave, and the fermentation that turns it into the characteristic drink. You will also learn about the agaves used and how aguamiel is harvested, as well as how to make your own cured pulque—a delicious combination of natural pulque with added flavors from seasonal fruits or herbs. At the end, your guide will take you back to your hotel, and your experience will conclude.

Finally, after having toured this area of more than 40 km2, the transportation will be ready to take you back to your hotel.

one_line_summary: Experience cowboy culture and scenic landscapes on a mule ride in Baja California Sur
bussines_description:
Supplier: Rancho Cacachilas
General Description: Title: Mule ride through El Gaspareño, Baja California Sur | Description: Today, your local guide in Spanish will wait for you at the meeting point to join a group of travelers and go on a cultural experience of approximately four hours and a half through cowboys’ history, their traditional costumes, and the differences among clothes’ uses, saddlers, and all the equipment they employ, since it is still in use. Learn helpful advice if you ever find yourself sleeping in the middle of nowhere, lulled by the summer heat, and surrounded by rattlesnakes. After this two-hour-and-a-half trip down memory lane, you will meet your mule and learn about the flora and a cowboy’s daily life. Amid the path, you will stop to observe the contrast of the hill gathered with mountains dotted with golden sand and surrounded by a dry forest full of quiet life meeting the Sea of Cortés. Finally, you will enjoy a goodbye meal prepared by the in-house chef; he creates traditional dishes with organic vegetables cultivated in gardens and ranch-made products.

bussines_description:
Supplier: Consultora Turística de Chiapas
General Description: Title: Looking for manatees in Chiapas | Description: Today, you will take a tour of approximately five hours accompanied by your local guide in Spanish to visit Catazajá, a Chiapas municipality recognized for having a great variety of flora and fauna; where you will board a motorboat to start the tour through the Lagoon of Catazajá to look for manatees, species mainly spread in warm and shallow waters of rivers, estuaries, mangroves, and coastal areas. Besides, you will look for more species, such as crocodiles, the howler monkey, the wood stork, and the roseate spoonbill; enjoy this adventure on the lagoon’s shores and make good memories by being in intimate contact with nature. Finish the experience in “La Toluqueña” restaurant before you leave Catazajá.

A restaurant that, through its chefs from Oaxaca, seeks to offer a wide variety of culinary options using local and seasonal ingredients. On this occasion you will be able to taste the Marea menu which is made up of: chocolate clam, red ceviche, giant stuffed shrimp, crab croquettes, white rock oysters, naked crab tacos, bronzed octopus soup, sarandeado fish skewer, mango meringue, coconut flan. The experience ends at the end of the menu. Note: Experience not available on Sundays.

bussines_description:
Supplier: San Pablo Etla
General Description: Title: The Puma Trail & Huautli Experience | Description: Today you will have a 6 hour private experience. You will meet your Spanish-speaking guide at the meeting point for a 3.76 km hike suitable for everyone. On this walk, known as the Huerta, you will be able to observe different types of plants and birds until you reach a spring. Afterwards, you will be able to participate in a talk about the huautli, better known as amaranth, its cultivation process and the elaboration of alegrías and tzoalli. Remember that at the end you will be able to elaborate and taste some of these, and with that, your experience will be over and you will be able to return on your own to your hotel.

You will be able to taste several of its typical dishes, from the delicious tacos árabes to the famous cemitas poblanas. Discover the places where some of these iconic Poblana dishes come from, from the delicious conchas to the emblematic clay pots made by potters in the La Luz neighborhood. You will visit one of the most famous bakeries and enjoy the smell of freshly baked bread, observe the nixtamal process in a tortilla factory while walking through the old neighborhoods and then see how potters work the clay with their own hands.

Next, you will visit from the best ‘Pescadería’ to the most amazing ‘Tostadería’ in the Mexican Caribbean. Finally, you will go to 3 renowned seafood restaurants to taste one beer, soft drink, or water per person in each of them; you will go to a handmade ice cream shop as long as you enjoy a walk through Playa del Carmen before you return to your hotel (this experience does not include transportation for your return).

one_line_summary: Experience authentic Mexican charro culture with riding, music, and tequila in Jalisco.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Entre Charros
General Description: Title: Among Charros Experience a Mexican Tradition | Description: Today you will enjoy La Charrería, one of the most emblematic traditions of Jalisco and Mexico. Your shared transportation will pick you up along with a group of travelers to take you to Lienzo Charro Hotel, where you will meet your local Spanish-speaking guide. This approximately 4-hour experience will begin with a tour through the history of the Mexican charro and how this character represents the national identity and cultural heritage of the country. You will have the opportunity to practice with the reata, the main tool of every charro, and learn about the care and handling of cattle. You will also experience the thrill of horseback riding and using the lasso like a true charro. Lastly, you will enjoy the music of the mariachi while tasting tequila, a typical Mexican beverage, which will be shared with the charros as they exchange stories and anecdotes.

unique_selling_points: ["Guided bicycle tour of Coba archaeological site","Visit to the largest pyramid in the Yucatan Peninsula, Nohoch Mul","Exploration of sacred Maya roads (sacbé)","Includes visits to the Church temple, Oval temple, and ball game site","Surrounded by lush jungle and lakes"]
one_line_summary: Explore the ancient Maya city of Coba by bike, discovering sacred roads and pyramids
bussines_description:
Supplier: Micaias Canche
General Description: Title: Coba and the sacred Mayan roads | Description: You will explore the archaeological site of Coba, which means Choppy Water, this city developed near five lakes that were a fundamental factor for its development and subsistence. Accompanied by your local English-speaking guide, you will take a bicycle tour of approximately two hours in the site, surrounded by beautiful trees. If you do not like to ride a bicycle, you can ask for a bicitaxi. You will learn about this important site, whose design and purpose were very different from those of other Mayan cities. The white roads built by the ancient Maya (sacbé) lead from each settlement to the main pyramid, Nohoch Mul, the largest in the Yucatan Peninsula. During this visit of approximately 1 hour 45 minutes, you will also see the Church temple, the Oval temple, and the ball game.

bussines_description:
Supplier: Eat México
General Description: Title: Discover the flavors and colors of the exotic San Juan Market | Description: Immerse yourself in the heart of the historic center and uncover the gastronomic roots of the Aztec capital with a visit to the San Juan Market. Renowned chefs and local buyers come to this famous city market in search of the best products, meats, and specialties, ranging from fruits and vegetables to lion meat.

Accompanied by your local guide in Spanish and a small group of travelers, you will take a 3.5 to 4-hour stroll through the market's aisles and its surroundings, delighting your senses with an abundance of colors and aromas. You will taste exotic fruits, cheeses, jams, coffee, and other delights while learning about Mexican cuisine and the history of the market. The tour continues through San Juan, following in the footsteps of the locals' daily life as you enjoy more traditional delicacies such as pulque (fermented agave drink), tacos, and seafood tostadas.

You will start at the Alameda Park to see the majestic Fine Arts Museum, a symbol of the Porfirio Diaz era. You will continue along the pedestrian street of Madero where you will see the Palacio de Minería and the National Museum of Art, until you reach the Plaza de la Constitución or known as Zócalo, the most important square in Mexico, here you will see the Cathedral of Mexico and the National Palace to finish in the Plaza de Santo Domingo.

unique_selling_points: ["Hiking to the summit of active and dormant volcanoes","Panoramic views of the Valley of Mexico","Legend of the volcanoes explained by local guide"]
one_line_summary: Full-day mountain hike to Iztaccihuatl and Popocatepetl volcanoes from Puebla
bussines_description:
Supplier: Unlimited experiences
General Description: Title: Hike to the Izta-Popo | Description: Today your transportation will pick you up from your hotel in Puebla and, accompanied by an English-speaking local guide, you will head to the Iztaccihuatl - Popocatepetl National Park on a 12-hour tour. Upon arrival at the park, located at an altitude of 3,500 metres, your guide will provide you with detailed information about the national park and the legend of the volcanoes. From this point, you will be able to enjoy views of the volcanoes, Popocatepetl being one of them, still listed as an active volcano. After checking in, you will head by transport to La Joyita, the last available car park to start the hike along the route of the portillos where the altitude will be 3,900 meters. It is at this point that the exciting hike begins, which will take you through different portillos, reaching a maximum altitude of 4,524 metres. From there, you will be able to appreciate the impressive valley of Mexico and marvel at the nature that surrounds both volcanoes. After enjoying the panoramic views, you will begin your descent back to the meeting point where your transport will be waiting to take you back to your hotel.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Hike to the Izta Popo National Park - 7h - SPA | serviceDescription: Hike to the Izta Popo National Park | serviceType: Operadora local, Transporte | destinationName: Puebla Area

one_line_summary: Discover the vibrant culture and history of Coyoacán and San Ángel in Mexico City.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Pablo Yuichi
General Description: Title: Walk through Coyoacán and San Ángel | Description: Embark on a 5-hour experience through the southern area of Mexico City. Your adventure will begin the moment your Spanish-speaking guide picks you up to head to the bohemian neighborhood of Coyoacán, recognized as one of the most picturesque places in the city. During the tour, you will marvel at the architecture of the churches, enjoy the plazas and immerse yourself in the gardens that adorn this place. You can't miss the opportunity to sample the neighborhood's churros and ice cream.

Afterwards, you will head to the San Angel area, where you will discover a small square full of art galleries exhibiting the talent of different urban artists. You will marvel at the works on display, which reflect the diversity and creativity of the local art scene. You will also have the opportunity to explore the Ex-Conventos del Carmen and San Jacinto, where you will be given an explanation of their history. As you walk through San Angel, you will enjoy a variety of dining options. From cafes to upscale restaurants offering Mexican and international cuisine.

one_line_summary: Private whale shark swim, snorkeling, and ceviche in Isla Mujeres
bussines_description:
Supplier: Ceviche Tours
General Description: Title: Private Whale Shark Swim Experience from Isla Mujeres | Description: Today you will meet your English speaking guide at the meeting point to begin this private experience, which will last approximately 5 hours. The whale shark is the largest fish in the world, a docile living being that feeds mainly on plankton. You will begin the experience by heading by boat to the north of Isla Mujeres in search of some specimens that enjoy the pleasant tropical waters. Once you find them, you will make two dives in pairs with your guide, each of about 5 minutes, to appreciate these majestic marine creatures. You will always follow the guide's indications to preserve and conserve them. Upon returning to Isla Mujeres, you will have the opportunity to snorkel on the reef. Finally, you will enjoy a delicious ceviche and refreshing drinks at Playa Norte.

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to one of the oldest distilleries in Tequila","Hands-on experience in tequila production","Traditional jima demonstration","Visit to the skywalk with panoramic views","Includes preparing your own Cantarito and barbecue lunch"]
one_line_summary: Discover tequila making at Casa Sauza with tastings, demonstrations, and local cuisine
bussines_description:
Supplier: Casa Sauza
General Description: Title: Experience the Hornitos tour at Casa Sauza and learn all about the tequila process | Description: Today, you will meet your local guide in Spanish and a group of travelers at Casa Sauza, one of the oldest distilleries in the magical town of Tequila. For approximately 3 hours you will immerse yourself in the fascinating world of tequila. You will begin by exploring the Agave Fields, where you will learn about the importance of this plant and its relationship to tequila production. You will also witness a demonstration of jima, the traditional process of cutting the agave leaves. Afterwards, you will visit the Bodega and the Skywalk, where you will learn about the tequila maturation and bottling process. You will continue with a visit to the Distillery to observe the tequila distillation process and discover the secrets behind its artisanal elaboration. Finally, you will have the opportunity to prepare your own Cantarito and enjoy a delicious barbecue lunch at La Cueva de Don Cenobio restaurant
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Hornitos Tour - 3h - SPA | serviceDescription: Hornitos Tour | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Jalisco
