unique_selling_points: ["Close encounters with marine life including dolphins","Traditional bottom fishing techniques without rods","Opportunity to prepare or take home fresh fish for cooking"]
one_line_summary: Exciting 4-hour fishing adventure off Holbox with marine encounters and local techniques
bussines_description:
Supplier: VIP Holbox
General Description: Title: Mini-fishing in Holbox Island | Description: This adventure begins at the Tiburón Ballena pier, from where you will set sail towards the sea that awaits you. During this fascinating tour of approximately 4 hours, you will discover the most outstanding fishing spots and have the opportunity to experience close encounters with the marine life of Holbox. If luck is on your side, you may be delighted by the occasional appearance of dolphins that sometimes surprise you with their presence.

The captain and your local Spanish-speaking guide will be giving you valuable tips and sharing with you the traditional techniques of bottom fishing with ropes, without rods. You will learn the secrets to catch small and medium size fish, such as corvina, grouper, snapper, blonde, chac chi and mojarra, among others. These fish will be more than enough to prepare a delicious ceviche or, if you prefer, you can take them with you at the end of the tour to cook them according to your taste. Finally, you will be able to enjoy the sea breeze while you contemplate the coastal landscapes that surround you.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Minifishing 26 feet boat - 4h - SPA | serviceDescription: Minifishing 26 feet boat | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Quintana Roo
Location: address: Av Damero, Centro, 77310 Holbox, Q.R. | locations: Isla Holbox

bussines_description:
Supplier: Mezcouting
General Description: Title: Chocolate making in Mitla, Oaxaca | Description: Today, your local guide in Spanish will take you to breakfast regional dishes in Tule and briefly visit Tule’s tree. You will learn from a female cook who specializes in the cocoa art how to prepare traditional chocolate from the very beginning; you will roast, grind, and transform the cocoa into bars with which you could prepare hot chocolate; besides this, you could also taste Mitla’s chocolate de agua blanca (white water hot chocolate). After this activity, you will taste many dishes with a traditional mezcal selection. Next, you will visit a local chronologist and antiquarian who will teach you about regional mezcals history; besides, you will have access to his black clay jugs, demijohns, and former glass carboys. To finish this experience of approximately nine hours, you will visit Mitla’s ruins (entrance fee included).

one_line_summary: Discover Guanajuato's rich history, art, and architecture in an immersive full-day tour
bussines_description:
Supplier: Coyote Canyon Adventures
General Description: Title: Discover the history and art of Guanajuato | Description: The Guanajuato tour is an enriching experience that will allow you to immerse yourself in the rich history and culture of this beautiful colonial city. Along with your local Spanish-speaking guide and a group of travelers, you will start from the Pípila lookout point, where you will have the opportunity to admire the panoramic views of Guanajuato and its impressive baroque architecture. From there, you will embark on a vehicle tour through the city's fascinating tunnels and subway streets, a unique and distinctive feature of Guanajuato.

Once you have reached the heart of the city, our specialized federal guide will take you through the most emblematic streets and alleys, telling you stories and anecdotes about life in colonial times and the struggle for Mexico's independence. You will also have the opportunity to learn about the cultural and artistic richness of Guanajuato, which has been recognized as a World Heritage Site by UNESCO. This tour of approximately 8 hours is an excellent option for those who want to discover the history and beauty of Guanajuato in a complete and enriching experience.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Guanajuato City tour - 8h - SPA | serviceDescription: Guanajuato City tour | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Guanajuato Area
Location: address: Zacateros 54, Zona Centro, 37700 San Miguel de Allende, Gto. | locations: San Miguel de Allende

unique_selling_points: ["Recreation of ancient Mayan trade routes","Boat navigation through mangroves and lagoons","Opportunity to observe manatees and crocodiles in natural habitat","Community-based ecotourism promoting conservation"]
one_line_summary: Explore Mayan trade routes and pristine lagoons in Sian Ka'an with eco-friendly guided tour
bussines_description:
Supplier: Community Tours Sian Ka’an
General Description: Title: The Ancient Canal Experience in the Sian Ka'an Biosphere Reserve with transportation from Riviera Maya | Description: Today you will visit the Sian Ka'an Biosphere Reserve, which in Mayan means place where the sky is born to live The Ancient Canal Experience which is a recreation of a Mayan trade route that consisted of arriving from the Caribbean Sea through a system of lagoons connected by canals through natural waters. Your shared transportation will pick you up to take you to the Muyil Community Center (approximately 1 hour 15 minutes from Playa del Carmen) and join a group of travelers to start the 8-hour tour with a local Spanish-speaking guide. This community-based ecotourism cooperative focuses on the conservation and preservation of ecosystems by promoting unique experiences with a commitment to responsible tourism. You will be transferred to the Muyil dock where you will take a boat to navigate through the reserve visiting the Muyil and Chunyaxche lagoons until you reach the Xlapac dock. Once there, enjoy a serene swim in the water. It is a moment of reconnection with mother earth, as you float slowly through the crystal clear canals surrounded by mangroves and the soft sounds of birds and other local animals. 
After this magical experience, you will visit the Capelchén Lagoon where with a little luck you will be able to observe manatees and crocodiles in their natural habitat, to finish the tour you will visit the coast of Boca Paila beach to observe the difference between the water of the lagoon system and the water of the beach. Return to Muyil where you will be welcomed with a traditional lunch and finally your shared transportation will take you back to Playa del Carmen.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Sian Kaan Ancient Canal Morning - 8h - SPA | serviceDescription: Sian Kaan Ancient Canal Morning | serviceType: Centro Ecoturístico | destinationName: Quintana Roo
Location: address: Community tours Sian Ka'an Muyil, Chunyaxché, Quintana Roo, México | locations: Tulum

bussines_description:
Supplier: Consultora Turística de Chiapas
General Description: Title: Waterfalls paradise in Chiapas | Description: Today, you will take a tour of approximately three hours accompanied by your local guide in Spanish and other travelers through Roberto Barrios waterfalls, also known as Valle de Bascán waterfalls, which many people consider a hidden jewel and a natural treasure in Chiapas, as well as a unique visual spectacle, which will offer you a peaceful and serene atmosphere to take pictures. Enjoy this tour amongst the Chiapas jungle as long as you look up to stepped waterfalls characterized by crystal and turquoise-colored waters or, if you want, you could walk in the path going down the river’s side until you reach the natural pits, where you can take a refreshing shower as long as you enjoy the landscape accompanied by jungle’s sounds. Do not miss the opportunity to enjoy this beauty of nature and escape from everyday hustle and bustle.

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to two iconic Chiapas waterfalls","Scenic river journey with swimming opportunities","Professional local guide"]
one_line_summary: Explore stunning waterfalls and lush nature in Chiapas with guided tour
bussines_description:
Supplier: Consultora Turística de Chiapas
General Description: Title: Visit Agua Azul and Misol-Ha waterfalls with DO in Palenque. | Description: Today, you will enjoy an exciting journey of approximately 10 hours visiting the stunning Agua Azul and Misol-Ha waterfalls. In the early morning, your local Spanish-speaking guide will pick you up at your hotel in San Cristóbal de las Casas, along with other travelers. After a couple of hours on the road, we will make a stop for you to savor a delicious breakfast. Once we reach our destination, you will be amazed by the Tulijá River, which winds through its limestone bed, forming a series of impressive waterfalls, creating natural pools enclosed by limestone barriers, known as the Agua Azul waterfalls. You will have around two hours to explore the riverbank, take a refreshing swim in its azure waters, enjoy the breeze and the lush surrounding vegetation, or simply listen to the relaxing sound of the water, making this place one of the most spectacular corners of Chiapas.

After this experience, you will continue the route for approximately one more hour until you reach the Misol-Ha waterfall, with a height of thirty-five meters. You will have about fifty minutes to take photographs or simply contemplate the tranquility and beauty of the surroundings. At the end of your visit, your transportation will comfortably take you back to your hotel in Palenque.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Agua Azul & Misol Ha - 8h - SPA | serviceDescription: Agua Azul & Misol Ha | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Chiapas

one_line_summary: Explore Puebla's historic center and craft your own Talavera pottery.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Puebla de ensueño
General Description: Title: Puebla City Tour & Talavera Workshop | Description: Today, you will meet your English-speaking guide at the meeting point to begin your approximately 7-hour experience. Together, you will take a walking tour of the historic center of the city. You will visit sites such as the Palafoxiana Library, one of the oldest libraries in Latin America. Its colonial building houses a collection of over 40,000 ancient volumes, many of which are incunabula and rare. You will also explore the Calle de los Dulces, where you can purchase a variety of sweets, and the Barrio de los Sapos, known for its antique shops and stores.

Next, you will visit a Talavera factory. Talavera is a type of white clay, known as Talavera clay, which is covered with a glazed enamel. During this visit, you will participate in a workshop where you will paint your own piece. Finally, you will tour the factory"s museum, and with that, your experience will conclude.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Puebla city tour + Talavera Workshop - 5h - ENG | serviceDescription: Puebla city tour + Talavera Workshop | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Puebla Area

unique_selling_points: ["Mayan underworld experience in Xibalba Cave","Cultural ritual asking permission to moon and gods","Integration of meditation and traditional embroidery"]
one_line_summary: Mayan spiritual cave meditation with embroidery and nature connection in Quintana Roo
bussines_description:
Supplier: Nuevo Durango
General Description: Title: Cave with meditation, embroidery & Cen Esmeralda | Description: Today you will learn about a project that combines nature conservation and traditional Mayan culture, located 1km from the local communities. You will meet at the established point with your English-speaking guide who will accompany you on this 2-hour adventure.
During the tour, you will be able to observe birds and some of the trees that produce honey. When you arrive at the cavern, you will find 3 vaults full of channels and crystalline subway rivers that you can access after purification, this ritual consists of asking permission to the moon and the gods protectors of the jungle and cenotes to enter the cave. Xibalba Cave better known as the Mayan underworld to relax, refresh and enjoy a meditation in the dark to be in contact with nature and yourself. At the end of the activity, you can return to your hotel.

Your instructor in Spanish will teach you how to create recipes that you can implement in your day-to-day life. This workshop is a way to connect with yourself and the way you consume food. Your instructor will give you practical tips to put into practice once you return home. The purpose of this workshop is to learn to cook whole, unprocessed, fresh, and nutrient-rich foods, such as healthier breakfasts, anti-inflammatory meals, gluten-free meals, and kombucha.

Note: There are five workshop themes that are scheduled. The workshop you can take will depend on the calendar.

unique_selling_points: ["Bicycle tour through Cholula's archaeological and colonial sites","Visit to Santa María Tonantzintla and San Francisco Acatepec churches","Optional exploration of Chipilo or Casa del Diablo mural"]
one_line_summary: Explore Cholula's rich history and architecture by bicycle with local guides.
bussines_description:
Supplier: CooperatIva Mili Cocina de Maices
General Description: Title: Exploring Cholula by Bicycle | Description: Today, you will embark on an exciting bicycle experience that will last approximately 4 hours. You will meet your local English-speaking guide and a group of fellow travelers at the meeting point in Cholula. First, you will indulge in a tasting of Mexican snacks. Then, you will prepare to hop on your bicycle and head towards the archaeological zone of Cholula. After that, you will visit the Santa María Tonantzintla church, renowned for its architecture blending indigenous and colonial elements. You will then continue to the San Francisco Acatepec church, which also boasts a rich colonial history.

The next stop will be optional: you can choose between visiting the Casa del Diablo, named after the mural on its façade, or exploring Chipilo, a small colony with Italian architecture. Your choice. To conclude, you will return to the place where you enjoyed the Mexican snacks for a tasting of craft beers made from corn. Once the tasting is completed, this experience will come to an end.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Cholula by bicycle - 5h - SPA | serviceDescription: Cholula by bicycle | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Puebla Area

unique_selling_points: ["40-minute hot air balloon ride over Teotihuacan","Guided tour of the City of the Gods with historical insights","Visit to artisan family home and obsidian craft demonstration","Tasting of pulque and xoconostle products","Comprehensive full-day experience combining adventure, culture, and local gastronomy"]
one_line_summary: Exciting full-day tour with hot air balloon and archaeological exploration at Teotihuacan
bussines_description:
Supplier: Teotihuacan en bici
General Description: Title: Hot air balloon ride and guided tour of Teotihuacan | Description: Today your Spanish-speaking local guide will meet you at your hotel and you will head out of Mexico City to the Teotihuacan Valley to begin your approximately 11-hour experience. Upon arrival, you will board a hot air balloon for a 40-minute ride to get a panoramic view of this iconic site. Afterwards, you will take a walking tour of the City of the Gods, your guide will tell you about its history while you walk along the Calzada de los Muertos. He will also tell you all about the mysteries of this ancient civilisation, where you will find buildings such as the Pyramid of the Sun and the Pyramid of the Moon. Afterwards, you will board your transport that will take you on a tour of the route of the Murals, an ancient natural observatory and the impressive views of the City of the Gods. You"ll close your day with a visit to the home of a family of artisans, where you"ll learn more about the obsidian process and how it is transformed into handicrafts. You will also have a tasting of pulque and products derived from xoconostle, a cactus fruit very representative of the area. At the end of the designated time, you will enjoy a local lunch and your transportation will take you back to Mexico City, where your tour will end.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Balloon flight & walking tour - 11h - SPA | serviceDescription: Balloon flight & walking tour | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Mexico Area
Location: address: Teotihuacan, Méx., México | locations: Teotihuacan, Mexico City

unique_selling_points: ["Award-winning architecture of winery","Comprehensive wine-making tour","Food pairing with 4-course meal","Visit to scenic Torre de Tierra viewpoint"]
one_line_summary: Explore Guanajuato's award-winning winery with tasting and gourmet food pairing
bussines_description:
Supplier: Cuna de Tierra
General Description: Title: Tasting and tour of the Cuna de Tierra Vineyard. | Description: Today your English-speaking guide will accompany you on a 3-hour shared experience at the Cuna de Tierra Vineyard, which has more than 30 hectares where different grape varieties are cultivated for the production of 6 red wines and 1 white wine, and has won several awards due to the architectural design of the winery. Your tour will begin with a visit to the Torre de Tierra viewpoint where you will be able to contemplate the vines, then you will go to the production area, followed by the barrel room where around 200 French, American and Hungarian oak barrels rest, contributing their characteristics to the wines under development. At the end of the tour you will taste 4 wines, accompanied by a 4-course meal.

unique_selling_points: ["Spectacular firefly light display","Guided nature experience in Amanalco","Sunset and nocturnal wildlife observation","Authentic local guide insights","Accessible outdoor adventure"]
one_line_summary: Experience the enchanting glow of fireflies in Amanalco's natural setting at sunset
bussines_description:
Supplier: Expediciones Amanalco
General Description: Title: The Luminous Dance of the Fireflies in Amanalco | Description: Embark on an experience of approximately 3 hours as you immerse yourself in nature. Start by admiring the sunset, accompanied by your local guide who will give you information about the environment. However, the most exciting part is yet to come: the aerial dance of the fireflies. These small creatures, endowed with a glow of their own, will delight you with their nocturnal display.

Discover the meaning behind their luminous dance as they dance. As the fireflies begin their dance, the darkness is illuminated with sparkling flashes, creating a light show.

unique_selling_points: ["Comprehensive cultural and architectural exploration of Guadalajara","Visit to emblematic sites like Instituto Cultural Cabañas and Teatro Degollado","Guided tour with local expert in Spanish"]
one_line_summary: Explore Guadalajara’s rich history, architecture, and art with a guided cultural tour.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Sensaciones Turísticas
General Description: Title: Visiting Guadalajara’s historic route | Description: Today, your local guide in Spanish will take you on a tour of approximately five hours to visit Guadalajara city, which offers a historical, cultural, and architectural legacy through its colonial buildings, as well as an artistic and pictorial heritage represented in the wall paintings of important painters and muralists, such as Gerardo Suárez, Jacobo Gálvez y José Clemente Orozco. On this walking tour, you will visit the historic center to discover the most emblematic sites of this city known as the “Pearl Tapatia”. You will find the large neoclassical, baroque, and gothic architectural styles combination; visit emblematic buildings, such as the Instituto Cultural Cabañas (Cabañas Cultural Institute), the Teatro Degollado, the Guadalajara Regional Museum, the Palace of Government, and the Cathedral of the Assumption, as well as its plazas and walkways decorated with art pieces by relevant Jalisco artists.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Historic Guadalajara Route - 4h - SPA | serviceDescription: Historic Guadalajara Route | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Jalisco
Location: address: Guadalajara, Jalisco, México | locations: Guadalajara

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to iconic Mayan archaeological site of Palenque","Wildlife tour in Catazajá lagoon with manatee sightings","Combination of cultural exploration and nature adventure"]
one_line_summary: Explore Mayan ruins and spot wildlife in Catazajá lagoon in Chiapas.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Consultora Turística de Chiapas
General Description: Title: Visit the archaeological site of Palenque and the lagoon of Catazajá. | Description: Today, you will join a group of travellers and your Spanish-speaking guide on a 7-hour adventure in Chiapas. You will start by visiting Palenque, one of the most emblematic archaeological sites of the Mayan world, also known as Lakamha (place of the great waters). You will explore its main constructions, such as the Temple of the Skull, the Tomb of the Red Queen, the Temple of the Inscriptions, the Palace, the aqueduct, the Group of the Crosses, the Ball Game, the Queen's Bath and more.
Then, you will head to Catazajá, where you will board a motorized boat to tour the lagoon in search of manatees, a species that inhabits warm, shallow waters of rivers, estuaries, mangroves and coastal areas. You will also have the opportunity to spot crocodiles, saraguato monkeys, American storks and roseate spoonbills. The experience will culminate at the restaurant La Toluqueña.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: AS Palenque & Manatee sanctuary in Catazaja - 7h - SPA | serviceDescription: AS Palenque & Manatee sanctuary in Catazaja | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Chiapas
Location: address: Palenque, Chiapas, México | locations: Palenque

unique_selling_points: ["Participation in endangered sea turtle conservation","Snorkeling in coral reefs with guide","Full-day eco-adventure from Puerto Vallarta"]
one_line_summary: Full-day eco-adventure with snorkeling and turtle release at Naranjo beach
bussines_description:
Supplier: Nayarit Adventures
General Description: Title: Snorkeling and Turtle Release at Naranjo beach | Description: Enjoy this approximately 12-hour wilderness experience as you immerse yourself in the crystal clear waters of the Bay. Your adventure begins when your shared transportation picks you up to take you to Rincon de Guayabitos where you will have a light lunch. Once ready, you will board a boat to Coral Island along with your local Spanish-speaking guide and a group of travelers. On this island, you will have a snorkeling class where you will learn how to use the equipment, once ready you can explore the rocky coral reefs accompanied by your guide. If you prefer to relax, you can stay on the island to enjoy the sand and the natural environment. 

Afterwards, you will head to El Naranjo beach. During your visit, you will receive a complete and detailed thematic talk about sea turtles, their importance in the marine ecosystem and the conservation efforts being made to protect them. In addition, you will have the opportunity to witness and participate in the release of baby turtles. This moment will connect you with nature and allow you to directly contribute to the preservation of these endangered species. Afterwards you will return to Rincon de Guayabitos to enjoy lunch at the Pineda Restaurant. Finally your transportation will take you back to Puerto Vallarta.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Turtle release - 12 h - SPA | serviceDescription: Turtle release | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Jalisco
Location: address: Sebastián Lerdo de Tejada Pte. 23, Centro, 63000 Tepic, Nay. | locations: Puerto Vallarta

one_line_summary: Explore Michoacán's monarch butterfly sanctuary and learn about their migration and conservation.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Jesús L´ópez
General Description: Title: Monarch butterflies: nature fragility in Michoacán | Description: Today, your local guide in Spanish will take you on a tour of approximately six hours through the El Rosario Monarch Butterfly Sanctuary, one of the most significant sanctuaries visited by monarch butterflies in Michoacán, México. On the way to your destination, there will be a speech about monarch butterflies, species known for their migration cycles and distinctive-remarkable appearance; therefore, you could have background information about them. Once at the sanctuary, you will admire monarch butterfly colonies covering this place's trees and branches closely, explore its paths, and taste the food prepared by the community's female cooks if you wish. Enjoy this experience and learn about the importance of this ecosystem's conservation for future generations before concluding this tour by returning to Morelia.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Visit of El Rosario Monarch Butterflies Reserve - 10 h - SPA | serviceDescription: Visit of El Rosario Monarch Butterflies Reserve | serviceType: Guía | destinationName: Michoacan

bussines_description:
Supplier: Jesús L´ópez
General Description: Title: Santa Clara del Cobre and Pátzcuaro legacy in Michoacán | Description: Today, your local guide in English will take you on tour for approximately eight hours through Santa Clara del Cobre, a place known for its handmade tradition in hammered copper object production. Start this experience by visiting the historic center of this city as long as you walk on cobbled streets and colonial houses, which will let you dive into local artisans' history and creativity; visit the Templo de Nuestra Señora del Sagrario and the Templo de la Inmaculada Concepción, two of the most important churches in Michoacán. In the end, go to Pátzcuaro and its attractions, such as the Plaza Gertrudis Bocanegra, the Vasco de Quiroga statue, and the Teatro Emperador Caltzontzin, the historical, architectural, and cultural legacy of colonial Mexico.

unique_selling_points: ["Living with a Nahá family in Chiapas","Participation in traditional tortilla making","Deep cultural connection with Lacandon community","Authentic indigenous experience"]
one_line_summary: Live authentically with a Nahá family, participate in traditional tortilla making
bussines_description:
Supplier: Naha Jungle Lodge
General Description: Title: Live with Nahá's Family | Description: Join this unique experience to live with a warm Nahá family. This tour begins at the cozy Ecolodge, where you will be greeted by your local Spanish-speaking guide. Together, you will walk through the community, immersing yourself in its charm, until you reach the endearing family backyard. 

Here, you will share stories about the culture, the importance of the milpa and the deep bond with the jungle for the Lacandon people. Then, you will be invited to the grandmother's house, where you will actively participate in the traditional process of making corn tortillas. You will be able to feel the magic of creating this ancestral food and appreciate its cultural significance. Finally, you will gather at the table to enjoy a home-cooked meal. You will be part of this family for approximately 2 hours, sharing laughter, flavors and moments in a cozy atmosphere.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Cultural route - 2h - SPA | serviceDescription: Cultural route | serviceType: Centro Ecoturístico | destinationName: Chiapas
Location: address: Nahá, Chiapas | locations: Nahá

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to Frida Kahlo's private spaces","Access to Diego Rivera's pre-Hispanic art collection","Architectural marvel of Anahuacalli Museum"]
one_line_summary: Explore Frida Kahlo's life and Diego Rivera's art in Mexico City’s iconic museums
bussines_description:
Supplier: Pablo Yuichi
General Description: Title: The Blue House of Frida Kahlo and the Anahuacalli of Diego Rivera | Description: Immerse yourself in the world of Frida Kahlo and Diego Rivera in this approximately 5-hour adventure. Your adventure begins when your English-speaking guide passes by you to take you to the Blue House, where the Mexican painter lived. Here you will have the opportunity to see a collection of paintings, photographs and personal objects that belonged to both her and her partner Diego Rivera. In addition to admiring these works of art, you will have access to intimate parts of Frida"s life, such as her studio, kitchen, bedroom and, of course, the courtyard garden.

Continuing your tour of the art world, you will visit the Diego Rivera Anahuacalli Museum, an architectural jewel. Here, pre-Hispanic art pieces representing the diverse cultures that flourished in Mesoamerica, which Rivera collected throughout his life, are permanently exhibited. In this place, you will be amazed by its architecture, design and construction in volcanic stone, which evokes the energy of a pre-Hispanic house known as teocalli. Inside this cultural space, you will find a central plaza with an open-air theater, an art gallery and a gallery. 

NOTE: Outside guides cannot give further explanation inside the Casa Azul/Museo Frida Kahlo so most of the explanation will be given outside or in the garden.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Casa Azul + Anahuacalli  Museum - 5 h - ENG | serviceDescription: Casa Azul + Anahuacalli  Museum | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Mexico Area
Location: address: Ciudad de México, CDMX, México | locations: Mexico City

unique_selling_points: ["Ancient Mayan city of Calakmul","Rich biodiversity in Calakmul Biosphere Reserve","Opportunity to spot endemic fauna","Climb to Structure II for panoramic jungle views"]
one_line_summary: Explore Mayan ruins and biodiversity in Calakmul's jungle
bussines_description:
Supplier: El Tucan Tours
General Description: Title: Explore the ancient archaeological site of Calakmul. | Description: Today, your transportation will take you and your local Spanish-speaking guide on a 1-day tour to visit one of Mexico's archaeological sites: the ancient Mayan city of Calakmul. Upon arrival, you will make a 60 kilometer journey between the entrance to the archaeological site and the jungle, which separates Calakmul from the rest of the world. Along the way, you will have the opportunity to appreciate the rich biodiversity of the Calakmul Biosphere Reserve, where with a little luck, you will be able to spot local fauna such as the ocellated turkey, the hoco pheasant, the coati, the spider monkey, toucans and the howler monkey. 
You will be able to climb to the top of Structure II where you can enjoy the view that the jungle offers, formed by an endless number of trees. There at the top, besides the beating of your own heart, you will be able to hear the song of the jungle, the life summarized in trills and hums, the spider monkeys moving the branches or the woodpeckers looking for insects. Finally you can rest in the Reserve and return to your hotel
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Calakmul Archaeological Site - 15h - SPA | serviceDescription: Calakmul Archaeological Site | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Campeche Area
Location: address: Campeche, Camp., México | locations: Campeche

one_line_summary: Immersive Mayan cultural experience with weaving, embroidery, and tortilla making
bussines_description:
Supplier: Centro Ecoturístico Unajil Ek Balam
General Description: Title: Discover the traditions of the Mayan community of Ek Balam | Description: Today, you will be accompanied by an expert local Spanish- speaking guide who will immerse you in the rich history, culture, traditions, and customs of this community. This interactive experience will allow you to see and learn about the weaving of hammocks, a traditional craft of Yucatan. You will have the opportunity to help in the manufacturing process. Next, you will visit a second Mayan house, where you will learn about the embroidery of colourful garments and have the chance to sew a souvenir piece to take home.

The experience will culminate with the preparation of corn tortillas, where you will knead the dough with your own hands and learn how to make the delicious tortillas that are part of the everyday diet of the Mayan people. In approximately 2.5 hours, you can immerse yourself in Mayan culture and gain a first-hand understanding of their traditions.

unique_selling_points: ["Interaction with local beekeepers and honey production","Boat tour through mangrove swamp to freshwater spring","Authentic Yucatán cuisine experience with Huevos Motuleños","Relaxing oceanfront beach at Sac-Há","Educational workshop on honey candle making"]
one_line_summary: Full-day eco tour exploring honey, coastal ecosystems, and local Yucatán cuisine
bussines_description:
Supplier: Coox Mayab
General Description: Title: Honey Taste & Coconut Eco Tour | Description: Your local English-speaking guide will pick you up early in the morning. To start the day, you will taste Doña Evelia's traditional and delicious Huevos Motuleños at the local market in Motul. Next, you will travel to Sinanché to learn about beekeeping in Yucatán and the different species of bees found in the region and their honey production process, interact with the bees wearing a beekeeper's suit, and participate in a workshop to create a handmade candle based on honey products.
Afterwards you will visit San Crisanto, a coastal community with a unique tropical landscape ideal for exploring. You will board a boat that will take you through the mangrove swamp to an Ojo de Agua (freshwater spring). During this beautiful experience, you will appreciate the diversity and richness of the local flora and fauna, which are essential to preserve the coasts from erosion. Then you will have lunch at a local restaurant. To finish the tour, relax at Sac-Há, an oceanfront beach area surrounded by coconut trees and white sand. This experience lasts approximately 10 hours.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Honey Taste & Coconut Eco Tour - 10h - ENG | serviceDescription: Honey Taste & Coconut Eco Tour | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Yucatan

General Description: Title: Visit to the Cenotes de Santa Barbara Park. | Description: Today, you will join a group of adventurers to explore the Cenotes of Santa Bárbara in Yucatán. The park is open from 9 am to 6 pm; during this time, you will have the opportunity to dive into four cenotes: Pool Cocom, Cascabel, Chacsinkín, and Xooch". Your safety is our priority, so you will be provided with life jackets that must be worn throughout the experience. In addition, you will enjoy water games and paddling areas, perfect for the whole family. From the resting area, you can choose between a bicycle, van, or trolley to reach the cenotes zone. Food (not included) will be available at the restaurant. You can also admire the surroundings from the lookout.
Note: The last admission time to the park is at 4 pm.

You will continue to the turtle bay at Punta Xen where you can enjoy the beach which is known to be nested by turtles, you will have time for lunch at one of the local restaurants (not included). unique_selling_points: ["Visit to a traditional Yucatecan village","Participation in bread baking in a stone oven","Tasting of local honey from Melipona bees","Authentic Yucatecan meal in a local home","Visit to the lesser-known Mayan archaeological site of Mayapán"]
one_line_summary: Immersive full-day Maya cultural experience in Yucatan with local food and archaeology
bussines_description:
Supplier: Coox Mayab
General Description: Title: Mayas of Yesterday, Mayas of Today | Description: Today, your local guide in English will pick you up to join a group of travelers and take you on an approximately ten-hour experience. First, you will head to Tekit, a traditional Yucatecan village whose daily life revolves around its beautiful church, market, and few small stores. Your first stop will be at a local bakery, famous for baking its bread in a stone oven; here, you can participate in the preparation and bake your polvorones. You will continue with a visit to a Mayan solar, where you will listen to an explanation about the importance of the Melipona bee and its honey production process; you will also have the opportunity to taste several types of honey. You will have a traditional Yucatecan meal in your host house, and then you will visit a guayabera factory to learn about the production process. Finally, you will go to the not well-known archaeological site of Mayapán, one of the last capitals of the pre-Hispanic Mayan era.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Mayas of Yesterday, Mayas of Today - 7.5h - ENG | serviceDescription: Mayas of Yesterday, Mayas of Today | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Yucatan

Do not miss this exciting sensory immersion in total darkness that will allow you to look up to stalactites inside the cenotes and discover the natural wonders in the Mayan world, spending time with nature and learning about this place"s culture, everything through an experience that will fit your arrival time to carry out the different activities that this place has to offer.

bussines_description:
Supplier: Wotoch Aayin - Ria Celestun
General Description: Title: Visit to beaches, waterfalls and flamingo watching. | Description: Today, you will experience an exciting 3-hour adventure in Campeche. Your Spanish-speaking guide will meet you at the Wotoch Aayin Ecotourism Centre and together you will embark on a 20-minute boat ride to Kan Balam beach on La Isla Arena, an ancient Mayan settlement where you can relax under the shade of the mangroves and enjoy the shallow waters. Then, you'll explore a freshwater eye in the middle of the sea, visit a beach with flamingos and a salt pans, and finally arrive at Celestun beach, part of the world heritage biosphere reserve. Here, you can enjoy the beach, dive into the sea and taste the local gastronomy in nearby restaurants (cost not included). At the end of this excursion, you will return to Isla Arena beach.

General Description: Title: Sandboarding adventure in the Magote Dunes | Description: Today, you will have a 3.5hrs experience in the Magote Dunes, located 30 min from the city of La Paz. Your Spanish speaking guide will pick you up at your hotel to take you to these sandy bars surrounded by sea and beach, formed by the accumulation of marine sand and produced by the wind, which serve as a natural protection for marine species from storms, waves, hurricanes and underwater currents. During this adventure you will enjoy the view of the city with some snacks while you practice and feel the adrenaline of sandboarding, you will also get as a souvenir a 1 minute video obtained from a GoPro camera and a drone (weather permitting). 
At the end of the tour, your transportation will take you back to your hotel.

unique_selling_points: ["Observation of pink flamingos in natural habitat","White clay bath with mineral benefits","Boat ride through mangroves"]
one_line_summary: Explore Rio Lagartos' wildlife, mineral-rich clay bath, and scenic boat ride.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Río Lagartos Riviera Maya Tours
General Description: Title: Rio Lagartos Biosphere Tour | Description: Today you will have an adventure of approximately 3hrs in the Rio Lagartos Natural Reserve. You will meet your English-speaking guide at the meeting point to begin this tour. Once there you will take a boat ride designed to enjoy the observation of the pink flamingo; the emblematic bird of the reserve, during this journey you will travel 20km of canals surrounded by mangroves and where you will see herons, eagles, gulls and cormorants, hopefully also some crocodiles. Then you will pass under the bridge Las Coloradas to go to have a white clay bath, which due to its high levels of phosphorus, sulfur and other minerals helps to exfoliate and detoxify the skin. You will have time for lunch* and recharge your energy. Finally you will return to a small beach on the Gulf of Mexico where you can remove the clay.
*Menu: Adults: Fish fillet to taste (grilled, garlic, breaded) OR Chicken breast to taste (grilled, breaded), 1 drink included (beer or soft drink). Children: Chicken nuggets with potatoes and fish fingers OR Pasta with pomodoro, alfredo or butter sauce.

bussines_description:
Supplier: Naha Jungle Lodge
General Description: Title: Nahá and Amarillo Lake Tour | Description: Today you will have a unique experience as you venture into the jungle of the Nahá Reserve, accompanied by an expert Lacandon guide who will take you on a 3-4 hour tour. You will begin with a pleasant 1-kilometre walk along a rural path, where you can appreciate the natural beauty of the area. At the same time, the Spanish-speaking guide shares their vast knowledge about the different species of local flora and fauna.


The path will lead you to the pier of the Nahá Lagoon, where you can contemplate the tranquillity of the lake while you board a boat to sail its crystal clear waters. You will enjoy an exciting boat ride that will allow you to appreciate the natural beauty of the place from a different perspective. Then, you will disembark to take a 1-kilometre walk near the water through the jungle, where you can listen to the sounds of nature in all its splendour. This walk will take you to the Yellow Lagoon, where you can experience the tranquillity and serenity that only a natural environment can provide.

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to one of Latin America's most important museums","Guided tour of Mexico City's historic landmarks","Exclusive insights into pre-Hispanic Mexico"]
one_line_summary: Explore Mexico City's historic center and the renowned Anthropology Museum with expert guides.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Pablo Yuichi
General Description: Title: Explore the historic center of Mexico City and the Museum of Anthropology | Description: Today you will meet your local English-speaking guide for a walking tour of approximately 3 hours through the historic center of Mexico City, one of the largest and most emblematic in Latin America. You will start at the Alameda Park to see the majestic Fine Arts Museum, a symbol of the Porfirio Diaz era. You will continue along the pedestrian street of Madero until you reach the Plaza de la Constitucion or known as Zocalo, the most important square in Mexico, here you will see the Cathedral of Mexico and the National Palace.

Afterwards you will take a guided tour of approximately 2 hours to one of the most important museums in Latin America and the world. It was built in the 1960's by architect Pedro Ramirez Vasquez and has 22 rooms designed to preserve Mexico's rich indigenous heritage. Accompanied by your guide, you will tour the museum's main collections while learning about the history of pre-Hispanic cultures and appreciating some of the most important pieces of pre-Columbian Mexico such as the Stone of the Sun, the Monkey Vessel, the Olmec Colossal Head, and the famous Pakal Mask, among others.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Historic Center Route & Anthropology Museum - 6h - ENG | serviceDescription: Historic Center Route & Anthropology Museum | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Mexico Area
Location: address: Ciudad de México, CDMX, México | locations: Mexico City

unique_selling_points: ["Spectacular blue cenote with towering rock walls","Multiple activities: zip-lining, kayaking, swimming","Rich biodiversity including monkeys, turtles, and toucans","Scenic trails through lush jungle","Regional culinary tasting stop in Champoton"]
one_line_summary: Explore the stunning Blue Cenote of Miguel Colorado with adventure and wildlife experiences
bussines_description:
Supplier: El Tucan Tours
General Description: Title: Visit to the Blue Cenote of Miguel Colorado. | Description: Today your transportation will pick you up to take you with your local guide in Spanish to visit the Cenote Azul in a tour of approximately 7 hours and 30 minutes. Where the landscape is a body of water surrounded by large rock walls 85m high, covered with jungle and trees that are reflected in the water; the diameter of the cenote is 250 m and is located 80 m below ground level. This cenote is a natural refuge for flora and fauna, especially during the dry season, as it is the only source of water for the species that live in the surrounding area. 
Among the activities you can do here are; zip-lining, kayaking and swimming, in addition to hiking through the beautiful trails and be amazed by the species that appear along the way, if you are lucky you may encounter; spider monkeys, howler monkeys, turtles, canoe-billed toucan, white-tailed deer, among others. To complete this experience you will pass through Champoton where you can taste typical dishes of the region (not included). At the end of the tour, your transportation will take you back to your hotel.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Miguel Colorado Cenotes - 8h - SPA | serviceDescription: Miguel Colorado Cenotes | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Campeche Area

bussines_description:
Supplier: Costa Magia
General Description: Title: Guided tour to the Lagunas de Chacahua National Park | Description: Today, your English-speaking guide will pick you up in the morning for a tour of approximately 8 hours in the Lagunas de Chacahua National Park, which is a representative place of the coastal nature of Oaxaca.  Once you arrive you can enjoy a traditional meal such as fish cooked in a clay oven, accompanied by hibiscus liqueur made by local producers. Then, you will board a boat that will take you to explore the lagoons and islands, besides sailing through the mangroves and meandering water channels, you can also dive into the waters and enjoy the therapeutic and exfoliating benefits of natural mud that contains a high concentration of sulfur, followed by this you will go to the Barra de Chacahua, where you will have the opportunity to take a refreshing bath and remove the mud from your skin.
You will have some free time to relax on the beach next to the enramadas and watch the sunset that provides one of the natural jewels of the State of Oaxaca, then your local host will guide you on a short walk of 20 minutes to reach the lighthouse to see the rich flora and fauna of the place, as well as visit the Piedra del Arco which is a natural rock formation. Finally you will return to Zapotalito to meet your transportation back to your hotel.

unique_selling_points: ["Exploration of one of the world's largest underground river systems","Floating in clear freshwater caves","Guided geological and natural history explanations","Includes traditional regional buffet lunch","Located in the heart of Riviera Maya"]
one_line_summary: Explore the underground river system of Río Secreto with adventure and geology
bussines_description:
Supplier: Río secreto
General Description: Title: Rio Secreto: The Mayan underworld | Description: Today, your transportation will pick you up in Cancun to join a group of travelers. You will experience 7 hours (including transportation time) at Rio Secreto, a natural reserve located in the heart of the Riviera Maya. Your local guide, who speaks Spanish, will be waiting for you at the meeting point to explore one of the world's largest underground river systems, where the history of our planet is written in thousands of geological formations. Floating in its clear, freshwater is an experience you will remember for a lifetime.

Your guide will explain everything about the walls and formations of this wonderful geological library as you explore various flooded caves, some where you can walk and others where you will need to swim. Once the tour is complete, a traditional buffet lunch awaits you with a variety of regional dishes. After finishing the meal, your transportation will take you back to your hotel in Cancun.

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to iconic Maya archaeological site of Palenque","Exploration of stunning Agua Azul waterfalls","Experience of Misol-Ha waterfall with photography opportunities"]
one_line_summary: Full-day tour exploring waterfalls and Maya ruins in Chiapas
bussines_description:
Supplier: Consultora Turística de Chiapas
General Description: Title: Visit the Agua Azul waterfalls, Misol-Ha, and the Palenque Archaeological Zone | Description: Today, you will enjoy a tour of approximately 14 hours, starting with a visit to the stunning Agua Azul and Misol-Ha waterfalls. In the early morning, your local guide who speaks Spanish will pick you up from your hotel in San Cristóbal de las Casas, along with other travelers. After a couple of hours on the road, there will be a stop for you to savor a delicious breakfast. You will reach your first destination, the Tulijá River, which meanders through its limestone bed, forming a series of impressive waterfalls and creating natural pools enclosed by calcareous dams, known as the Agua Azul waterfalls. You will have about two hours to explore the riverbank, take a refreshing dip in its blue waters, enjoy the breeze and the lush surrounding vegetation, or simply listen to the relaxing sound of the water that makes this place one of the most spectacular corners of Chiapas. You will continue the journey for approximately one hour to reach the Misol-Ha waterfall, with a drop of thirty-five meters in height. You will have enough time to take some photographs and then head to one of the most representative archaeological sites of the Maya world: Palenque, whose true name is Lakamha (place of the great waters). You will explore the main structures of the site, such as the Temple of the Skull, the Tomb of the Red Queen, the Temple of the Inscriptions, the Palace, the aqueduct, the Cross Group, the Ball Court, the Queen's Bath, and many more. Finally, you will return to the city of San Cristóbal de las Casas.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Misol Ha, Agua Azul & Palenque AS - 16h - SPA | serviceDescription: Misol Ha, Agua Azul & Palenque AS | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Chiapas
Location: address: Palenque, Chiapas, México | locations: Palenque

At the meeting point your local Spanish-speaking guide will be waiting for you to start a walking tour of approximately 4 hours through the streets of the Aztec capital. 

During this experience you will learn about the history and gastronomy of Mexico while visiting the most emblematic places of the historic center such as the Metropolitan Cathedral, the ruins of the ancient Aztec city, the Palace of Fine Arts and the Postal Palace, you will also make a few stops at local food stalls and restaurants that your guide will take you to and taste traditional Mexican food including tacos and a dessert. You will understand why Mexican gastronomy is considered Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity, at the end of the experience your transportation will take you back to your lodging.

one_line_summary: Explore the ancient Maya city of Edzná with expert guides in a 4-hour archaeological tour
bussines_description:
Supplier: El Tucan Tours
General Description: Title: Visit the archaeological site of Edzná | Description: Together with your local Spanish-speaking guide, you will leave the city of Campeche to visit the archaeological site of Edzná, the ancient capital of the Maya world during the Classic Period (600-1000 AD). To date, over 200 structures have been discovered. During this tour, you will have the opportunity to visit the most representative constructions that showcase Puuc and Chenes architectural features, such as the Great Acropolis, the Casa Grande or Nohochná, and the ballgame court. Marvel at the glyphs depicting geometric, animal, and human images on each structure. Learn about the history of this ancient city, its origins, its splendor, and the decline of its civilization during this approximately 4-hour experience.

General Description: Title: San Sebastián del Oeste, Puerto Vallarta: history, flora, and fauna in the same place | Description: Today, your local guide in Spanish will pick you up to join a group of travelers to take you on a tour of approximately nine hours through San Sebastián del Oeste, a colonial Mexico mining village with a diversity of both plant and animal species, some of them endemic. Before arriving at your destination, eat a light breakfast in La Estancia as long as you look at local birds; afterward, prepare yourselves to tour an observation site with different bird species, including flycatchers, woodpeckers, the elegant trogon, the citreoline trogon, the bat falcon, the blue-hooded euphonia, and several hummingbirds’ species; hopefully, you could see the elusive bumblebee hummingbird.

Supplier: Ocean Tours
General Description: Title: Visit Isla Contoy and Isla Mujeres in Quintana Roo | Description: Today, your local guide in English will pick you up to join a group of travelers to take you on an experience of approximately ten hours that includes breakfast; you will explore Contoy, the last virgin island in the Mexican Caribbean. Next, you will practice snorkeling in one of the world’s leading coral reefs and visualize corals and tropical fish of great variety. Enjoy the peace, crystal water beaches, flora, and fauna. Finally, you will taste the regional and typical food prepared by a team of sailors and ship captains before visiting Isla Mujeres, where you will have one hour to shower on the beaches, take a free tour through this fishing village’s colorful streets, or take advantage of the time to go shopping.

Supplier: Jesús L´ópez
General Description: Title: Morelia’s historical richness in Michoacán | Description: Today, your local guide in Spanish will take you on a three-hours tour through the historical center of Morelia, Michoacán capital, full of Spanish colonial architecture in pink quarry and baroque style. First, visit Morelia Cathedral, a building built during the Viceroyalty; you will see some of the city's historical places as you walk along, such as the Public Library and the Clavijero Palace. You will arrive at the Candy Market, where you will find typical and regional candies. Continue seeing historical places, such as the first music school, la Plaza de Armas, the San Francisco convent, and the San Diego church without missing visiting Bosque Cuauhtémoc and the famous Morelia’s aqueduct. Let yourself be amazed by this city with strict building regulations that ensure the conservation of the place’s appearance and environment.

unique_selling_points: ["UNESCO World Heritage Site","Rich biodiversity including manatees","Snorkeling in Mesoamerican Reef","Visit to mangrove ecosystems"]
one_line_summary: Explore Sian Ka'an's rich ecosystems with snorkeling, wildlife, and mangrove adventures
bussines_description:
Supplier: México Kan Tours
General Description: Title: Sian Ka'an Adventure | Description: Today you will visit, in a shared excursion of approximately 10 hours, Sian Ka'an an incredibly rich and diverse natural reserve, an area where underground freshwater rivers flow into the Caribbean. It is considered a UNESCO World Heritage Site due to its ecological importance, the mixture of overlapping ecosystems provides living and breeding space for a wide variety of fish, mammal, bird and reptile species.

Your local English-speaking guide will pick you up and take you to Boca Paila Lagoon, about 8 km inland from the biosphere, where you will board a small boat to visit Boca Paila, a vital convergence point for many animals, where you will have the opportunity to spot resident birdlife, crocodiles, a plethora of fish and even the rare manatee. Weather permitting, you will head a short distance out into open water to snorkel the Mesoamerican Reef, where you will delight in healthy corals and fish in abundance. (In case the weather does not permit snorkeling, you will visit an open cenote instead). This is a beautiful journey through tropical saltwater channels, mangrove islands and flooded sinkholes. A homemade lunch will be waiting for you on the beach when you return and you will relax among the coconut trees for a while, enjoying a dip in the sea if you wish, before heading back.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Sian Kaan Adventure - 10h - ENG | serviceDescription: Sian Kaan Adventure | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Quintana Roo
Location: address: Avenida Tulum S/N. Entre Orion y, C. Centauro Sur, Centro, 77760 Tulum, Q.R. | locations: Tulum, Oaxaca de Juárez

unique_selling_points: ["Exploration of virgin jungle and cenotes","Community-led initiative promoting local culture and environment","Swim in multiple cenotes fed by the world's largest underground river"]
one_line_summary: Bike and swim through pristine cenotes in a community-led eco-adventure
bussines_description:
Supplier: Bejil Ha
General Description: Title: The Waterway Experience | Description: Today, your local Spanish speaking guide will meet you at your hotel in Xpu-ha at 7:00 a.m. with a group of other travellers to begin your approximately 6 and a half hour experience, together you will head to the community of Chemuyil.  Accompanied by your guide and pedalling a bicycle, you will get to know the jungle and the cenotes. This is a project initiated by 5 young people from the community, who want to make known and preserve the place where they used to live and play during their childhood. The initiative allows visitors to explore virgin jungles, discover the fauna and become one with nature. The bike ride is short, it is important that you enjoy swimming in the cenotes. The first one is known locally as La Cuevita; an enclosed cenote where your guide will tell you anecdotes and stories about the place. Next, you will go to an open cenote where you will enjoy some relaxing moments surrounded by the abundant nature where, with a bit of luck, you will be able to observe some of the endemic birds of the Yucatan Peninsula. Finally, you will visit an open cenote of spectacular beauty. All of them are part of a system fed by the largest underground river in the world. At the end of the designated time for the activity, your experience will be over.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Camino del agua - 5h - SPA | serviceDescription: Camino del agua | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Quintana Roo
Location: address: Chemuyil, Quintana Roo, México https://goo.gl/maps/sPu44g5EoCQ2taSM8 | locations: Chemuyil

Get ready to marvel at the marine life of Puerto Escondido as you immerse yourself in this fascinating and thrilling adventure.

It was built in the 1960's by architect Pedro Ramirez Vasquez and has 22 rooms designed to preserve Mexico's rich indigenous heritage. Accompanied by your English-speaking guide, you will tour the museum's main collections while learning about the history of pre-Hispanic cultures and appreciating some of the most important pieces of pre-Columbian Mexico such as the Aztec Calendar, the Olmec Colossal Head, and the famous Mask of Pakal.

unique_selling_points: ["UNESCO World Heritage site","Authentic chinampa farming demonstration","Unique island of dolls with historical significance","Endemic species like axolotl"]
one_line_summary: Explore Xochimilco's chinampas and the mysterious island of dolls in a 5-hour cultural tour
bussines_description:
Supplier: OlinTlalli
General Description: Title: The legend of the Island of the Dolls and the ancestral technique of chinampa farming in Xochimilco | Description: Today, you will meet with your English-speaking guide to visit Xochimilco on a 5-hour tour and learn about the pre-Hispanic agricultural system that still operates: the Chinampas. Together, you will head to the Xochimilco docks, which means Place of Flowers. This is a canal system divided by small artificial islands called chinampas, and it was declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1987. You will enjoy a ride on a traditional trajinera where your guide will tell you the history of the canals, the endemic species, and the challenges of maintaining these canals today. You will visit the Island of the Dolls, known for its unusual collection of dolls hanging from trees and buildings throughout the island. These dolls, many of which are deteriorated, were placed there by Julián Santana Barrera, the former caretaker of the island. After visiting this iconic place, you will arrive at the chinampa where you will receive a theoretical and practical explanation of the steps followed to produce all kinds of vegetables. Later, you will take a tour of the planting area, where you will learn about the biofilter, which also serves as a refuge for the region"s endemic species, the Axolotl. After the explanation, you will return to the dock where your experience will end.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Island of dolls and demonstrative chinampa - 5h - ENG | serviceDescription: Island of dolls and demonstrative chinampa | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Mexico Area
Location: address: Xochimilco, CDMX, México | locations: Mexico City

unique_selling_points: ["Full snorkeling lesson with equipment provided","Opportunity to explore coral reefs and marine biodiversity","Includes a traditional Mexican lunch at Pineda Restaurant","Guided aquatic adventure with local expertise"]
one_line_summary: Full-day snorkeling and diving adventure at Coral Island with guided marine exploration
bussines_description:
Supplier: Nayarit Adventures
General Description: Title: Diving and Snorkeling at Coral Island | Description: Embark on an adventure of approximately 11 hours. Your adventure begins when your shared transportation picks you up at your hotel to take you to Rincon de Guayabitos. You will enjoy a light lunch before boarding a boat that will take you, your local English-speaking guide and other travelers to explore Coral Island.

At Coral Island, you will receive a full snorkeling lesson and be provided with all the equipment necessary to dive into the crystal clear waters. Afterwards, you will head just a few meters away from the island where you will have the opportunity to explore the reefs and discover the marine life that inhabits this area on a single dive lasting approximately 40 minutes. If you prefer, you can also enjoy snorkeling classes on the island to admire the underwater beauty without the need to dive. After this aquatic experience, you will return to Guayabitos Bay, where you will enjoy a lunch to recharge your batteries at the Pineda Restaurant. Finally, your transportation will take you back to Tepic.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Coral Island diving - 11h - ENG | serviceDescription: Coral Island diving | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Nayarit
Location: address: Sebastián Lerdo de Tejada Pte. 23, Centro, 63000 Tepic, Nay. | locations: Puerto Vallarta

unique_selling_points: ["Bicycle route through ancient city with views of pyramids","Visit to artisan family home and obsidian craft","Tasting of pulque and xoconostle products"]
one_line_summary: Explore Teotihuacan's pyramids and murals by bike, with cultural and culinary experiences.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Teotihuacan en bici
General Description: Title: Biking tour in Teotihuacan | Description: Today your English speaking local guide will pick you up from your hotel and head out of Mexico City to the valley of Teotihuacan to begin your approximately 9 and a half hour experience. Here, your guide will tell you about the meaning of the City of the Gods, while you walk along the Calzada de los Muertos, telling you all the mysteries of this ancient civilisation, where you will find buildings such as the Pyramid of the Sun and the Pyramid of the Moon. The second part of the tour will be by bicycle, on a route of approximately 10 km, you will get to know the route of the Murals, an ancient natural observatory and the impressive views of the City of the Gods. You will close your day with a visit to the home of a family of artisans, where you will learn more about the process of obsidian and how it is transformed into handicrafts. You will also have a tasting of pulque and products derived from xoconostle, a cactus fruit very representative of the area. At the end of the designated time, you will enjoy a local lunch and head back to the city of Querétaro, where your tour will end.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Teotihuacán Biking Tour - 9.5h - ENG | serviceDescription: Teotihuacán Biking Tour | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Mexico Area
Location: address: Teotihuacan, Méx., México | locations: Teotihuacan, Mexico City

bussines_description:
Supplier: Consultora Turística de Chiapas
General Description: Title: Palenque, Agua Azul, and Misol-Ha in Chiapas | Description: Today, you will take a tour of approximately seven hours accompanied by your local guide in Spanish and other travelers to see the Tulijá River, whose limestone bed descends in steps to form impressive waterfalls set that creates natural pools contained by calcareous dikes, resulting in the formation of the famous Agua Azul waterfalls. You will walk on the river shores, shower yourself in its indigo and refreshing waters, enjoy the breeze, appreciate the surrounding vegetation, or listen to the relaxing water sound. Continue the experience at Misol-Ha Waterfalls, a thirty-five meters high waterfall, where you will take pictures as long as you enjoy this place’s tranquility and natural beauty. Finally, you will reach Palenque City; you will have the afternoon at your disposal to stroll or have dinner at the location of your choice.

General Description: Title: A tour through the city center of Mérida, Yucatán | Description: Today, your local guide in Spanish will take you on a tour of approximately three hours through Mérida City. You will start your tour by visiting this city's historical center, where you will get to know Paseo de Montejo, one of the city's leading roads, and Parque de las Américas, which has four divisions full of culture and tradition. Next, you will visit the cathedral of Yucatán, the paintings in the Palacio de Gobierno (The Government House), and the Casa de Montejo, the only example of a Renaissance-style civilian house in Mexico, and you will listen to an explanation about this house history, now converted into a museum. Finally, you will visit the mansions on Montejo Avenue and finish this experience in Parque de las Américas.

General Description: Title: Discover the Magic of Isla Aguada | Description: Embark on an adventure to discover the Magical Town of Isla Aguada, a destination located in the heart of the Laguna de Términos Flora and Fauna Protection Area. On this approximately 8-hour tour, you will have the opportunity to witness the spectacle of bottlenose dolphins in their natural environment. Accompanied by your certified local Spanish-speaking guide, you will be able to contemplate these creatures in their natural habitat.

In addition to the dolphins, you will also visit the fascinating Bird Island, where you will be able to admire a great variety of marine birds in their natural habitat. During the tour, you can enjoy the waters of the beaches of Isla Aguada, where you can relax on the sandy beaches and dive into the refreshing waters.

unique_selling_points: ["Authentic jarana dance demonstration by a traditional expert","Interactive dance lesson with the teacher","Insight into Yucatecan celebrations and traditional dress"]
one_line_summary: Learn and dance the traditional jarana dance in Yucatan with local experts
bussines_description:
Supplier: Mun Ha Chac Lol
General Description: Title: Learning the jarana dance in Mun-Ha | Description: Today, your local guide in English will wait for you at the meeting point to go on a jarana dance exhibition of approximately one hour. The dance exhibition will begin depending on whether they are just women or whether there are both men and women. In the first scenario, a woman who has won several traditional jarana dance competitions and teaches this dance will present the exhibition; in the second scenario, a boy or a young man will handle it. First, she will explain to you the type of traditional dress they wear, as well as the wearing of the “terno” (a dress worn in celebrations and ceremonies), the places where happen the traditional celebrations; and how this type of dance goes beyond folklore and “vaquería” (one of the most popular and conventional celebrations in this entity). Next, there will be an exhibition of one or two dance pieces; you will have the opportunity to dance with the teacher to let her teach you the first steps of a jarana dance, or, if you wish, she can also teach you the most complicated dances. You will dance one or two complete pieces with her. Finally, you can ask her to repeat any of the pieces before you receive your serviette (a type of long handkerchief for display) and finish this experience.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Teaching the jarana dance - 1h - ENG | serviceDescription: Teaching the jarana dance | serviceType: Centro Ecoturístico | destinationName: Yucatan
Location: address: Muna, Yuc., México | locations: Muná

General Description: Title: Mystical bonfire & Jungle & chicle experience | Description: You will enjoy a bonfire of approximately one hour that will begin before sunset. Your experience will begin with a brief welcoming ceremony led by a J'men, who is an intermediary person between humans and deities and is performed for the purification and recharging of the visitor's energy. During the bonfire you will listen to storytelling about the sacred tree, the aluxes, wayes, and the xtabay. This while drinking the sacred drink of the Maya. This experience is in Spanish but an interpretation in English is available.

unique_selling_points: ["Immersive city and neighborhood tour","Visit to iconic landmarks and colonial streets","Narration by archaeologist guide"]
one_line_summary: Comprehensive cultural tour of Coyoacán and Mexico City's Historic Centre
bussines_description:
Supplier: Paola Parra
General Description: Title: Tour of Coyoacan and the Historic Centre of Mexico City | Description: Today, you'll enjoy a seven-hour tour that will immerse you in the history and culture of Coyoacan and Mexico City's Historic Centre. Your Spanish-speaking guide will pick you up from your hotel and take you to one of the city's most charming neighbourhoods, famous for its cobblestone streets and colonial architecture. Equipped with a radio, you'll listen to the narrations of an archaeologist tour guide as you take in the sights of ancient churches, public squares and lush gardens. Take the opportunity to sample local desserts, such as churros and ice cream, although these are not included in the experience.
The adventure continues to some of Latin America's most significant monuments. You'll start at the Alameda Park, where you'll admire the Palacio de Bellas Artes, an icon of the Porfirio Díaz era. Then you'll stroll along the pedestrianised Madero Street, past the exterior of the Palacio de Minería and the National Museum of Art, and on to the Zócalo. This fundamental square of Mexico is home to the imposing Cathedral of Mexico and the National Palace, where you can marvel at the grandeur of these iconic buildings. To round off your experience, you will participate in a raffle for a gift and then be transferred comfortably back to your hotel.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: 2 tours: Coyoacán + Historic center - SPA | serviceDescription: 2 tours: Coyoacán + Historic center | serviceType: Guía | destinationName: Mexico Area
Location: address: Ciudad de México, CDMX, México | locations: Mexico City

unique_selling_points: ["Summit overlooking San Cristóbal de las Casas","Visit to sacred Mayan worship centers","Exploration of local textile traditions"]
one_line_summary: Hike through volcanic forest, explore Mayan ruins, and discover local textiles in Chiapas
bussines_description:
Supplier: El Refugio
General Description: Title: Hiking to the land of flowers | Description: Today you will join a six hour and thirty minute group hike through two picturesque villages in Chiapas. The adventure begins in the forest of the dormant Huitepec Volcano, where three craters are now the bed of a lush forest. You will meet your Spanish-speaking guide at the established meeting point to begin a six-kilometre hike to the summit, witnessing the transition of endemic flora and fauna. From 2750 metres above sea level at the summit, you will overlook San Cristobal de las Casas and explore Mayan worship centres and ruins on a mountain considered sacred by the Mayan and Tzotzil cultures. The route continues with a three-kilometre descent on rocky trails to the village of Zinacatán, famous for its rose, chrysanthemum and carnation greenhouses. The tour of the village includes a visit to the main churches, kaleidoscopes of flowers and colours. As a finale, La Casa de las Tejedoras will open its doors to reveal the secrets of the local textiles and the inspiration behind their designs. The day concludes with a lunch made with fresh produce from the local garden. Finally, the return to the initial meeting point will mark the end of this cultural immersion.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Hiking to the land of flowers - 7h - SPA | serviceDescription: Hiking to the land of flowers | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Chiapas
Location: address: Avenida Ignacio Allende 23, Barrio de la Merced, 29240 San Cristóbal de las Casas, Chis. | locations: San Cristóbal de las Casas

unique_selling_points: ["Exploration of virgin cenotes fed by the world's largest underground river","Community-led initiative promoting local conservation","Bike tour through pristine Yucatan jungle","Opportunity to observe endemic birds and local fauna","Stories and anecdotes about local history and nature"]
one_line_summary: Bike and swim through pristine cenotes in the Yucatan jungle, supporting community conservation
bussines_description:
Supplier: Bejil Ha
General Description: Title: The Waterway Experience | Description: Today, your local English speaking guide will pick you up at your hotel in Playa Del Carmen at 7:00 a.m. with a group of other travellers to begin your 6 hour experience, together you will head to the community of Chemuyil.  Accompanied by your guide and pedalling a bicycle, you will get to know the jungle and the cenotes. This is a project initiated by 5 young people from the community, who are looking to promote and preserve the place where they used to live and play during their childhood. The initiative allows visitors to explore virgin jungles, discover the fauna and become one with nature. The bike ride is short, it is important that you enjoy swimming in the cenotes. The first one is known locally as La Cuevita; an enclosed cenote where your guide will tell you anecdotes and stories about the place. Next, you will go to an open cenote where you will enjoy some relaxing moments surrounded by the abundant nature where, with a bit of luck, you will be able to observe some of the endemic birds of the Yucatan Peninsula. Finally, you will visit an open cenote of spectacular beauty. All of them are part of a system fed by the largest underground river in the world. At the end of the designated time for the activity, your experience will be over.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Camino del agua - 6h - ENG | serviceDescription: Camino del agua | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Quintana Roo
Location: address: Chemuyil, Quintana Roo, México https://goo.gl/maps/sPu44g5EoCQ2taSM8 | locations: Chemuyil

unique_selling_points: ["Scenic boat tour of Sumidero Canyon","Rich biodiversity and waterfalls","Visit to picturesque Chiapa de Corzo town","Historical Mudejar-style fountain"]
one_line_summary: Explore Sumidero Canyon and Chiapa de Corzo in a scenic 5.5-hour tour.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Consultora Turística de Chiapas
General Description: Title: Visit to the Sumidero Canyon and Chiapa de Corzo. | Description: Today you will enjoy a tour of approximately 5.5 hours to discover the wonders of Tuxtla Gutierrez, through a descent to the Embarcadero Cahuaré. To begin, you will meet your Spanish-speaking guide at the meeting point, where you will board a motorboat that will take you to the Sumidero Canyon. This natural formation, with walls that have been sculpted over 136 million years and reach heights of 800 metres, will dazzle you with waterfalls, natural caves and a rich biodiversity of flora and fauna. Afterwards, you'll visit the viewpoints before heading to Chiapa de Corzo, a picturesque town on the banks of the Grijalva River. Here, you will explore its streets, markets and churches, and have the opportunity to visit La Pila, an impressive Mudejar-style fountain built in red brick. At the end of this experience, transportation will take you to Tuxtla Gutierrez Airport.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Sumidero Canyon & Chiapa de Corzo - 5.5h - SPA | serviceDescription: Sumidero Canyon & Chiapa de Corzo | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Chiapas
Location: address: Palenque, Chiapas, México | locations: Palenque

unique_selling_points: ["Hands-on Maya cooking experience in Valladolid","Harvesting ingredients from organic garden","Learning ancestral culinary techniques","Immersive cultural and gastronomic education"]
one_line_summary: Experience authentic Maya cuisine with hands-on cooking in Valladolid.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Aldea Xbatún
General Description: Title: Traditional Mayan cooking workshop in Valladolid | Description: Today you will experience traditional Maya cuisine in Valladolid, where your local Spanish-speaking guide and a group of travelers will be waiting for you. This 3-hour activity begins by harvesting the ingredients in the organic garden of the family that will receive you and that you will use for the preparation of the food. From there, you will take a short walk to the restaurant.

Once at the restaurant, you will cook different dishes (appetizer, main course, and dessert) that focus on the culinary tradition of the Mayas. You will experience fresh flavors and ingredients from the region, ancestral techniques, and recipes. During the experience, you will also learn about Maya culture and gastronomy in general. Finally, you will taste the dishes that you prepared in a very pleasant and traditional atmosphere.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Mayan cooking workshop - 3h - SPA | serviceDescription: Mayan cooking workshop | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Yucatan
