unique_selling_points: ["Authentic Mayan forest experience","Visit to a sacred cenote (rejollada)","Insight into traditional milpa agriculture","Cultural and natural heritage conservation","Craft workshop included"]
one_line_summary: Explore Mayan forests, learn about milpa, and visit a sacred cenote in Yucatán
bussines_description:
Supplier: Ta Náayta
General Description: Title: Milpa & mayan forest, Xcanahaltún & craft workshop | Description: Today, your local guide in English will take you on a two-hour tour through Yalcobá, a Yucatecan community in the heart of the southern Mexico Maya jungle, where you will walk in Mayan forests and learn about milpa (a traditional agricultural system used throughout Mesoamerica and based on the three sisters association: corn, beans, and squash). In this tour, the diversity of butterflies, insects, and other animals is as present as the variety of local plants that grow in this region. Besides the informative speech, you will be able to visit a cenote known as rejollada, which is only for appreciation; explore this place stamped with our ancestors' fingerprints through an experience that looks for Yucatán cultural and natural heritage conservation and let yourself be amazed by what you will discover if you pay attention to sounds and smells around you.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Milpa, mayan forest, Xcanahaltún & craft workshop - 6h - ENG | serviceDescription: Milpa, mayan forest, Xcanahaltún & craft workshop | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Yucatan
Location: address: C 1 X 6 y 6 A, 97794 Yalcobá, Yuc. | locations: Yalcobá

unique_selling_points: ["Mythical Alux stories","Educational focus on medicinal plants","Visit to a natural cenote or rejollada","Local guide in Spanish"]
one_line_summary: Educational Maya jungle tour with myth stories and natural sights in Yucatán
bussines_description:
Supplier: Ta Náayta
General Description: Title: Interpretative tour in Yucatán | Description: Today, your local guide in Spanish will take you on a tour of approximately two hours through the Maya jungle as long as you listen to a speech about different types of trees and medicinal plants that you will find around you; as well as a speech about the regional birds if you have the chance to see them in your way to a dead cenote or “rejollada”; a cavity that looks like a cenote. Next, you will listen to Mayan stories about the Alux, a mythical entity that steals bright objects, candies, tobacco, and livestock; simultaneously, it makes all kinds of mischief. You will also learn about Yuum Balam’s history, the keeper of milpas, mountains, and lands.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Interpretive senderism - 2h - SPA | serviceDescription: Interpretive senderism | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Yucatan
Location: address: C 1 X 6 y 6 A, 97794 Yalcobá, Yuc. | locations: Yalcobá

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to the City of the Gods with a local guide","Bicycle route through ancient murals and observatory","Hands-on experience with obsidian crafts","Tasting of pulque and local products"]
one_line_summary: Explore Teotihuacan's mysteries by bike, with cultural insights and local flavors
bussines_description:
Supplier: Teotihuacan en bici
General Description: Title: Biking tour in Teotihuacan | Description: Today you will meet at the meeting point with your Spanish-speaking local guide to begin your approximately 6-hour experience. Together you will tour the City of the Gods. As you walk along the Causeway of the Dead, your guide will tell you all about the mysteries of this ancient civilisation, where you will find buildings such as the Pyramid of the Sun and Pyramid of the Moon. The second part of the tour will be by bicycle, on a route of approximately 10 km, you will visit the Route of the Murals, an ancient natural observatory and the impressive views of the City of the Gods. You will close your day with a visit to the home of a family of artisans, where you will learn more about the process of obsidian and how it is transformed into handicrafts. You will also have a tasting of pulque and products derived from xoconostle, a cactus fruit very representative of the area. At the end of the designated time, you will enjoy a local lunch and your experience will be over.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Teotihuacán Biking Tour - 6h - SPA | serviceDescription: Teotihuacán Biking Tour | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Estado de Mexico
Location: address: Teotihuacan, Méx., México | locations: Teotihuacan, Mexico City

bussines_description:
Supplier: Centro Ecoturístico Xcanché
General Description: Title: Explore the X|Canché Cenote | Description: Today, you will experience a one-and-a-half-hour visit to the Cenote Xcanche, located just 1.5 km from the Ek Balam archaeological site. You will meet your local guide, who speaks Spanish, at the meeting point and take a bicycle ride during which you will learn about the history of this natural place. The cenote, a natural pit of underground water, is situated 15 metres below the ground surface and reaches a water mirror with a diameter of 50 metres, being surrounded by vegetation. You will be provided with a life jacket so that you can safely dive into the refreshing waters of green and blue hues. Once your allotted time has concluded, the experience will be over, and you can return to your hotel.

bussines_description:
Supplier: Aventura Mundo Huatulco
General Description: Title: Rafting, campfire and nightlife in Copalita. | Description: Today you will immerse yourself in a 5-hour overnight adventure with a group of travellers through the most peaceful section of the Copalita archaeological site. Your transportation and Spanish speaking guide will be waiting for you at your hotel to begin the journey to the river, where you will embark on a rafting trip under the moon and stars. Surrounded by the sounds of nature, you will then make your way to the mouth of the river known as Bocana. Here, you can relax by a warm campfire, sharing snacks and toasting with wine and beer. At the end of the experience, your transportation will take you back to your hotel.
Note: This experience is recommended for children over 5 years old.

bussines_description:
Supplier: OTEPSA
General Description: Title: A tour through Huatulco city in Oaxaca | Description: Today, your local guide in French will pick you up to join a group of travelers and take you on a tour of approximately three hours and a half to visit some of the leading viewpoints in the Huatulco Bays (la Bocana, Punta Santa Cruz, Chahué, el Faro, and more) and observe part of the jungle, flora, and endemic fauna, as well as the architecture and conformation of some areas that you will remember thanks to a postcard captured by the team. Next, you will lead to the city center to see the local and commercial area formation, where you can acquire handicrafts, souvenirs, histories, and information about Huatulco. Finally, you will arrive at a gastronomic tasting of Oaxaca, characterized by mezcal, chocolate, coffee, mole, quesillo (little cheese), and chapulines.

one_line_summary: Explore the UNESCO Celestún Biosphere Reserve with wildlife, boat trip, and natural swimming tunnels
bussines_description:
Supplier: Mayan Ecotours
General Description: Title: Explore the Celestun Biosphere Reserve | Description: Your adventure of approximately eight hours begins accompanied by your local guide in Spanish and a group of travelers in an eco-tourist paradise, which is part of the world heritage of the special reserve of the biosphere, officially declared a wildlife refuge since 1979.  A boat trip awaits you at the mouth of the Esperanza River in the Gulf of Mexico, where you will appreciate a unique natural ecosystem. Here, you will find ducks that migrate from Canada, fish, pelicans, the pink or Caribbean flamingo, among other 234 mammal species.  Afterwards, you will visit the ojo de agua, where you can swim through natural tunnels formed by branches. To end your trip, you will enjoy a delicious meal with a beautiful view of the beach.

Supplier: Manialtepec
General Description: Title: Experience the magic of bioluminescence at Manialtepec | Description: Your local English speaking guide will pick you up to experience the bioluminescence, a spectacle of nature. Your first stop will be at Puerto Suelo, a virgin beach near Puerto Escondido where you will enjoy a beautiful sunset. This activity of approximately 3 hours is nocturnal so, as soon as the sun sets, you will board a boat and let the show begin. Once on the boat you will be able to observe how the water lights up due to the microorganisms that live in it. You will also be able to enjoy a beautiful starry sky.

one_line_summary: Explore Rio Lagartos' mangroves, flamingos, salt ponds, and enjoy a Mayan clay bath
bussines_description:
Supplier: María Francisca
General Description: Title: Visit to the Rio Lagartos Reserve, between mangroves and flamingos | Description: Rio Lagartos, a town located in the Ria Lagartos Biosphere Reserve, is one of the main nesting areas for flamingos in the YUCATAN PENINSULA. 

You will embark with your local Spanish-speaking guide for a boat trip of two hours in this fascinating nature reserve to discover the biodiversity of the ecosystem between mangroves, crocodiles, and flamingos. You will observe Las Coloradas, beautiful salt ponds that have a pinkish hue due to their salt concentration. (Their color depends on the time of year and the light). You will also have the opportunity to take a Mayan exfoliating bath in the white clay mounds, which are beneficial for the skin as they hydrate and soften the dermis. At the end, you will have time to get off the boat and enjoy the gentle waves on a beautiful beach.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Discover Río Lagartos & Las Coloradas - 2h - SPA | serviceDescription: Discover Río Lagartos & Las Coloradas | serviceType: Centro Ecoturístico | destinationName: Yucatan

unique_selling_points: ["Expert archaeologist guide","In-depth cultural immersion","Visit to iconic landmarks and museums","Rich historical narration"]
one_line_summary: Explore Mexico City's historic center with an expert guide in a comprehensive cultural tour.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Paola Parra
General Description: Title: A tour of Mexico City's historic centre, temples and palaces | Description: Today, in a cultural immersion of approximately three hours, you will visit the heart of Mexico: the Historic Centre, renowned for housing some of the most imposing palaces and cathedrals in Latin America. You will meet your guide, an expert Spanish-speaking archaeologist, at a predetermined meeting point. With the help of a radio, you'll receive a detailed narration as you explore the Zocalo, considered the second largest plaza in the world, as well as the historic Templo Mayor, once the epicentre of Mexica religious life, and its accompanying museum. Don't miss the majesty of the Metropolitan Cathedral, a jewel of architecture and faith.
The tour will also take you along the lively Madero Street, where the diversity of shops, museums, cafes and the rich gastronomic offer will capture your senses. Additionally, you will pass culturally significant palaces such as the Palacio de Bellas Artes, a temple of culture and art. At the conclusion of your journey through Mexican history and culture, you will celebrate with a raffle of gifts before being taken back to your hotel.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Tour of the historic center of Mexico City - 4 h - SPA | serviceDescription: Tour of the historic center of Mexico City | serviceType: Guía | destinationName: Mexico Area

bussines_description:
Supplier: Choya Tours
General Description: Title: Tour of Espiritu Santo Island | Description: Today, you will have a 7-hour tour of Espiritu Santo Island with another group of travelers. Your transportation and your English-speaking guide will pick you up and take you to the pier, from where you will head to Espiritu Santo Island by boat, just 33 km away from La Paz Bay. During this tour, you will have the opportunity to explore the islands of La Partida, El Gallo, La Gallina, and Los Islotes, which cover an approximate area of 100 km2. The fascinating contrast between the reddish color of the limestone rocks, the turquoise blue of the sea, and the beautiful sunsets creates an admirable scenery.

Additionally, Espiritu Santo Island is a protected natural area with a diverse fauna. You will have the chance to observe a colony of sea lions on the beach, and during certain months (except June, July, and August), you will have the opportunity to swim near them. To end the tour, you will visit Ensenada Grande Beach, where you can relax, enjoy some snacks, and savor the evening.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Espiritu Santo Island Tour - 7h - ENG | serviceDescription: Espiritu Santo Island Tour | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Baja California Sur
Location: address: José María Morelos y Pavón 260, Zona Central, 23000 La Paz, B.C.S. | locations: La Paz

unique_selling_points: ["Authentic Nahuatl language corn varieties","Hands-on tortilla making experience","Extraction and tasting of aguamiel from maguey","Cultural ceremony expressing gratitude to Mother Earth","Local cuisine dinner"]
one_line_summary: Immersive 10-hour cultural tour exploring corn varieties, traditional processes, and local rituals.
bussines_description:
Supplier: CooperatIva Mili Cocina de Maices
General Description: Title: Corn forest in San Mateo Ozolco | Description: Today you will have an authentic experience near Cholula, lasting approximately 10 hours. Your local guide in Spanish will pick you up and you will head to the community of San Mateo Ozolco in Cholula. Upon arrival, there will be an exhibition of corn, where they will show you 15 varieties of corn and teach you their original names in Nahuatl. Then, you will learn how to grind the corn on a metate and understand the process of nixtamalization. Afterwards, you will cook your own tortillas on a griddle and be offered coffee and bread for breakfast.

Next, you will walk through the cornfields and learn about different varieties of maize. Here, you will participate in a workshop called Tlachicue, which involves extracting aguamiel from the maguey plants. Aguamiel is the sap that, after fermentation, becomes pulque, but you will have the opportunity to taste the non-alcoholic aguamiel. The tour will continue with a ceremony to express gratitude to Mother Earth, and to conclude the experience, your hosts will prepare a dinner featuring local cuisine. Once finished, you will be taken back to your hotel.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Corn Forest - 10h - SPA | serviceDescription: Corn Forest | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Puebla Area
Location: address: Plaza la estación, Calle 6 Nte. 1, San Miguel, Barrio de San Miguel Tianguisnahuitl, 72778 Cholula de Rivadavia, Pue. | locations: Cholula

You could enjoy crystal waters, vegetation, and wildlife in an open cenote and a close one; besides, you will taste this area"s regional and typical meal, including a hot soup, a main dish, and a dessert accompanied by two flavored glasses of water. Do not miss this exciting sensory immersion in total darkness that will allow you to look up to stalactites inside the cenotes and discover the natural wonders in the Mayan world, spending time with nature and learning about this place"s culture.

General Description: Title: Mezcal: from the agave to the tradition in Oaxaca | Description: Today, your local guide in English will take you on a tour of approximately nine hours, whose purpose is to visit two palenques of mezcal distilled in a clay pot. The first one has been managed by the same family for four generations, besides being engaged with sustainable agriculture and community retribution; nowadays, it produces mezcal for domestic and international sales. The second is a small palenque that makes mining mezcal micro-lots (an average of 20-60 liters per production) for its local sale. Taste each palenque mining mezcal and buy them directly from the producers. To finish this experience, eat in the Ocotlán market, where you will try different regional dishes.

General Description: Title: Snorkeling, the newest way to explore the Marietas islands in Puerto Vallarta | Description: Today, your local guide in Spanish will pick you up to join a group of travelers to take you on a tour of approximately five hours, where a boat will lead you to the Marietas islands, Biosphere reserve hosted by coral reefs, fish such as bobos, and seabirds like frigatebirds. On the one hand, bobos refer to fish species with characteristic, shy, and curious behavior; on the other hand, frigatebirds are large birds with wingspans and dark plumage. Their distinguished skill is continuous flight. Enjoy this adventure playing snorkeling and discovering beaches while keeping an eye on the surrounding islands’ landscapes with something to provide.

one_line_summary: Snorkel with turtles in Akumal's protected marine refuge, guided in English
bussines_description:
Supplier: Akumal Dive Center
General Description: Title: Snorkeling and turtle watching in Akumal | Description: Today, your local guide in English will pick you up to join a group of travelers and take you to Akumal, one of the favorite destinations in the Caribbean Sea and the place where you will practice snorkeling for approximately one hour. First, you will board a boat to move away from the coast for about two minutes. Here, you will visit Akumal Bay, a Marine Species Protection Refuge Area decreed by CONANP since 2016, where you can explore depths ranging from 4 to 35 meters with snorkeling equipment and the necessary safety to swim and enjoy turtle watching. Several species visit Mexican beaches, such as the green turtle (Chelonia mydas), the loggerhead turtle (Caretta caretta), and the hawksbill turtle (Eretmochelys imbricata). You must follow the regulations and instructions to avoid disturbing or harming the turtles and be able to admire them in their full splendor.

General Description: Title: Gastronomy, Xcanahaltún & Cuevas rehoyadas | Description: Today, your local guide in English will take you to a Yucatecan gastronomy workshop that can last approximately three hours, depending on cooking time. First, a Mayan family will teach you how to prepare tortillas along with a typical dish of the region; you will learn all about the preparation process from the natural raw materials selection until the food is on the table. Immerse yourself in Yalcobá or in a small ranch named Betaña to live this experience as long as you listen to a speech about the regional gastronomy and Melipona bees, a group of stingless bees who are in American tropical and subtropical regions; they are especially valued for their honey production, their role as pollinators, and their cultural importance.

General Description: Title: Kayak tour of Huatulco"s bays. | Description: Today, you will join a group of travellers for a kayak tour lasting approximately 3 hours and 50 minutes through the bays of Huatulco. Your Spanish speaking guide will pick you up at your hotel at 5:45 am. The first stop will be the bufadero, a natural viewpoint where you can witness the sunrise, a moment where the energy and magic of the place is palpable. You will continue paddling towards Blanquita Island, crossing cliffs to reach the fishermen"s beach, known for its emerald green waters and gentle waves. Being an unspoilt beach, the connection with nature will be even more intense, and you will have time to dive into the crystal clear waters and enjoy a healthy breakfast waiting for you on the shore. The end of this experience is the return trip by land transport to your hotel.

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to five traditional villages showcasing diverse crafts","Opportunity to see artisans at work and learn craft techniques","Experience vibrant local markets and workshops","Authentic insight into Oaxaca's rich artisan heritage","Visit to Josefina Aguilar's renowned workshop"]
one_line_summary: Explore Oaxaca's rich craft traditions across five vibrant villages in a full-day cultural tour.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Etnoturística
General Description: Title: A Journey through Traditional Handicraft in Oaxaca | Description: Today, you will take the Oaxacan handicraft route. In approximately 6 hours, your English-speaking local guide will accompany you to visit five villages dedicated to craftsmanship. You will first visit Coyotepec, famous for producing black pottery. There, you can visit a workshop to discover how extraordinary pieces made of this material are crafted. As the second destination, you will visit Ocotlan, especially its market, a space full of colours, aromas, and flavours around the 18th-century temple built by Dominican friars. In Ocotlan, we will also visit the workshop of Josefina Aguilar, a clay artisan who brings clay figures depicting village characters and traditional community events to life with bright colours.


You will continue with the third village, San Antonino, where the main attraction is its embroidery tradition. The women of this village are recognized for their skill and dexterity in embroidery, which has been passed down from generation to generation. San Antonino's embroideries are characterized by their colourful and vibrant style, featuring floral designs and geometric patterns. You will then proceed to the fourth village, Jalietza, where they are experts in the technique of backstrap loom weaving, and their textiles are renowned for their quality and beauty. Artisans use bright and vivid colours and traditional Zapotec geometric designs and motifs. Lastly, there is Tilcajete, known for being a craft centre specialising in creating alebrijes, the popular hand-painted wooden sculptures. Each piece is unique, as artisans use their creativity to bring to life fantastic and colourful figures that combine elements from real and imaginary animals.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Handicraft Route - 6h - ENG | serviceDescription: Handicraft Route | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Oaxaca
Location: address: Oaxaca, Centro, Oaxaca de Juárez, Oaxaca, México | locations: Oaxaca de Juárez

unique_selling_points: ["Long-distance whale migration observation","Whale-friendly panga boats","Scenic transfer across Baja California peninsula","Includes local meal","Seasonal experience (Jan-Mar)"]
one_line_summary: Experience the awe of gray whale migration on a full-day eco-adventure in Baja California Sur.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Choya Tours
General Description: Title: Migration Tour of the Great Gray Whale | Description: Today you will experience a 9-hour tour with a group of fellow travelers. Your Spanish-speaking guide will pick you up from your hotel in the morning, between 08:00 and 08:30 am. Therefore, we recommend having a good breakfast at your hotel before departure. You will be transported by road to the northern part of the state, crossing the entire peninsula from the Sea of Cortez to the Pacific side. This transfer will take approximately 2 hours until you reach Magdalena Bay, where a boat will be waiting for you to go whale watching, with an approximate duration of 2 hours.

The tour is conducted on panga boats with specific dimensions, size, and weight characteristics to be whale-friendly. During the ride, you can enjoy the natural scenery and spot the gray whale, a mammal that can measure up to 16 meters in length and weigh up to 35 tons. The migration of this whale is considered one of the longest among any mammal, traveling approximately 16,000 kilometers during a 6-month round trip, from the Arctic to Baja California Sur, where they can swim continuously for periods of 20 hours at a speed of 10 knots or more. After the boat ride, you will enjoy a delicious meal at a local restaurant (included) and then return by road for 2 hours to the city of La Paz, where you will be dropped off at the doors of your hotel.

Please note: This tour is only available from January 15th to March 15th.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Whales Tour - 9h - SPA | serviceDescription: Whales Tour | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Baja California Sur
Location: address: José María Morelos y Pavón 260, Zona Central, 23000 La Paz, B.C.S. | locations: La Paz

bussines_description:
Supplier: Cabo Pulmo Travel
General Description: Title: Adventure and Authenticity in Baja: Hiking with Rural Experience | Description: Today you will live an experience of approximately 8 hours to go hiking and have a rural experience meeting a Pericue family. The experience will start with your English speaking guide who will pick you up from your hotel in San Jose del Cabo and take you to unknown trails in this part of the Baja and reach places that not everyone has the privilege to see such as San Dionisio, where you can see cave paintings, which, thanks to recent findings are known to be more than 7500 years old. Afterwards you will continue on to the dark pool another highlight of this tour, getting here will not be easy but it will be well worth it when you are swimming in the calm waters or if you are braver you can jump off a cliff into the natural pool. Afterwards, you will head to the farm of a local family who will be waiting for you with a local meal, you will be able to share your time with them, see first hand what it is like to live in this area, and, with time running out, your experience will be over.

one_line_summary: Explore mangroves, cenote swimming, and wildlife in Celestún's natural reserve.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Guardianes de los Manglares
General Description: Title: Special Boat Tour of Dzinintún | Description: Today, you will visit the Ecotourism Parador of the Guardians of the Dzinintún Mangroves. There, you will take a special 2-hour boat tour. You will meet your local guide in English at the meeting point and begin a walking tour along the riverbank, where you will visit some ruins that used to function as houses. Then, you will board the boat to head towards the estuary, where you can observe the nature and the importance of mangroves in the region's ecosystem. Afterward, you will make your way to the Celestún Ría, a natural reserve that is home to a large number of pink flamingos and other species.

You will continue towards a 150-meter mangrove tunnel, naturally formed along the way. Upon exiting this tunnel, you will arrive at a cenote where you will have the opportunity to swim if you wish (there are crocodiles in this cenote, but your expert guide in the reserve will indicate if it is possible to swim or not). Once the swimming time is over, you will return to the meeting point to leave the boat and walk to a small island inhabited by various birds and raccoons. Here, you will have the opportunity to feed them and thus conclude the experience.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Special boat tour - 2h15min - ENG | serviceDescription: Special boat tour | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Yucatan
Location: address: C. 2-D, Felipe Carrillo Puerto, 97367 Celestún, Yuc. | locations: Celestun

The first stop will be at the Paper Workshop, founded by the visual artist Francisco Toledo. This workshop was created with the aim of providing high-quality paper to the artist community in Oaxaca. The second stop will be at the old textile factory of San Agustín, which the master Toledo himself transformed into an exhibition center and art workshops. Nearby, you will find the ceramic and sculpture studio of Master Adán Paredes, where your guide will explain what takes place in this location. This experience will undoubtedly show you a very authentic side of the city of Oaxaca. You can draw inspiration from it, as many people have done when visiting the city.

Upon arrival you will be able to rappel down to a depth of 20 meters, but not before experiencing a small Mayan purification ceremony. one_line_summary: Full-day biking and cultural tour of Teotihuacan with artisan visit and local tasting
bussines_description:
Supplier: Teotihuacan en bici
General Description: Title: Biking tour in Teotihuacan | Description: Today your English speaking local guide will pick you up from your hotel and head out of Mexico City to the valley of Teotihuacan to begin your approximately 9-hour experience. Here, your guide will tell you about the meaning of the City of the Gods, while you walk along the Calzada de los Muertos, telling you all the mysteries of this ancient civilisation, where you will find buildings such as the Pyramid of the Sun and the Pyramid of the Moon. The second part of the tour will be by bicycle, on a route of approximately 10 km, you will get to know the route of the Murals, an ancient natural observatory and the impressive views of the City of the Gods. You will close your day with a visit to the home of a family of artisans, where you will learn more about the process of obsidian and how it is transformed into handicrafts. You will also have a tasting of pulque and products derived from xoconostle, a cactus fruit very representative of the area. At the end of the designated time, you will enjoy a local lunch and head to the city of Cholula Puebla, where your tour will end.

unique_selling_points: ["Majestic 800-meter-high canyon walls","Rich flora and fauna","Historic village of Chiapa de Corzo","Mudejar-style red brick fountain"]
one_line_summary: Explore Sumidero Canyon and Chiapa de Corzo on a scenic full-day tour in Chiapas.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Consultora Turística de Chiapas
General Description: Title: Visit to the Sumidero Canyon and Chiapa de Corzo, Chiapas. | Description: Today, you will join a group of other travellers on a tour of approximately 7 hours, accompanied by your Spanish-speaking guide. You will start by descending from Tuxtla Gutierrez to Embarcadero Cahuaré, where you will board a motorboat that will take you to the majestic Sumidero Canyon. This geographical feature was formed some 136 million years ago and has imposing walls up to 800 metres high. During the tour, you will be able to admire waterfalls, natural caves and the rich flora and fauna of the region. Afterwards, you will head to Chiapa de Corzo, one of the most picturesque villages in Chiapas, situated on the banks of the Grijalva River. Before returning to San Cristobal, you will have time to explore the streets of the town, visit its lively markets, admire its churches, enjoy lunch in a local restaurant and visit La Pila, a Mudejar-style fountain built in red brick.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Sumidero Canyon & Chiapa de Corzo - 6.5h - SPA | serviceDescription: Sumidero Canyon & Chiapa de Corzo | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Chiapas
Location: address: Palenque, Chiapas, México | locations: Palenque

unique_selling_points: ["Historic residence of viceroy and emperor","Impressive murals depicting Mexico's history","Panoramic views of Mexico City and forest","Located within one of the largest green areas in Mexico City"]
one_line_summary: Explore Mexico's rich history at Chapultepec Castle with scenic forest views
bussines_description:
Supplier: Pablo Yuichi
General Description: Title: Visit to the historic Chapultepec Castle | Description: Today you will visit the Chapultepec Castle in approximately 4 hrs, your English speaking guide will pick you up at your hotel to take you to this historic building surrounded by the forest of the same name which is one of the largest green areas of the Aztec capital. You will start with a walk through the forest and then start climbing to the top of the hill where the castle is located. The castle was built in 1785 as the residence of the viceroy of New Spain and later remodeled to be the home of Emperor Maximilian and Empress Carlota. In 1939 it became the National Museum of History, with a magnificent collection of historical pieces and murals with interpretations of Mexico's history. From the top there are beautiful views of the forest and the city. At the end of the tour, transportation will take you back to your hotel.

Location: address: Ciudad de México, CDMX, México | locations: Mexico City

General Description: Title: Mystic Bonfire in Chunhuhub | Description: You will enjoy a bonfire of approximately one hour that will begin before sunset. Your experience will begin with a brief welcoming ceremony led by a J'men, who speaks Spanish and is an intermediary person between humans and deities and is performed for the purification and recharging of the visitor's energy. During the bonfire you can listen to storytelling about the sacred tree, the aluxes, wayes, and the xtabay. This while drinking the sacred drink of the Maya.

You will head to the market to enjoy its colors, sounds, aromas and of course: its flavors! Then, you will meet a chef to prepare the delicious mole, a unique dish with a great variety of ingredients such as chocolate, almonds, sesame seeds, and a variety of dried chili peppers, among others. Of course, the chef will share with you his secrets of traditional cooking. Finally, you will enjoy the mole you prepared on a Talavera dish, beautiful traditional handmade ceramic from Puebla.

unique_selling_points: ["Educational focus on endemic salamander species","Hands-on experience in natural habitat","Promotion of biodiversity awareness"]
one_line_summary: Learn about Mexico City's endemic salamander in Xochimilco's natural chinampa environment
bussines_description:
Supplier: OlinTlalli
General Description: Title: Explore the natural beauty of Xochimilco and learn about the salamander a unique experience in Mexico City | Description: This activity gives you the opportunity to learn about an endemic and endangered species: the salamander. On this trajinera tour, you will be taken to the Chinampa, a protected natural area where you can learn about the history and unique characteristics of this species, and learn about the challenges it faces today.

During the tour, the tour Spanish-speaking guides will show you the importance of respecting the habitat of the salamander and how to protect its natural environment for its survival. You will be able to appreciate the beauty of the salamander in its natural habitat. This educational and hands-on experience is ideal for those interested in biodiversity and nature conservation, and is an activity that will leave you with a new understanding and appreciation of the salamander.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Visit to the ajolotario - 2h - SPA | serviceDescription: Visit to the ajolotario | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Mexico Area
Location: address: Xochimilco, CDMX, México | locations: Mexico City

unique_selling_points: ["Educational exploration of tacos' regional variations","Guided tour with local expert Garu","Authentic street food experience"]
one_line_summary: Explore Mexico City's vibrant taco scene with a local guide in this 3-hour culinary tour.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Like a local by Garu
General Description: Title: Ultimate Taco Crawl with Garu | Description: Today, you"ll meet at the meeting point with your Spanish-speaking guide Garu to begin your approximately 3-hour experience. Together, you"ll take a tour of Mexico City, a journey into the world of tacos, a world-renowned food with a rich variety of flavours and styles. This tour isn"t just about tasting tacos, it"s also an educational adventure where you"ll learn the art of identifying and ordering different types of tacos like a local. From bustling street vendors to charming local restaurants, we"ll explore various neighbourhoods, each offering a unique twist on this iconic dish. You"ll learn the ingredients, regional variations and cultural significance of each type of taco, making for a delicious and enlightening experience. At the end of the designated activity time, your experience will be over and you can return to your hotel on your own.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Ultimate Taco Crawl with Garu - 3h - SPA | serviceDescription: Ultimate Taco Crawl with Garu | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Mexico Area
Location: address: Ciudad de México, CDMX, México | locations: Mexico City

unique_selling_points: ["Scenic catamaran tour of Bacalar's cenotes and mangroves","Snorkeling at Witch’s Cenote and Bird Island","Observation of stromatolites and diverse birdlife","Visit to Black Cenote with vibrant depths"]
one_line_summary: Explore Bacalar’s stunning cenotes and mangroves on a scenic catamaran tour
bussines_description:
Supplier: Veleando Ando
General Description: Title: Bacalar cenotes in a catamaran hobbie in Quintana Roo | Description: Today, your local guide in Spanish will wait for you at the meeting point to go on a tour of approximately four hours, where you will board a catamaran-type sailboat for two people that will lead you to the south of Lake Bacalar and enjoy snacks and fruit water or beer. During your trip, you will connect with nature, observe and learn about stromatolites and the mangrove importance, and swim in the turquoise blue waters of Lake Bacalar. Next, you will visit The Pirate Canal, where you can swim and practice snorkeling; you will navigate through the Witch’s Cenote, also known as Black Cenote, to dive into the waters and enjoy the different colors of the depths. Besides, you will learn about Bird Island, a place locally declared as a sanctuary, where you will observe birds and the different colors of Lake Bacalar. Finally, you will go deeper into the Cenote Esmeralda, an outstanding beauty area where crystal and clean water flow into the lake.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Catamaran Hobbie Cat 14 ft Premium Tour - 4h - SPA | serviceDescription: Catamaran Hobbie Cat 14 ft Premium Tour | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Quintana Roo
Location: address: Veleando Ando, Carretera Federal 307, Bacalar, Quintana Roo, México | locations: Bacalar

one_line_summary: Authentic 9-hour traditional cooking class in Teotitlán, Oaxaca with local guide
bussines_description:
Supplier: Mezcouting
General Description: Title: Teotitlán: the culinary legacy of Oaxaca on your plate | Description: Today, your local guide in Spanish will take you on a hands-on experience of approximately nine hours through the traditional cuisine of Teotitlán, a village known for its hand-knitted rugs production and located less than 40 minutes from Oaxaca, the capital famous for its well-preserved Spanish colonial architecture reflected in its churches, plazas, and cobbled streets full of history and culture.

With a traditional cook’s help, you will cook authentic and regional dishes using the four region-specific types of corn and all types of traditional tools such as comal and metate, signs of the city’s rich culinary legacy. In the end, you will taste your dish along with a traditional mezcal chosen by the host; this experience could include local delights such as tepache, chocolate, atole, memelas, and tamales if you consider visiting Teotitlán’s local market.

bussines_description:
Supplier: Huatulco Salvaje
General Description: Title: Explore the seven bays of Huatulco, Oaxaca | Description: Today, your local guide in Spanish will pick you up to join a group of travelers and take you on a tour of approximately five hours, where you will board a small motorboat that will lead you to explore the crystal waters of Costa Esmeralda, a relaxed and calm place ideally for those looking to escape from the hustle and bustle and enjoy the beauty of nature. Then, you will enter Huatulco National Park, a natural protected area with a great biodiversity of marine life. Here, you will visit the seven bays of Huatulco and observe this place’s variety of flora and fauna species. You could practice snorkeling in rocky formations and coral reefs, home to thousands of fish, crustaceans, and mollusks species.

unique_selling_points: ["Exclusive access to ancient cave paintings","Interaction with local Pericue family","Cliff jumping into natural pools","Authentic rural Baja experience"]
one_line_summary: 8-hour Baja adventure: hiking, cave paintings, cliff jumping, and local family experience
bussines_description:
Supplier: Cabo Pulmo Travel
General Description: Title: Adventure and Authenticity in Baja: Hiking with Rural Experience | Description: Today you will live an approximately 8-hour experience of hiking and rural exploration, getting to know a Pericue family. The experience will begin with your English-speaking guide who will take you through unknown paths of this part of Baja, reaching places that not everyone has the privilege to see, such as San Dionisio, where you can observe cave paintings that, thanks to recent findings, are known to be over 7500 years old.

Afterwards, you will continue towards La Poza Obscura, another highly interesting place in this tour. Getting here won"t be easy, but it will be worth it when you"re swimming in the calm waters or, if you"re more daring, jumping off a cliff into the natural pool. Once finished, you will head towards a local family"s farm, where they will be waiting for you with a traditional meal. You"ll have the chance to spend time with them and firsthand experience what it"s like to live in this area. Finally, you will return to your hotel.

unique_selling_points: ["Authentic Mayan community experience","Hands-on gum extraction technique","Guided by local elder with interpreter","Deep connection with nature and traditional medicine"]
one_line_summary: Explore Mayan jungle and traditional gum extraction with community guide in Chunhuhub
bussines_description:
Supplier: Kíichpam Kaax Selva Bonita
General Description: Title: Walk through the Mayan jungle in Chunhuhub to learn about gum extraction | Description: This experience of approximately three hours takes place in the mornings. You will meet a grandfather from the community who will be your local guide for this experience; he will be assisted by an Spanish-speaking interpreter. You will start walking through the jungle, listen to the birds singing and learn about the flora and fauna of this ecosystem. You will identify which trees have benefits and which to be careful with. The Mayan communities use the jungle as the basis of their traditional medicine, which you will also learn about during this tour. If it is rainy season, you will see the technique used by the locals to climb the trees and extract the gum, of course, you can try it too. On the way back, you will contemplate the surroundings enjoying the sounds of the wind hitting the trees in a quiet moment. Appreciate the environment and have a connection with nature.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Jungle and chicle - 3h - SPA | serviceDescription: Jungle and chicle | serviceType: Centro Ecoturístico | destinationName: Quintana Roo

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to historic convents and art galleries in San Angel","Architectural marvel of Anahuacalli Museum built with volcanic stone","Collection of pre-Hispanic art collected by Diego Rivera"]
one_line_summary: Explore San Angel's art scene and Diego Rivera's architectural masterpiece.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Pablo Yuichi
General Description: Title: Tour of galleries, former convents and architectural gems in San Angel and the Anahuacalli Museum. | Description: Today you will experience approximately 5hrs in San Angel and the Anahuacalli Museum. Your English-speaking guide will pick you up at your hotel to take you to your first stop; the San Angel area, where you will discover a small square full of art galleries exhibiting the talent of different urban artists. You will observe the works on display, which reflect the diversity and creativity of the local art scene. You will also have the opportunity to explore the Ex-Conventos del Carmen and San Jacinto, where you will be given an explanation of their history. As you tour San Angel, you will enjoy a variety of dining options. From cafes to upscale restaurants offering Mexican and international cuisine. To continue this adventure, you will head to the Diego Rivera Anahuacalli Museum, an architectural gem. Here, you will witness a permanent collection of pre-Hispanic art representing the diverse cultures that flourished in Mesoamerica and were collected by Diego Rivera throughout his life. You will have the opportunity to observe the architecture, design and construction in volcanic stone, which evokes the energy of the ancient pre-Hispanic houses known as teocallis. At the end of the tour, transportation will take you back to your hotel.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: San Ángel & Anahuacalli Museum - 4.5h - ENG | serviceDescription: San Ángel & Anahuacalli Museum | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Mexico Area
Location: address: Ciudad de México, CDMX, México | locations: Mexico City

one_line_summary: Authentic Mayan temazcal ritual for spiritual cleansing and relaxation in Nuevo Durango
bussines_description:
Supplier: Nuevo Durango
General Description: Title: Temazcal in Nuevo Durango | Description: Hand in hand with your local guide, you will experience a Mayan temazcal ritual that will help you cleanse your spirit and body. This ancestral ritual dates back to pre-Hispanic times in Mexico before the conquest and was carried out by different Mesoamerican cultures. The experience lasts approximately 3 hours, where in an enclosed structure hot stones are placed to heat the place and generate steam as well as medicinal herbs. It is a medicinal and spiritual process that helps relaxation, and allows moments of introspection and reflection, purifying thoughts and regenerating the mind.

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to historic La Paz with iconic buildings","Relaxing beach time at Balandra and El Tecolote","Opportunity to see the Balandra Mushroom","Snorkeling in shallow waters with diverse fish","Authentic regional artisan products and souvenirs"]
one_line_summary: Explore La Paz's historic sites and relax on stunning beaches in a full-day tour.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Choya Tours
General Description: Title: City tour of La Paz and beaches | Description: Today you will take an 8-hour tour with a group of fellow travelers. Your Spanish-speaking guide will pick you up from your hotel, and you will start the tour in the historic center of La Paz. You will pass through its main streets and historical buildings, such as the old City Hall, Juarez Theater, Velázco Garden, Cathedral of Our Lady of La Paz, some museums, and the craft center, where you will find various regional products, sculptures, and souvenirs made by local artisans using materials from the region, such as choya, damiana, palo de arco, and various seashells.

Next, you will be transported to El Tecolote Beach, where you will have free time to swim or enjoy a pleasant time by the sea. You will have a meal at a restaurant and then proceed to Balandra Beach, where you will take a walk along the beach. There, you can see the Balandra Mushroom (a natural heritage of B.C.S.) or climb a hill to enjoy incredible views of the bay. Get ready with your swimsuit for swimming or snorkeling in shallow waters, where you can observe various fish species or simply relax on a white sandy beach. Finally, you will head to the Coromuel Beach pier to take photos and capture this experience.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: City tour and beaches - 8h - SPA | serviceDescription: City tour and beaches | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Baja California Sur

one_line_summary: Full-day boat tour exploring Huatulco's bays and marine life
bussines_description:
Supplier: OTEPSA
General Description: Title: Boat ride in Huatulco Bays | Description: Today, your local guide in Spanish will pick you up to join a group of travelers and take you on a tour of approximately eight hours through the sea of Huatulco, a unique place in the world for its marine fauna. You will begin with a catamaran tour through the leading bays, where you will immerse yourself in its crystal clear waters and explore its underwater world; you will witness from whales (sighting availability in December and January) to vibrant multicolored fish, turtles, and dolphins (not guaranteed). As long as you enjoy the tour, the crew will take care of you as you deserve, and once you arrive at your destination, you can explore the ocean closely. Finally, if you wish, you can practice snorkeling (extra cost for snorkeling equipment rent).

unique_selling_points: ["Exploration of one of the world's largest underground river systems","Guided tour with detailed geological explanations","Swimming and walking in flooded caves","Traditional regional buffet lunch included"]
one_line_summary: Explore the stunning underground river system of Río Secreto with guided adventure and cave swimming
bussines_description:
Supplier: Río secreto
General Description: Title: Rio Secreto: The Mayan underworld | Description: Today, your transport will pick you up in Tulum to join a group of travellers. You will experience 7 hours (including transport time) at Río Secreto, a natural reserve located in the heart of the Riviera Maya. Your local guide, who speaks English, will be waiting for you at the meeting point to explore one of the world's largest underground river systems, where the history of our planet is written in thousands of geological formations. Floating in its fresh and crystal-clear waters is an experience you will remember for a lifetime.

Your guide will explain everything about the walls and formations of this wonderful geological library as you explore various flooded caves, some of which you can walk in and others where you will need to swim. Once the tour is completed, a traditional buffet lunch with a variety of regional dishes awaits you. After the meal is finished, your transport will take you back to your hotel in Tulum.

unique_selling_points: ["Authentic Lacandon Maya bow and arrow craftsmanship","Hands-on learning experience","Test your archery skills in the jungle","Cultural insight into nomadic tribe traditions"]
one_line_summary: Learn traditional Lacandon Maya archery in Chiapas jungle.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Naha Jungle Lodge
General Description: Title: Bow and arrow workshop in Nahá | Description: Until 50 years ago, the Lacandon Maya were a nomadic tribe living in the deep jungle of Chiapas, in this workshop you will learn about that time and how they used arrows and bows entirely made by them to hunt and feed their families. During one hour you will learn how to turn a dry cane into a fully functional arrow that is light and has great balance to fly in the air. You will feather the top, add the tip made with different stones and finally tie it together to have your very own arrow. Once you have finished building it, you will have the opportunity to test it and demonstrate your archery skills.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Bow and arrow workshop - 1h - SPA | serviceDescription: Bow and arrow workshop | serviceType: Centro Ecoturístico | destinationName: Chiapas
Location: address: Nahá, Chiapas | locations: Nahá

one_line_summary: Explore a fascinating insect collection from Quintana Roo and neighboring countries
bussines_description:
Supplier: Nuevo Durango
General Description: Title: Visit to the Insect Museum | Description: Today, you will meet your English-speaking guide at the meeting point to begin your approximately 30-minute experience. Together you will visit the Insect Museum, which contains all types of insects from Quintana Roo. With exhibits dating back to the late 1970s, this community museum with a very curious history displays an interesting collection of insects, spiders, scorpions and butterflies. In addition, thanks to various exchanges over the years, the museum exhibits some species from neighboring Guatemala and Belize, which makes it even more interesting. At the end of the designated time of the activity your experience will be over.

unique_selling_points: ["Impressive canyon with 800m walls","Authentic town experience in Chiapa de Corzo","Combination of natural beauty and local culture","Includes boat exploration and free time in town"]
one_line_summary: Explore the stunning Sumidero Canyon and vibrant Chiapa de Corzo in a full-day cultural tour
bussines_description:
Supplier: Consultora Turística de Chiapas
General Description: Title: Visit to the Sumidero Canyon and Chiapa de Corzo in Chiapas. | Description: Today, you will enjoy a tour of approximately 6 hours through various places in Chiapas. First, your driver will pick you up at Tuxtla Gutierrez International Airport and take you to the Embarcadero Cahuaré. There, accompanied by your Spanish-speaking guide, you will board a boat to explore the impressive Sumidero Canyon, a natural wonder with walls that reach a height of 800 metres. Afterwards, you will continue to Chiapa de Corzo, a town where you will have free time to stroll through its colourful streets, visit its markets, churches or enjoy the local gastronomy in one of the restaurants. At the end of this experience, the driver will take you to San Cristobal de las Casas.

unique_selling_points: ["Unparalleled whale sighting in Cabo San Lucas","Seasonal migration from Alaska to Baja California","Respectful wildlife observation"]
one_line_summary: Experience the majestic gray whales in Cabo San Lucas on a respectful, guided boat tour.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Rancho Tours
General Description: Title: Gray Whale Watching | Description: Today, you will enjoy a unique experience of approximately two hours, exploring the bay of Cabo San Lucas in search of gray whales. In the morning, you will meet your guide at the meeting point to begin the experience. You will head to the pier to board a glass-bottom boat and begin navigating around the bay. For approximately two hours, you will patiently search for these majestic creatures, which have traveled from the Bering Sea in Alaska to the southern part of the American continent, covering over 7,500 kilometers to settle in temperate waters for a season and reproduce. While their main destination is Magdalena Bay in Baja California Sur, they also arrive in other locations such as the Sea of Cortez, offering an unparalleled spectacle that, from the waters of Cabo San Lucas, becomes a daily privilege between January and April. With remarkable grandeur, these whales occasionally and unexpectedly breach, creating an unforgettable sight. At the end of the tour, you will return to the pier, and your transportation will take you back to your hotel, marking the conclusion of this extraordinary experience.
NOTE: Since this is a wildlife event, your guide will do their best to spot the whales and make the most of the experience while always respecting their space and well-being.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Whale watching - 2h - ENG | serviceDescription: Whale watching | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Baja California Sur
Location: address: esq. Libertad, Calle Mariano Abasolo s/n, Downtown, Centro, 23450 Cabo San Lucas, B.C.S. | locations: Cabo San Lucas

unique_selling_points: ["Wildlife observation with motion-activated cameras","Guided jungle flora and fauna explanations","Potential wildlife sightings including jaguar"]
one_line_summary: Guided jungle trail with wildlife watching and flora insights in Chiapas
bussines_description:
Supplier: Canto de la Selva
General Description: Title: Listen to the Jungle"s Song: Ficus Ceiba Trail | Description: Today you will experience the Ficus Ceiba trail through the jungle that surrounds Canto de la Selva hotel. The tour will start a few meters from the hotel, and your Spanish-speaking guide will be waiting for you at the reception and will lead the group. This experience covers a distance of 2 kilometers and lasts for 1 hour and 30 minutes.

During the tour, you will have the opportunity to listen to the jungle. Your guide will provide explanations about the jungle flora, such as pacaya, cedar trees, the king tree, the mythical ceiba, and many others. Pay attention because you might hear howler monkeys, some macaws, and if you"re very lucky, you might even hear a jaguar. In this trail, motion-activated cameras are placed to monitor the animals with video footage. Your guide will provide you with sheets containing images of the animals you might encounter.

Note: During the rainy season, it is more likely to observe wildlife, but it also increases the presence of mosquitoes.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Ficus trail - 1.5h - SPA | serviceDescription: Ficus trail | serviceType: Centro Ecoturístico | destinationName: Chiapas

unique_selling_points: ["Authentic Maya corn processing experience","Demonstration of traditional drinks like pozole and atole","Support for local community and sustainable agriculture","Cultural insights into Maya offerings and rituals"]
one_line_summary: Learn about Maya corn traditions with a community-led immersive experience in Yaxunah
bussines_description:
Supplier: Parador Turístico Yaxunah
General Description: Title: Corn Immersion at Yaxunah | Description: With a local Spanish-speaking guide, you will live an experience of approximately 2 hours where you will learn about the production process of corn, a food so important for the Mayas, which represents the spirit of the people. First you will visit a sustainable milpa, that is, a milpa that seeks to increase the efficiency of soil resources, without burning the bushes at the end of the harvest and using the same plants as fertilizer for the soil. From Don Francisco you will learn about the tasks of cleaning, planting and harvesting, as well as the challenges faced by producers due to climate change and pests. The work in the milpas directly supports the community by providing corn for food, work and the possibility of creating complementary economic income through tourism. 

There will be a demonstration of the beverages that can be made from corn, called pozoles and atoles. You will learn about the preparation of these drinks, how the corn is shelled and the nixtamal is made, and then taste 8 varieties, including those drinks that are taken on special occasions, such as Pinole (in the Mayan baptism) or Pozole of corn (as part of offerings to the gods). Afterwards you will be offered traditional pozoles made by the community from corn, accompanied by an explanation of how they were used for baptisms or offerings to the gods. Afterwards you can return to taste local food.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Immersion in corn - 2.5h - SPA | serviceDescription: Immersion in corn | serviceType: Centro Ecoturístico | destinationName: Yucatan
Location: address: Yaxunah, Yaxcabá, Yucatán, México | locations: Yaxunah

bussines_description:
Supplier: Jesús L´ópez
General Description: Title: The Door of Heaven in Michoacán | Description: Today, your local guide in English will take you on a tour of approximately eight hours through Pátzcuaro, a city known as “The Door of Heaven” surrounded by mountains and forests on the shores of Lake Pátzcuaro. Visit its temples, convents, manors, and baroque-style churches by walking on cobbled streets and through handicraft stands until arriving at Plaza Gertrudis Bocanegra, the principal city’s plaza where the statue of Vasco de Quiroga, a Spanish bishop who played an essential role in Pátzcuaro and Michoacán history, is; do not forget to visit the Teatro Emperador Caltzontzin, a former Augustinian ex-convent, and enjoy the history, architecture, and culture of this place.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Pátzcuaro tour - 8 h - ENG | serviceDescription: Pátzcuaro tour | serviceType: Guía | destinationName: Michoacan

Supplier: Tihorappers
General Description: Title: Puksi’ik’al Kaaj:  Heart of the village | Description: Today, you will live an experience of approximately 4 hours in the community of Tihosuco, in the state of Quintana Roo, alongside a group of travellers. Your local guide, who speaks Spanish, will be waiting for you at the meeting point to start the experience. You will begin by visiting the Museum of the Caste War, a space that houses a valuable collection on the uprising of the Mayas in 1847. Afterward, your guide will take you to see the historical monuments around the community. You will have time to eat at a local host"s house. To conclude, you will witness a performance by the rap group Tihorappers, a project that combines the rap genre with the Maya language. After this presentation and saying goodbye, the experience will have ended.

bussines_description:
Supplier: Travesía Cora
General Description: Title: Visit Sangangüey Volcano in Nayarit | Description: Today, your local guide in Spanish will wait for you at the meeting point to join a group of travelers and go on an approximately six-hour tour. First, for hiking, you will move to the slopes of Sangangüey Volcano, a Nayarit icon with a five-hour climb time through sharp paths. Enjoy this challenge thanks to the three-hour descent and the satisfaction of knowing that the book at Sangangüey Matatipac Valley Guardian"s highest part will capture your name. You can only do this activity in the season from November to May since it is not available in summer.

unique_selling_points: ["Boat navigation along Usumacinta River","Visit to two major Mayan archaeological sites","Authentic Lacandon community experience","Impressive mural paintings over 1100 years old","Combination of cultural, historical, and adventure elements"]
one_line_summary: Explore Mayan ruins and culture via river and jungle in Chiapas
bussines_description:
Supplier: Consultora Turística de Chiapas
General Description: Title: Explore the ancient Mayan cities of Yaxchilan and Bonampak | Description: Today you will start very early in the morning on a shared tour, after a one hour drive you will take time for breakfast, the experience continues with a ninety minute drive to Frontera Corozal, place where along with your guide you will board a boat to navigate the Usumacinta River, which acts as a natural border between Guatemala and Mexico, you will travel the river for about thirty minutes until you reach the Mayan city of Yaxchilan, which means place of green stones. Once there, you will visit for two hours the history of the most emblematic buildings of the place such as the ball game and the labyrinth, stelae and lintels that narrate the lifestyle and government of that pre-Hispanic city, at the end, you will take the boat back. On the way back to the main boarding place you will take a short rest and if you wish you can have something to eat before leaving for Bonampak. 

After a fifty minute ride you will arrive at the Lacandon community of Lacanja Chansayab, where you will change transportation to enter the dense jungle for nine kilometers and arrive at Bonampak, a Mayan city whose name in Spanish means: Place of painted walls: You can discover the magic of this site in one of its three chambers that narrate the political, religious and warrior life of Bonampak, you will also witness the presentation of an heir, the preparation of the war, the war itself and finally the presentation of the captives and sacrifices, all through its mural paintings that are more than 1100 years old. Once the Bonampak experience is over, you will take the local transportation back to your hotel in Palenque.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: AS Yaxchilán & AS Bonampak - 13h - SPA | serviceDescription: AS Yaxchilán & AS Bonampak | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Chiapas
Location: address: Palenque, Chiapas, México | locations: Palenque

bussines_description:
Supplier: México Kan Tours
General Description: Title: Renew your spirit in the tranquility of a cenote | Description: In this approximately 4 and a half hour experience, you will swim and walk in the stillness and silence of a pristine cenote, illuminated by soft lamps that will guide you on your journey, accompanied by your English-speaking guide.

With each step you take, you will become more immersed in your own being, connecting with the elements around you and feeling embraced by the womb of mother earth. In the cenote, you will perform a rebirthing meditation, allowing the energy of the place to absorb and renew you. As you head towards the exit of the cenote, ready to be reborn, you will be greeted with an exclusive concert that will harmonize your frequency with that of the earth, creating an experience of healing and connection with the natural environment.

one_line_summary: Explore the ancient Zapotec city of Monte Alban, a UNESCO World Heritage Site in Oaxaca.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Etnoturística
General Description: Title: Tour the archaeological site of Monte Alban | Description: Your local English-speaking guide will pick you up for a 45-minute drive to the outskirts of Oaxaca to visit the archaeological site of Monte Alban. This great Zapotec city developed on the top of a hill in the center of the Central Valleys of Oaxaca and had a great influence on the development of Mesoamerica, because of its importance it was declared a World Heritage Site by UNESCO. Surrounded by a landscape of mountains and valleys, you will tour the complex's main structures for approximately two hours, including the North Platform and the Great Plaza, paying special attention to the Gallery of the Dancers and the ball game among other impressive buildings.

Supplier: Eating with Carmen Food Tours
General Description: Title: Local gastronomy of Tulum | Description: Today, your local guide in Spanish will wait for you at the meeting point to join a group of travelers and take you on a local Mexican food tour of approximately three hours in Tulum, away from the tourist-leading attractions. First, you will taste authentic tacos de guisado (served tacos with two or more stews), fresh fruit juices, and regional tacos. Besides visiting a fruit market, you will try mole (a mixture of spicy Mexican sauces) and some tamales (corn dough wrapped in a banana or corn leaf) in the local market. Finally, you will enjoy a refreshing dessert before you return to your hotel (this experience does not include transportation for your return).

bussines_description:
Supplier: Consultora Turística de Chiapas
General Description: Title: Palenque: Agua Azul and Misol-Ha famous waterfalls in Chiapas | Description: Today, you will take a tour of approximately eight hours accompanied by your local guide in Spanish to see the Tulijá River, whose limestone bed descends in steps to form impressive waterfalls set that creates natural pools contained by calcareous dikes, resulting in the formation of the famous Agua Azul waterfalls. After breakfast, you will walk on the river shores, shower yourself in its indigo and refreshing waters, enjoy the breeze, appreciate the surrounding vegetation, or listen to the relaxing water sound. Continue the experience at Misol-Ha Waterfalls, a thirty-five meters high waterfall, where you will take pictures as long as you enjoy this place’s tranquility and natural beauty. Finally, you will reach Palenque City to learn about the main buildings, such as The Temple of the Inscriptions, The Palace, the Cross Group, the Ballgame, The Temple of the Skull, and many others.

bussines_description:
Supplier: Consultora Turística de Chiapas
General Description: Title: Motiepá Trail and Palenque Archaeological Zone | Description: Today, you will go on a tour of about 5 hours through the Motiepá trail and the Archaeological Zone of Palenque, accompanied by your local guide who speaks English and other travellers. The walk starts on the Motiepá trail, in the jungle near the archaeological area, where you will discover the Motiepá waterfall, surrounded by lush nature. Later, you will explore Palenque, also known as Lakamha, and see structures such as the Temple of the Skull, the Tomb of the Red Queen, the Temple of Inscriptions, and other significant sites. At the end, transportation will take you back to Palenque.

one_line_summary: 4-hour kayaking adventure exploring Bacalar's pirate canal at sunrise
bussines_description:
Supplier: Ke Rico Bacalar
General Description: Title: Kayaking in the Pirate"s Canal | Description: Today, you will enjoy a kayaking experience of approximately 4 hours. Accompanied by your Spanish-speaking guide, you will visit the non-touristy area of Bacalar to witness the sunrise and explore the Pirate"s Canal, while your guide narrates its history. When you reach the end of the canal, you"ll have some time for breakfast. Then, you will paddle towards the mangroves and, if you are observant, you might spot the wildlife that inhabits the area. Once at Mariscal Lagoon, you"ll be able to admire the sunrise casting its first rays of light over the water. On the way back through the Pirate"s Canal, you"ll have time for swimming. Depending on the weather, you may visit an ecopark or a beach. After it"s all done, you"ll return to the port with your guide.

one_line_summary: Learn to prepare and savor Chile en Nogada in a regional Puebla culinary workshop
bussines_description:
Supplier: Teoxintle Taller
General Description: Title: Learn how to prepare Chile en Nogada in a gastronomic workshop | Description: Today, you'll have the opportunity to prepare one of Mexico's most traditional dishes: the famous Chile en Nogada. This gastronomic experience will take place in a location in Cautlancingo, Puebla. The chef, who speaks English, will accompany you and provide you with a detailed recipe book so you can follow each step of the preparation. This approximately two-and-a-half-hour experience will begin by exploring the origins and history of this traditional Mexican dish.

Using ingredients from the region and sourced from small local producers, the chef will guide you in preparing the filling. You'll continue by learning to make the nogada, a walnut-based sauce essential to this dish. Finally, you'll plate your creation and savor it, accompanied by refreshing fresh waters.

unique_selling_points: ["Participate in traditional Mayan cooking in community setting","Experience cooking in an underground PIB oven","Authentic Mayan culinary tradition with local women"]
one_line_summary: Learn to cook traditional Mayan cochinita in a community setting in Yaxunah
bussines_description:
Supplier: Parador Turístico Yaxunah
General Description: Title: Gastronomic workshop in Yaxunah | Description: In the morning you will participate in a two-hour gastronomic experience in the company of Spanish-speaking women from the Yaxunah community. Today you will prepare the traditional cochinita, a typical Mayan meal cooked in the PIB oven underground and wrapped in banana leaves (a vegetarian option can be substituted). 

First, you will prepare the recado, a seasoning based on achiote, pepper, and other spices, helping to grind the ingredients in a metate. Then add the seasonings to the pork and proceed to introduce the food into the pit with hot stones. The pot is completely covered with leaves and earth so that it cooks slowly. While it is cooking, you can participate in the preparation of the dessert and tortillas or enjoy a walk and come back at lunchtime to enjoy the delicious cochinita.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Gastronomic & hammock worshop AS Yaxunah Lol Ha - 6.5h - SPA | serviceDescription: Gastronomic & hammock worshop AS Yaxunah Lol Ha | serviceType: Centro Ecoturístico | destinationName: Yucatan

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to iconic Mexico City landmarks","In-depth exploration of pre-Hispanic artifacts","Guided tour by English-speaking expert"]
one_line_summary: Discover Mexico City's rich history and indigenous heritage in a comprehensive guided tour
bussines_description:
Supplier: Pablo Yuichi
General Description: Title: Ruta Centro Histórico + Museo Antropología | Description: Today you will meet your local English-speaking guide for a walking tour of approximately 3 hours through the historic center of Mexico City, one of the largest and most emblematic in Latin America. You will start at the Alameda Park to see the majestic Fine Arts Museum, a symbol of the Porfirio Diaz era. You will continue along the pedestrian street of Madero until you reach the Plaza de la Constitucion or known as Zocalo, the most important square in Mexico, here you will see the Cathedral of Mexico and the National Palace.

Afterwards you will take a guided tour of approximately 2 hours to one of the most important museums in Latin America and the world. It was built in the 1960's by architect Pedro Ramirez Vasquez and has 22 rooms designed to preserve Mexico's rich indigenous heritage. Accompanied by your guide, you will tour the museum's main collections while learning about the history of pre-Hispanic cultures and appreciating some of the most important pieces of pre-Columbian Mexico such as the Stone of the Sun, the Monkey Vessel, the Olmec Colossal Head, and the famous Pakal Mask, among others.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Ruta Centro Histórico + Museo Antropología - 5 h - ENG | serviceDescription: Ruta Centro Histórico + Museo Antropología | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Mexico Area
Location: address: Ciudad de México, CDMX, México | locations: Mexico City

On this occasion you can taste the Maíz menu which is made up of; Oaxacan tlayuda, tuber salad, gordita de suadero, cochinita panucho, octopus tlacoyo, sea and milpa ceviche, black duck enmolada, New York with esquites, sweet corn tamale and plantain cart. unique_selling_points: ["Close encounters with the largest fish in the Gulf of California","Regulated activity to protect whale sharks","Guided experience in English"]
one_line_summary: Swim and observe majestic whale sharks in Baja California Sur's pristine waters
bussines_description:
Supplier: IES Travel
General Description: Title: Whale Shark Swimming and Whale Shark Sighting in Baja California Sur | Description: Today, you will go to the meeting point to board a boat and head to el mogote, an area of refuge for whale sharks; there is where the food they eat accumulates and where you can usually find them. When boarding the boat, you will get a life jacket, and you will meet your local guide in English, who will join you with a group of travelers to tell you about the regulations and dynamics of the activity. On reaching the place, you can make several dives to swim and get as close as possible to one of the largest fish that inhabit the Gulf of California. The average time of stay is approximately two hours since there is a regulation of time and people to reduce the impact that the activity generates. Finally, you will return to the starting point to finish this experience of approximately three hours.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Swimming with whale sharks - 2h - ENG | serviceDescription: Swimming with whale sharks | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Baja California Sur

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to iconic murals in historic buildings","Learn about the social and political context of Mexican muralism","Guided tour with local expert"]
one_line_summary: Explore Mexico City's murals and history with expert guides in a 3-hour walking tour
bussines_description:
Supplier: México a pie
General Description: Title: A Walk among Murals: Exploring the History and Legacy of Mexican Muralists | Description: Mexican muralism was an artistic and political movement that emerged in Mexico in the 1920s, in the midst of the Mexican Revolution. It was an artistic movement that focused on the creation of public murals that depicted the history, traditions and social struggles of Mexico. This movement generated great controversy at the time, but today it is recognized as one of the most important in the history of Mexican and world art.

On this 3-hour walking tour accompanied by your local guide and a small group of other travelers, you will have the opportunity to learn about the work of the three greats of Mexican muralism: Diego Rivera, José Clemente Orozco and David Alfaro Siqueiros. We will visit three different buildings in the Historic Center of Mexico City, where you will be able to appreciate the work of these and other artists, as well as learn more about their history and importance in the development of Mexican muralism.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Mural art walking tour - 3h - SPA | serviceDescription: Mural art walking tour | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Mexico Area
Location: address: Mexico City, CDMX, México | locations: Mexico City

unique_selling_points: ["Community-initiated project preserving local heritage","Exploration of virgin jungle and cenotes by bike","Opportunity to observe endemic birds of Yucatan","Swimming in multiple spectacular cenotes"]
one_line_summary: Bike and swim through virgin jungles and cenotes in Chemuyil, Quintana Roo.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Bejil Ha
General Description: Title: The Waterway Experience | Description: Today, your local Spanish speaking guide will meet you at your hotel in Chemuyil with a group of other travellers to begin your approximately 5 and a half hour experience, together you will head to the community of Chemuyil. In the company of your guide and pedalling a bicycle, you will get to know the jungle and the cenotes. This is a project initiated by 5 young people from the community, who want to make known and preserve the place where they used to live and play during their childhood. The initiative allows visitors to explore virgin jungles, discover the fauna and become one with nature. The bike ride is short, it is important that you enjoy swimming in the cenotes. The first one is known locally as La Cuevita; an enclosed cenote where your guide will tell you anecdotes and stories about the place. Next, you will go to an open cenote where you will enjoy some relaxing moments surrounded by the abundant nature where, with a bit of luck, you will be able to observe some of the endemic birds of the Yucatan Peninsula. Finally, you will visit an open cenote of spectacular beauty. All of them are part of a system fed by the largest underground river in the world. At the end of the designated time for the activity, your experience will be over.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Camino del agua - 5h - SPA | serviceDescription: Camino del agua | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Quintana Roo
Location: address: Chemuyil, Quintana Roo, México https://goo.gl/maps/sPu44g5EoCQ2taSM8 | locations: Chemuyil

bussines_description:
Supplier: Consultora Turística de Chiapas
General Description: Title: Visit to the Sumidero Canyon and Chiapa de Corzo in Chiapas. | Description: Today, you will enjoy a tour of approximately 6 hours through various places in Chiapas. First, your driver will pick you up at Tuxtla Gutierrez International Airport and take you to the Embarcadero Cahuaré. There, accompanied by your English-speaking guide, you will board a boat to explore the impressive Sumidero Canyon, a natural wonder with walls that reach a height of 800 metres. Afterwards, you will continue to Chiapa de Corzo, a town where you will have free time to stroll through its colourful streets, visit its markets, churches or enjoy the local gastronomy in one of the restaurants. At the end of this experience, the driver will take you to San Cristobal de las Casas.
