one_line_summary: Gastronomic walking tour exploring Mérida’s authentic Yucatecan cuisine
bussines_description:
Supplier: Eating with Carmen Food Tours
General Description: Title: Tasting the local gastronomy of Mérida, Yucatán | Description: Today, your local guide in Spanish will wait for you at the meeting point to join a group of travelers and take you on a gastronomic walking tour of approximately three hours through Mérida’s city center. You will start in one of the most iconic places in the city: Plaza Grande, where you will get some traditional refreshing drinks and taste the first dish of the day, gorditas (corn tortillas with pork rinds and sauce). Next, you will eat poc chuc (fileted pork marinated in sour sauce) and visit one of the leading, authentic, and local food markets in Mérida. Finally, you will taste salbutes (fried tortillas filled with stews from Yucatecan cuisine), tamales (corn dough wrapped in a banana or corn leaf), some local fruits, carnitas (pork meat), and pastor (a variety of tacos) before you return to your hotel (this experience does not include transportation for your return).
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Mérida Local Experience - 3h - SPA | serviceDescription: Mérida Local Experience | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Yucatan

General Description: Title: Discover the Flavors of Roma Neighbourhood | Description: Today at 12:30 p.m., you will have a gastronomic experience of approximately 4 hours. Your Spanish-speaking guide and fellow travellers will meet you at the meeting point. You will start a 6 km walk where you will visit 6 places to explore the gastronomy of this neighbourhood, which has more than 110 years of history. As you walk, your guide will tell you stories about the place and its architecture. On this tour, you"ll taste everything from fish tacos, tamales and signature coffee to vegan tacos and cocktails, all selected under the curatorship of your local guide. When you"ve finished visiting these places, tasting contemporary dishes and learning about Mexican culture, your experience will be over and you"ll return on your own to your hotel.

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to the largest pyramid in Mesoamerica","Authentic Talavera factory tour with artisan demonstrations","Exploration of colonial churches with baroque art"]
one_line_summary: Discover Cholula’s pyramid, colonial churches, and Talavera ceramics in Puebla.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Unlimited experiences
General Description: Title: Visit Cholula and a talavera factory | Description: Today, your transportation and local guide in Spanish will take you on a tour of approximately 6 hours to discover the archaeological zone of Cholula, home to the largest pyramid in Mesoamerica. Experts claim that it is even larger than the pyramid of Giza. During the tour, you will visit the museum and the altar courtyard. Upon reaching the summit, you can admire the Church of Remedies, built by the Spaniards during the conquest.


You will continue this tour with a visit to the town of Tonantzintla, where you can appreciate its church, a 16th-century temple that showcases the Baroque art that flourished in New Spain. Next, you will explore another church, San Francisco Acatepec, distinguished by its facade adorned with Talavera tile mosaics combined with red bricks. To conclude the tour, you will visit the Talavera de la Reyna factory, where you will have the opportunity to tour the factory and witness the work of the artisans up close. You can appreciate the different stages of the production process, from moulding and decoration to glazing and firing in traditional wood-fired kilns. After the visit, you will return to your hotel.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Cholula & talavera - 6h - SPA | serviceDescription: Cholula & talavera | serviceType: Operadora local, Transporte | destinationName: Puebla Area
Location: address: Av. Don Juan de Palafox y. Mendoza entre calle Ayuntamiento y Calle 2 Norte, Centro histórico de Puebla, 72000 Heroica Puebla de Zaragoza, Pue. | locations: Puebla

unique_selling_points: ["Unique tricycle exploration of Cobá archaeological site","Visit to Nohoch Muul, the tallest pyramid in Riviera Maya","Learn about Maya cosmology and ceremonial ball game"]
one_line_summary: Explore Cobá's ancient Maya ruins on a guided tricycle adventure in the jungle
bussines_description:
Supplier: Micaias Canche
General Description: Title: Tricycle Tour through Cobá | Description: Today, you will enjoy an adventure of approximately one hour and forty-five minutes, taking a tricycle ride through the fascinating archaeological site of Cobá. In the morning, you will meet your guide at the designated meeting point to begin the experience. You will head to this historic site, whose name means “choppy water,” in reference to the system of lagoons and crystal-clear cenotes that characterize it. You will ride along the Sacbé, or white roads, which were built hundreds of years ago by the ancient Maya civilization as part of a commercial network connecting their various cities. Along the way, you will discover Nohoch Muul, the tallest pyramid in Cobá and the Riviera Maya. Rising 42 meters in the heart of the jungle, this structure reflects the cosmological beliefs of the Maya. It was considered a sacred place, with its central staircase symbolizing the entrance to the underworld. You will also learn about the famous Ball Game, or Poktapok, a ceremonial ritual in which players attempted to pass a rubber ball through stone hoops using only their hips. Additionally, you’ll discover Stela One, a massive carved stone that, according to the Maya calendar, marks December 21, 2012, as the end of an era. This is where the idea that the world would end on that date originated! At the end of the tour, you will return to the starting point, marking the conclusion of this extraordinary experience.

Upon arrival, you will be able to contemplate from the outside the shell of the former Hacienda Timul, admiring the old buildings and discovering how the passage of time has left its mark on this mansion. For security reasons, access to the interior of the abandoned hacienda is not permitted during the tour. To conclude this experience, you will enjoy Yucatecan delicacies accompanied by a refreshing drink.

First, visit an apiary to learn more about honey products and continue the experience in a vineyard that will give you access to a cellar with resting oaks and bottles ready to ferment the must and turn it into wine.
 
 Enjoy a sparkling wine accompanied by an explanation of the scents and flavors of this product. Continue the tour in a cheese cellar, a place to elaborate and ripen different types of regional cheeses; taste five variants of this product. Try the typical city’s food or a meat barbecue in a restaurant on the road and finish with a Museo del Cuarzo tour, followed by an explanation of Bernal’s city center history.

unique_selling_points: ["Exploration of an unknown cenote in Yucatán","Visit to a community supporting Maya cultural and natural heritage","Experience of underground Xibalba with geological marvels","Adventure requiring physical conditioning and a sense of exploration"]
one_line_summary: Explore a mysterious cenote and underground cave in Yucatán's Maya jungle
bussines_description:
Supplier: Ta Náayta
General Description: Title: Unknown cenotes exploration in Yucatán | Description: Today, your local guide in Spanish will take you on a tour of approximately two hours to visit a Yucatecan community in the heart of the southern Mexico Maya jungle; the initiative is a local association that supports the Yalcoba Maya community through cultural and natural heritage conservation programs. While you stay at this place, we will offer you a visit to different local and environmental projects, which take place in collaboration with the partners; from a different perspective, you will learn about the Maya territory richness and the related culture far away from any folklore. A daydreaming day full of magic and learning.

The day starts by visiting a unique place within the community; you will discover an open cenote with biodiversity richness and unmeasurable charm. During this experience, you will appreciate the outstanding biodiversity accompanied by birds singing, which will be the entrance to cenotes cycle comprehension. The first site is a little-water cenote in its final life cycle stage, surrounded by vegetation and in a relaxing environment. After that, you will go down into the Yucatán Peninsula depths: you will visit a cave rich in history, with impressive dimensions and full of remarkable geological structures; enjoy this place’s silence and calm. The next step is a trip to the underground world (Xibalba), where you will go down into a virgin cenote only for refreshment; feel the strength of this place that will let you swim as long as you look up to sunlight rays reflected in this crystal water body. This activity requires physical conditioning, a sense of adventure, and not being afraid of heights.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Exploration of 1 unknown cenote - 2h - SPA | serviceDescription: Exploration of 1 unknown cenote | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Yucatan

one_line_summary: Ecological Mayan mythology walk in Muná with cultural legends and jungle views
bussines_description:
Supplier: Mun Ha Chac Lol
General Description: Title: Mayan mythology walk in Muná | Description: Today, your local guide in English will wait for you at the meeting point to go to the community of Muná to take an ecological tour of approximately one hour and a half through the jungle and visit a viewpoint. This community project combines nature conservation and traditional Mayan culture. You will start with a view from the viewpoint, where you will surely get spectacular photos. Then, you will enter the jungle and feel how it slowly embraces you. At the trail's end, you will enter the cave of the Mayan aluxes. According to Mayan mythology, these beings inhabit the jungle, filling these territories with legends and magic. It is believed that Mayan witches and sages made aluxe figures that came to life at night to care for the owner's properties, animals, and the jungle itself. The guides will also tell you the legend of Xtabay and the meaning of Xibalbá.

one_line_summary: 7-hour kayaking adventure exploring Bacalar Lagoon's wildlife and stromatolites
bussines_description:
Supplier: Ke Rico Bacalar
General Description: Title: Kayak the Sanctuary | Description: Today, you will take a 7-hour kayak tour through the rapids of Bacalar Lagoon. Your local guide, who speaks English, will be waiting for you to provide a brief explanation and to help you with the necessary equipment for this activity. Throughout the journey, your guide will explain the importance of the lagoon and the stromatolites (mineral structures) that are responsible for giving the lagoon its distinctive color.

Afterward, you will head towards your first stop, the rapids area, where you will have the opportunity to observe the nature and wildlife that the lagoon boasts. You will have breakfast while enjoying the unique landscape. You will continue in your kayak, exploring the area and observing various birds. If you visit the lagoon during the winter, you might have the chance to see howler monkeys. Later, you will reach a river where you can snorkel to observe turtles and other marine animals. Following that, you will proceed to your second stop for a lunch with guacamole and some beers. You will have time to swim and relax. Finally, you will return to the starting point to conclude the experience.

You will walk through the city’s streets looking for the best-hidden gems of local vegan food, appreciate urban art, and learn about the customs and stories of the region and the city. In this unique experience, you will eat traditional Mexican food in its vegan version [like tamales (corn dough wrapped in a banana or corn leaf), tacos, tostadas (toasted tortillas), local fruits, etc.], visit local fruit markets, and learn about the history of food and local life. Finally, you will return to your hotel (this experience does not include transportation for your return).

You will begin with a visit to the Bodega, where you will learn about the tequila maturation process and how it influences its flavor and quality. You will continue with a visit to the Distillery to observe the tequila distillation process and discover the secrets behind its artisanal elaboration. unique_selling_points: ["Scenic boat ride through Montes Azules Biosphere Reserve","Opportunity to see diverse wildlife including crocodiles and monkeys","Visit to community-run butterfly artisanal project","Educational insight into local ecology and conservation efforts"]
one_line_summary: Scenic boat tour on Lacantún River with wildlife viewing and community butterfly project
bussines_description:
Supplier: Canto de la Selva
General Description: Title: Lacantún River and Casa del Morpho Tour | Description: Today you will have an experience aboard a boat for a 3-hour ride on the Lacantún River. With your local guide in Spanish, you will head upstream to delve deeper and learn more about the Montes Azules Biosphere Reserve. Your guide will tell you more about how the Lacantún River changed course, leading to the Canto de la Selva hotel being situated on an island. Pay attention as you may spot crocodiles, howler monkeys, macaws, and many different-sized and colorful birds.

Afterwards, you will arrive at the Casa del Morpho, a project run by local women who craft artisanal products using butterflies. These butterflies are not endangered and are cared for by a group of biologists knowledgeable in their preservation. This project serves as a means to generate resources for the community of these women, so feel free to purchase items such as bookmarks, earrings, bracelets. You may even have the opportunity to see the artisans at work, depending on their availability. At the end of the visit, you will return to the hotel. Don"t forget to bring your camera to capture this experience.

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to the picturesque bohemian neighborhood of Coyoacán","Exclusive tour of Diego Rivera's Anahuacalli Museum with pre-Hispanic art collection","Architectural marvel in volcanic stone inspired by ancient teocallis","Cultural immersion in Mexico City's historic and artistic heritage"]
one_line_summary: Explore Coyoacán's bohemian charm and Diego Rivera's pre-Hispanic art museum in Mexico City
bussines_description:
Supplier: Pablo Yuichi
General Description: Title: Exploring Coyoacán and the Diego Rivera Anahuacalli Museum | Description: Embark on an approximately 5-hour experience through the southern area of Mexico City, accompanied by your English-speaking guide. You will begin your adventure as soon as your guide passes you to head to the bohemian neighborhood of Coyoacán, recognized as one of the most picturesque places in the city. Its cobblestone streets and colonial architecture will envelop you. As you wander through its streets, you will discover churches, plazas and gardens. You can also delight your palate with the typical churros and ice cream of the neighborhood.

Continuing your tour, you will arrive at the Diego Rivera Anahuacalli Museum, an architectural jewel. Here, you will witness a permanent collection of pre-Hispanic art representing the diverse cultures that flourished in Mesoamerica and were collected by Diego Rivera throughout his life. You will have the opportunity to observe the architecture, design and construction in volcanic stone, which evokes the energy of the ancient pre-Hispanic houses known as teocallis.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Coyoacan & Anahuacalli Museum - 5h - ENG | serviceDescription: Coyoacan & Anahuacalli Museum | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Mexico Area
Location: address: Ciudad de México, CDMX, México | locations: Mexico City

Give you a chance to experience Guanajuato, a city with many legends and traditions and one of the most common destinations for travelers who like art, tranquility, history, and colored surroundings and views seen from abounding rooftops and terraces in this historical walk. As well as its neighborhoods, houses, temples, and buildings will drive you to part of its history; its alleys will lead you to esplanades and historical places of the city. One of them is the Callejón del Beso, a symbolic place for lovers where the eternal love lives in a tragical love story.

unique_selling_points: ["UNESCO World Heritage Site","Diverse ecosystems","Possibility to spot manatees","Combination of boat tour and snorkeling/cenote visit","Homemade beach lunch"]
one_line_summary: Explore the rich ecosystems of Sian Kaan with boat rides, wildlife spotting, and snorkeling or cenot
bussines_description:
Supplier: México Kan Tours
General Description: Title: Discover Sian Kaan | Description: Today, your local guide in English will pick you up to join a group of travelers to take you on a half-day excursion to discover the Sian Ka"an nature reserve, where subway freshwater rivers meet the Caribbean. Due to its great ecological importance, this reserve is a World Heritage Site recognized by UNESCO. Its unique combination of ecosystems creates a vital habitat for fish, mammals, birds, and reptiles great variety.

Next, you will board a small boat to explore the lagoons of Sian Kaan and reach the Boca Paila bridge, a vital convergence point for numerous animal species located about 8 km in the heart of the biosphere. Hopefully, you can spot resident birds, crocodiles, fish abundance, and even the rare manatee. If conditions allow it, you will sail into the open water to enjoy a snorkeling experience at the Mesoamerican Reef. If the weather isn"t suitable for snorkeling, you will visit an incredible open cenote instead. After the exploration, a homemade lunch awaits you on the beach; if you wish, you can relax among the coconut trees and enjoy swimming in the sea before returning.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Sian Kaan Discovery - 9h - ENG | serviceDescription: Sian Kaan Discovery | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Quintana Roo

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to the renowned Underwater Museum of Art (MUSA) with over 450 sculptures","Exploration of the vibrant Manchones Reef with diverse marine species","Cultural visit to the Virgin of El Farito, a submerged religious icon with local significance"]
one_line_summary: Snorkel the vibrant reefs and underwater museum of Isla Mujeres in a 3-hour adventure
bussines_description:
Supplier: Ceviche Tours
General Description: Title: Shared snorkeling at the Underwater Museum and Reef of Isla Mujeres | Description: Today you will meet your Spanish-speaking guide and a group of travelers at the meeting point to begin this approximately 3-hour experience. You will head out to visit the Manchones Reef, which has a depth of 15 meters and extends for approximately 2 kilometers. In this space you will be able to admire diverse coral formations, as well as an enormous diversity of marine species of different sizes, colors and shapes. You will also have the opportunity to visit the impressive Underwater Museum of Art (MUSA), which houses a collection of more than 450 works by artist Jason DeCaires.

Afterwards, you will head to El Farito National Park, which has a spectacular reef and offers the possibility of appreciating the marine fauna. In its surroundings, you will have the opportunity to meet the Virgin of El Farito, who was submerged in 1966 to provide protection to the fishermen, who worship and pay tribute to her with flowers, coins and faithful promises.

unique_selling_points: ["Authentic Maya temazcal ritual","Includes UMA visit and hammock workshop","Cultural and spiritual cleansing experience"]
one_line_summary: Authentic Maya temazcal with UMA visit and hammock workshop in Quintana Roo
bussines_description:
Supplier: Nuevo Durango
General Description: Title: Temazcal, UMA visit & Hammock workshop | Description: With your local English-speaking guide, you will experience a Mayan temazcal ritual that will help you cleanse your spirit and body. This ancestral ritual dates back to pre-Hispanic times in Mexico before the conquest and was performed by different Mesoamerican cultures. The experience lasts approximately 3 hours, where in an enclosed structure hot stones are placed to heat the place and generate steam as well as medicinal herbs. It is a medicinal and spiritual process that helps relaxation, and allows moments of introspection and reflection, purifying thoughts and regenerating the mind.

unique_selling_points: ["Kayaking in estuary","Firefly and stargazing tour","Visit to crocodile farm and salt farm","Wildlife spotting including flamingos"]
one_line_summary: Two-day eco-adventure with kayaking, wildlife, and stargazing in Campeche.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Wotoch Aayin - Ria Celestun
General Description: Title: 2 days and 1 night adventure with kayaks, beaches, fireflies and visit to UMA | Description: On this 2-day, 1-night adventure, you will join a group of travellers and your English-speaking guide at the Wotoch Aayin Ecotourism Centre. Arrival is scheduled around 1 pm, where you will be greeted with a lunch including a dish of your choice and a drink, accompanied by local snacks at Los Cocodrilos restaurant. Then, you will start the tour by visiting the crocodile farm of the Crocodile Sustainable Environmental Management Unit, followed by an interpretative trail and a lookout point. Afterwards, you will venture out in kayaks to explore the estuary (tide permitting). In the evening, you will head to the cosy cabins to rest before a firefly and stargazing tour with your guide. Dinner will consist of pasta with ham and mushrooms, shrimp and drinks. To end the day, you will enjoy a campfire where you can share stories and roast marshmallows. The next day, the adventure continues with a sunrise from a lookout point, breakfast and a boat ride around the island, visiting a fresh water lagoon in the middle of the sea and a salt farm where you can spot flamingos at Playa Herradura. You will have free time to enjoy a refreshing swim before concluding this experience in contact with nature at Wotoch Aayin.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Adventure & relax at the crocodile's house - 2d1n - ENG | serviceDescription: Adventure & relax at the crocodile's house - 2d1n | serviceType: Centro Ecoturístico | destinationName: Campeche Area
Location: address: Isla Arena, Campeche, México | locations: Isla Arena

Supplier: Casa de la Luz
General Description: Title: Milpa menu | Description: Today, you will have a gastronomic experience at the Tezontle restaurant that is part of the Casa de la Luz hotel. A restaurant that, through its chefs from Oaxaca, seeks to offer a wide variety of culinary options using local and seasonal ingredients. On this occasion you will be able to taste the Milpa menu which is made up of: artichoke with breezes, pot beans, huitlacoche soup, chinampa salad, tomatoes and quesillo, green gold tlayuda, cottage cheese tetela in green pipian, flower and pumpkin, rice pudding, corn with rompope. The experience ends at the end of the menu. Note: Experience not available on Sundays.

bussines_description:
Supplier: Coyote Aventuras
General Description: Title: Visit Hierve el Agua and Teotitlán in Oaxaca | Description: Today, you will live an experience lasting approximately 12 hours. Your transport and an English-speaking local guide will meet you at the rendezvous point. The first stop will be in the community of San Isidro Roaguía, near Hierve el Agua, where you will enjoy breakfast before exploring the waterfall. You will have free time to swim in the natural pools. Then, you will embark on a 7 km hike to discover another waterfall, lesser known by travellers, where you can also swim.

Later on, you will visit Teotitlán del Valle, a village famous for its textiles made by local families. You will take a stroll through the village until you reach the home of Josefina, a master craftswoman. She will show you the process of creating these textiles. You will enjoy a meal at Josefina's house, where you will have the opportunity to share experiences and stories. After the meal, the experience will conclude, and you will return to the meeting point.

Along this culinary route, you will have the opportunity to explore the flavours that tell the story of Campeche, sampling specialties such as 'campechanos', a popular taco that has made its way to Mexico City, becoming one of the favourites. The itinerary includes a visit to a local restaurant, an ice cream parlour, a chocolate shop, and of course, a local taqueria. At each of these places, you will be able to taste dishes that will allow you to delve deeper into Mexican cuisine. Upon finishing the tour, you will be able to return to your hotel on your own.

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to iconic Espiritu Santo Island","Wildlife observation: sea lions, dolphins, turtles","Snorkeling in clear turquoise waters","Spectacular volcanic rock formations","Cultural history of Pearl Islands"]
one_line_summary: Full-day adventure exploring Espiritu Santo Island's wildlife and landscapes
bussines_description:
Supplier: IES Travel
General Description: Title: Adventure day at Espiritu Santo Island, Baja California Sur | Description: Today, you will visit one of the most representative places of Baja California: Espiritu Santo Island, which is part of a chain of rocky islands that extend southward along the western edge of the Gulf of California. Early in the morning, you will be received at the fiscal dock of the city of La Paz by your guide in English, who will join you with a group of travelers and a crew of a boat; you will receive an explanation of the day's activity, and you will get a life jacket. The experience begins with a one-and-a-half-hour ride across the leading bay of La Paz to the island, where you can enjoy incredible views.

On arrival, the boat will make some stops at strategic points to learn a little of the Pearl Islands history, so named by Hernán Cortéz. You will appreciate the local fauna, such as birds and turtles, hopefully, sea lions and dolphins. Enjoy the landscape of rock formations formed by alternating layers of lava and volcanic ash; cliffs rise above the turquoise waters, where you will have time to practice snorkeling. You will also visit a beach to enjoy lunch and relax. After a few hours of enjoyment and rest, you will leave for the La Paz pier; where you will finish this experience of approximately eight hours.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Tour to Espíritu Santo Island - 8h - ENG | serviceDescription: Tour to Espíritu Santo Island | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Baja California Sur
Location: address: La Paz, Baja California Sur, México | locations: La Paz

bussines_description:
Supplier: Huatulco Salvaje
General Description: Title: Explore the seven bays of Huatulco, Oaxaca | Description: Today, your local guide in Spanish will take you on a tour of approximately five hours, where you will board a small motorboat that will lead you to explore the crystal waters of Costa Esmeralda, a relaxed and calm place ideally for those looking to escape from the hustle and bustle and enjoy the beauty of nature. Then, you will enter Huatulco National Park, a natural protected area with a great biodiversity of marine life. Here, you will visit the seven bays of Huatulco and observe this place’s variety of flora and fauna species. You could practice snorkeling in rocky formations and coral reefs, home to thousands of fish, crustaceans, and mollusks species.

Your experience will begin with a welcome ceremony with copal at the healing tree. Afterwards, you will swim in the semi-open cenote of Tsukán and visit the Mayan house to learn about its various characteristic objects. You will also have the opportunity to participate in the Yucatan flavours workshop, where you will be able to make your own recado (typical local dish). You will also have access to the bar, the picnic area and the snack and souvenir shop.

You will learn the art of weaving hammocks and embroidering blouses from the women of the community who will share their knowledge and all the traditional techniques to learn how to create beautiful hand embroidered landscapes and flowers on napkins, tablecloths, headbands, bracelets, huipiles and dresses. You can try to keep up with them and take home a traditional souvenir made with love by these artisans. At the end of the activity, you can return to your hotel.

You will meet your guide, who speaks English, at the meeting point around 8:00 a.m. You will be welcomed with coffee and receive an explanation on how to use the equipment and the safety measures. Once this is done, you will head together towards the cenotes, where you can make two dives. Your guide will not only be attentive to your safety and wellbeing but will also share with you the history of the cenotes. Depending on your level of experience and desires, your guide will carefully select the most suitable diving sites for you. The dives will be conducted at a leisurely pace, allowing you to fully enjoy the experience. In addition, you will have the opportunity to recharge with snacks and water. Once the activity is concluded, you will return to the meeting point to end this experience.

unique_selling_points: ["Visit one of the largest pre-Columbian cities in Mesoamerica","Explore well-preserved architectural structures and urban layout","Discover the cultural transition from Totonac to Mixtec civilizations","Experience the charm of a colonial village and volcanic crater lake"]
one_line_summary: Explore the ancient city of Cantona and colonial Tepeyehualco in Puebla
bussines_description:
Supplier: Unlimited experiences
General Description: Title: Visit the Cantona archaeological site | Description: Today, your transportation and English-speaking local guide will take you to visit the archaeological site of Cantona on a 7-hour tour. Cantona stands out as one of the largest pre-Columbian cities in Mesoamerica, spanning approximately 12 square kilometers. You will have the opportunity to observe its architectural structures, such as pyramids, plazas, ball courts, and roads. It is also notable for its intricate system of paths and well-planned urban layout. It was inhabited in the past by the Totonac culture and later by the Mixtecs. The visit to Cantona will last for 2 hours.

Afterwards, you will be transferred to Tepeyehualco, a charming village with a rich history and special cultural appeal. Here, you will find a beautiful colonial church that serves as an important landmark in the area. Additionally, Tepeyehualco boasts a lake characterized by its high levels of salinity and magnesium, making it a volcanic crater lake. Your guide will provide recommendations for enjoying a meal (not included). After this visit, you will return to your hotel.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Cantona Archaeological Site - 7h - ENG | serviceDescription: Cantona Archaeological Site | serviceType: Operadora local, Transporte | destinationName: Puebla Area

one_line_summary: Explore Cholula's culture with a hands-on corn tortilla workshop and iconic site visit
bussines_description:
Supplier: Puebla de ensueño
General Description: Title: Cholula Corn Tour | Description: Today, you will meet your Spanish-speaking guide at the meeting point to begin your approximately 5-hour experience. Together, you will take a tour of the Cholula city center, visit a local market, and see the Church of Our Lady of Remedies, one of the most iconic sites in Cholula, Puebla. Located atop the Great Pyramid of Cholula, also known as Tlachihualtépetl, the church offers an impressive panoramic view of the region. Next, you will participate in a workshop where you will learn about the making of corn tortillas and their cultural significance in Mexico. You will learn the technique of making them by hand, from selecting the grain to preparing the dough. Afterward, you can taste your creation with some traditional antojitos like guacamole and salsas, concluding your experience.

one_line_summary: Explore Guanajuato's rich mining history through tunnels, neighborhoods, and heritage sites.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Cacomixtle
General Description: Title: Mining districts of Guanajuato | Description: Today, your local guide in Spanish will take you on a two-and-a-half-hour tour through the first silver and gold mining center in the world par excellence: Guanajuato. Enjoy Guanajuatos mining past in a vehicle that will pick you up at your hotel and lead you to some of the most traditional mining neighborhoods in the city; you will learn about its history under the culture and landscape of the region. Also, you could look up to its former mining haciendas, subway streets, tunnels, and 600-meter mine shafts. In the end, visiting this World Heritage Site could bring you the opportunity to discover more about this mining center on your own or to continue your experience by tasting typical dishes in a local restaurant. By the way, the decision is up to you.

Accompanied by an expert Spanish-speaking guide who will be at your side at all times, giving you recommendations to make the most of the experience. You will be immersed in the nature of the Biosphere Reserve and, from the moment you get on the boat and cross the waters until you reach the entrance of the reserve, you will feel the excitement of what awaits you.

Once on dry land, you will begin your tour on foot, entering the jungle. As you make your way through the trees and with a little luck, you will have the opportunity to spot a variety of species such as wild boars, tapir, monkeys and deer, as well as the surrounding flora.

unique_selling_points: ["Witness the spectacular migration of monarch butterflies from Canada to Mexico","Experience the sacred connection of Temoanchan, ancestral site","Observe the fragile beauty of butterflies embodying spiritual symbolism","Guided by local experts during the peak migration months"]
one_line_summary: Witness the awe-inspiring monarch butterfly migration in a sacred natural setting
bussines_description:
Supplier: Expediciones Amanalco
General Description: Title: Exploring the journey of the monarch butterflies at Amanalco | Description: From the depths of Temoanchan, the sacred place of the ancestors, souls return in the form of butterflies. Join this approximately 5-hour journey accompanied by your local English-speaking guide to witness the journey of the monarch butterflies from Canada to our country. Discover their extraordinary evolution and the challenges they face to survive a journey.

This unique experience is only available during the months of November to March, when the monarch butterflies arrive to this territory in search of refuge. Venture out during this period and witness the beauty and fragility of these creatures that embody the ancestral spirit and the connection between the earthly and spiritual worlds.

one_line_summary: Discover the vibrant markets, history, and crafts of San Cristobal de las Casas.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Consultora Turística de Chiapas
General Description: Title: Tour of the streets, markets and museums of San Cristobal de las Casas. | Description: Today, a walking tour of approximately two and a half hours through the markets, streets and museums of San Cristobal de las Casas, Chiapas, one of Mexico's magical towns, awaits you. You will meet your English-speaking guide at the scheduled meeting point and time to begin this experience. The tour starts in the narrow streets of the historic centre, where you will unravel the history and magic of this place. You will explore the local markets and have the opportunity to buy locally grown produce at local stalls, enjoying a multi-coloured display of fruits, vegetables, and the traditional dress of the diverse communities of Chiapas. Afterwards, you will visit the handicraft market and discover the majestic Cathedral of San Cristobal Martir, dedicated to Fray Bartolomé de las Casas, the first bishop of this cathedral and defender of the indigenous people of Chiapas.
Afterwards, you will arrive at the main square, where colours, flavours and cultures merge thanks to the diversity of people who inhabit it. You will continue with an amber handicraft workshop, where you will learn about its origin and history, and you will have the opportunity to acquire handicrafts. At the end of this enriching experience, you can return to your hotel on your own.

General Description: Title: Explore Chichén Itzá: A Wonder of the Mayan World | Description: Discover the legacy of the ancient Mayan civilization at the archaeological site of Chichén Itzá. A local English-speaking guide will take you on a tour of approximately 1 hour and 45 minutes to visit the most emblematic buildings, including the Pyramid of Kukulcan, the Temple of the Warriors and the Observatory. As you walk through the site, you will admire the intricate sculptures and reliefs depicting the life and beliefs of the ancient Maya. With its impressive architecture and design, Chichén Itzá is one of the most impressive sites on the Yucatán Peninsula. This is an excellent opportunity to learn about the Mayan culture and its legacy in world history.

Besides, you could learn more about turtles’ biology, ecology, and conservation in Mexico and Puerto Vallarta; discover different regional ecosystems and animal species in a conservation activity carried out by Mexican biologists who have performed it to safeguard an endangered species. What you made today for environmental conservation will be what future generations will thank and enjoy.

Prepare yourself for an experience in a boat that will lead you to see the nearest star falling to Earth, the Sun. Then, you will go to the bay inside Huatulco National Park, where you will stop at the beach for a brief interpretation and observation of the constellations" appearance from a celestial sphere (the universe"s visible part in a spherical representation observed from our planet). Next, you will enter the bay"s waters to cover you with the bioluminescence glow; you will finish on the beach tasting a cup of coffee and regional bread.

unique_selling_points: ["Boat ride through the biodiverse Rio Lagartos reserve","Observation of flamingos and salt lagoons with unique pink hues","Mayan exfoliating bath in white clay mounds","Combination of nature, culture, and wellness in one experience","Visit to Las Coloradas salt lagoons with stunning natural colors"]
one_line_summary: Explore Rio Lagartos' biodiversity, flamingos, salt lagoons, and enjoy a Mayan clay bath
bussines_description:
Supplier: María Francisca
General Description: Title: Visit to the Rio Lagartos Reserve, between mangroves and flamingos | Description: Rio Lagartos, located in the Ria Lagartos Biosphere Reserve, is one of the main flamingo nesting areas of the YUCATANIC PENINSULA. 

You will embark with your local English-speaking guide on a two-hour boat ride through this fascinating nature reserve to discover the biodiversity of the ecosystem among mangroves, crocodiles and flamingos. You will observe Las Coloradas, beautiful salt lagoons that have a pinkish hue due to their salt concentration (their color depends on the time of year and the light). You will also have the opportunity to take an exfoliating Mayan bath in the white clay mounds, beneficial for the skin as they moisturize and soften the dermis. At the end, you will have time to get off the boat and enjoy the gentle waves on a beautiful beach.

unique_selling_points: ["Natural mangrove tunnel experience","Wildlife feeding at island","Flamingo observation in natural reserve"]
one_line_summary: Explore Celestún's mangroves and wildlife on a scenic boat tour with wildlife encounters
bussines_description:
Supplier: Guardianes de los Manglares
General Description: Title: Classic Boat Tour of Dzinintún | Description: Today, you will visit the Ecotourism Parador of the Guardians of the Mangroves of Dzinintún. You will take a classic boat tour of approximately 1 hour, where you will meet your local Spanish-speaking guide at the meeting point to board the boat and head towards the Celestún Ría, a natural reserve that hosts a large number of pink flamingos and other species. Afterward, you will continue towards a 150-meter mangrove tunnel, formed naturally along the way. Upon exiting this tunnel, you will arrive at a natural spring where you will have the opportunity to swim if you wish (there are crocodiles in this spring, but your expert guide in the reserve will advise you if swimming is possible or not). After the swimming time, you will return to the meeting point to disembark the boat and walk to a small island inhabited by various birds and raccoons. Here, you will have the opportunity to feed them and thus conclude the experience.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Classic boat tour - 1.5h - SPA | serviceDescription: Classic boat tour | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Yucatan
Location: address: C. 2-D, Felipe Carrillo Puerto, 97367 Celestún, Yuc. | locations: Celestun

unique_selling_points: ["Wildlife observation in a protected biosphere","Colorful water scenery with turquoise and military green rivers","Guided tour with local expert"]
one_line_summary: Exciting boat tour exploring wildlife in Montes Azules Biosphere Reserve
bussines_description:
Supplier: Centro Ecoturístico las Guacamayas
General Description: Title: Motorboat navigation through the Montes Azules Biosphere Reserve | Description: Today, an adventure awaits you aboard a motorboat as you explore the Montes Azules Biosphere Reserve. During this 2-hour tour, you will have the opportunity to observe the diversity of wildlife that inhabits this protected area. From the moment you board the boat, you will be surrounded by a landscape full of life.

You will navigate the Lacantun River, accompanied by a local Spanish-speaking guide who will point out the birds, reptiles and mammals that might cross your path. If you are lucky you may spot saraguato monkeys, spider monkeys, swamp crocodiles, iguanas, herons, macaws and many other fascinating species. Afterwards, you will enter the Tzendales River, where you will enjoy the natural scenery. A unique detail of this experience is the difference in the color of the water in both rivers: one is turquoise green and the other is military green.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Boat tour - 2h - SPA | serviceDescription: Boat tour | serviceType: Centro Ecoturístico | destinationName: Chiapas
Location: address: Marqués de Comillas, Chis., México | locations: Marqués de Comillas

one_line_summary: Explore the underwater art and reef diversity of Isla Mujeres with beginner-friendly diving.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Ceviche Tours
General Description: Title: Diving at the Underwater Museum of Art and Reef of Isla Mujeres | Description: Today you will meet your Spanish-speaking guide and a group of travelers at the meeting point to begin this shared dive experience, which will last approximately 4 hours. First, you will head to a shallow water area to learn how to use the equipment together with your guide. Then, you will move for 20 minutes to get to the dive area. The first dive, lasting approximately 45 minutes each, will take place at the impressive Underwater Museum of Art (MUSA), which houses a collection of over 450 works by artist Jason DeCaires. The second dive will take place at the Manchones Reef, which has a depth of 15 meters and extends approximately 2 kilometers. Here you will be able to admire diverse coral formations, as well as an enormous diversity of marine species of different sizes, colors and shapes. Afterwards, you will return to Isla Mujeres.

unique_selling_points: ["Spectacular views of two iconic volcanoes","Cultural and geological insights into Mexican identity","Moderate challenging hike with rewarding scenery"]
one_line_summary: Hike between Iztaccíhuatl and Popocatépetl volcanoes with cultural and geological insights
bussines_description:
Supplier: Rafael Noreña
General Description: Title: Between the Izta and the Popo in Puebla, México | Description: Today, your local guide in English will take you on a tour of approximately five hours to the Paso de Cortés, a mountain pass of 3.670 m above sea level located between the Popocatépetl and Iztaccíhuatl volcanoes, two of the most significative elements in history, culture, and Mexican identity. On the way, you will listen to these two volcanoes’ history and geology as long as you walk beneath their shadows and in the company of landscapes never seen before. Though travelers with a moderate level of physical condition should perform this experience due to some points in the tour reaching 3.900 m above sea level, nothing can stop those who are persistent enough from getting the reward of reaching the end of the path.

unique_selling_points: ["Kayak through natural mangrove tunnel","Observation of endemic flora and fauna","Mayan clay bath experience","Visit to petrified forest and reforestation area"]
one_line_summary: Exciting kayak adventure exploring mangroves, wildlife, and Mayan traditions in Celestún
bussines_description:
Supplier: Guardianes de los Manglares
General Description: Title: Special Kayak Tour of Dzinintún | Description: Today, you will visit the Ecotourism Parador of Guardians of the Dzinintún Mangroves. During this exciting 2-hour journey, you will be accompanied by a local English-speaking guide. The experience will begin with a brief explanation and recommendations about what you will see. Then, you will take a kayak to head towards the Dzinintún lagoon, where you can use binoculars provided by your guide to observe a variety of flora, such as red and white mangroves, and if you pay attention, you might spot various endemic animals.

You will continue your adventure by entering an 800-meter-long natural mangrove tunnel along the way. Upon exiting the tunnel, you will be able to admire the beauty of the Celestún Estuary, a natural reserve that hosts a large population of pink flamingos and other species. Here, you will have the opportunity to enjoy a Mayan bath, which involves applying clay to your body, known for its exfoliating properties. The kayak ride concludes at the border between Yucatán and Campeche, where the second part of the experience begins. In this second part, you will go hiking and visit the mangrove reforestation area and the petrified forest. Your guide will provide you with information about the importance of reforestation and the preservation of mangroves. At this point, you can choose to take a mototaxi back or walk back to the same starting point. End of the experience.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Special kayak tour - 2h15min - ENG | serviceDescription: Special kayak tour | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Yucatan
Location: address: C. 2-D, Felipe Carrillo Puerto, 97367 Celestún, Yuc. | locations: Celestun

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to a traditional Barro Rojo pottery workshop with local women","Hands-on participation in wool rug weaving with Zapotec patterns","Tasting and learning about mezcal production from local palenque","Focus on social issues like gender roles and community empowerment","Authentic cultural experience with local families"]
one_line_summary: Immerse in Oaxaca's textile, ceramics, and mezcal traditions with local artisans
bussines_description:
Supplier: Etnoturística
General Description: Title: Experience the culture of Oaxaca: discover textile art, ceramics and mezcal | Description: Join your local English-speaking guide for a 5-hour cultural experience in Oaxaca. Start your tour by visiting a Barro Rojo pottery workshop in Tlapazola, where local women will teach you the traditional technique of making this craft and share their inspiring story of fighting against traditional gender roles in their community. Next, head to the town of Teotitlán del Valle to meet a family of wool rug weavers. They will show you the entire process of carding, spinning, dyeing, and weaving the fiber into a beautiful rug with symbolic Zapotec patterns, and you'll even have the opportunity to participate in the process. Finally, visit a palenque dedicated to the production of Mezcal to taste some varieties of agaves and learn about the elaboration process

one_line_summary: Thrilling coastal and mountain coasteering adventure in Huatulco
bussines_description:
Supplier: Aventura Mundo Huatulco
General Description: Title: Hike along the coast and in the mountains of Huatulco. | Description: Today you will join a group of travellers for an almost 5 hour hike along the coast and mountains of Huatulco. The journey begins when an expert guide, fluent in Spanish, picks you up from your accommodation. From there, you will be transported to the starting point of the route, a 5km trek that promises to be as challenging as it is rewarding. Equipped with helmet and lifejacket, your group will venture along cliffs, negotiate rocks and explore ravines by the sea, all framed by natural landscapes. You will feel the spray of the sea on your skin and hear the sound of the waves and the call of the seagulls as they soar overhead. At the end of this experience, transportation will take you back to your hotel.
Note: This experience is recommended for ages 10+.

unique_selling_points: ["Comprehensive cultural and historical experience in Mexico City","Visit to one of Latin America's most important museums","Climb and explore the historic Chapultepec Castle with panoramic views"]
one_line_summary: Explore Mexico's rich indigenous heritage and historic castle in a full-day guided tour.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Pablo Yuichi
General Description: Title: Museo Antropología + Castillo Chapultepec | Description: Today you will have a guided tour of approximately 5 hours. First you will visit the Museum of Anthropology, one of the most important museums in Latin America and the world. It was built in the 1960s by architect Pedro Ramirez Vasquez and has 22 rooms designed to preserve Mexico's rich indigenous heritage. Accompanied by your English-speaking guide, you will tour the museum's main collections while learning about the history of pre-Hispanic cultures and appreciating some of the most important pieces of pre-Columbian Mexico such as the Aztec Calendar, the Olmec Colossal Head, and the famous Mask of Pakal. 

Your second stop of the day will be the majestic Chapultepec Castle surrounded by a forest of the same name, one of the largest green areas of the Aztec capital. You will start with a walk through the forest and then start climbing up to the castle located at the top of the hill. The castle was built in 1785 as the residence of the viceroy of New Spain and was later remodeled to be the home of Emperor Maximilian and Empress Carlota. In 1939 it became the National Museum of History with a magnificent collection of historical pieces and murals with interpretations of the history of Mexico. From the top there are beautiful views of the forest and the city.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Museo Antropología + Castillo Chapultepec - 5 h - ENG | serviceDescription: Museo Antropología + Castillo Chapultepec | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Mexico Area
Location: address: Ciudad de México, CDMX, México | locations: Mexico City

unique_selling_points: ["Authentic community immersion","Visit to pineapple plantation and local family","Cultural murals in Chunhuhub","Traditional embroidery with grandparents","Swim in crystalline cenote"]
one_line_summary: Explore Mayan culture, local life, and cenote refreshment in Chunhuhub.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Kíichpam Kaax Selva Bonita
General Description: Title: Koonex Xiimbal: Let's go for a walk | Description: Embark on a journey through the local communities, accompanied by your local Spanish-speaking guide on this adventure of approximately 7 hours. You will begin by visiting a pineapple plantation, where you will learn about its importance, cultivation and origin, as well as other fruits found in the Milpa Maya. Immerse yourself in the culture and traditions by spending time with a local family and tasting a delicious peninsular dish. Then, climb aboard a tricycle to explore the community of Chunhuhub, admire its cultural murals and enjoy a typical dessert of the region.

You will continue your adventure in the community of Xpichil, where you will have the opportunity to immerse yourself in the local way of life through handmade embroidery and the teachings passed down by the grandparents. To close with a flourish, you will enter the jungle and visit a cenote of crystalline waters in the community of Dzula, where you will be able to refresh yourself.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Koonex Xiimbal: Let's go for a walk - 5h - SPA | serviceDescription: Koonex Xiimbal: Let's go for a walk | serviceType: Centro Ecoturístico | destinationName: Quintana Roo

unique_selling_points: ["Snorkeling in one of the world's most impressive coral reefs","Visit to Isla Contoy, a protected natural reserve","Cultural experience in Isla Mujeres with local shopping"]
one_line_summary: Full-day tour exploring Isla Mujeres, Contoy, snorkeling, and local culture
bussines_description:
Supplier: Ocean Tours
General Description: Title: Visit to the reserve, Isla Contoy and Isla Mujeres. | Description: Today, during a full 10-hour tour, you will have the opportunity to explore Isla Mujeres, Contoy and a national park, starting with a meeting at your hotel with your English-speaking guide and a group of travellers. The first stop will be the Flamingos Pier to enjoy a light breakfast, including coffee, sweet bread, fruit and iced tea, perfect to start the day. With renewed energy and life jackets on, the group will venture out to the reef to, weather permitting, snorkel one of the world's most impressive coral reefs located in the Contoy Reserve, a spectacle of corals and tropical fish. Then, the excursion continues to Isla Contoy, where you will have the option to take a land tour and try regional dishes such as Tikincix fish and grilled chicken, accompanied by rice, salad, tortilla chips, tortillas and sauces, not forgetting soft drinks and beer. The trip culminates in Isla Mujeres, where you can dive into the crystal clear waters of its beaches or stroll through the vibrant streets of the fishing village, taking the opportunity to buy souvenirs. Finally, you will return to Flamingos Pier, ending this day of adventure and culture.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Paradise Islands - 10h - ENG | serviceDescription: Paradise Islands | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Quintana Roo
Location: address: Calle Diagonal 55 Sur Manzana 22 Lote 1, entre 18, Ejidal, 77712 Playa del Carmen, Q.R. | locations: Tulum, Playa del Carmen, Puerto Morelos, Cancún

unique_selling_points: ["Two cavern dives in Tulum's famous cenotes","Leisurely pace for full enjoyment","Expert English-speaking guides"]
one_line_summary: Exciting cavern diving adventure in Tulum's stunning cenotes
bussines_description:
Supplier: Zen Diving
General Description: Title: Cave Diving in Tulum | Description: Today, you will enjoy a caving diving experience lasting approximately 8 hours. You will meet your guide, who speaks English, at the meeting point around 8:00 a.m. You will be welcomed with coffee and will receive an explanation on how to use the equipment and safety measures. Once this is done, you will head together to the destination, where you can carry out two dives. Depending on your level of experience and your wishes, your guide will carefully select the most suitable diving sites for you. The dives are conducted at a leisurely pace, allowing you to fully enjoy the experience. In addition, you will have the opportunity to recharge with snacks and water. At the end of the activity, you will return to the meeting point to conclude this experience.

Note: To participate in this experience, it is necessary to have taken the introductory courses in cavern diving.

unique_selling_points: ["Traditional trajinera boat ride through historic canals","Visit to the last remnants of Tenochtitlan's rivers","Exploration of bohemian Coyoacán neighborhood with colonial charm","Authentic Mexican desserts tasting in Coyoacán"]
one_line_summary: Discover Mexico City's historic canals and bohemian charm in one full-day tour
bussines_description:
Supplier: Pablo Yuichi
General Description: Title: Xochimilco and the bohemian neighborhood of Coyoacan | Description: Your English-speaking guide will pick you up to visit the southern area of Mexico City. Your first stop will be one of the most emblematic areas of the capital: the canals of Xochimilco, a word that in Nahuatl means Field of Flowers and that are the last memory of the rivers that crossed the valley of the ancient Tenochtitlan. You will board a traditional trajinera, a colorfully painted wooden boat, and while you sail you will learn about the history of the place, its famous chinampas or floating gardens and the famous ajolotes.  

You will continue your day in the bohemian neighborhood of Coyoacán, one of the most picturesque in the city and characterized by its cobblestone streets and colonial architecture. During your walk you will see churches, squares and beautiful gardens. We suggest you taste the typical desserts of the neighborhood, such as the delicious churros and ice cream.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Trajinera ride in Xochimilco + Coyoacán - 5 h - ENG | serviceDescription: Trajinera ride in Xochimilco + Coyoacán | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Mexico Area
Location: address: Ciudad de México, CDMX, México | locations: Mexico City

You will taste different percentages such as 100, 80, 70, 70 chipotle, 56, white, among others. You will also be able to combine them with different ingredients such as cheese, bacon or beetroot. At the end of this tasting, your experience will be over and you will return on your own to your hotel.

one_line_summary: Calm sunset kayaking on Lacantun River with birdwatching and tranquility
bussines_description:
Supplier: Centro Ecoturístico las Guacamayas
General Description: Title: Kayaking on the Lacantun River | Description: Today you will immerse yourself in a kayaking adventure along the Lacantun River. During this one-hour experience, you will be accompanied by your local Spanish-speaking guide who will provide instructions and help you navigate the calm waters of the river. As you enter the natural landscape, you will feel a sense of calm and connection with the nature that surrounds you.

As you make your way along the river, your guide will lead you to the perfect spot to watch the sunset. As the sun sets over the horizon, the sky will be tinged with orange tones. At the end of your kayak tour, you can relax, swim and enjoy a well-deserved rest. You can sunbathe on the river bank while watching the birds that inhabit the area and simply enjoy the peace and tranquility that this natural environment offers.

Supplier: Cinco Lagos
General Description: Title: Tour of a coffee plot | Description: Today, you will have the opportunity to embark on a journey of approximately two hours through a family-owned plot dedicated to coffee cultivation. A guide, who speaks Spanish, will be waiting to lead you to the plot, located about 30 minutes from your accommodation. Upon arrival, you will begin a walk during which you will have the opportunity to observe the coffee plants in their natural environment. Your guide will explain the entire coffee process, from its planting to harvest. If your visit coincides with the harvest season (December to April), you will have the chance to pick the coffee beans yourself. At the conclusion of the designated time for the visit, you will return to your accommodation, marking the end of this enriching experience.

unique_selling_points: ["Horseback tour through Guanajuato's scenic mountains","Cultural stories of Santa Rosa de Lima and Monte de San Nicolás","Local family-prepared cuisine","Conservation awareness and projects"]
one_line_summary: Explore Guanajuato’s mountains on horseback, combining culture, cuisine, and conservation
bussines_description:
Supplier: Cacomixtle
General Description: Title: On horseback in the mountains in Guanajuato | Description: Today, your local guide in Spanish will take you on a tour of approximately four hours and a half, where you can walk around Guanajuato’s surrounding haciendas and ranches and explore part of the Camino Real en la Sierra de Santa Rosa at the gallop’s pace of a “cuaco” as long as you listen to stories of Santa Rosa de Lima and Monte de San Nicolás villages, both locations of Guanajuato’s city.

Enjoy this experience with the seasoning of the food prepared by a local family; in the meantime, look up to the local landscape and learn about the conservation and dissemination projects carried out by the inhabitants of these locations to safeguard their oak forest, preserve their soil’s richness, and raise awareness of how can we protect our natural resources. Have a cultural, artistic, and gastronomic experience. Everything is in the same place.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: On horseback in the mountains - 4h - SPA | serviceDescription: On horseback in the mountains | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Guanajuato Area
Location: address: Guanajuato, Gto., México | locations: Guanajuato

unique_selling_points: ["Operational pre-Hispanic agricultural system","Traditional trajinera cruise","Educational and practical experience at chinampa","UNESCO World Heritage Site"]
one_line_summary: Discover Xochimilco's ancient chinampas on a traditional trajinera tour.
bussines_description:
Supplier: OlinTlalli
General Description: Title: Demonstrative Chinampa on a traditional trajinera | Description: Today, you will visit Xochimilco on a 3-hour tour to discover the pre-Hispanic agricultural system that is still operational: the Chinampas. With your local guide speaking Spanish, you will head towards the Xochimilco docks, which means Place of Flowers. This is a system of canals divided by small artificial islands called chinampas and was declared a World Heritage Site by UNESCO in 1987.

You will enjoy two hours of cruising (1 hour each way) on a traditional trajinera, a type of traditional boat. During the journey, your guide will tell you about the history of the canals, the endemic species, and the challenges involved in maintaining these canals today. You will arrive at a chinampa, covering just over 3 hectares nestled in the Protected Natural Area Ejidos of Xochimilco and San Gregorio Atlapulco. There, you will receive both theoretical and practical explanations of the steps followed to produce all kinds of vegetables. Later, you will tour the planting area, concluding with an explanation of the biofilter, which also serves as a refuge for the region"s endemic species, the Axolotl. After the explanation, you will return to the dock and from there to your hotel.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Demonstrative chinampa - 3h - SPA | serviceDescription: Demonstrative chinampa | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Mexico Area
Location: address: Xochimilco, CDMX, México | locations: Mexico City

unique_selling_points: ["World Wonder of the Mayan civilization","Expert local guide in Spanish","Visit to iconic structures like Kukulcan Pyramid and Observatory","Deep cultural and historical insights"]
one_line_summary: Explore Chichén Itzá, a Mayan World Wonder, with expert guidance and rich history
bussines_description:
Supplier: Juan Pat
General Description: Title: Explore Chichén Itzá: A Wonder of the Mayan World | Description: Discover the legacy of the ancient Mayan civilization at the archaeological site of Chichen Itza. A local Spanish-speaking guide will take you on a tour of approximately 1 hour and 45 minutes to visit the most emblematic buildings, including the Pyramid of Kukulcan, the Temple of the Warriors and the Observatory. As you walk through the site, you will admire the intricate sculptures and reliefs depicting the life and beliefs of the ancient Maya. With its impressive architecture and design, Chichén Itzá is one of the most impressive sites on the Yucatán Peninsula. This is an excellent opportunity to learn about the Mayan culture and its legacy in world history.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Guided visit in Chichén Itzá Archaeological Zone - 2h - SPA | serviceDescription: Guided visit in Chichén Itzá Archaeological Zone | serviceType: Guía | destinationName: Yucatan

unique_selling_points: ["Observation of endemic and emblematic birds in Huatulco","Use of binoculars and telescopes for bird identification","Integration with eBird app for bird counting","Leisurely exploration of flat, accessible trails","Immersive natural environment in Las Ninfas reserve"]
one_line_summary: Relaxing 4-hour birdwatching experience in Las Ninfas, Huatulco
bussines_description:
Supplier: Ecoturística Las Ninfas
General Description: Title: Birdwatching in Las Ninfas: Alas Huatulco | Description: Today, your Spanish-speaking guide will pick you up at your hotel to take you on a approximately 4-hour experience in the ecotourism reserve Las Ninfas in the Jabalina Community. This experience is perfect for bird watching. Here, you will immerse yourself in a natural environment, awakening your senses. You will have the opportunity to enjoy the morning songs of the birds as you explore the place at a leisurely pace. You can observe and identify birds with binoculars or a telescope and capture incredible photos. You will also admire endemic and emblematic birds near a stream.

Then, you will enter a zone of flat and uncomplicated trails in a deciduous forest. After enjoying some snacks, you will continue bird watching for 2 to 3 hours, depending on your preference and the intensity of the birds present. While observing these beautiful birds, you will also learn about their environmental and cultural significance. At the end of the observation, we will register the number of birds we have seen in the eBird application. Finally, your transportation will take you back to your hotel.

During this experience, you will have the opportunity to immerse yourself in the delicious Yucatecan gastronomy, a unique blend of European and Mexican flavours. You will enjoy regional dishes, fresh seasonal fruits, juices, tamales and much more in the main market of the city. unique_selling_points: ["Nighttime jungle adventure","Opportunity to observe native owls","Star gazing in natural setting"]
one_line_summary: Night jungle hike in Chiapas to observe owls and stars
bussines_description:
Supplier: Naha Jungle Lodge
General Description: Title: Owl Watching at Night | Description: Today, you will experience a two-hour journey in the Nahá community, where you will observe owls. Accompanied by your local guide, who speaks Spanish, you will meet in the hotel reception to set off at dusk. You will venture along the community paths in search of these owls. Nahá is home to a wide variety of these birds. Your guide will use an app to show you the different types and the sounds they make. While on the paths, you will remain silent to listen for the owls' responses. With patience and luck, they will perch in the trees, allowing you to observe them. Even if you don't see them, the experience is incredible; you can admire the starry sky and even identify constellations if you pay attention. Once the allotted time is over, you will return with your guide to the hotel.

Note: Observing the owls is not guaranteed as they live freely in the jungle.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Owl watching night hike - 1.5h - SPA | serviceDescription: Owl watching night hike | serviceType: Centro Ecoturístico | destinationName: Chiapas
Location: address: Nahá, Chiapas | locations: Nahá

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to one of the oldest cities in America","View of majestic volcanoes Iztaccihuatl and Popocatepetl","UNESCO World Heritage Site tour of Puebla","Visit to the Great Pyramid of Cholula"]
one_line_summary: Explore colonial Puebla and Cholula with expert guide, UNESCO sites and volcano views
bussines_description:
Supplier: Pablo Yuichi
General Description: Title: Get to know the colonial cities of Puebla & Cholula | Description: Your English speaking driver-guide will pick you up early to visit two of Mexico's colonial gems in an approximately 12 hour experience, the magical town of Cholula and the city of Puebla. You will start with a road trip of approximately 2 hours, if it is a clear day you will be able to see the majestic volcanoes Iztaccihuatl and Popocatepetl. The first stop will be Cholula, one of the oldest cities in America. You will take a walking tour of the town center and visit the Great Pyramid of Cholula and the church of Our Lady of Remedies. 

You will continue to Puebla, have free time for lunch and then take a tour of its historic center, considered a World Heritage Site by UNESCO and famous for its colonial architectural monuments. You will visit emblematic places such as the Cathedral, the Plaza de las Armas, the Callejón de los Sapos and the church of Santo Domingo. Return to Mexico City.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Puebla & Cholula visit - 10h - ENG | serviceDescription: Puebla & Cholula visit | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Mexico Area
Location: address: Ciudad de México, CDMX, México | locations: Mexico City

You will then get into the water with your instructor and put into practice what you have learnt, including kite control exercises and kite drags over the surface of the water on a board - an unmissable experience to enjoy in Holbox! unique_selling_points: ["Community-based ecotourism cooperative","Float through mangroves in crystalline waters","Visit to little-known archaeological site of Muyil","Traditional meal included"]
one_line_summary: Float through mangroves and explore Muyil in Sian Ka'an Biosphere Reserve
bussines_description:
Supplier: Community Tours Sian Ka’an
General Description: Title: Float in the Muyil Sian Ka'an Biosphere Reserve with transportation from Cancun. | Description: Today you will visit the Sian Ka'an Biosphere Reserve, which in Mayan means place where the sky is born. Your transportation will pick you up early to take you to the Muyil community center (approx. 2 hours from Cancun) where you will have a light snack and join a group of travelers and your local Spanish-speaking guide to begin the excursion which lasts approximately 5 hours. This community-based ecotourism cooperative focuses on the conservation and preservation of ecosystems by promoting unique experiences with a commitment to responsible tourism.

Your first stop will be at the little known and mysterious archaeological site of Muyil, which you will reach at the end of an interpretive trail surrounded by jungle. You will walk to the shore of the Chunyaxche lagoon and its wonderful turquoise color, where you will take a small boat to pass through a channel of crystalline waters with mangroves on each side, arriving at a small dock. From there, you will jump into the river, a relaxing experience in contact with nature! It is a moment of reconnection, as you float slowly through the channels you will feel the tranquility of your surroundings with the sounds of local birds and the gentle current of water that will make you live a unique moment. At the end, you will return to the community center walking along a trail. You will be welcomed with a traditional meal to complete the excursion. At the end of the tour, your transportation will take you back to Cancun.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Muyil Forest & Float - 10h - SPA | serviceDescription: Muyil Forest & Float | serviceType: Centro Ecoturístico | destinationName: Quintana Roo

General Description: Title: Live the experience of Swimming in a Cenote with Rapel | Description: Today you will dive into the waters of Nuevo Durango, where you will connect with nature and live a spiritual journey of 40 minutes with your local guide, who will take you to discover a beautiful cenote, the cenotes are unique natural formations of the Yucatan Peninsula, this particular one is approximately 20 meters deep and is only accessible by rappel so you will live an adventure. Before entering you will live a brief Mayan ritual to ask permission to enter, once in the cenote you can swim inside to cool off and admire the rock formations of the place.

one_line_summary: Explore the sacred Xcanahaltun Cenote with a guided Yucatán adventure
bussines_description:
Supplier: Ta Náayta
General Description: Title: Xcanahaltun Cenote in Yucatán | Description: Today, your local guide in English will take you on a one-hour tour through one of the semi-open cenotes of the region: le Xcanahaltun Cenote, which allowed ancient Maya to stock up on water as long as they were being developed and settled in Dzalbay village surroundings; in this cenote’s walls, you could look up to stalactites that have created capricious formations; in its cupola, you will find stalagmites abundance that has formed over the years. Enjoy greenish crystal waters reflected by the sunlight going through a hole at the top of the cenote. Besides histories about Yucatán’s real jewels, cenotes are natural pits filled with fresh water; the Maya civilization considered them sacred.

bussines_description:
Supplier: Uxmal Choco Story
General Description: Title: Guided tour of the Chocolate Museum near Uxmal | Description: The Chocolate Museum is located in the heart of Uxmal, and it is a true treasure for chocolate lovers. Your local Spanish-speaking guide will take you through the different sections of the museum, sharing stories about the Mayan relationship with chocolate. From the early Mesoamerican cultures to the present day, you will discover the secrets of chocolate production and its ritual and cultural significance. The interactive exhibits allow you to learn about the processes of cultivation, harvesting, and preparation of cacao. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to taste different types of chocolate, from traditional hot chocolate to chocolate bars with innovative flavors.

unique_selling_points: ["Only coral reefs in the Gulf of California","UNESCO World Heritage Site","Opportunity to see sea turtles and sea lions","Educational marine ecosystem conservation focus","Full-day guided snorkeling adventure"]
one_line_summary: Full-day snorkeling tour in Cabo Pulmo’s UNESCO-protected coral reefs
bussines_description:
Supplier: Cabo Pulmo Travel
General Description: Title: Cabo Pulmo snorkeling experience | Description: Today you will experience a snorkelling activity in Cabo Pulmo National Park for approximately 9 hours. Your Spanish-speaking guide will pick you up at your hotel in San Jose del Cabo to go, together with other fellow travellers, to this park where you will find the only reefs in the Gulf of California and Sea of Cortes, as well as a great diversity of species. Cabo Pulmo is a protected natural area designated as a UNESCO World Natural Heritage Site, important for the conservation of oceans and hard coral reefs. You will board a boat to begin your tour, where you will learn about marine life and the importance of ecosystem conservation. You will make different stops for snorkelling such as Las Navajas reef, where you will appreciate the white coral. You will also visit Chopitos and Carrizal, areas with shallow depths where you will have a better experience of observing the white and hard coral. In Carrizal you will have the chance to see sea turtles. With a bit of luck you will be able to visit the sea lion colony, sometimes they can be seen during mating season and, when the time is up, your experience will be over.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Snorkel - 9h - SPA | serviceDescription: Snorkel | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Baja California Sur
Location: address: Parque Nacional Cabo Pulmo, Domicilio Conocido, 23574 Cabo Pulmo, B.C.S. | locations: Cabo Pulmo

unique_selling_points: ["Nighttime wildlife observation in Bacalar lagoon","Kayak adventure with local guide","Evening to early morning experience"]
one_line_summary: Exciting nocturnal kayak adventure in Bacalar lagoon with wildlife observation
bussines_description:
Supplier: Ke Rico Bacalar
General Description: Title: The Adventurous Kayak in the San Felipe Lagoon | Description: Today, you will experience an exhilarating kayak adventure. In the afternoon, at 6:00 p.m., you will depart from the village of Bacalar with your Spanish-speaking local guide towards the San Felipe lagoon, located 30 minutes away. Upon arrival, kayaks will be prepared, and you will enjoy an appetiser including guacamole, tortilla chips, fried plantains, and your choice of juice or water. Then, for three hours, you will paddle in the lagoon in search of nocturnal wildlife, focusing on Morelet's crocodiles, birds, frogs, and turtles. After returning to the starting point, you will have another snack of sandwiches accompanied by a beer. The adventure continues with a one-hour walk to observe more nocturnal wildlife, such as tarantulas and snakes. Finally, you will return to Bacalar around 1:00 a.m., concluding this unique experience.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Adventurous kayak: crocodiles - 8h - SPA | serviceDescription: Adventurous kayak: crocodiles | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Quintana Roo
Location: address: Bacalar Lagoon, Quintana Roo, México | locations: Bacalar
