unique_selling_points: ["Visit to one of Mexico's most iconic archaeological sites","Climb the Pyramid of the Sun for panoramic views","Visit the Basilica of Our Lady of Guadalupe, a cultural and religious icon"]
one_line_summary: Explore Teotihuacan's pyramids and the Basilica of Guadalupe in a full-day cultural tour
bussines_description:
Supplier: Pablo Yuichi
General Description: Title: Visit of Teotihuacan and the Basilica of Guadalupe | Description: Today you will have a 6 hour experience to one of the most important archaeological sites in Mexico. Your local English speaking guide will pick you up and take you to Teotihuacan also known as The City of the Gods and recognized as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. You will walk along the famous Calzada de los Muertos and visit the most emblematic buildings such as the Palace of Quetzalpapalotl famous for its murals and pillars; the 42-meter high Pyramid of the Moon and the Pyramid of the Sun. To reach the top of the latter it is necessary to climb its 365 steps, one for each day of the year, from here you have a wonderful view of the archaeological site and the Valley of Teotihuacan. 

On the way back, you will visit the Basilica of Our Lady of Guadalupe which is the most visited Catholic temple in the world after the Vatican, the Basilica is an icon of the city and a must visit if you want to know the tradition of Mexican society today.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Teotihuacan Archaeological Site & La Basilica - 8h - ENG | serviceDescription: Teotihuacan Archaeological Site & La Basilica | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Mexico Area
Location: address: Ciudad de México, CDMX, México | locations: Mexico City

unique_selling_points: ["Aerial panoramic view of Teotihuacan","Combination of hot-air balloon and bike tour","Visit to artisan family home and obsidian craft demonstration","Tasting of pulque and xoconostle products"]
one_line_summary: Exciting hot-air balloon and bike tour exploring Teotihuacan's heritage and crafts
bussines_description:
Supplier: Teotihuacan en bici
General Description: Title: Hot-air balloon ride and guided bike tour in Teotihuacan | Description: Today you will meet at the meeting point with your Spanish-speaking local guide to begin your approximately 11-hour experience. Upon arrival, you will board a hot air balloon for a 40-minute ride to get a panoramic view of this emblematic place. The second part of the tour will be by bicycle, on a 10 km route, you will visit the route of the Murals, an ancient natural observatory and the impressive views of the City of the Gods. You will close your day with a visit to the home of a family of artisans, where you will learn more about the process of obsidian and how it is transformed into handicrafts. You will also have a tasting of pulque and products derived from xoconostle, a cactus fruit very representative of the area. At the end of the designated time, you will enjoy a local lunch and your experience will be over.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Balloon flight & biking tour - 9h - SPA | serviceDescription: Balloon flight & biking tour | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Estado de Mexico
Location: address: Teotihuacan, Méx., México | locations: Teotihuacan, Mexico City

unique_selling_points: ["Immersive local family interaction","Authentic regional dishes","Cultural exchange in Chiapas","Opportunity to learn about local traditions"]
one_line_summary: Authentic dinner with a local Chiapas family, rich in regional tradition
bussines_description:
Supplier: Cinco Lagos
General Description: Title: Dinner with a local family in the community of San Nicolas, Chiapas | Description: Today, you will experience an immersive dinner with a local family in the community of San Nicolás. Your local guide will accompany you from the Cinco Lagos cabins to the community, which will take approximately 25 minutes by transportation. During the journey, you will have the opportunity to observe how communities in this region of Chiapas live.

Upon arrival, you will be greeted by your host in the kitchen, where you will find the table set and ready to serve you a traditional regional dinner, such as chicken broth, mole with rice, or mole tamales, depending on the season. You can accompany your dinner with beans, tortillas, fresh cheese, sauces, and a cup of locally sourced coffee. However, the most important aspect will be the interaction with the family. Take the opportunity to chat with each member, ask them about the region and the dishes. They will be delighted to share with you. Once you have finished dinner and expressed gratitude, you will return to the cabins.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Meal with community family - 1.5h - SPA | serviceDescription: Meal with community family | serviceType: Centro Ecoturístico | destinationName: Chiapas
Location: address: Cabañas Cinco Lagos, La Trinitaria, Chis., México | locations: Lagos de Montebello

unique_selling_points: ["Operated by local Mayan families","Multiple access options: stairs and jumping platform","Crystal-clear waters with sun sparkle","Authentic eco-tourism experience"]
one_line_summary: Explore crystal-clear waters of Cenote Esmeralda with local Mayan stewardship
bussines_description:
Supplier: Nuevo Durango
General Description: Title: Dive into the crystal clear waters of Cenote Esmeralda in Nuevo Durango | Description: Today, you will have an adventure at Cenote Esmeralda in the community of Nuevo Durango. You will meet your Spanish-speaking guide at the established point for the visit.  The cenote is named for the crystalline color of its waters, which sparkle in the sun. Access to the cenote is easy, with two options available: stairs for those who prefer a gentler entrance, and the option to jump into the water from an elevated platform for those looking for a more adventurous experience. In addition, this cenote is operated by a cooperative made up of eight Mayan families, who care for and preserve it in an exceptional way. Once inside the cenote, you can take as much time as you wish to relax and enjoy the natural beauty that surrounds you. At the end of the activity, you can return to your hotel.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Cenote Esmeralda - 1h - SPA | serviceDescription: Cenote Esmeralda | serviceType: Centro Ecoturístico | destinationName: Quintana Roo
Location: address: Cabañas Nuevo Durango | locations: Nuevo Durango

unique_selling_points: ["Scenic river hike with endemic wildlife","Water crossing adventure","Natural landscape observation"]
one_line_summary: Thrilling river hike with wildlife and water crossing in Chiapas
bussines_description:
Supplier: Hotel Argovia Finca Resort
General Description: Title: Hiking along The River | Description: Today, you will live an experience lasting approximately 2 hours and 30 minutes, embarking on a 6 km walk. The departure will be from the hotel reception to start this adventure, accompanied by a group of travellers and your local guide who speaks Spanish. During the journey, you will have to circle a water intake, but before arriving, you will have the opportunity to observe natural landscapes with lush vegetation typical of the region. If you are lucky, you might spot endemic species such as deer, armadillos, and birds, including toucans and quetzals. Your guide will provide detailed information about these.

Subsequently, you will arrive at the Cuilco pool, where you can swim and relax after the journey. Once the set time has elapsed, you will return to the hotel, not before crossing a river, either by swimming or jumping over stones. Undoubtedly, it will be an adventure-filled experience.

Note: This experience has restrictions for minors and for people who do not have good physical condition.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Hiking to El Río - 2.5h - SPA | serviceDescription: Hiking to El Río | serviceType: Alojamiento, Operadora local | destinationName: Chiapas

unique_selling_points: ["Opportunity to spot jaguars and other wildlife","Guided jungle experience with flora and fauna explanations","Proximity to hotel for convenience"]
one_line_summary: Guided jungle hike in Chiapas with wildlife sightings and nature insights
bussines_description:
Supplier: Canto de la Selva
General Description: Title: Hiking through the jungle: Jaguar Trail | Description: Today you will experience the Jaguar trail through the jungle surrounding Canto de la Selva hotel. The tour lasts for 1 hour and 30 minutes and starts just a few meters from the hotel. Your Spanish-speaking guide will be waiting for you at the reception and will lead the group. This trail used to be a circuit, but due to the change in course of the Lacantún River, it also disrupted the path of the trail. Therefore, you will reach the Lacantún River, where if you are very observant, you may spot animal footprints as they come down from the jungle to drink water, and then you will return along the same path.

During the tour, you will have the opportunity to listen to the sounds of the jungle. Your guide will provide explanations about the jungle"s flora, such as pacaya, cedar trees, the king tree, the mythical ceiba, among many others. Pay attention, as you may hear the howling of monkeys and see some macaws. This trail is named Jaguar because a jaguar has been observed on the camera traps. After completing the tour, you will return to the hotel.

Note: During the rainy season, it is more likely to observe wildlife, but the presence of mosquitoes also increases.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Jaguar Trail - 3h - SPA | serviceDescription: Jaguar Trail | serviceType: Centro Ecoturístico | destinationName: Chiapas

unique_selling_points: ["Community-based ecotourism experience","Floating in crystalline waters amidst mangroves","Visit to a little-known archaeological site"]
one_line_summary: Float through mangroves and explore Muyil's hidden archaeological site in Sian Ka'an
bussines_description:
Supplier: Community Tours Sian Ka’an
General Description: Title: Float in the Muyil Sian Ka'an Biosphere Reserve | Description: Today you will visit the Sian Ka'an Biosphere Reserve, which in Mayan means place where the sky is born. Your transportation will pick you up early to take you to the Muyil community center (approx. 1 hour 40 minutes from Puerto Morelos) where you will have a light snack and join a group of travelers and your local Spanish-speaking guide to begin the excursion which lasts approximately 5 hours. This community-based ecotourism cooperative focuses on the conservation and preservation of ecosystems by promoting unique experiences with a commitment to responsible tourism.

Your first stop will be at the little known and mysterious archaeological site of Muyil, which you will reach at the end of an interpretative trail surrounded by jungle. You will walk to the shore of the Chunyaxche lagoon and its wonderful turquoise color, where you will take a small boat to pass through a channel of crystalline waters with mangroves on each side, arriving at a small dock. From there, you will jump into the river, a relaxing experience in contact with nature! It is a moment of reconnection, as you float slowly through the channels you will feel the tranquility of your surroundings with the sounds of local birds and the gentle current of water that will make you live a unique moment. At the end, you will return to the community center walking along a trail. You will be welcomed with a traditional meal to complete the excursion. At the end of the tour, your transportation will take you back to Puerto Morelos.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Muyil Forest & Float - 10h - SPA | serviceDescription: Muyil Forest & Float | serviceType: Centro Ecoturístico | destinationName: Quintana Roo
Location: address: Community tours Sian Ka'an Muyil, Chunyaxché, Quintana Roo, México | locations: Tulum

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to traditional villages along historic route","Hands-on artisanal process of jipi hat making","Experience colonial architecture and local rituals","Taste of regional artisanal bread","Cultural immersion in Campeche area"]
one_line_summary: Explore Campeche's cultural villages and artisanal crafts along the historic Camino Real route.
bussines_description:
Supplier: El Tucan Tours
General Description: Title: Crafts and culture on the Camino Real Artisan"s Route. | Description: Accompanied by your local guide in Spanish, the transportation will take you to visit part of the path that was once traced by the Spaniards to join the cities of Merida and Campeche in approximately 5 hours. Several villages developed here that preserve their culture through rituals and handicrafts. You will start with Hecelchakan where you can enjoy a typical breakfast of the region (not included), a place that is known for its cultural history, besides hosting archaeological and cultural sites, such as the Church of San Francisco de Asis which is an example of colonial architecture. You will continue to Becal to learn about the artisanal process of the jipi hats made from the fibers of the jipijapa plant, you can also appreciate the traditional embroidered clothing of Dzidbalche and taste the artisanal bread of Pomuch as well as visit its cemetery. At the end of the tour, your transportation will take you to your hotel.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Camino Real Artisanal Route - 7h - SPA | serviceDescription: Camino Real Artisanal Route | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Campeche Area

unique_selling_points: ["Observation of diverse marine fauna including manta rays and turtles","Visit to sunken ships on seabed","Includes transportation from Bacalar to Mahahual","Ideal for family and group adventure","Opportunity to enjoy local food after snorkeling"]
one_line_summary: 7-hour snorkeling adventure in Mahahual's turquoise waters with marine fauna
bussines_description:
Supplier: Bacalar Escape
General Description: Title: Snorkeling in Mahahual's turquoise water | Description: Today, you will join a group of travelers for a 7 hr experience in Mahahual, located 1 hr and 20 min from Bacalar. Your Spanish speaking guide will pick you up at your hotel and take you to this small fishing village that has gentle waves ideal for swimming and snorkeling, the turquoise water allows you to observe some of the fauna of this place such as manta rays, eels, turtles and even some sunken ships lying on the seabed. Upon arrival you will be provided with the necessary equipment to snorkel and appreciate the marine life for approximately 1hr 20 min. Afterwards you will have free time to enjoy the beach and taste the local food. Finally, transportation will take you back to your hotel.
Note: Lunch is not included.

This trail, with an extensive network of 100 km of historical and natural trails, will immerse you in the beauty and culture of the Yucatan, either through hiking or cross country biking. You"ll start by choosing your starting point, whether it"s a hacienda, a Mayan village or a cenote. You will then meet your Spanish-speaking guide at the designated meeting point, where you will receive a brief introduction to the history of your chosen location, as well as the necessary instructions for the journey. You will begin your journey along the ancient trails to your final destination, where you will have the opportunity to explore the cenotes. Afterwards, at an Ecotourism Centre or Hacienda, you will be able to relax in the middle of nature or in the swimming pools, while enjoying the local food. At the end, transportation will take you back to the initial meeting point.

You will meet your Spanish-speaking local guide at the designated meeting point to begin the tour. The experience will start with a Mayan welcome ceremony, a unique moment to connect with the local culture. Afterwards, you will explore the reserve, home to the charming spider monkeys, observing them as you stroll along nature-filled trails. You will also enjoy kayaking on the serene lagoon and have the opportunity to refresh yourself in a crystal-clear cenote. Once the allotted time has concluded, you will return to the meeting point, bringing this remarkable experience to a close.

This ancestral ritual dates back to pre-Hispanic times in Mexico before the conquest and was performed by different Mesoamerican cultures. The experience lasts approximately 3 hours, where in an enclosed structure hot stones are placed to heat the place and generate steam as well as medicinal herbs. It is a medicinal and spiritual process that helps relaxation, and allows moments of introspection and reflection, purifying thoughts and regenerating the mind.

If you are lucky enough, you will hear the local birds known as the chuínes along with the anecdotes of old exploits that occurred in the Camino Real Tierra Adentro. The importance of local communities' hard-working, soil restoration, reforestation, and forest care will be the main topic of this walking tour.

one_line_summary: Thrilling canyoning adventure through waterfalls and lush forests in Chiapas
bussines_description:
Supplier: Las 3 Tzimoleras
General Description: Title: Escapadita Tour - Adventure and Adrenaline at the 3 Tzimoleras | Description: Your thrilling adventure begins early in the morning at the center of Tzimol, where you will meet your local Spanish-speaking guide. Here, you will receive instructions and the necessary equipment for today's experience. You will board a pick-up vehicle and embark on a scenic journey through the mountains and hills of this region. For approximately forty minutes, you will enjoy views of the sugarcane fields and the La Angostura Dam on the horizon.

Upon arrival, you will walk approximately 400 meters along a trail to reach the riverbank. Your guide will lead you from the tranquility and beauty of the forest to experience the exhilarating combinations of emotions at the first and second waterfalls. Here, you can go canyoning, which includes walking, swimming, jumping into the water, and exploring the river. Get ready for adrenaline-filled moments with jumps ranging from half a meter to 7 meters high! If you prefer something more relaxed, you can also rest in the shade and enjoy the sounds of the forest and waterfalls. You will enjoy a full day of adventure, with an approximate duration of five hours, where you can relax, marvel at the surrounding natural beauty, and immerse yourself in the tranquility of the environment. At the end of the experience, you can delight in local snacks before returning to Tzimol.

bussines_description:
Supplier: Blue Beach Surf School
General Description: Title: Whale watching tour in Puerto Escondido | Description: Today, you will have the opportunity to embark on an early three-hour tour to see whales and, on occasion, dolphins in their natural habitat. Your guide will pick you up and take you to Manzanillo Beach, where the boat departs to search for these enigmatic animals. During the tour, your guide will tell you all about the grey whale and its migration before heading out to find them. It is important to note that seeing whales cannot be guaranteed as they are free animals, and we cannot control nature, but in most cases, it is possible to see them. At the end of the tour, your guide will leave you on the beach so you can go your own way.

one_line_summary: Discover Campeche's rich history and colonial charm on a guided city walk
bussines_description:
Supplier: El Tucan Tours
General Description: Title: Walking tour through the Walled City of Campeche | Description: Today, you will meet with your local Spanish-speaking guide to explore the historic center of San Francisco de Campeche, one of Mexico's World Heritage cities. Let yourself be inspired by its seaside skyline and colorful colonial facades.

Campeche existed within walls. During an approximately 3-hour tour, you will walk along a part of these walls. You will visit the pier, the Puerta de Tierra, the reconstructed Puerta de Mar, a museum, and three popular neighborhoods, all while learning about the fascinating history of this city. Discover the tales of pirate attacks, the English conquest attempts, and the Spanish colonization. This will help you understand the influence of a cultural blend, both pre-Hispanic and colonial, that is experienced in the daily life of the city.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: San Francisco de Campeche City Tour - 3h - SPA | serviceDescription: San Francisco de Campeche City Tour | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Campeche Area

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to the oldest inhabited city in America","Over 365 churches, one for each day of the year","Climb to the Sanctuary of Our Lady of Remedies with panoramic views","Visit to two of Mexico's most beautiful baroque churches"]
one_line_summary: Explore Cholula's rich history, stunning churches, and panoramic views in this full-day guided tour
bussines_description:
Supplier: Puebla de ensueño
General Description: Title: Walking tour of the magical town of Cholula | Description: You will meet your local English speaking guide to get to know the magical town of Cholula, the oldest city in America inhabited without interruption since its origins and known as the city of churches. According to legend, it has more than 365 churches, one for each day of the year. 

Your first stop will be the Cholula Site Museum, where you will learn about the pre-Hispanic history of the site through its tunnels and the Great Main Basement, which today is completely covered. Afterwards, you will climb to the top of this settlement to visit the famous Sanctuary of Our Lady of Remedies and appreciate its baroque-style architecture and decoration, as well as enjoy beautiful views of the city. You will have free time for lunch to finally visit two jewels of baroque in Mexico: Churches of Santa Maria Tonantzintla and San Francisco Acatepec.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Cholula City Tour - 5h - ENG | serviceDescription: Cholula City Tour | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Puebla Area

In the company of your local Spanish-speaking guide, you will start by visiting Cerro de San Basilio, where you can admire colonial-era monuments such as the La Marinera church and the Fort of San Blas. You will then take a boat ride through the La Tovara mangroves, and if you wish, you will have the opportunity to swim in its freshwater. After the boat ride, you will visit Matanchen Bay to enjoy a seafood meal. To conclude the tour, you will visit a banana bread bakery before returning to Puerto Vallarta.

unique_selling_points: ["Authentic Zapotec rural cooking experience","Interaction with local women chefs","Preparation of traditional dishes using traditional methods","Visit to local markets for ingredient selection"]
one_line_summary: Participate in an authentic Zapotec rural cooking workshop in Oaxaca, learning traditional recipes.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Etnoturística
General Description: Title: Rural cooking workshop in Oaxaca | Description: Today, your English-speaking guide will pick you up to take you to a Rural Cooking Workshop that lasts approximately 6 hours. You will have the opportunity to visit Teotitlán del Valle or Santa Ana del Valle, depending on the availability of the local cooks. These communities are part of the Zapotec community in the Oaxaca Valley. During your visit, you will meet with the comideras in the local market. These women are recognized for their culinary knowledge and skills and are responsible for preparing feasts for community celebrations. They have earned prestige for their cooking expertise. You will learn about selecting and buying local products that will be used to prepare the dishes.


 Afterwards, you will go to their home to enjoy their cooking, where you will participate in the preparation of their most traditional dishes, which consist of a soup, either chepil boiled soup, milpa soup, pumpkin leaf soup or chickpea soup, a green mole with pumpkin seed, a dessert (apples or tejocotes in sweet, chocolate tamale) and a drink (coffee or chocolate) all made by hand, to firewood stove, metate and a molcajete. Finally, you will delight your palate with the prepared delicacies.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Rural cooking workshop - 5h - ENG | serviceDescription: Rural cooking workshop | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Oaxaca
Location: address: Oaxaca, Centro, Oaxaca de Juárez, Oaxaca, México | locations: Oaxaca de Juárez

bussines_description:
Supplier: Mezcouting
General Description: Title: Chocolate making in Mitla, Oaxaca | Description: Today, your local guide in English will take you to breakfast regional dishes in Tule and briefly visit Tule’s tree. You will learn from a female cook who specializes in the cocoa art how to prepare traditional chocolate from the very beginning; you will roast, grind, and transform the cocoa into bars with which you could prepare hot chocolate; besides this, you could also taste Mitla’s chocolate de agua blanca (white water hot chocolate). After this activity, you will taste many dishes with a traditional mezcal selection. Next, you will visit a local chronologist and antiquarian who will teach you about regional mezcals history; besides, you will have access to his black clay jugs, demijohns, and former glass carboys. To finish this experience of approximately nine hours, you will visit Mitla’s ruins (entrance fee included).

one_line_summary: Kayaking adventure through Holbox's vital mangrove ecosystems with wildlife viewing.
bussines_description:
Supplier: VIP Holbox
General Description: Title: Kayaking in the mangroves of Holbox Island | Description: Today you will enjoy a fun shared kayak tour of approximately 3 hours to visit the mangrove system of Holbox, best known for being an ecosystem of vital importance to the environment, which are home to many species and contribute to mitigate the effects of climate change by being able to absorb and store CO2 in their roots. 

You will meet your local Spanish-speaking guide and a group of travelers on a beach in Holbox, here you will get into your kayak and start paddling a few meters in the sea in two stages of 45 minutes each, until you reach the entrance of the Kuká River. In the river, you can already feel the difference in the density of the water and the change of air. Paddling here is usually quite easy. During the experience your guide will give you tips and explain about this ecosystem while you enjoy an incredible view, beautiful landscapes and the flora and fauna that inhabit each one, including flamingos, fish, birds and possibly even crocodiles. Finally you will return to the beach where this experience ends.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Mangrove Kayaking - 2h - SPA | serviceDescription: Mangrove Kayaking | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Quintana Roo

unique_selling_points: ["Close encounter with sea lions at San Rafaelito","Snorkeling with potential dolphin sightings","Panoramic views from Balandra Hill"]
one_line_summary: Explore Balandra and San Rafaelito with snorkeling, birdwatching, and scenic views in Baja.
bussines_description:
Supplier: IES Travel
General Description: Title: Visit Balandra and San Rafaelito in Baja California Sur | Description: Today, your local guide in Spanish will wait for you at the meeting point to join a group of travelers and leave on a boat from the dock of La Paz city towards the Balandra Beaches, just twenty-five minutes north of it. You will travel around the bay until your first stop, Gaviota Island, where you will appreciate different bird species, of which you will listen to a brief informative speech. Next, you will visit a small colony of sea lions called San Rafaelito, where you can practice snorkeling; hopefully, you will swim closely with a sea lion.

Thirty minutes later, you will reach Balandra Beach, where you will settle in and have a snack; you will have time to relax, swim, nap, or contemplate the landscape. If you wish, on top of a hill, you can walk up a path to admire this site’s panoramic view. Finally, you will board the boat and return to La Paz city to finish this experience of approximately five hours; hopefully, you will see some dolphins swimming in freedom on your return journey.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Balandra and San Rafaelito - 5h - SPA | serviceDescription: Balandra and San Rafaelito | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Baja California Sur

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to historic railway station turned cultural center","Photographic spot at Quetzalcóatl's stairs referencing D. H. Lawrence","Stroll along iconic 'love' pier and lighthouse","Charming cobbled streets and adobe architecture in Ajijic","Artistic murals by local painters"]
one_line_summary: Cultural lakeside tour exploring Chapala and Ajijic's historic and artistic gems
bussines_description:
Supplier: Sensaciones Turísticas
General Description: Title: Exploring Lakeside Treasures | Description: Today, you will live a cultural experience lasting approximately 6 hours, beginning this adventure in Chapala, which owes its name to the lake that surrounds it. Here, alongside your Spanish-speaking local guide, you will explore its streets and discover its most representative places. Among them are the old railway station, now transformed into a site museum and cultural centre, as well as the Quetzalcóatl's stairs, a perfect spot for photographs that references the time when the writer D. H. Lawrence wrote the first draft of his novel 'The Plumed Serpent'. You will also visit the old Nido Hotel, now housing the municipal presidency, and walk along its promenade until you reach the iconic 'love' pier, which you will stroll along to the lighthouse, a witness to the era when steamboats sailed the lake.

From Chapala, you will move to the charming Magic Town of Ajijic, whose name in Nahuatl means 'Place where the water springs'. This village will captivate you with its picturesque cobbled streets and adobe architecture. You will be able to see its main square and the murals that decorate the facades of houses, shops, and galleries, made by various painters who are part of the local artistic community. Of course, you will enjoy a pleasant walk along its boardwalk, where the view of the lake and the Sierra will leave you breathless, thus concluding this experience.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Ajijic and Chapala riverside route - 6h - SPA | serviceDescription: Ajijic and Chapala riverside route | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Jalisco
Location: address: Guadalajara, Jalisco, México | locations: Guadalajara

unique_selling_points: ["Authentic Day of the Dead preparations with local families","Participation in altar creation and grave decoration","Visit to traditional bakery for pan de muerto","Deep cultural immersion in Oaxaca's traditions"]
one_line_summary: Experience authentic Day of the Dead traditions with local families in Oaxaca.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Etnoturística
General Description: Title: Day of the Dead: Preparations for the Celebration, October 31st | Description: Today, you will live a 13-hour experience to get a closer look at the celebration of the Day of the Dead. Alongside fellow travellers and your local English-speaking guide, you will gather at the meeting point to take transportation and embark on this day full of activities. The first stop will be at the marketplace, where you will buy all the necessary items to create the traditional altar of the dead. On this altar, food, fruit, drinks, and objects that the person who is no longer with us enjoyed in life are placed. After the shopping is done, you will head towards Tlalixtac to set up the altar in the home of a rural family. Furthermore, you will also visit a bakery here to witness the process of making the pan de muerto, a bread that is only sold during these dates.

Once the altar is set up, you will have time to enjoy a traditional festive meal. Later, you will have free time to explore the community. In the afternoon, you will gather with the group and your guide to make your way to Xoxocotlán. There, you will witness the cleaning and decoration of the graves by the people. This is done in order to invite their deceased loved ones to take part in the festivities. Your guide will provide you with candles and flowers that you can place with all the respect that this ceremony deserves on a grave of your choice.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Day 1 October 31: Day of the dead - 10h - ENG | serviceDescription: Day 1 October 31: Day of the dead | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Oaxaca
Location: address: Oaxaca, Centro, Oaxaca de Juárez, Oaxaca, México | locations: Oaxaca de Juárez

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to Mexico's premier anthropology museum","Explore historic Chapultepec Castle with murals and artifacts","Breathtaking views of Chapultepec Forest","Insight into Mexico's social, religious, and political history"]
one_line_summary: Comprehensive cultural tour of Mexico City’s top historic sites with expert guide
bussines_description:
Supplier: Paola Parra
General Description: Title: A cultural tour of Mexico: Anthropology Museum and Chapultepec Castle | Description: Today you will embark on a 7 hour and 30 minute journey through Mexico's history, starting with the service of an Spanish-speaking guide who will pick you up from your hotel. Your first stop will be the renowned Museum of Anthropology, a cultural icon inaugurated in the 1960s, where you will witness a vast collection of artefacts and sculptures that tell the stories of Mexico's pre-Hispanic civilisations. Admire key pieces such as the Aztec Calendar and the Mask of Pakal.
After a lunch break, where you will receive culinary recommendations from your guide, you will continue to Chapultepec Castle. This historic site houses murals, photographs, documents, jewellery and furniture recounting significant episodes from the Conquest to the Mexican Revolution. As you explore the castle's halls, you will discover the daily life and social, religious and political dynamics that have shaped Mexico's various historical periods. You will also enjoy the breathtaking views of Chapultepec Forest and gain an understanding of its importance and structure. At the end of your cultural journey, transportation will take you back to your hotel.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Tour Museum of Anthropology and Chapultepec Museum - SPA | serviceDescription: Tour Museum of Anthropology and Chapultepec Museum | serviceType: Guía | destinationName: Mexico Area
Location: address: Ciudad de México, CDMX, México | locations: Mexico City

unique_selling_points: ["Luxury catamaran tour in Bacalar","Visit to Stromatolites and mangroves","Snorkeling at Pirate Canal and Cenote Esmeralda","Bird sanctuary observation","Scenic navigation through Black Cenote"]
one_line_summary: Luxury catamaran tour exploring Bacalar's cenotes, stromatolites, and wildlife
bussines_description:
Supplier: Veleando Ando
General Description: Title: Bacalar cenotes in a catamaran stilleto in Quintana Roo | Description: Today, your local guide in Spanish will wait for you at the meeting point to go on a tour of approximately four hours, where you will board a catamaran-type sailboat for two or up to eight people that will lead you to the south of Lake Bacalar and enjoy snacks and fruit water or beer. During your trip, you will connect with nature, observe and learn about stromatolites and the mangrove importance, and swim in the turquoise blue waters of Lake Bacalar. Next, you will visit The Pirate Canal, where you can swim and practice snorkeling; you will navigate through the Witch’s Cenote, also known as Black Cenote, to dive into the waters and enjoy the different colors of the depths. Besides, you will learn about Bird Island, a place locally declared as a sanctuary, where you will observe birds and the different colors of Lake Bacalar. Finally, you will go deeper into the Cenote Esmeralda, an outstanding beauty area where crystal and clean water flow into the lake.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Catamaran Stilleto 27 ft Premium Tour - 4h - SPA | serviceDescription: Catamaran Stilleto 27 ft Premium Tour | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Quintana Roo
Location: address: Veleando Ando, Carretera Federal 307, Bacalar, Quintana Roo, México | locations: Bacalar

one_line_summary: Explore the Mayan wonders of Kabah and Uxmal with expert guidance.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Kankabi'ok Tours
General Description: Title: Visiting Kabah and Uxmal cities | Description: Today, your local guide in English will pick you up to join a group of travelers and take you to an activity of approximately ten hours and a half. You will visit the Puuc routes used by the Mayan people to connect the cities of the Yucatán peninsula and the Kabah city, where your guide will explain the city’s secrets and the buildings’ function. Finally, before eating and taking your return transportation to Campeche, you will go to Uxmal, a city where the Mayan people reached an exceptional architectural level.

one_line_summary: Explore Mexico City's historic center with a guided 4-hour walking tour including transportation.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Pablo Yuichi
General Description: Title: Walking tour of the historic center of Mexico City (with transportation) | Description: Today your local guide will pick you up for a walking tour of approximately 4 hours through the historic center of Mexico City, one of the largest and most emblematic in Latin America. You will start at the Alameda Park to see the majestic Fine Arts Museum, a symbol of the Porfirio Diaz era. You will continue along the pedestrian street of Madero where you will see outside the Palacio de Minería and the National Museum of Art, until you reach the Plaza de la Constitución or known as Zócalo, the most important square in Mexico, here you can see the Cathedral of Mexico and the National Palace to finish in the Plaza de Santo Domingo.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Ruta Centro Histórico - 4 h - ENG | serviceDescription: Ruta Centro Histórico | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Mexico Area
Location: address: Ciudad de México, CDMX, México | locations: Mexico City

unique_selling_points: ["Exploration of the Yucatán cenotes ring by bicycle","Immersive nature experience in ancient cenotes","Authentic local cuisine included"]
one_line_summary: 8-hour bicycle tour exploring Yucatán's stunning cenotes of Homún
bussines_description:
Supplier: Ecoturismo Yucatán
General Description: Title: Discovering the cenotes of Homun by bicycle | Description: Today, you will embark on an approximately 8-hour bicycle tour from Telchaquillo to Chunkanán, where you will discover the beauty of a part of the Yucatán cenotes ring, the cenotes of Homún. You will meet your Spanish-speaking guide at the meeting point to equip yourself with safety helmets and receive some instructions before starting this bicycle adventure towards the three cenotes.

During the journey, you can enjoy the fresh breeze as you immerse yourself in the region's nature. Once you reach the cenotes, you will be amazed by the view and can immerse yourself in their refreshing waters. If you prefer, you can also request life vests to feel even safer and more relaxed as you explore the crystal-clear waters of the cenotes. The experience of swimming in these ancient natural wells is truly magical. Furthermore, to recharge your energy, you will be offered a meal that will allow you to savor the local cuisine. The experience will conclude after the meal.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Bike tour in Telchaquillo with cenotes in Homun - 8h - SPA | serviceDescription: Bike tour in Telchaquillo with cenotes in Homun | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Yucatan
Location: locations: Mérida

unique_selling_points: ["Traditional marigold flower and Day of the Dead symbolism","Chinampa farming demonstration by local farmer","Scenic canal navigation in Xochimilco"]
one_line_summary: Discover marigold cultivation and local flavors in Xochimilco's scenic canals
bussines_description:
Supplier: OlinTlalli
General Description: Title: Cempasúchitl flower with tasting | Description: Today, you will embark on a tour lasting approximately 3 hours in Xochimilco. You will meet with a Spanish-speaking local guide at the meeting point, from where you will board a motor-equipped trajinera to navigate for 15 minutes along some of the canals of the Xochimilco Ecological Reserve. Throughout this journey, you will have the opportunity to admire a wide diversity of birds and the distinctive landscape of the chinampas. Despite the briefness of the tour, the guide will share interesting facts about the place with you. Upon arriving at the chinampa, you will be greeted with a breakfast made with marigold petals. Subsequently, a chinampero (a chinampa farmer) will explain to you the ancestral technique he uses to cultivate a wide variety of flowers and vegetables. He will place special emphasis on the cultivation of the marigold, also known as the Flower of the Dead, an emblematic plant used on Day of the Dead altars to guide the deceased to their family"s offerings. You will take a walk through the different types of crops until concluding by cutting a bouquet of marigold flowers. The experience concludes by returning to the starting point.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Cempasúchitl flower and local gastronomy - 2h - SPA | serviceDescription: Cempasúchitl flower and local gastronomy | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Mexico Area
Location: address: Xochimilco, CDMX, México | locations: Mexico City

The local population preserves its cultural traditions and has deep roots in rural life. Before you begin your journey to Cuajimoloyas community and start your walk through the forest to learn a little about this place’s vegetation, you will eat and drink something.

one_line_summary: Educational Maya jungle tour with stories, nature, and local legends in Yucatan
bussines_description:
Supplier: Ta Náayta
General Description: Title: Interpretive senderism, Xcanahaltún & bees | Description: Today, your local guide in English will take you on a tour of approximately two hours through the Maya jungle as long as you listen to a speech about different types of trees and medicinal plants that you will find around you; as well as a speech about the regional birds if you have the chance to see them in your way to a dead cenote or “rejollada”; a cavity that looks like a cenote. Next, you will listen to Mayan stories about the Alux, a mythical entity that steals bright objects, candies, tobacco, and livestock; simultaneously, it makes all kinds of mischief. You will also learn about Yuum Balam’s history, the keeper of milpas, mountains, and lands.

one_line_summary: Experience the sacred Maya cenote of Yokdzonot with nature, culture, and cuisine
bussines_description:
Supplier: Cenote Yokdzonot
General Description: Title: The Mayan cenote of Yokdzonot: A unique connection between nature and culture | Description: Today, you will experience a unique moment of leisure at one of Yucatán|s most authentic cenotes: Yokdzonot Cenote. This place, where nature, culture, and spirituality intertwine in a unique way, is considered sacred by the Maya culture. In 2005, it was transformed into an ecological tourist site by a group of women from the rural community of Yokdzonot.

During your visit to the cenote, you will enjoy a three-course meal included in your experience. You are free to decide how to organise your time here, whether to return to your hotel or continue on your journey.

bussines_description:
Supplier: Mun Ha Chac Lol
General Description: Title: Mayan astronomy in Mun-Ha, Yucatán | Description: Today, your local guide in English will wait for you at the meeting point to go on a historical tour of approximately one hour and a half through the ancient Mayan civilization in Mun-Ha to learn about its astronomy, a millenary tradition with such vital importance in the material and spiritual life development shared by the other Mesoamerican societies. Thanks to a specialist, you will learn more about this topic in an interactive speech, allowing you to immerse yourself in the astronomic knowledge of the Mayan priest class, which guided citizens’ lives according to its predictions. Finally, you could learn about the Mayan calendar and its importance in this millenary culture’s day-to-day basis.

one_line_summary: Experience the vibrant Day of the Dead at Mercado Jamaica with food, flowers, and folk art
bussines_description:
Supplier: Eat México
General Description: Title: The Day of the Dead in Mexico’s City Jamaica Market | Description: Today, your local guide in Spanish will wait for you at the meeting point to join a group of travelers and go on a tour of approximately three hours and a half through Mexico City’s Jamaica Market — the top local destination for anyone seeking Day of the Dead flowers, food, crafts, and some of the best antojitos (little cravings) in the city. Learn about this unique cultural holiday and the food that goes with it; if you’re in Mexico City for this festivity, you must visit the Jamaica Market, whose aisles overflow with orange marigolds and red velvets, all destined for ofrendas around the city. You will stroll them when they have a bounty of food, flowers, and folk art — picture sugar skulls, papel picado, and tiny skeleton figurines, all designed especially for the Day of the Dead. Finally, you will know the significance of ofrendas and everything you need to make one; you will eat tacos, tlacoyos, tamales, atole, and more during this experience.

bussines_description:
Supplier: San Miguel Music Tours
General Description: Title: A musical tour through San Miguel de Allende streets | Description: Today, your local guide in Spanish will wait for you at the meeting point to join a group of travelers and go on a walking tour of approximately three hours through the hidden jewels of San Miguel de Allende. You will start in an outdoor cafe to listen to Mexican folk songs, anecdotes, legends, and a little bit of the history of this place. Next, you will visit the 'La Aurora' factory, one of the biggest art and design centers in Latin America, where you can appreciate various art styles. Afterward, you'll stroll through nature along a stream, observing plants, pathways, and charming narrow streets, and visit a handicrafts market. Finally, you'll delight in a gourmet meal, drinks, and music entertainment.

bussines_description:
Supplier: Primitivo Noh Caamal

You will meet your Spanish-speaking guide at the meeting point from where you will set off on a hike along ascending trails to The Dragon"s Cave, a spectacular karst formation where limestone rocks are chemically transformed on contact with water, creating stalactites and stalagmites. After the exploration, you will have the opportunity to rest in a clearing, soaking up the tranquillity of the surroundings, before returning to the park to enjoy a moment of relaxation by the river, accompanied by local coffee and French bread. At the end of this adventure, you will return to the initial meeting point.

This reef is home to an impressive diversity of marine life, including over 65 species of stony coral, 350 species of molluscs and over 500 types of fish. It is also a vital refuge for endangered species such as the manatee, sea turtle, horn coral, black reef and queen conch.

bussines_description:
Supplier: Pablo Yuichi
General Description: Title: Walk through the bohemian neighborhood of Coyoacan with a visit to the Casa Azul. | Description: Your Spanish-speaking guide will pick you up for a 5-hour experience in the southern part of Mexico City. Your first stop will be the bohemian neighborhood of Coyoacan, one of the most picturesque in the city and characterized by its cobblestone streets and colonial architecture. During your tour you will see churches, squares and beautiful gardens. We suggest you taste the typical desserts of the neighborhood, such as the delicious churros and ice cream. Finally you will visit the Casa Azul, a space dedicated to the Mexican painter Frida Kahlo, you will see paintings, photographs and personal objects that belonged to her and her partner Diego Rivera, as well as her studio, kitchen, bedroom and, of course, the beautiful courtyard garden.
* No outside guides are allowed at the Casa Azul/Museo Frida Kahlo if you would like a guided tour, you will need to hire a guide at the entrance (not included).

You will meet your Spanish-speaking guide and other travellers at the meeting point for a cooking class with Alfredo Chávez, Mexico"s renowned chef from his training in various Michelin-starred restaurants in Paris, New York and Lyon. In this class you will learn how to make tortillas by hand, prepare different dishes with seasonal ingredients and make a wide variety of sauces in a molcajete. You"ll also taste drinks such as gourmet coffee and fresh drinks. At the end of this experience, your tour will be over and you will return on your own to your hotel.

bussines_description:
Supplier: Tamara Underwater
General Description: Title: Snorkeling in Puerto Morelos Reef National Park | Description: Today, you will join a group of travelers in Puerto Morelos where your English-speaking guide will be waiting for you and accompany you on a 2-hour tour to the Puerto Morelos Reef National Park, this park is the second largest in the world, has been declared a protected area and is one of the best preserved reefs in Mexico, established in 1998, is part of the Mesoamerican Barrier Reef System. First you will be provided with the necessary equipment for the activity (vest, fins, mask and snorkel), then you will approach the coral reef, where thanks to the clear and low water of the area you will be able to observe species of corals, fish, crustaceans and sea grasses of the reef lagoon, along the tour you will also have the chance to find sea turtles. 
Afterwards you will return to the dock located a few minutes away from the reef and finally you will be able to return to your hotel.

bussines_description:
Supplier: Hotel Argovia Finca Resort
General Description: Title: Walk to the Viewpoint | Description: Today, you will embark on a journey to watch the sunrise from a viewpoint for approximately 2 hours and 30 minutes. Accompanied by a group of travellers and your local guide who speaks Spanish, you will delve into a trail of about 2 km. As you make your way to the viewpoint, you will be able to see the nearby farms, the coast, and the impressive Tacaná volcano. Once at the summit, your guide will give you some free time to enjoy the view while savouring a coffee and seasonal bread. After the designated time, you will return to the hotel via the same 2 km trail, concluding the experience.

Note: It is recommended to leave at 5:00 am to see the sunrise.

bussines_description:
Supplier: Parador Turístico Yaxunah
General Description: Title: Explore the archaeological zone of Yaxunah | Description: You will visit the archaeological site of Yaxunah for an hour traveling by bicycle or on foot with a local Spanish-speaking guide from the community. Yaxunah was communicated with Chichen Itza and Coba through sacbes or white roads, cobblestone roads used as trade routes between the cities, the longest of the Maya World linked the cities of Yaxunah and Coba. During the visit you will be able to see the most emblematic buildings such as: The Observatory, The Ball Game, the Sculpture of the Goddess Ixchel, the Acropolis, Popol Nah and the Great Mayan Sacbe, all surrounded by the dense vegetation.

General Description: Title: Explore, on a shared tour, the second largest market in Mexico City: La Merced | Description: Immerse yourself in a culinary experience as you delve into the lesser-known corners of Mexico City accompanied by your Spanish-speaking guide and a group of travelers. The approximately 3.5 hour tour will take you off the beaten path, straight to the second largest market in the city. Here you can sample a wide variety of tacos and antojitos. As you explore the market, you will discover the flavors and aromas of traditional Mexican cuisine, as well as the ingredients that have been an integral part of the country's culinary culture for centuries. 

In addition to the variety of food, our tour will take you through what many consider to be the oldest part of Mexico City's historic center. You will stroll through streets full of history and charm, admiring the colonial architecture. This tour is specially designed for adventurous travelers looking to immerse themselves in the authenticity of the local culture through its lesser known flavors and places.

bussines_description:

General Description: Title: Yucatecan handicrafts in Yalcobá | Description: Today, your local guide in Spanish will take you on a tour of approximately one hour through Yacolbá, a Yucatecan community in the very heart of southern Mexico's Maya jungle, where you will meet a family with which you will participate in a workshop for local handicrafts making. Learn about how the inhabitants seek Maya territory richness and related culture conservation; and the protection of cultural and natural heritage from a different perspective. Create a cultural encounter space with your hosts by making your bracelet or dreamcatcher; let the community experts guide you, who will teach you all the making process as long as you learn more about how they learned their job, how they look for its conservation, and how life is within the community. In the end, you will get your handicraft as a souvenir.

Finally, you will visit a beach and a sea turtle nesting area.

Besides, you will also visit a Meliponary, a space to safeguard Melipona bees (stingless bees) and manage them for productive purposes; learn and admire them. Finally, as well as the breeding of native Melipona bees for honey production, you can understand the Mayan way of life, which centered around religion, agriculture, and war.

Afterwards, you will swim in the semi-open cenote of Tsukán and visit the Mayan house to learn about its various characteristic objects. You will also have the opportunity to participate in the Yucatan flavours workshop, where you will be able to make your own recado (typical local dish). Afterwards, you will enjoy a meal at the Tsukán restaurant menu buffet. You will also have access to the bar, the picnic area and the snack and souvenir shop.

one_line_summary: Explore Mexico City's historic center and vibrant San Juan Market in a 4-hour guided tour
bussines_description:
Supplier: Pablo Yuichi
General Description: Title: Explore the historic center of Mexico City and San Juan Market | Description: Today you will meet your local English-speaking guide for a 4-hour walking tour of Mexico City's historic center, one of the largest and most emblematic in Latin America. You will start at the Alameda Park to see the majestic Bellas Artes, a symbol of the Porfirio Diaz era. Continue along the pedestrian street of Madero until you reach the Plaza de la Constitucion or Zocalo, the most important square in Mexico, here you will see the Cathedral of Mexico and the National Palace.

Then you will visit the San Juan Market. Famous chefs and local shoppers flock to the city's famous food market in search of the best produce, meats and specialties on offer, from fruits and vegetables to lion meat. You will stroll through the aisles of the market and its surroundings, delighting your senses with the riot of colors and aromas. You can visit local stands of exotic fruits, cheeses, jams, coffee and other delicacies while learning about Mexican cuisine and the history of the market.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Walking tour: Historic Center & San Juan Market - 4h - ENG | serviceDescription: Walking tour: Historic Center & San Juan Market | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Mexico Area

unique_selling_points: ["Swim alongside the largest fish in the world","Includes a continental breakfast and ceviche tasting","Opportunity to see dolphins, rays, and turtles"]
one_line_summary: Experience swimming with majestic whale sharks in Holbox's pristine waters.
bussines_description:
Supplier: VIP Holbox
General Description: Title: Swim with the Whale Shark in the waters of Holbox | Description: Today you will have the opportunity to live a unique experience. You will arrive at the meeting point to meet your Spanish-speaking guide and a group of travelers who will do the activity together. Here you will enjoy a delicious continental breakfast, while you are given an informative talk and all the necessary equipment. Once you are ready, you will set sail from the dock in a boat to begin your search for whale sharks, an experience that lasts approximately 8 hours. 
 
During the trip, you may also see other species such as rays, dolphins, and turtles. Once you find the whale shark you will experience the thrill of seeing or swimming alongside the largest fish in the world. The whale shark is the most peaceful giant on the planet and can grow as big as a bus. Your guide is an expert in swimming alongside the whale shark and will advise you on how to enjoy the experience safely and confidently. On the way back, you will stop at a small reef for snorkeling. Finally you will arrive at Santa Paula, where you can swim, stretch your legs and taste a 100% fresh ceviche, the final journey to Holbox, will be only 45 minutes. 

Important: Whale Shark season goes from mid May to mid September, the best season to have very good weather conditions and see whale sharks is during the months of June, July and August.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Whale Shark Tour - 8h - SPA | serviceDescription: Whale Shark Tour | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Quintana Roo
Location: address: Av Damero, Centro, 77310 Holbox, Q.R. | locations: Isla Holbox

unique_selling_points: ["Authentic Maya agricultural techniques","Walkthrough of traditional milpa cultivation","Identification of medicinal and edible plants","Cultural immersion in Yucatan Maya community"]
one_line_summary: Learn traditional Maya maize cultivation and plant identification in Ek Balam
bussines_description:
Supplier: Centro Ecoturístico Unajil Ek Balam
General Description: Title: Learning about maize and corn in the village of Ek Balam | Description: Today you will head to Ek Balam, a town where Maya is the most spoken language. During this tour, you will lqearn about the ancestral technique that this culture has used up to this day to obtain foods such as corn, beans, and squash, made possible thanks to the milpa. Your English-speaking guide will be waiting for you to start this 2 and a half hour journey along. You will arrive at the milpa plantations, where you will get information about the process of producing corn: its cleaning, planting, and harvesting. Afterwards, you will walk along nearby trails filled with different plants from the region, identifying those used by the Maya, natives of Yucatan, as food and those used for medicinal purposes; you will also discover very important trees, which are used to build their houses and tourist cabins.

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to artisan crafting traditional clay cups","Participation in mezcal production process","Tasting of fruit-infused mezcals in organic family project","Visit to ritual space Cruz del Pedimento for spiritual requests"]
one_line_summary: Explore Oaxaca's mezcal heritage with tastings, artisan visits, and production insights.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Etnoturística
General Description: Title: The Mezcal Route | Description: Today, your local English-speaking guide will pick you up to take an approximately 9-hour tour through the mezcal-producing region of Matatlán, known as the World Capital of Mezcal, and Chichicapam. You will start by visiting an artisan who crafts and paints cantaritos, traditional clay cups for drinking and serving mezcal. From there, you will move on to the Cruz del Pedimento, a ritual space where you can make a request. This is where the local people usually request successful harvests throughout the year. Continuing your tour, you will visit San Baltazar Guelavila, where you will explore a rustic and small palenque (mezcal distillery). A master mezcalero will guide you through the production process, and you will have the opportunity to taste the agua miel (honey water) and learn about the social aspects of mezcal.


Your next stop will be amidst agave landscapes and mountains in the community of San Baltazar Chichicapam. Here, you will visit a traditional mezcal palenque with another master mezcalero, allowing you to get involved in the production process, from filling the fermentation vats to helping with the agave wheelbarrows. You will take a short break at a Family House in Chichicapán, where you can enjoy a meal and have the opportunity to try the typical food of the village. Finally, your tour will conclude at a palenque in Santa Catarina Minas, a popular project driven by a renowned mezcal-producing family. They specialize in the organic production of a single range of agaves. You will also have the opportunity to visit the greenhouse and taste up to twenty fruit-infused mezcals.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: The Mezcal Route - 9h - ENG | serviceDescription: The Mezcal Route | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Oaxaca
Location: address: Oaxaca, Centro, Oaxaca de Juárez, Oaxaca, México | locations: Oaxaca de Juárez

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to ancient Maya ruins of Cobá with optional bicycle or bicycle cab","Participation in a small Mayan ceremony in Punta Laguna","Jungle hike with biodiversity insights including spider monkeys","Zip lining over the jungle and canoeing in a lagoon","Swimming in a colorful cenote with natural light"]
one_line_summary: Full-day adventure exploring Maya ruins, jungle, and cenote in Quintana Roo
bussines_description:
Supplier: México Kan Tours
General Description: Title: Explore Cobá, Punta Laguna & a Cenote | Description: Your English-speaking guide will pick you up early to begin this approximately 9-hour shared adventure. The first stop on your itinerary is the archaeological site of Coba. Here, you will have the opportunity to explore the ruins by bicycle, surrounded by vegetation. If you prefer a more relaxed option, you can opt for a bicycle cab. The white roads, known as sacbes, built by the ancient Maya, will lead you from the settlements to the Nohoch Mul pyramid, the largest in the Yucatan Peninsula.

Your adventure will continue at the Punta Laguna Nature Reserve. Here, you will have the opportunity to participate in a small Mayan ceremony before beginning the jungle hike, where your guide will show you the biodiversity and provide information about the plants and animals that inhabit the area, such as the spider monkey. Before finishing, you can decide to go on the zip line and return with a canoe to navigate the lagoon. You will then head to the community of Nuevo Durango, where you will enjoy a home-cooked meal. Afterwards, you will have the opportunity to swim in a semi-open cenote, where natural light will allow you to admire its colors.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Mayan Inland Expedition - 9.5h - ENG | serviceDescription: Mayan Inland Expedition | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Quintana Roo
Location: address: Avenida Tulum S/N. Entre Orion y, C. Centauro Sur, Centro, 77760 Tulum, Q.R. | locations: Tulum, Oaxaca de Juárez

You will participate in an artisanal coffee workshop where you will immerse yourself in the roasting process, from the selection of beans to the aromatic beverage we all know, and you will have the opportunity to roast the beans yourself. You will learn about the different levels of roasting and how time and temperature affect the final result. Additionally, you will enjoy a regional breakfast. After finishing, your guide will take you back to your hotel, concluding your experience.

one_line_summary: Full-day guided tour exploring Teotihuacan's history, crafts, and local flavors
bussines_description:
Supplier: Teotihuacan en bici
General Description: Title: Walking tour in Teotihuacan | Description: Today your English speaking local guide will meet you at your hotel and, along with fellow travellers, head out of Mexico City to the valley of Teotihuacan to begin your approximately 8-hour experience. Here, your guide will talk to you about the significance of the City of the Gods, while you walk along the Calzada de los Muertos, telling you all about the mysteries of this ancient civilisation, where you will find buildings such as the Pyramid of the Sun and Pyramid of the Moon. Afterwards, you will board your transport that will take you on a tour of the route of the Murals, an ancient natural observatory and the breathtaking views of the City of the Gods. You"ll close your day with a visit to the home of a family of artisans, where you"ll learn more about the obsidian process and how it is transformed into handicrafts. You will also have a tasting of pulque and products derived from xoconostle, a cactus fruit very representative of the area. At the end of the designated time, you will enjoy a local lunch and your transportation will take you back to Mexico City, where your tour will end.

You will take a tour of a ranch, where you will identify what flowers serve them as food. Next, you will experience being in an apiary (with security equipment) to learn about the honey production process, which varies depending on the region, the flowers’ disponibility, and the bee species involved. Once this experience of approximately six hours finishes, you will enjoy a honey tasting and a lunch from the ranch to your table.

one_line_summary: Learn to make authentic Mexican corn tortillas in a traditional Yucatan community.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Mun Ha Chac Lol
General Description: Title: Making your own corn tortilla in the community of Mun-Ha | Description: Today, your local guide in English will wait for you at the meeting point to take you to an interactive workshop of approximately, where you will learn about the process of making a corn tortilla, one of the essential foods in the Mexican diet and in Mayan cosmology. The workshop begins with explaining the difference between masa and pozole-pozol, two basic ingredients for making the tortilla. It emphasizes the importance of the tortilla in the culture and cuisine of the region. Afterwards, you will make a ball of masa and shape it into a tortilla using your hands. Then, you will be taught how to place the tortilla on the comal and prevent it from burning, so you can achieve a perfect tortilla. Finally, you will learn how to remove the tortilla from the comal, and you can prepare guacamole to accompany your freshly made tortilla.

one_line_summary: Explore Yucatán caves with local stories and geological wonders.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Ta Náayta
General Description: Title: Caves and “Rejolladas” Exploration in Yucatán | Description: Today, your local guide in English will take you on a tour of approximately two hours, where you will enter a small space to reach and see another cave. If you are willing to, you will crawl through a narrow cave to go to another one. Both are 6 kilometers from Yalcobá, a Yucatecan community in the heart of the southern Mexico Maya jungle. Besides, if you cannot go to the interpretative tour experience, you will listen to stories about the Alux, a mythical entity that steals bright objects, candies, tobacco, and livestock; simultaneously, it makes all kinds of mischief. Also, you will listen to an explanation about stalactite formations, which are geological formations developed by the drip and the deposition of minerals dissolved in water.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Exploration of Caves and Rehoyadas - 1.5h - ENG | serviceDescription: Exploration of Caves and Rehoyadas | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Yucatan

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to lesser-known archaeological site Dzibilnocac","Exploration of ancient Mayan monuments and masks","Combination of cultural and historical insights"]
one_line_summary: Explore ancient Mayan sites and learn about their astronomical and cultural significance.
bussines_description:
Supplier: El Tucan Tours
General Description: Title: Expedition in the Chenes region. | Description: Today your transportation will pick you up and take you on an 8 hour experience along with your local guide in Spanish, you will visit the Chenes region and explore the vestiges of ancient kingdoms: Hochob, Dzibilnocac and Tabasqueño. The first stop will be El Tabasqueño where the Emblem Tower is, a monument associated with astronomical scientific activities, and where  you will also see a large number of stelae that recoroded information about the most relevant aspects of the city. You will continue to Hochob, where you can also visit several ancient monuments such as the East Palace, where you can find a huge mask representing the Mayan god Itzamná, or Structures II and III, with decorated masks, false temples and simulated staircases. Finally you will visit Dzibilnocac, a little known archeological site where you will find the Painted Vault, a group of mounds, platforms, vaulted buildings and rooms decorated with masks of the Mayan god of rain, Chaac. At the end of the tour, your transportation will return you to your hotel.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Chenes Archaeological Route - 11h - SPA | serviceDescription: Chenes Archaeological Route | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Campeche Area

unique_selling_points: ["Observation of American flamingos in their natural habitat","Visit to Las Coloradas salt lakes with unique pink hue","Mayan exfoliating mud bath for skin health","Combination of wildlife, natural beauty, and cultural elements"]
one_line_summary: Explore Rio Lagartos' biodiversity, flamingos, salt lakes, and enjoy a Mayan mud bath.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Rio Lagartos Xplore
General Description: Title: Boat trip in the Rio Lagartos Reserve | Description: Rio Lagartos is a small fishing village located in the north of the Yucatan Peninsula within the Ria Lagartos Biosphere Reserve. It is one of the main feeding and nesting areas of American flamingos in the Peninsula. During this experience, you will navigate for two hours in a boat through the mangrove ecosystem. Together with your local guide in Spanish, you will visit the feeding area of the flamingos to discover the biodiversity of the ecosystem, where you can observe different types of birds and, with some luck, crocodiles.

You will also have the opportunity to appreciate Las Coloradas (salt factory), beautiful salt lakes that have a pinkish tone due to their salt concentration (the color depends on the time of the year and the amount of daylight). During the tour, you will have the opportunity to take a Mayan bath (exfoliating mud bath) in the white clay mounds, which are beneficial for the skin due to their concentration of sulfur, minerals, salts and seaweed as they moisturize and soften the dermis. You will finish the excursion with free time on the beach to swim or just enjoy.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Flamingos tour - 2h - SPA | serviceDescription: Flamingos tour | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Yucatan
Location: address: Calle 9, 97720 Río Lagartos, Yuc., México | locations: Rio Lagartos

unique_selling_points: ["Authentic street food experience in Oaxaca","Visit to Mercado de la Merced and local neighbourhoods","Access to the 16th-century aqueduct and Santo Domingo Temple museum","Sampling of traditional Oaxacan hot chocolate","Exploration of colonial architecture and vibrant markets"]
one_line_summary: Explore Oaxaca's rich culture and street food on a full-day guided city tour
bussines_description:
Supplier: Etnoturística
General Description: Title: Gastronomy and culture on the streets of Oaxaca | Description: Today, you will enjoy an approximately 5-hour visit to the city of Oaxaca to explore its cultural, historical, and gastronomic richness with the guidance of a local Spanish-speaking guide. You will begin by visiting the Mercado de la Merced, where you can try a traditional baked empanada. Then, you will stroll through the colourful streets of the Jalatlaco neighbourhood until you reach the 16th-century Aqueduct, where you can savour delicious street tacos on García Vigil Street.


Next, you will continue to the architectural complex of the Santo Domingo Temple, which houses a museum of cultures and the treasure of the Seventh Tomb of Monte Albán. Here, you can refresh yourself with one of the city's famous ice creams. Finally, you will walk along the baroque facades of the Cathedral and the colonial mansions on Alcalá Street before ending at the Plaza de la Constitución. This place features an authentic modernist kiosk and markets with delightful aromas and flavours. Here, you can enjoy a delicious Oaxacan hot chocolate to conclude the tour.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Tour Street Food & Culture - 6h - SPA | serviceDescription: Tour Street Food & Culture | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Oaxaca
Location: address: Oaxaca, Centro, Oaxaca de Juárez, Oaxaca, México | locations: Oaxaca de Juárez

one_line_summary: Learn diverse coffee extraction methods with tastings at Hotel Argovia Finca Resort
bussines_description:
Supplier: Hotel Argovia Finca Resort
General Description: Title: Workshop on Coffee Extraction Methods | Description: Today, you will live an experience of approximately 1 hour to discover various coffee extraction techniques. Accompanied by a group of travellers and your local guide who speaks Spanish, you will learn methods such as the French press, Italian press, chemex, and Japanese siphon. Each offers a unique and captivating flavour profile. You will delve into the characteristics of each extraction method and learn about the factors that influence the final flavour of your cup of coffee. From temperature and contact time to the fineness of the grind, you will learn how each detail can influence the final outcome. You will have a tasting with each of the methods accompanied by artisanal bread, and with this, the experience will conclude.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Workshop on coffee extraction methods - 1h - SPA | serviceDescription: Workshop on coffee extraction methods | serviceType: Alojamiento, Operadora local | destinationName: Chiapas

This palenque has been managed by the same family for four generations, besides being engaged with sustainable agriculture and community retribution; nowadays, it produces mezcal for domestic and international sales. one_line_summary: Mayan cave meditation experience connecting with nature and spirituality
bussines_description:
Supplier: Nuevo Durango
General Description: Title: Visit the Nuevo Durango Cavern | Description: Today you will visit a project that combines nature conservation and traditional Mayan culture, located 1km from the local communities. You will meet at the established point with your Spanish-speaking guide who will accompany you on this 2-hour adventure.
During the tour, you will be able to observe birds and some of the trees that produce honey. When you arrive at the cavern, you will find 3 vaults full of channels and crystalline subway rivers that you can access after purification, this ritual consists of asking permission to the moon and the gods protectors of the jungle and cenotes to enter the cave. Xibalba Cave better known as the Mayan underworld to relax, refresh and enjoy a meditation in the dark to be in contact with nature and yourself. At the end of the activity, you can return to your hotel.

bussines_description:
Supplier: Las 3 Tzimoleras
General Description: Title: Standup Paddleboard & Snorkel at Chucumaltik Cenote | Description: Today, you will meet your English-speaking guide and fellow travellers to begin your approximately 3-hour experience. Together, you will visit the Chucumaltik Cenote where your guide will tell you about the history, flora and fauna of the site. You will tour the cenote on standup paddleboards and explore underwater by snorkelling and observing the geological formations of the cenote walls. You will also have the opportunity to jump 8 metres into the deep blue of the cenote and, at the end of these activities, you can take some time to enjoy the cenote and the beauty that surrounds it. At the end of the designated time, your experience will have come to an end.

unique_selling_points: ["Recreation of ancient Mayan trade routes","Serene lagoon swimming experience","Wildlife observation including manatees and crocodiles","Community-based ecotourism focus","Traditional local lunch included"]
one_line_summary: Explore ancient Mayan trade routes and wildlife in Sian Ka'an's pristine lagoons.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Community Tours Sian Ka’an
General Description: Title: The Ancient Canal Experience in Sian Ka'an Biosphere Reserve | Description: Today you will visit the Sian Ka'an Biosphere Reserve, which in Mayan means place where the sky is born to live the Ancient Canal Experience which is a recreation of a Mayan trade route that consisted of arriving from the Caribbean Sea through a system of lagoons connected by canals through natural waters. You will start by arriving at the Muyil Community Center to join a group of travelers to begin this approximately 5-hour experience with a local Spanish-speaking guide. This community-based ecotourism cooperative focuses on the conservation and preservation of ecosystems by promoting unique experiences with a commitment to responsible tourism. You will be transferred to the Muyil dock where you will take a boat to navigate through the reserve visiting the Muyil and Chunyaxche lagoons until you reach the Xlapac dock. Once there, enjoy a serene swim in the water. It is a moment of reconnection with mother earth, as you float slowly through the crystal clear canals surrounded by mangroves and the soft sounds of birds and other local animals. 

After this magical experience, you will visit the Capelchén Lagoon where with a little luck you will be able to observe manatees and crocodiles in their natural habitat, to finish the tour you will visit the coast of Boca Paila beach to observe the difference between the water of the lagoon system and the water of the beach. Return to Muyil where you will be welcomed with a traditional lunch to complete the excursion.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Sian Kaan Ancient Canal Morning - 5h - SPA | serviceDescription: Sian Kaan Ancient Canal Morning | serviceType: Centro Ecoturístico | destinationName: Quintana Roo
Location: address: Community tours Sian Ka'an Muyil, Chunyaxché, Quintana Roo, México | locations: Tulum
