one_line_summary: Educational tour in Xochimilco to learn about and observe the axolotl in its natural habitat
bussines_description:
Supplier: OlinTlalli
General Description: Title: Visit to the ajolotario | Description: Today you will meet your Spanish-speaking guide at the meeting point to begin your approximately 2-hour experience. You will have the opportunity to learn about an endemic and endangered species: the axolotl. On this trajinera tour, you will be taken to the Chinampa, a protected natural area where you can learn about the history and unique characteristics of this species, and understand the challenges it faces today. The team will show you the importance of respecting the axolotl"s habitat and how to protect its natural environment for its survival. You will have the chance to appreciate the beauty of the axolotl in its natural habitat. This educational and hands-on experience is ideal for those interested in biodiversity and nature conservation, and it will leave you with a new understanding and appreciation of the axolotl. At the end of your designated activity time, you will return to the meeting point and your experience will conclude.

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to ancient Tule Tree, one of the oldest and strongest trees in the world","Exploration of unique mineral-rich springs at Hierve el Agua with panoramic mountain views","Authentic weaving workshop in Teotitlán del Valle","Mezcal tasting and learning about traditional production methods"]
one_line_summary: Full-day cultural tour exploring Oaxaca's archaeological sites, natural wonders, and mezcal.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Etnoturística
General Description: Title: Oaxaca's Hidden Gems: Discover Mitla, Hierve el Agua, Teotitlán & Mezcal! | Description: Today you will join other travellers and your English-speaking guide on tour (approximately 8 hours) designed with a mix of archaeology, handicrafts and nature; you will start the tour 10 km from Oaxaca City after a 20-minute transfer. Your first stop will be in Santa Maria del Tule to see the ancient Tule Tree, a Montezuma cypress approximately two thousand years old and whose trunk is known to be the strongest in the world. From there, you will be transferred for approximately one and a half hours to the Hierve el Agua Park, unique for its rock formations that resemble waterfalls; here, you can explore the area and bathe in the mineral-rich cold water springs while enjoying the panoramic view of the surrounding mountain scenery. You will then descend to the Mitla Archaeological Zone to appreciate and learn about the geometries in the decorative walls. After a 30-minute break, you will head to Teotitlán del Valle, where you will visit the House of some wool weavers to learn about the process of spinning, weaving and colouring the wool. Finally, you will go to the Mezcal Palenque, where you will have the opportunity to taste the different types of mezcal and learn about the elaboration process. After a full day of activities, you will return to Oaxaca City.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Mitla, Tule, Hierve el agua, Teotitlán & Mezcal - 8h - ENG | serviceDescription: Mitla, Tule, Hierve el agua, Teotitlán & Mezcal | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Oaxaca
Location: address: Oaxaca, Centro, Oaxaca de Juárez, Oaxaca, México | locations: Oaxaca de Juárez

bussines_description:
Supplier: México Kan Tours
General Description: Title: Tulum by bicycle | Description: Today you will meet your German speaking guide and a group of travelers at 7:45 am at the meeting point, where you will begin your journey of approximately 6 hours. You will be given a bicycle that will accompany you on this experience. The first stop will be at the ruins of Tulum, where you will immerse yourself in the history of this ancient city located in front of the Caribbean Sea. After the visit to the ruins, you will return to the town of Tulum to explore its streets full of mural art, architecture and cafes that reflect the authenticity of the local culture.

You will continue your day by visiting the Mayan Melipona Bee Foundation, where you will have the opportunity to learn more about the stingless bee and taste its honey. You will learn about the importance of this species and its role in the local ecosystem. To culminate this experience, you will head to a cenote, where you can dive into its waters, swim and relax while marveling at the submerged caves and subway rivers that flow inside.

bussines_description:
Supplier: Nayarit Adventures
General Description: Title: Discover Coral Island and the City of Compostela | Description: Begin this approximately 11.5 hour activity when your shared transportation picks you up at your hotel and takes you to the city of Compostela. You will enjoy a light breakfast. Afterwards, you will head to Rincon de Guayabitos. Accompanied by your local English-speaking guide and a group of travelers, you will have the opportunity to listen to a thematic talk about the ecotourism activities that take place on the Coral Island of Rincon de Guayabitos Bay.

Once prepared, you will embark on a boat that will take you through the beaches of the bay until you reach Coral Island. On this island, you will have a snorkeling class where you will learn how to use the equipment, once ready you can explore the rocky coral reefs accompanied by your guide. If you prefer to relax, you can stay on the island to enjoy the sand and the natural environment. Afterwards, you will return to Rincon de Guayabitos beach to enjoy a seafood lunch at the Pineda Restaurant. Finally, you will board your transportation to the historic and stately city of Compostela. There, you will enjoy a stroll through its main square and its colonial cathedral, and you will also have the opportunity to taste the famous Manantial raspados. At the end of this visit, you will return to Tepic.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Snorkel Coral Island & Señorial de Compostela - 11.5h - ENG | serviceDescription: Snorkel Coral Island & Señorial de Compostela | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Nayarit
Location: address: Sebastián Lerdo de Tejada Pte. 23, Centro, 63000 Tepic, Nay. | locations: Puerto Vallarta

one_line_summary: Explore Coyoacán's colonial charm, history, and local flavors with a guided tour.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Pablo Yuichi
General Description: Title: Tour the bohemian neighborhood of Coyoacán | Description: Today you will head to the south of Mexico City to visit the bohemian neighborhood of Coyoacán, one of the most picturesque in the city and characterized by its cobblestone streets and colonial architecture. 

Accompanied by your local English-speaking guide, you will take a walking tour of approximately 4 hours to learn about its history, from pre-Hispanic times to the present day. You will appreciate the Hidalgo Garden and the Centennial Garden as well as the Parish and Ex Convent of San Juan Bautista. During your tour you will see churches, plazas and beautiful gardens. We suggest you taste the typical desserts of the neighborhood, such as the delicious churros and ice cream.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Coyoacán - 4 h -  ENG | serviceDescription: Coyoacán | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Mexico Area
Location: address: Ciudad de México, CDMX, México | locations: Mexico City

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to UNESCO World Heritage Site Uxmal","In-depth tour of Mayan architecture and history","Interactive Chocolate Museum with cacao history","Botanical gardens featuring cacao trees","Rescued endemic fauna at animal refuge"]
one_line_summary: Discover Uxmal's Mayan ruins and the rich history of cacao at the Chocolate Museum.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Mayan Ecotours
General Description: Title: Visit to the archaeological site of Uxmal and the chocolate museum | Description: Your shared transportation will pick you up to visit the archaeological site of Uxmal, approximately 1 hour and 15 minutes from Mérida. Uxmal is a land surrounded by legends, myths and anecdotes, declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Along with your local guide you will take a tour through the history of this majestic place visiting some of the most emblematic buildings such as The Pyramid of the Soothsayer, The Plaza of the Birds, The Nun"s Quadrangle, The Ball Court, The Governor"s Palace, The Great Pyramid and The Dovecote, as well as the northern group with The Old Woman"s House, The Cemetery and The Temple of the Phalluses.

Afterwards, you will visit the Chocolate Museum, which retraces the history of cocoa: from its origin, distribution and uses around the world, to its millenary forms of Mayan preparation.  In addition to the tour of the museum, you can visit the botanical gardens with cacao trees and complement it with a tour of the animal refuge, where you can admire endemic fauna that has been rescued. Finally you will return to Mérida at approximately 5 pm.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Uxmal, Chocolate Museum and Cenote - 10h - SPA | serviceDescription: Uxmal, Chocolate Museum and Cenote | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Yucatan
Location: address: Mérida, Yuc., México | locations: Mérida

General Description: Title: Tezontle menu | Description: Today, you will have a gastronomic experience at Tezontle restaurant, part of the Casa de la Luz hotel. A restaurant that, through its chefs from Oaxaca, seeks to offer a wide variety of culinary options using local and seasonal ingredients. On this occasion you can taste the Tezontle menu which is made up of; capulin tlayuda, stone broth, deer stick roll, chile de agua stuffed with marlin, aguachile de humo, marrow soup, tropical tuna, pulque borreguito, bis-choco, horchata marchanta. The experience ends at the end of the menu. Note: Experience not available on Sundays.

unique_selling_points: ["Exploration of sacred Mayan caves","Swim in sunlit cave waters","Journey from sea to jungle through caves"]
one_line_summary: Explore sacred caves and vibrant reefs on an adventurous Tulum snorkeling tour
bussines_description:
Supplier: México Kan Tours
General Description: Title: Snorkeling Tour: Amazing Underground realm & Caribbean Reef Snorkel | Description: Your English-speaking guide will pass by you and a group of other travelers for a shared tour lasting around 6 hours. You'll start by snorkeling in the colorful Caribbean Sea, where you can contemplate the impressive and colorful diversity of the Mesoamerican reef that characterizes it.  

You'll continue with a visit to a 600-metre-long cave, where you'll appreciate the different types of formations, learn about their formation process and learn about the importance of these caves to the inhabitants of the Yucatan Peninsula. These natural wonders are considered sacred because they are the gateway to the vital liquid and, in Mayan cosmovision, they are also the entrances to the subterranean world. In the first part of the cave, you'll walk through water about a metre deep until you reach an area where the cave ceiling has collapsed, letting in natural light and allowing you to swim in deeper, sunlit water. You'll keep swimming and walking along the cave until you emerge in the middle of the jungle!
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Mayan Underworld - 7h - ENG | serviceDescription: Mayan Underworld | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Quintana Roo
Location: address: Avenida Tulum S/N. Entre Orion y, C. Centauro Sur, Centro, 77760 Tulum, Q.R. | locations: Tulum, Oaxaca de Juárez

unique_selling_points: ["Live demonstration of traditional corn processing","Visit to sustainable milpa supporting local community","Tasting of 8 varieties of corn-based drinks and foods","Educational insight into Maya cultural practices and offerings"]
one_line_summary: Learn about Maya corn traditions with hands-on tasting and community insights
bussines_description:
Supplier: Parador Turístico Yaxunah
General Description: Title: Corn Immersion at Yaxunah | Description: With a local Spanish-speaking guide, you will live an experience of approximately 2 hours where you will learn about the production process of corn, a food so important for the Mayas, which represents the spirit of the people. First you will visit a sustainable milpa, that is, a milpa that seeks to increase the efficiency of soil resources, without burning the bushes at the end of the harvest and using the same plants as fertilizer for the soil. From Don Francisco you will learn about the tasks of cleaning, planting and harvesting, as well as the challenges faced by producers due to climate change and pests. The work in the milpas directly supports the community by providing corn for food, work and the possibility of creating complementary economic income through tourism. 

There will be a demonstration of the beverages that can be made from corn, called pozoles and atoles. You will learn about the preparation of these drinks, how the corn is shelled and the nixtamal is made, and then taste 8 varieties, including those drinks that are taken on special occasions, such as Pinole (in the Mayan baptism) or Pozole of corn (as part of offerings to the gods). Afterwards you will be offered traditional pozoles made by the community from corn, accompanied by an explanation of how they were used for baptisms or offerings to the gods. Afterwards you can return to taste local food.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Corn, horn workshop, AS Yaxunah & Lol Ha - 7.5h - SPA | serviceDescription: Corn, horn workshop, AS Yaxunah & Lol Ha | serviceType: Centro Ecoturístico | destinationName: Yucatan
Location: address: Yaxunah, Yaxcabá, Yucatán, México | locations: Yaxunah

unique_selling_points: ["Traditional trajinera boat tour through Xochimilco's canals","Visit to an ajolotl farm and learn about the axolotl's cultural significance","Hands-on experience with ancestral chinampa farming techniques","Educational insights into ecological systems like biofilters and axolotl shelters","Opportunity to purchase fresh flowers and vegetables directly from farmers"]
one_line_summary: Discover Xochimilco's biodiversity and traditional farming on a scenic trajinera tour
bussines_description:
Supplier: OlinTlalli
General Description: Title: Explore the biodiversity of Xochimilco on a trajinera boat | Description: The 5 hour tour begins at Embarcadero Cuemanco, where you will meet your local guide in Spanish and the paddler who will take you on the traditional trajinera. During the hour-long tour, you will enjoy the tranquil atmosphere of the canals while your guide tells you about the history and importance of Xochimilco, as well as the great variety of birds you will see along the way.

The first stop will be at an ajolotl farm, where you will learn more about the legendary axolotl and its importance to Mexican culture. Afterwards, you will continue on to the Olintlalli chinampa, where you will learn first-hand about the ancestral agricultural techniques used by the chinamperos to grow flowers and vegetables in this place. Here you will have the opportunity to put into practice some of the steps described by the farmer and, if you wish, purchase some freshly harvested flowers and vegetables. The tour ends with an explanation of how the Biofilter and the axolotl shelter work.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Ajolotario and demonstrative chinampa - 5h - SPA | serviceDescription: Ajolotario and demonstrative chinampa | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Mexico Area
Location: address: Xochimilco, CDMX, México | locations: Mexico City

unique_selling_points: ["Swimming in rarely visited crystal-clear cenotes","Bike ride through lush natural surroundings","Visit to colonial Izamal and 16th-century convent","Exploration of archaeological site Kinich Kakmó"]
one_line_summary: Full-day adventure exploring cenotes, colonial towns, and archaeological sites in Yucatán.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Coox Mayab
General Description: Title: Adventure in the Mayab | Description: Today, you will join a group of travelers for a 12.5 hrs adventure in Mayab, your Spanish speaking guide will be waiting for you at 7.30 am at the meeting point, from where transportation will take you to Cenotillo, so called because of the large number of cenotes found there, among which stands out the Xooch cenote, unique for its large size and the lush nature that surrounds it. To get from Cenotillo to Xooch, you will be able to make a 4 km bike ride, upon arrival you will have the experience of swimming in crystal clear waters since many tourists do not go there.
 Afterwards, you will enjoy lunch at the cooperative's restaurant and then return to Merida, stopping in Izamal to observe its cobblestone streets and yellow facades. Afterwards, you will visit the convent of Padua, which resembles most of the convents that were built in the 16th century and has four chapels, the church and the convent with its own orchard. Finally, you will visit the archaeological site of Kinich Kakmó, which is also known as the city of the hills or of the three cultures for its archaeological remains, colonial buildings and modern settlements.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Adventure in the Mayab - 10h - ENG | serviceDescription: Adventure in the Mayab | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Yucatan
Location: address: Apiturismo Sinanché Calle 24, 97420 Sinanché, Mexico | locations: Mérida

unique_selling_points: ["Guided tour through authentic Mayan forests","Visit to a sacred cenote for appreciation","Educational focus on milpa agriculture and biodiversity","Cultural and natural heritage conservation","Experience in a traditional Yucatecan community"]
one_line_summary: Explore Mayan forests, milpa, and sacred cenote in Yucatán with local guides
bussines_description:
Supplier: Ta Náayta
General Description: Title: Mayan forests and milpa in Yacolbá | Description: Today, your local guide in English will take you on a two-hour tour through Yalcobá, a Yucatecan community in the heart of the southern Mexico Maya jungle, where you will walk in Mayan forests and learn about milpa (a traditional agricultural system used throughout Mesoamerica and based on the three sisters association: corn, beans, and squash). In this tour, the diversity of butterflies, insects, and other animals is as present as the variety of local plants that grow in this region. Besides the informative speech, you will be able to visit a cenote known as rejollada, which is only for appreciation; explore this place stamped with our ancestors' fingerprints through an experience that looks for Yucatán cultural and natural heritage conservation and let yourself be amazed by what you will discover if you pay attention to sounds and smells around you.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Milpa and mayan forest guided tour - 2h - ENG | serviceDescription: Milpa and mayan forest guided tour | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Yucatan
Location: address: C 1 X 6 y 6 A, 97794 Yalcobá, Yuc. | locations: Yalcobá

unique_selling_points: ["Authentic Oaxaca market experience","Sampling traditional memelas and empanadas","Trying grasshoppers (chapulines) with tortillas","Visit to vibrant neighborhoods of Oaxaca","Flexible stops tailored to travelers' wishes"]
one_line_summary: Discover Oaxaca's vibrant markets and authentic street foods in a 6-hour guided tour.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Etnoturística
General Description: Title: Oaxacan Markets: A Culinary Journey through Colors and Flavors | Description: Chilean poet Pablo Neruda once said, Mexico is in its markets, and today you will have the opportunity to discover what he meant. Accompanied by a local English-speaking guide, you will start at the popular mercado de abastos (supply market), where you will taste the famous memelas of Doña Vale. You will then continue to la merced market, where some empanadas prepared on a charcoal stove and a variety of sauces await you. Right here, you will also try a chapulines (grasshoppers) tortilla with poleo tea.

The next stop will be in the neighborhood of Trinidad de las Huertas, where you will sample piedrazos, which are bread soaked in vinegar. You will continue your tour through the Reforma neighborhood, where you will try the delicious guisados tacos. You will have the option to choose between two dishes, tetelas or tacos from Comal del Carmen. Last but not least, you will enjoy the best tortas from Oaxaca and empanadas de amarillo.

*Please note that the provider occasionally adapts the tour and stops according to the travelers" wishes, so there may be some minor changes.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Popular gastronomy tour - 6h - ENG | serviceDescription: Popular gastronomy tour | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Oaxaca
Location: address: Oaxaca, Centro, Oaxaca de Juárez, Oaxaca, México | locations: Oaxaca de Juárez

bussines_description:
Supplier: Nayarit Adventures
General Description: Title: Snorkeling at Coral Island and Visit to the Magical Town of Sayulita | Description: Your day will begin with a light breakfast before heading to Rincón de Guayabitos (approx. 1 hour away). Accompanied by your local Spanish-speaking guide, you will board a boat to Playa del Toro to enjoy its soft sand and crystal-clear waters. You will then continue to Coral Island, where you will snorkel among rocky coral reefs, and later arrive at Crab Island to admire a multitude of colorful crabs from the boat. Upon returning, a delicious seafood-based meal will be waiting for you. Finally, you will head to the charming village of Sayulita for a 40-minute walking tour before returning to Puerto Vallarta.

unique_selling_points: ["UNESCO protected marine park","Endangered species sightings","Living coral reefs in Sea of Cortez","Guided snorkeling with equipment included"]
one_line_summary: Full-day snorkeling adventure exploring UNESCO marine park in Cabo Pulmo
bussines_description:
Supplier: Cabo Pulmo Travel
General Description: Title: Snorkeling at Cabo Pulmo Reef | Description: Today, you will have a 9-hour snorkeling experience with transportation picking you up either in La Paz or San José del Cabo. You will be accompanied by your English-speaking guide who will provide you with the necessary equipment to make your journey as comfortable as possible. You will head towards the Cabo Pulmo Reef, where you will spend approximately 3 hours.

The Cabo Pulmo Reef is a marine park protected by UNESCO. In addition to housing 226 species of fish and marine life, it has living corals that form reefs in the Sea of Cortez. It is a refuge for endangered species such as the Gulf grouper, which you can see during this experience. After completing this activity, you will be taken back to your hotel.

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to traditional Tzotzil communities","Explore the syncretic religious practices at San Juan Chamula","Learn traditional backstrap loom weaving in Zinacantán","Authentic indigenous cultural experience","Visit to historic colonial church"]
one_line_summary: Explore indigenous Tzotzil villages with rich cultural and religious traditions in Chiapas
bussines_description:
Supplier: Consultora Turística de Chiapas
General Description: Title: Visit to San Juan Chamula and San Lorenzo Zinacatán, Chiapas. | Description: Today you will live an adventure of approximately 4 hours in two indigenous villages of the highlands of Chiapas: San Juan Chamula and San Lorenzo Zinacatán. You will meet your Spanish speaking guide at the designated meeting point to head first to San Juan Chamula, a Tzotzil community with a rich religious and cultural syncretism. You will walk through its streets and visit the Church of San Juan Evangelista, where the atmosphere is of great spiritual significance with candles and candles always burning and people praying. Next, you will explore San Lorenzo Zinacantan, known as the Place of Bats. Here, you will admire the colonial church of San Lorenzo and visit a family home to learn about the fascinating tradition of backstrap loom weaving.

bussines_description:
Supplier: Cuna de Tierra
General Description: Title: Tasting and tour of the Cuna de Tierra Vineyard. | Description: Today your Spanish-speaking guide will accompany you on a 3-hour shared experience at the Cuna de Tierra Vineyard, which has more than 30 hectares where different grape varieties are cultivated for the production of 6 red wines and 1 white wine, and has won several awards due to the architectural design of the winery. Your tour will begin with a visit to the Torre de Tierra viewpoint where you will be able to contemplate the vines, then you will go to the production area, followed by the barrel room where around 200 French, American and Hungarian oak barrels rest, contributing their characteristics to the wines under development. At the end of this tour you will taste 4 wines with 4 course meal.

bussines_description:
Supplier: Eat México
General Description: Title: Family candy in the streets of the historic center of Mexico City | Description: This tour was designed with children in mind. Accompanied by your local Spanish-speaking guide and a group of travelers, you will take a shared walking tour of approximately 2.5 to 3 hours through the heart of Mexico City's historic center. 

You will sample a mix of sweet and savory snacks, such as Mexican sweet bread, seafood tostadas, turkey tortas spread with avocado and typical Mexican sweets, and visit the San Juan Gourmet Market. Children, meanwhile, will have time on the playground, accumulate points in a fun game of the visit and receive an activity book to doodle and color. As is customary in children's circles, we finish with ice cream (and churros!).

unique_selling_points: ["Exploration of one of the world's largest underground river systems","Walking and swimming through flooded caves","Guided geological tour with expert local guide","Traditional regional buffet lunch included"]
one_line_summary: Explore the stunning underground river system of Río Secreto with guided caving and swimming.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Río secreto
General Description: Title: Rio Secreto: The Mayan underworld | Description: Today, your transportation will pick you up in Puerto Morelos to join a group of fellow travelers. You will embark on a 7-hour experience (including transport time) at Río Secreto, a natural reserve located just minutes away from Playa del Carmen in the heart of the Riviera Maya. Your local guide, who speaks Spanish, will be waiting for you at the meeting point to explore one of the world's largest underground river systems, where the history of our planet is written in thousands of geological formations. Floating in its fresh and crystal-clear waters is an experience you will cherish for a lifetime.

Your guide will explain everything about the walls and formations of this marvelous geological library as you explore various flooded caves, some of which you can walk through, while others require swimming. Once the tour is concluded, a traditional buffet lunch awaits you, featuring a variety of regional dishes. After the meal, your transportation will take you back to your hotel in Puerto Morelos.

one_line_summary: Kayak through Chiapas' lush Lacantun River, spotting wildlife and enjoying jungle sounds
bussines_description:
Supplier: Canto de la Selva
General Description: Title: Kayaking the Lacantun River | Description: Today you will have a kayak experience on the Lacantún River, lasting approximately 2 hours. This experience can start directly from the hotel or from the dock. Depending on the season, the water level of the river may vary. You will paddle with the current to fully enjoy the experience. Your local Spanish-speaking guide will accompany you in the boat and will notify you if they spot any interesting animals, such as howler monkeys, macaws, coatis, and even crocodiles. Don't worry, these animals have respect for humans, and you should also show respect towards them.

You will arrive at a riverbank where, if you are observant, you may see animal tracks as they approach the river to drink water. Enjoy this experience by swimming in this part of the river and make the most of the afternoon while listening to the sounds of the jungle. This is a unique experience to understand the immensity and importance of conserving the rainforest. At this point, you will get back on the boat to return to the hotel.

At the established meeting point, you will meet your English-speaking guide, from where you will begin your adventure in the city"s main market. During this tour, you will learn about the customs and traditions of Yucatan and sample the local cuisine, tasting authentic dishes and fresh fruits. Once you have acquired the necessary ingredients at the market, you will travel by bus to the host"s house, who will guide you step by step in the preparation of a traditional menu, an experience that will immerse you in the authentic culture and flavours of Yucatan!

bussines_description:
Supplier: Sensaciones Turísticas
General Description: Title: Immerse yourself in the magic of Mazamitla | Description: Today, you will explore the charming Magic Town of Mazamitla. Your 10-hour journey starts with a pick-up from your hotel. Accompanied by a Spanish-speaking local guide, you will discover the beauty of Mazamitla, a name meaning place where deer are hunted with arrows in Nahuatl. Nestled in the heart of the Sierra del Tigre, near Lake Chapala, this town is famed as the Mexican Switzerland for its stunning forested landscape views. You'll stroll through its cobblestone streets, visit artisanal candy and punch factories, admire the San Cristóbal Church and the main square, and explore other cultural attractions. The white houses with wooden gates and tiled roofs add a unique charm to this one-of-a-kind experience.

unique_selling_points: ["Hands-on cooking experience with local chef","Visit to a vibrant Oaxaca market","Learn traditional Oaxacan recipes and techniques","Authentic seasonal menu including beverage","Cultural immersion in Oaxaca's culinary heritage"]
one_line_summary: Interactive Oaxaca cooking class with market tour and traditional recipes
bussines_description:
Supplier: Etnoturística
General Description: Title: Oaxacan Cooking Workshop | Description: Today, your local English-speaking guide will take you, along with a group of travelers, to experience the traditional cuisine of Oaxaca for 4 and a half hours. You will start by visiting a local market accompanied by a chef, with whom you will buy the necessary ingredients to prepare typical dishes. As you explore the market, pay attention to the colors and aromas that fill the air, and you will have a firsthand experience of how the community of Oaxaca thrives in this place.


Afterward, you will head to the chef's workshop or a local Oaxacan kitchen, depending on availability. Here, you will have the opportunity to learn the secrets of Oaxacan cooking through practical experience, preparing a seasonal menu with an appetizer, soup, main course, dessert, and a traditional beverage (aguas frescas). This experience will allow you to understand the importance of Oaxaca's gastronomic heritage that has been preserved over the years. In the end, you will enjoy the dishes you have prepared and have the opportunity to share your learnings with others. Finally, you will return to your hotel to rest.

one_line_summary: Explore Tzimol's traditions with a cultural tour, tasting, and craft making in Chiapas.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Las 3 Tzimoleras
General Description: Title: Tuk tuk tuk tour, posh tasting and mat making in Tzimol | Description: Today, in Tzimol, Mexico, you will join a group of travellers for an approximately 4-hour experience. You will meet your English-speaking guide at the set meeting point to explore this picturesque village, nestled in a valley surrounded by hills and sugar cane fields. Tzimol is known for its traditional industries such as the production of panela or piloncillo made from cane sugar, petates (woven palm mats) and posh (an alcoholic drink also made from cane sugar). You will have the opportunity to taste these products and participate in their production. You will also visit the Ojo de Agua, where the river that runs through the Tzimol valley and feeds the waterfalls of Las 3 Tzimoleras is born, where you can take a break. During the tuk tuk (motorbike taxi) tour, you will learn about the history of the village, take pictures and enjoy the interactive murals that show the daily life of its inhabitants.

unique_selling_points: ["Community-led initiative by local youth","Exploration of virgin jungle and cenotes","Swimming in multiple cenotes fed by the world's largest underground river","Authentic local stories and anecdotes from guide"]
one_line_summary: Explore pristine cenotes and jungle on a guided biking adventure in Chemuyil.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Bejil Ha
General Description: Title: The Waterway Experience | Description: Today, your local English speaking guide will pick you up at your hotel in Puerto Morelos at 6:30 a.m. with a group of other travellers to begin your 6 and a half hour experience, together you will head to the community of Chemuyil.  Accompanied by your guide and pedalling a bicycle, you will get to know the jungle and the cenotes. This is a project initiated by 5 young people from the community, who want to make known and preserve the place where they used to live and play during their childhood. The initiative allows visitors to explore virgin jungles, discover the fauna and become one with nature. The bike ride is short, it is important that you enjoy swimming in the cenotes. The first one is known locally as La Cuevita; an enclosed cenote where your guide will tell you anecdotes and stories about the place. Next, you will go to an open cenote where you will enjoy some relaxing moments surrounded by the abundant nature where, with a bit of luck, you will be able to observe some of the endemic birds of the Yucatan Peninsula. Finally, you will visit an open cenote of spectacular beauty. All of them are part of a system fed by the largest underground river in the world. At the end of the designated time for the activity, your experience will be over.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Camino del agua - 6.5h - ENG | serviceDescription: Camino del agua | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Quintana Roo
Location: address: Chemuyil, Quintana Roo, México https://goo.gl/maps/sPu44g5EoCQ2taSM8 | locations: Chemuyil

bussines_description:

General Description: Title: Tortilla Crawl: Visit to Teotihuacán and Traditional Barbacoa | Description: Today, you will enjoy a cultural and gastronomic experience lasting approximately eight hours, visiting Teotihuacán, also known as the City of the Gods, and trying a traditional Mexican dish: barbacoa. In the morning, your guide will pick you up to begin the experience. Before arriving at Teotihuacán, you will make a stop to have lamb barbacoa for breakfast, a traditional dish prepared by cooking meat in an underground pit covered with maguey leaves. If you are vegetarian, do not worry, there will be other options for you.

Throughout the day, if you wish and time allows, you may visit the murals in the area or make a stop at the Basilica of Guadalupe. To conclude the experience, you will be taken back to your hotel at the end of the day.

one_line_summary: Explore Guanajuato's rich history and flavors on a guided street food tour.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Cacomixtle
General Description: Title: Historical street food tour in Guanajuato | Description: Today, your local guide in Spanish will take you on a three-hour tour through Guanajuato’s streets and alleys to enjoy and learn about the history, mining, and typical gastronomy of this city; it is in the Mexican Bajío. Discover the variety of dishes offered by its local food stands as long as you listen to characteristic stories of Guanajuato intermingled with the culinary encounter between Europe and America.

You will be able to visit the plazas and esplanades of the city without missing to try the diversity of gastronomic samples that both places can offer. If your diet lets you do so, fulfill your culinary cravings with gorditas, tamales (regional food made from corn), guacamayas (bolillo stuffed with pork skin, also known as chicharrón, and local sauce named pico de gallo), and delight yourself with the best history-gastronomy fusion.

one_line_summary: Nighttime bioluminescence tour in Chacahua Lagoons, Oaxaca
bussines_description:
Supplier: Costa Magia
General Description: Title: Bioluminescence Exploration in the Chacahua Lagoons. | Description: Tonight, your English-speaking guide will pick you up at 7:00 pm at your hotel to take you on a 3-hour experience that can only be witnessed at night. During this time you will have the privilege of witnessing a unique phenomenon generated by millions of microorganisms that form the plankton and that acquires its maximum splendor in the lagoons of Chacahua when the moon hides. Your guide will be with you at all times to explain more about this phenomenon. 
At the end of this experience, transportation will take you back to your hotel.

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to Tehuacán's historic center and Zócalo","Biodiversity and paleontological heritage at Paleoparque","Salt flats and monumental cacti in Biosphere Reserve","Learning about mezcal production"]
one_line_summary: Full-day cultural and natural exploration of Tehuacán Biosphere Reserve and historic Puebla
bussines_description:
Supplier: Unlimited experiences
General Description: Title: Tehuacan Biosphere Reserve | Description: Today, your Spanish-speaking guide will meet you at your hotel in Puebla to begin your approximately 15-hour experience. Together, you will travel to Tehuacán, one of the most important cities in Puebla for its history, culture and traditions. Afterwards, you will visit Paleoparque, a place in charge of protecting the biodiversity and paleontological heritage of the region. You will also visit the botanical garden and Zapotitlán Salinas, popular for its extensive flora and fauna. Next you will visit the mezcal palenque where you will learn a little about this famous drink. Afterwards you will visit the centre of Tehuacán and tour the Zócalo, the Cathedral and the Iglesia del Carmen. Afterwards, you will move on to the Biosphere Reserve and during the trip you will be able to observe the thousands of monumental cacti and mountains of salt flats where the salt extraction process takes place. You will take a walk through the Biosphere Reserve, see more cacti, an ancient sotolin, marine fossils and geological faults. At the end of the tour, you will return to Puebla, be taken back to your hotel and your experience will be over.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Tehuacan Biosphere Reserve - 16h - SPA | serviceDescription: Tehuacan Biosphere Reserve | serviceType: Operadora local, Transporte | destinationName: Puebla Area

General Description: Title: Walk from Destiladeras Beach to Cometa Beach | Description: Embark on a shared hike of approximately 10 hours, along 3 kilometers of beach in the Riviera Nayarit along with your local English-speaking guide and a group of travelers. This activity will take you from Playa Destiladeras to Playa Cometa. During this journey, you will witness diverse landscapes.

On the way, you will reach a highlight: the petrified watchdog. This rock formation will surprise you with its peculiar appearance and will become a lookout point from which you will be able to admire panoramic views. This activity is available during the season from October to June, when conditions are ideal to enjoy the weather and the tranquility of the beaches of the Riviera Nayarit.

unique_selling_points: ["Immersive exploration of Xochimilco's ecological canals and history","Visit to iconic Coyoacán landmarks and architecture","Local gastronomy recommendations","Full-day guided cultural experience"]
one_line_summary: Full-day guided tour exploring Xochimilco's canals and Coyoacán's historic sites
bussines_description:
Supplier: Paola Parra
General Description: Title: The south of Mexico City: A full day in Xochimilco and Coyoacán | Description: Today you will embark on an exhaustive nine-hour excursion, with a local Spanish-speaking guide who will meet you at your hotel to start the day. The starting point will be the Embarcadero de Cuemanco, from where you will enter the ecological canals of Xochimilco. Here you will have the opportunity to visit the lagoon and the island that serves as the stage for the representation of the Llorona, while you immerse yourself in the rich history and culture of Xochimilco, which extends from pre-Hispanic times to the 20th century. The importance of the chinampas in local agriculture will be another highlight of the tour.

The adventure continues to Coyoacán, a neighbourhood that exudes history and culture at every turn. You will visit iconic places such as the Plaza de Santa Catarina, the temple of the same name, and the Casa de Cultura Jesús Reyes Heroles. You will stroll through the Centennial Garden, admire the façade of the Casa de Ordaz, delight in the architecture of the Atrial Arches and the church and convent of San Juan Bautista. The Hidalgo Garden, the Porfirian Kiosk, the Palace of Cortés, the historic Caballo Calco Street, and you will have the chance to explore the cantina on Higuera Street and the 18th century Casa Colorada will not go unnoticed. During the tour, you will have time to enjoy the local gastronomy, with recommendations from your guide to choose the best place to eat. At the end of the day, transportation will be waiting to take you back to your hotel, concluding this experience.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Coyoacán Tour + Xochimilco - SPA | serviceDescription: Coyoacán Tour + Xochimilco | serviceType: Guía | destinationName: Mexico Area
Location: address: Ciudad de México, CDMX, México | locations: Mexico City

unique_selling_points: ["Snorkeling with sea lions and dolphins","Scenic boat ride with views of volcanic rock formations","Historical stops at Pearl Islands"]
one_line_summary: Full-day adventure exploring Espiritu Santo Island's wildlife and landscapes
bussines_description:
Supplier: IES Travel
General Description: Title: Adventure day at Espiritu Santo Island, Baja California Sur | Description: Today, you will visit one of the most representative places of Baja California: Espiritu Santo Island, which is part of a chain of rocky islands that extend southward along the western edge of the Gulf of California. Early in the morning, you will be received at the fiscal dock of the city of La Paz by your guide in Spanish, who will join you with a group of travelers and a crew of a boat; you will receive an explanation of the day"s activity, and you will get a life jacket. The experience begins with a one-and-a-half-hour ride across the leading bay of La Paz to the island, where you can enjoy incredible views.

On arrival, the boat will make some stops at strategic points to learn a little of the Pearl Islands history, so named by Hernán Cortéz. You will appreciate the local fauna, such as birds and turtles, hopefully, sea lions and dolphins. Enjoy the landscape of rock formations formed by alternating layers of lava and volcanic ash; cliffs rise above the turquoise waters, where you will have time to practice snorkeling. You will also visit a beach to enjoy lunch and relax. After a few hours of enjoyment and rest, you will leave for the La Paz pier; where you will finish this experience of approximately eight hours.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Tour to Espí­ritu Santo Island - 8h - SPA | serviceDescription: Tour to Espí­ritu Santo Island | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Baja California Sur

one_line_summary: Leisurely 4-hour ecotourism hike exploring flora, fauna, waterfalls, and streams near Huatulco
bussines_description:
Supplier: Ecoturística Las Ninfas
General Description: Title: Amidst Flora and Fauna: Hiking in Las Ninfas Huatulco | Description: Today, your Spanish-speaking guide will pick you up from your hotel to experience approximately 4 hours and take you to the ecotourism reserve Las Ninfas in the Community of Jabalina, just a 15-minute drive from Huatulco. Your experience will begin at 7:00 am, giving you the opportunity to enjoy the morning bird songs as you explore the area at a leisurely pace.
Las Ninfas is characterized by its lush vegetation and impressive natural surroundings. It features well-maintained trails that allow you to explore and enjoy the diversity of flora and fauna that the area holds. During your visit, you"ll be able to admire the beauty of waterfalls, streams, and natural pools, creating a tranquil and refreshing atmosphere. At the end of the tour, you"ll be taken back to your hotel.

bussines_description:
Supplier: Aura Cocina Mexicana
General Description: Title: Gastronomic class of 4 traditional Mexican dishes. | Description: Today, in the company of your Spanish-speaking guide, you will enjoy a gastronomic class of approximately 3.5 hours in the Colonia Roma Norte in Mexico City. This area of the city is known for its gastronomy and the city"s nightlife, with a wealth of restaurants, entertainment venues and historic buildings. To begin with, you will be warmly welcomed in the kitchen with your choice of fresh water, coffee or herbal tea, depending on your preference. Later on, you will have the opportunity to prepare four traditional dishes: sopes, mextlapiques, mole blanco and pastel de elote, allowing you to discover more about Mexican gastronomy.
Please note that the welcome meal options may vary depending on your arrival time; if you arrive in the afternoon, guacamole and chicharrón will be provided.

unique_selling_points: ["UNESCO marine park protection","Endangered Gulf Grouper sightings","Coral reef ecosystem in Sea of Cortez","Professional Spanish-speaking guide","Includes equipment and safety briefing"]
one_line_summary: Explore the vibrant marine life of Cabo Pulmo with a guided scuba diving adventure.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Cabo Pulmo Travel
General Description: Title: Start your diving experience in Cabo Pulmo | Description: Today you will have a diving experience lasting approximately 9 hours with transportation that will pick you up and join you with a group of travelers either in La Paz or San José del Cabo. Accompanied by your Spanish-speaking guide, who will provide you with the necessary equipment to make your journey as comfortable as possible, you will head towards the Cabo Pulmo reef, where you will spend approximately 3 hours. Before starting the dive, your instructor will give you a 30-minute course to explain everything related to the diving equipment.

The Cabo Pulmo reef is a marine park protected by UNESCO. In addition to hosting 226 species of fish and marine life, it has living corals that form reefs in the Sea of Cortez. It is a refuge for endangered species such as the Gulf Grouper, which you can see during this experience. After finishing this activity, you will be taken back to your hotel.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Discover scuba - 9h - SPA | serviceDescription: Discover scuba | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Baja California Sur

unique_selling_points: ["Mythical origin of Mexcaltitlán as Aztlán","Visit to emblematic mural 'Nuestras Raíces'","Cultural and historical insights into Mexica heritage","Authentic local cuisine on the island"]
one_line_summary: Discover Mexcaltitlán, the mythic cradle of Mexicanness, on this immersive cultural tour.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Nayarit Adventures
General Description: Title: Exploring Nayarit: From Santiago Ixcuintla to the Mythical Island of Mexcaltitán | Description: Your approximately 7-hour shared adventure begins when your transportation picks you up at your hotel to take you to the Municipality of Santiago Ixcuintla, Nayarit. To begin, your local Spanish-speaking guide will give you a thematic talk about the ecotourism and cultural activities that take place in the area. Once you arrive in Santiago Ixcuintla, you will visit the emblematic Mexican mosaic mural known as Nuestras Raíces (Our Roots). Here, your guide will explain the meaning behind this work of art. 

Then, you will head to the pier to set sail for Mexcaltitán Island. Upon arrival, you will walk through its streets, admiring its church and visiting its museum, where your guide will tell you about the history of the island, considered the mythical Aztlan, from where the Mexica people departed in search of their destiny with the symbol of the eagle devouring a snake on a nopal cactus. Part of this historical explanation will take place inside the museum itself. Afterwards, you will head to one of the most renowned restaurants on the island, where you will enjoy a meal. Once satisfied, you will return to Tepic.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Mexcaltitlán Island Tour: Cradle of Mexicanness - 7h - SPA | serviceDescription: Mexcaltitlán Island Tour: Cradle of Mexicanness | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Nayarit
Location: address: Sebastián Lerdo de Tejada Pte. 23, Centro, 63000 Tepic, Nay. | locations: Puerto Vallarta

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to iconic Maya archaeological site of Palenque","Exploration of stunning Agua Azul waterfalls with vibrant blue waters","Relaxing experience at Misol-Ha waterfall with photo opportunities"]
one_line_summary: Full-day tour exploring Maya ruins, waterfalls, and natural beauty of Chiapas
bussines_description:
Supplier: Consultora Turística de Chiapas
General Description: Title: Tour of Palenque and the Milso-Ha and Agua Azul Waterfalls with DO in SCC | Description: Today, you will embark on a tour lasting approximately 14:30 hours, exploring the treasures of the Maya world. You will meet early with your Spanish-speaking guide and a group of fellow travelers to visit the archaeological site of Palenque, also known as Lakamha ('place of the great waters'). You will discover emblematic structures such as the Temple of the Skull, the Tomb of the Red Queen, the Temple of the Inscriptions, the Palace, the aqueduct, the Group of the Crosses, the Ball Game, and the Bath of the Queen. The adventure continues at Misol-ha Waterfall, an impressive 35-meter drop, perfect for taking photos and enjoying the tranquility and beauty of the location. Next, you will visit the Agua Azul waterfalls, formed by the limestone bed of the Tulijá River descending in steps, creating intense blue waterfalls and natural pools. You can walk along the riverbank, swim in its waters, enjoy the breeze, appreciate the surrounding vegetation, or listen to the relaxing sound of water. You will end your day with transportation back to the magical town of San Cristóbal de las Casas.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: AS Palenque, Agua Azul & Misol Ha - 12h - SPA | serviceDescription: AS Palenque, Agua Azul & Misol Ha | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Chiapas
Location: address: Palenque, Chiapas, México | locations: Palenque

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to the cradle of Mexican independence","Exploration of Baroque art jewel in America","Historical sites linked to Father Hidalgo","Taste of Dolores ice cream","Cultural immersion in historic towns"]
one_line_summary: Discover Mexico's independence history in Dolores Hidalgo and Atotonilco
bussines_description:
Supplier: Coyote Canyon Adventures
General Description: Title: Dolores Hidalgo and the Sanctuary of Atotonilco | Description: This tour is called The first steps of Father Hidalgo. (The experience begins in San Miguel de Allende where your local Spanish-speaking guide will pick you up and drive you for an hour to the town of Dolores Hidalgo known for being the cradle of Mexico's independence. Accompanied by a group of travelers you will walk through the historic center visiting its most emblematic places such as the Parish of Our Lady of Dolores, the Casa de Hidalgo Museum and the Museum of Independence. Here you will have the opportunity to taste the famous Dolores ice cream. 

On the way back to San Miguel de Allende, you will visit the Sanctuary of Atotonilco, considered one of the jewels of baroque art in America, an emblematic place because it was here where Father Miguel Hidalgo took the banner with the image of the Virgin of Guadalupe and started the fight for Independence.  Finally you will return to San Miguel de Allende. This experience lasts approximately 6 hours.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Atotonilco and Dolores Hidalgo - 6h - SPA | serviceDescription: Atotonilco and Dolores Hidalgo | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Guanajuato Area
Location: address: Zacateros 54, Zona Centro, 37700 San Miguel de Allende, Gto. | locations: San Miguel de Allende

unique_selling_points: ["Bioluminescent sea experience","Stargazing in Holbox","Easy paddle suitable for all"]
one_line_summary: Kayak under the stars and bioluminescent sea in Holbox for a magical night
bussines_description:
Supplier: VIP Holbox
General Description: Title: Kayaking under the stars in Holbox Island | Description: Today you will have the opportunity to marvel at the magic of Holbox's night sky, the bioluminescence of its sea, the celestial vault and the great amount of stars and stars that can be seen on a clear night, in a 2 hour shared tour.

The meeting point with your local Spanish-speaking guide will be on a beach where you will get into the kayaks and start paddling while you get away from the noise and lights of the town. It is a short and easy paddle (no experience necessary). After a short time you will feel the immensity of the sky and the sea around you. You will observe the sky and look for constellations, clusters and galaxies. If you are lucky, you may even see a shooting star! Then you will look for another type of glow, but this time in the sea: those caused by the plankton that, when agitated, makes the sea light up drawing the outlines of what moves it. You can get out of the kayak and enjoy the grandeur that surrounds you and feel small before the universe. If you wish, you can swim before returning, guided by the lights of the town. A wonderful experience.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Kayaking under the stars - 2h (before 12:00am) - SPA | serviceDescription: Kayaking under the stars | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Quintana Roo
Location: address: Av Damero, Centro, 77310 Holbox, Q.R. | locations: Isla Holbox

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to Monte Alban with detailed exploration of Mayan and Zapotec ruins","Witnessing Alebrije carving and painting workshops","Experience at Cuilapam's 16th-century monastery","Hands-on learning at Doña Rosa's Black Pottery Workshop"]
one_line_summary: Discover Oaxaca's rich history and artisan crafts in a full-day cultural tour.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Etnoturística
General Description: Title: Explore the history and crafts of Oaxaca through Monte Alban, Arrazola, Cuilapam and Coyotepec. | Description: Today, your English-speaking guide will pick you up to join a group of travellers and explore historically significant places in Oaxaca for approximately 9 hours. Your first stop will be at the Monte Albán Archaeological Zone, located south of Oaxaca, surrounded by mountains and valleys. You will tour the North Platform and the Great Plaza, paying special attention to the Gallery of the Dancers and the ball game, among other impressive buildings.


You will then continue to the community of Arrazola, a town known for its workshops dedicated to the carving and painting of Alebrijes, where you can witness their history and production process. After a 20-minute transfer, you will arrive in Cuilapam, where you will visit the 16th-century Ex Monastery of Santiago Cuilapam. Finally, after a break, your tour will conclude with a visit to Doña Rosa's Black Pottery Workshop in Coyotepec, where you will learn about its history and the production process of this famous product. Return to Oaxaca.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Monte Alban, Arrazola, Cuilapam & Coyotepec - 7h - ENG | serviceDescription: Monte Alban, Arrazola, Cuilapam & Coyotepec | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Oaxaca

unique_selling_points: ["Seven-hour panoramic mountain hike in Baja California Sur","Exploration of abandoned mines and desert flora","Spectacular views of La Ventana Bay and La Paz City","Guided experience with local Spanish-speaking guide"]
one_line_summary: Seven-hour mountain hike with panoramic views and canyon exploration in Baja California Sur
bussines_description:
Supplier: Rancho Cacachilas
General Description: Title: A walk through a path to The Sierra Cacachilas in Baja California Sur | Description: Today, your local guide in Spanish will wait for you at the meeting point to join a group of travelers and go on a walk of approximately seven hours through a simple but steep path to the highest part of The Sierra Cacachilas, where the guide will give you security recommendations, the climb time, and the first part distance. During the climb, you will walk among stones, drover’s road, and some forgotten mines’ remains; and you will see many plants and Baja California Sur dry forest’s characteristic cactus. When you reach the path’s summit, you will have a panoramic view of La Ventana Bay to the east and La Paz City to the west; you can climb some giant granite stones and take selfies and photos. Next, you will eat a snack and take a break before descending, as long as you appreciate the flora and the canyons. Finally, you will return to the vehicles for a drive to El Gaspareño and eat lunch.

This purification ceremony of approximately 4 hours, gives you the opportunity to reconnect with yourself and your ancestors.

As you immerse yourself in the steam baths, you will feel your tensions and worries melt away, leaving space for tranquility and emotional balance. This authentic experience will fill you with positive energies and prepare you to walk a new path, charged with vitality and spiritual connection.

one_line_summary: Explore Puebla's vibrant offerings tradition with market visits and historic altars.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Puebla de ensueño
General Description: Title: Offering Corridor Experience in Cholula | Description: Today, you will meet with your English-speaking guide to begin your approximately 3.5-hour experience. Together, you will visit a lively and colorful local market where you can find a variety of traditional elements used in offerings, such as marigold flowers, candles, sugar skulls, and typical foods. Your guide will tell you about the history and importance of this Mexican tradition that honors deceased loved ones. Next, you will tour the Historic Center of Puebla to visit squares and streets adorned with altars and offerings created by the community and local merchants, each altar telling a unique story. Additionally, you will be able to taste typical sweets and the traditional pan de muerto. With that, your experience will be complete, and you can return to your hotel.

unique_selling_points: ["Unique circular pyramids (Guachimontones)","Visit to a traditional family tequila distillery","Stunning views of Tequila Volcano","Authentic Mexican cultural experience in Tequila town"]
one_line_summary: Explore Guachimontones pyramids, tequila distillery, and Tequila town in Jalisco.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Sensaciones Turísticas
General Description: Title: Tequila Route and Agavero Landscape with family distillery visit. | Description: Today, with your local Spanish-speaking guide and a group of travelers you will visit the enigmatic archaeological zone of Guachimontones and the magical town of Tequila. Your first stop will be Teuchitlán, considered by some researchers as one of the most important findings of western archaeology in Mesoamerica for having circular pyramids, better known as Guachimontones, these structures are unique, as to date no other pyramids with this type of architecture have been found anywhere else in the world.

Afterwards, you will head to the Magical Town of Tequila, but first, you will visit a family tequila factory to learn about its famous production process, here you can also admire the wonderful views of the agave landscape, as well as the Tequila Volcano, which with its height of 2,900 meters dominates the entire region. Finally, you will visit the Magical Town of Tequila where you will have free time to stroll through its picturesque streets and enjoy the lifestyle around the tequila culture, where the natural and cultural attractions emblematic of Mexican culture stand out. Duration: 9 hours.

bussines_description:
Supplier: Etnoturística
General Description: Title: Walk through Oaxaca's colourful streets | Description: Today, you will have a 3-hour walking tour through the colourful streets of Oaxaca in a group of travellers accompanied by a local guide in English. The tour will start early, and you will visit the main attractions of the city, including the 16th and 17th-century aqueduct, the old Seminary of Santa Cruz, the façade of the Casa Juarez, the Templo del Carmen, the Plaza de Santo Domingo, the former Convent of Santa Catalina de Siena, the Calle de Alcala, the beautiful Cathedral with its baroque façade and the Chapel of the much revered Señor del Rayo. You will also stroll through the Alameda and Constitution squares, where you can visit the Benito Juarez and 20 de Noviembre markets and enjoy the colours, aromas and flavours of the most representative products of the Oaxacan gastronomy. You will also visit a chocolate factory to learn about the traditional way of elaborating  Oaxacan chocolate.

one_line_summary: Discover Tlaquepaque's artisan traditions, history, and sweets in an immersive 5-hour tour
bussines_description:
Supplier: Sensaciones Turísticas
General Description: Title: Tlaquepaque: Artisan's route | Description: Today, with your local Spanish-speaking guide, you will visit the Magical Town of Tlaquepaque, a destination that offers travelers diverse gastronomic, artistic, cultural and traditional options that are still alive, through a tour of its neighborhoods to learn about its history, colonial architecture, stories and unique anecdotes, hidden in the corners of its mansions, You will also visit the most representative artisan workshops, where you will become part of this activity by becoming an apprentice, guided by the master artisans who for several generations have preserved this tradition, and you will learn the process of creating pieces in the different traditional techniques of this town.

You will also visit the Mexican sweet shop, where you will delight yourself with the sweet tradition of the aromas, textures and flavors of the most representative sweets of this region, learning about the process of making 100% handmade rompope, chocolate, marzipan, cocada, cajeta and many other delicacies. Duration: 5 hours

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to iconic Hotel California","Transparent boat tour of Los Cabos Arch","Tequila tasting experience","Combination of cultural, natural, and culinary highlights"]
one_line_summary: Comprehensive 12-hour tour exploring Los Cabos' culture, natural beauty, and cuisine
bussines_description:
Supplier: Choya Tours
General Description: Title: Tour of the Jewels of Los Cabos | Description: Today, you will take an 12-hour tour alongside another group of travelers. Accompanied by your local guide who speaks English, you will explore the Magical Town of Todos Santos and visit the Hotel California, renowned for the song of the same name by the rock band The Eagles. You will stroll through its streets, artisan shops, small squares, and art galleries. Afterwards, you will visit Cabo San Lucas, a destination globally recognized for its natural beauty, beaches, and water and adventure activities. Observing the city will give you an idea of how life is in this region.

You will continue the day with a tour on a fully transparent boat to admire the famous Arch of Los Cabos up close. You will walk along the Beach of Love and the Beach of Divorce, and witness rock formations such as the Inverted Peninsula and the Witch. You will also explore the beautiful marina of Cabo San Lucas. Later, you will head to a restaurant to recharge and savor authentic Mexican dishes.

The tour will proceed with a visit to a tequila house, where you will learn about the traditional process of tequila production and have the opportunity to taste it (for adults only). The final stop will be in San José del Cabo, a destination where you will visit La Misión de San José del Cabo, a historic site founded by the Jesuits. Additionally, you will pass by its main square, explore more art galleries, and browse through artisan shops to take home a memento from the Baja Sur region.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Los Cabos Tour - 12h - ENG | serviceDescription: Los Cabos Tour | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Baja California Sur
Location: address: José María Morelos y Pavón 260, Zona Central, 23000 La Paz, B.C.S. | locations: La Paz

unique_selling_points: ["Exploration of bohemian Coyoacán neighborhood","Visit to Museo Nacional de las Culturas Populares with diverse exhibits","Opportunity to taste local churros and ice cream","Chance to purchase authentic handicrafts and culinary products"]
one_line_summary: Discover Coyoacán's charm and Mexico's vibrant popular culture in a 5-hour guided tour
bussines_description:
Supplier: Pablo Yuichi
General Description: Title: Explore Coyoacán and its museum of popular cultures | Description: Embark on a fascinating 5-hour experience through the charming southern area of Mexico City. You will begin your tour when your English-speaking guide will pick you up and take you to the bohemian neighborhood of Coyoacán, a picturesque place with its cobblestone streets and colonial architecture. As you explore this neighborhood, you will marvel at churches, plazas and gardens. You can"t miss the opportunity to taste the typical churros and ice cream of the area.

Next stop is the Museo Nacional de las Culturas Populares, where you can immerse yourself in temporary exhibits that showcase the work of different artists. In addition, a bazaar is often set up in the museum"s esplanade, where you might find a wide variety of handicrafts from different states, ranging from textiles and jewelry to home ornaments. If you"re lucky, you may also come across culinary exhibits, where you can purchase tamales, mole, coffee and even mezcal. Don"t miss the impressive tree of life located at the entrance of the museum, where the main characters of the conquest and those related to the discovery of America are exhibited.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Coyoacan + Museum of popular cultures - 5 h - ENG | serviceDescription: Coyoacan + Museum of popular cultures | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Mexico Area
Location: address: Ciudad de México, CDMX, México | locations: Mexico City

one_line_summary: Guided educational tour of Mexico's Museum of Anthropology in Mexico City
bussines_description:
Supplier: José Esquivel
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Guided visit to the Museum of Anthropology - 4h - FRA | serviceDescription: Guided visit to the Museum of Anthropology | serviceType: Guía | destinationName: Mexico Area

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to one of Latin America's most important museums","Climb to historic Chapultepec Castle with panoramic views","Learn about Mexico's rich indigenous and colonial history"]
one_line_summary: Explore Mexico's rich history at the Museum of Anthropology and Chapultepec Castle.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Pablo Yuichi
General Description: Title: Visit the Museum of Anthropology and Chapultepec Castle | Description: Today you will have a guided tour of approximately 5 hours. First you will visit the Museum of Anthropology, one of the most important museums in Latin America and the world. It was built in the 1960s by architect Pedro Ramirez Vasquez and has 22 rooms designed to preserve Mexico's rich indigenous heritage. Accompanied by your English-speaking guide, you will tour the museum's main collections while learning about the history of pre-Hispanic cultures and appreciating some of the most important pieces of pre-Columbian Mexico such as the Aztec Calendar, the Olmec Colossal Head, and the famous Mask of Pakal. 

Your second stop of the day will be the majestic Chapultepec Castle surrounded by a forest of the same name, one of the largest green areas of the Aztec capital. You will start with a walk through the forest and then start climbing up to the castle located at the top of the hill. The castle was built in 1785 as the residence of the viceroy of New Spain and was later remodeled to be the home of Emperor Maximilian and Empress Carlota. In 1939 it became the National Museum of History with a magnificent collection of historical pieces and murals with interpretations of the history of Mexico. From the top there are beautiful views of the forest and the city.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Anthropology Museum & Chapultepec Castle - 5h - ENG | serviceDescription: Anthropology Museum & Chapultepec Castle | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Mexico Area
Location: address: Ciudad de México, CDMX, México | locations: Mexico City

unique_selling_points: ["Exploration of one of the world's largest underground river systems","Guided tour through flooded caves with geological formations","Combination of adventure, nature, and educational experience","Includes traditional regional buffet lunch","Convenient pickup and drop-off from Puerto Morelos"]
one_line_summary: Explore the stunning underground river system of Río Secreto with guided adventure and regional meal
bussines_description:
Supplier: Río secreto
General Description: Title: Rio Secreto: The Mayan underworld | Description: Today, your transportation will pick you up in Puerto Morelos to join a group of travelers. You will experience a 7-hour adventure (including transportation time) at Río Secreto, a natural reserve located just minutes away from Playa del Carmen, in the heart of the Riviera Maya. Your local guide, who speaks English, will be waiting for you at the meeting point to explore one of the world's largest underground river systems, where the history of our planet is written in thousands of geological formations. Floating in its clear, freshwater is an experience you will cherish for a lifetime.

Your guide will explain everything about the walls and formations in this marvelous geological library as you explore various flooded caves, some where you can walk and others where you'll need to swim. After the tour is completed, a traditional buffet lunch with a variety of regional dishes awaits you. Once the meal is finished, your transportation will take you back to your hotel in Puerto Morelos.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Rí­o secreto - ENG | serviceDescription: Rí­o secreto | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Quintana Roo
Location: address: RÍO SECRETO, Playa del Carmen, Q.R., México | locations: Playa del Carmen

bussines_description:
Supplier: Tuskán Santuario de Vida
General Description: Title: Tsukán - Legendary Experience | Description: Today, you will visit Tsukan, a place renowned for its history and natural scenery. Your experience will begin with a welcome ceremony with copal at the healing tree. Afterwards, you will swim in the semi-open cenote of Tsukán and visit the Mayan house to learn about its various characteristic objects. You will also have the opportunity to participate in the Yucatan flavours workshop, where you will be able to make your own recado (typical local dish). Afterwards, you will enjoy a meal at the Tsukán restaurant based on a three-course menu with a natural drink included. You will also have access to the bar, the picnic area and the snack and souvenir shop.

unique_selling_points: ["Climb Mexico's fourth highest mountain, Xinantécatl","Explore indigenous cosmovision related to water","Visit the Lakes of the Sun and the Moon at the summit","Choose between lagoon or summit routes for varied experiences","Guided by local English-speaking expert"]
one_line_summary: Conquer Mexico's fourth highest mountain with cultural insights and stunning views
bussines_description:
Supplier: Expediciones Amanalco
General Description: Title: Hiking on Mexico's fourth highest mountain: Xinantécatl | Description: We invite you to explore Xinantécatl, the fourth highest mountain in Mexico, which rises 4,680 meters above sea level. On this approximately 6-hour hike, you will have the opportunity to discover the indigenous cosmovision related to the element of water. At the summit of Xinantécatl, you will find the Lakes of the Sun and the Moon. Immerse yourself in this experience in the company of your local English-speaking guide.

For your adventure, you will be able to choose between two routes. The lagoon route will take you to explore the aquatic landscapes, where you will be able to admire the lakes. On the other hand, the Pico del Aguila route will challenge you to the heights of the mountain, offering panoramic views. This experience will allow you to immerse yourself in nature and connect with the Xinantécatl mountain.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Climb to the Nevado de Toluca - 10h - ENG | serviceDescription: Climb to the Nevado de Toluca | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Estado de Mexico

bussines_description:

General Description: Title: Temazcal & traditional extraction | Description: Guided by specialists in ceremonies and activities of traditional Mayan medicine and your English guide, you will delve into the rescue and dissemination of ancestral culture, while immersing yourself in steam baths with natural herbs in the heart of the jungle. This purification ceremony of approximately 4 hours, gives you the opportunity to reconnect with yourself and your ancestors.

As you immerse yourself in the steam baths, you will feel your tensions and worries melt away, leaving space for tranquility and emotional balance. This experience will fill you with positive energies and prepare you to walk a new path, charged with vitality and spiritual connection.

unique_selling_points: ["Only reef system in Gulf of California","UNESCO World Heritage Site","Diverse marine species including sea turtles and sea lions","Educational experience on ecosystem conservation"]
one_line_summary: Snorkeling in Cabo Pulmo's unique coral reefs and marine biodiversity.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Cabo Pulmo Water Sports
General Description: Title: Cabo Pulmo snorkeling experience. | Description: Today you will experience a snorkeling activity in Cabo Pulmo National Park of approximately 2 hrs 30 min. You will meet your Spanish speaking guide at the meeting point to go to this park where you will find the only reefs of the Gulf of California and Sea of Cortez, as well as a great diversity of species. Cabo Pulmo is a natural protected area designated as a UNESCO World Natural Heritage Site, important for the conservation of oceans and hard coral reefs.

You will board a boat to begin your tour, where you will learn about marine life and the importance of ecosystem conservation. You will make different stops for snorkeling such as Las Navajas reef, where you will appreciate the white coral. You will also visit Chopitos and Carrizal, areas with shallow depths where you will have a better experience observing the white coral and hard coral. In Carrizal you will have the chance to see sea turtles. With a little luck you will be able to visit the sea lions colony, sometimes they can be seen during mating season.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Snorkel - 2.5h - SPA | serviceDescription: Snorkel | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Baja California Sur
Location: address: Acceso a la playa s/n, 23574 Cabo Pulmo, B.C.S. | locations: Cabo Pulmo

You will visit the pantheon, participate in ofrendas elaboration, and then move to the cave/cenote that a shaman used for the Day of the Dead Mayan rite making as long as he shares music, sings, a campfire, etc. Finally, you will return to the central plaza and lead to the community’s dome for dinner. Note: Guide services have an extra cost.

one_line_summary: Explore Chiapas' stunning Sumidero Canyon with scenic viewpoints and wildlife.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Consultora Turística de Chiapas
General Description: Title: Sumidero Canyon landscapes in Chiapas | Description: Today, you will take a tour of approximately five hours accompanied by your local guide in Spanish and other travelers to see Tuxtla Gutiérrez sights through the descent towards Cahuaré Dock. Immediately, you will board a motorboat that will lead you to the Sumidero Canyon, a natural formation with walls reaching as high as 800 m; its walls formation occurred about 136 million years ago. You will see waterfalls, caves made by nature throughout the years, and representative flora and fauna of this place. In a vehicle, you will travel to the Sumidero Canyon viewpoints, a chance to know this place from the heights. If available, you will visit five different viewpoints and stop at them. Appreciate your surroundings from different perspectives and surprise yourself with what this place's natural landscapes and wild sounds can offer.

unique_selling_points: ["Hiking to the summit of active volcano Popocatepetl","Panoramic views of the Valley of Mexico","Legend of the volcanoes explained by a local guide"]
one_line_summary: Full-day mountain hike to Izta-Popo volcanoes with panoramic views and legend insights
bussines_description:
Supplier: Unlimited experiences
General Description: Title: Hike to the Izta-Popo | Description: Today your transportation will pick you up from your hotel in Cholula and, accompanied by a local English-speaking guide, you will head to the Iztaccihuatl - Popocatepetl National Park on a 12-hour tour. Upon arrival at the park, located at an altitude of 3,500 metres, your guide will provide you with detailed information about the national park and the legend of the volcanoes. From this point, you will be able to enjoy views of the volcanoes, Popocatepetl being one of them, still listed as an active volcano. After checking in, you will head by transport to La Joyita, the last available car park to start the hike along the route of the portillos where the altitude will be 3,900 meters. It is at this point that the exciting hike begins, which will take you through different portillos, reaching a maximum altitude of 4,524 metres. From there, you will be able to appreciate the impressive valley of Mexico and marvel at the nature that surrounds both volcanoes. After enjoying the panoramic views, you will begin your descent back to the meeting point where your transport will be waiting to take you back to your hotel.
