unique_selling_points: ["Only active pearl farm in the Caribbean","Authentic family-owned operation","Speed-snorkeling experience in artificial reef","Educational tour on pearl cultivation"]
one_line_summary: Discover Caribbean pearls and marine life on a relaxing Cozumel island tour
bussines_description:
Supplier: Cozumel Pearl Farm
General Description: Title: Tour and snorkel at the Cozumel Pearl Farm. | Description: Today, you will join a group of travelers for a tour of approximately 6 hours at the Cozumel Pearl Farm. Your English-speaking guide will meet you at the Puerto de Abrigo from where you will take a boat called La Ostra. You will start the tour to an island that belongs to a family owned and operated pearl farm where they grow and process pearls. This is the only active pearl farm in the Caribbean, here you can relax in the pleasant natural environment while enjoying the scenery, the turquoise water, the white sand, the coral reefs and of course the breeze and fresh air, all this away from the crowds and cruise ships. 
During this tour you will learn about the oyster cultivation process, the patience involved and see some of the first pearls from the farm, you will also visit the laboratory where the experts will show you the process and answer any questions you may have. Afterwards you will go snorkeling at the oyster farm on an artificial reef to experience the unique experience of Speed-Snorkeling where you will be able to see many fish and sea fans in a coral formation. Finally, you will enjoy the lunch included in this experience and then have free time to relax in a hammock, walk or swim in this paradise. At the end, the boat will take you back to Puerto de Abrigo.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Cozumel pearl farm tour - 6h - ENG | serviceDescription: Cozumel pearl farm tour | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Quintana Roo

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to bird sanctuary with diverse bird species","Walk along pristine Passion Island beach","Experience diving in natural freshwater spring"]
one_line_summary: Explore Holbox's islands with bird watching, pristine beaches, and freshwater springs.
bussines_description:
Supplier: VIP Holbox
General Description: Title: Tour 3 islands in Holbox. | Description: Today, you will join a group of travelers for an adventure of approximately 3hrs on 3 different islands in Holbox. You will meet your English speaking guide at the meeting point at 10 am to head to the first stop; *Birds Island; it is a protected sanctuary and is just a bird watching place, where you can find a diversity of birds such as frigate birds, white ibis, snowy egrets, white and gray pelicans, wood storks and if the season allows, flamingos. Afterwards, you will head to Passion Island, where you will walk along this virgin beach, with white sand and crystal clear waters, full of bushes and a lookout point where you will be able to observe your surroundings. To continue with the adventure, you will visit the protected area of Yalahau, where you can dive wearing a life jacket in the fresh water spring that gushes from the bottom.

Note:*This destination can be changed to Punta Mosquito if you discuss it with the tour leader.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Classic 3 island tour - 3h - ENG | serviceDescription: Classic 3 island tour | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Quintana Roo

unique_selling_points: ["Community-based ecotourism focus","Floating experience in crystalline waters","Visit to little-known archaeological site of Muyil","Integration with local community and traditional meal"]
one_line_summary: Float through mangroves and explore Muyil in Sian Ka'an Biosphere Reserve
bussines_description:
Supplier: Community Tours Sian Ka’an
General Description: Title: Float in the Muyil Sian Ka'an Biosphere Reserve | Description: Today you will visit the Sian Ka'an Biosphere Reserve, which in Mayan means place where the sky is born. When you arrive at the Muyil community center, you will have a light snack and join a group of travelers and your local Spanish-speaking guide to begin the approximately 5-hour excursion. This community-based ecotourism cooperative focuses on the conservation and preservation of ecosystems by promoting unique experiences with a commitment to responsible tourism.

Your first stop will be at the little known and mysterious archaeological site of Muyil, which you will reach at the end of an interpretative trail surrounded by jungle. You will walk to the shore of the Chunyaxche lagoon and its wonderful turquoise color, where you will take a small boat to pass through a channel of crystalline waters with mangroves on each side, arriving at a small dock. From there, you will jump into the river, a relaxing experience in contact with nature! It is a moment of reconnection, as you float slowly through the channels you will feel the tranquility of your surroundings with the sounds of local birds and the gentle current of water that will make you live a unique moment. At the end, you will return to the community center walking along a trail. You will be welcomed with a traditional meal to complete the excursion.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Muyil Forest & Float - 6h - SPA | serviceDescription: Muyil Forest & Float | serviceType: Centro Ecoturístico | destinationName: Quintana Roo
Location: address: Community tours Sian Ka'an Muyil, Chunyaxché, Quintana Roo, México | locations: Tulum

Finally, before eating and taking your return transportation that will leave you in Mérida, you will go to Uxmal, a city where the Mayan people reached an exceptional architectural level.

unique_selling_points: ["UNESCO World Heritage Site","Authentic pre-Hispanic agricultural system","Biofilter refuge for endemic species","Hands-on demonstration of traditional farming"]
one_line_summary: Discover Xochimilco's ancient chinampas and endemic species on a cultural boat tour
bussines_description:
Supplier: OlinTlalli
General Description: Title: Demonstrative chinampa on a conventional trajinera | Description: Today, you will visit Xochimilco on a 3-hour tour to learn about the pre-Hispanic agricultural system that still operates today: the Chinampas. With your local guide, who speaks Spanish, you will head to the Xochimilco docks, which means Place of Flowers. This is a system of canals divided by small artificial islands called chinampas, which was declared a World Heritage Site by UNESCO in 1987.

You will enjoy a two-hour ride (one hour each way) on a conventional trajinera. During the journey, your guide will tell you about the history of the canals, the endemic species, and the challenges involved in maintaining these canals today. You will arrive at a chinampa, covering just over 3 hectares, nestled in the Protected Natural Area Ejidos of Xochimilco and San Gregorio Atlapulco. There, you will receive a theoretical and practical explanation of the steps followed to produce all kinds of vegetables. Later on, you will tour the planting area, concluding with an explanation of the biofilter, which also serves as a refuge for the region"s endemic species, the Axolotl. Upon completing the explanation, you will return to the dock and then to your hotel.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Demonstrative Chinampa - 2h - SPA | serviceDescription: Demonstrative Chinampa | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Mexico Area
Location: address: Xochimilco, CDMX, México | locations: Mexico City

unique_selling_points: ["Visit to one of Mexico's most iconic archaeological sites","Climb the Pyramid of the Sun for panoramic views","Guided tour with expert local guide"]
one_line_summary: Explore the ancient wonder of Teotihuacan with expert guidance in a full-day cultural experience
bussines_description:
Supplier: Pablo Yuichi
General Description: Title: Explore the archaeological site of Teotihuacan | Description: Today you will have a 5 hour experience to one of the most important archaeological sites in Mexico. Your local English-speaking guide will pick you up and take you to Teotihuacan, also known as The City of the Gods and recognized as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. 

You will walk along the famous Calzada de los Muertos and visit the most emblematic buildings such as the Palace of Quetzalpapalotl famous for its murals and pillars; the 42-meter high Pyramid of the Moon and the Pyramid of the Sun. To reach the top of the latter it is necessary to climb its 365 steps, one for each day of the year, from here you have a wonderful view of the archaeological site and the Valley of Teotihuacan.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Teotihuacan Archaeological Site - 7h - ENG | serviceDescription: Teotihuacan Archaeological Site | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Mexico Area
Location: address: Ciudad de México, CDMX, México | locations: Mexico City

unique_selling_points: ["Exploration of a virgin cenote with crystal-clear waters","Visit to a historic Maya cave with impressive geological features","Engagement with local community projects supporting Maya culture and environment"]
one_line_summary: Explore cenotes, caves, and Maya culture in a full-day adventure in Yucatán.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Ta Náayta
General Description: Title: Unknown cenote, crafts worshop & bees | Description: Today, your local guide in English will take you on a tour of approximately two hours to visit a Yucatecan community in the heart of the southern Mexico Maya jungle; the initiative is a local association that supports the Yalcoba Maya community through cultural and natural heritage conservation programs. While you stay at this place, we will offer you a visit to different local and environmental projects, which take place in collaboration with the partners; from a different perspective, you will learn about the Maya territory richness and the related culture far away from any folklore. A daydreaming day full of magic and learning.

The day starts by visiting a unique place within the community; you will discover an open cenote with biodiversity richness and unmeasurable charm. During this experience, you will appreciate the outstanding biodiversity accompanied by birds singing, which will be the entrance to cenotes cycle comprehension. The first site is a little-water cenote in its final life cycle stage, surrounded by vegetation and in a relaxing environment. After that, you will go down into the Yucatán Peninsula depths: you will visit a cave rich in history, with impressive dimensions and full of remarkable geological structures; enjoy this place’s silence and calm. The next step is a trip to the underground world (Xibalba), where you will go down into a virgin cenote only for refreshment; feel the strength of this place that will let you swim as long as you look up to sunlight rays reflected in this crystal water body. This activity requires physical conditioning, a sense of adventure, and not being afraid of heights.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Unknown cenote, crafts worshop & bees - 6h - ENG | serviceDescription: Unknown cenote, crafts worshop & bees | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Yucatan
Location: address: C 1 X 6 y 6 A, 97794 Yalcobá, Yuc. | locations: Yalcobá

unique_selling_points: ["Hands-on traditional Mayan craft","Participation in local cultural preservation","Take-home handcrafted souvenir"]
one_line_summary: Participate in a traditional Mayan jícara engraving workshop in Yucatán.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Mun Ha Chac Lol
General Description: Title: Jícara workshop in Mun-ha, Yucatán | Description: Today, your local guide in English will wait for you at the meeting point to introduce you to this interesting project of approximately one hour and a half, where the locals seek the conservation of nature and traditional Mayan culture. Here, the members of this community will invite you to participate in a workshop on jicara engraving, a fruit that is grown in the Yucatán peninsula and was used to store food or water in ancient times. You will be surprised to see the different types of crafts that can be made with the natural fruit. You will test your manual and artistic skills as well as your creativity so that at the end you will be able to take home a handicraft made by yourself.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Lec workshop - 1.5h - ENG | serviceDescription: Lec workshop | serviceType: Centro Ecoturístico | destinationName: Yucatan
Location: address: Muna, Yuc., México | locations: Muná

unique_selling_points: ["Spectacular limestone waterfalls","Natural swimming pools in indigo waters","Visit to iconic waterfalls of Chiapas","Guided tour with local expert","Relaxing and scenic nature experience"]
one_line_summary: Explore stunning waterfalls and natural pools in Chiapas with a guided full-day tour
bussines_description:
Supplier: Consultora Turística de Chiapas
General Description: Title: Agua Azul and Misol Ha | Description: Today, you will start very early in the morning. Your local guide in Spanish will pick you up at your hotel before sunrise and take you to the route to the city of Palenque. After two hours before reaching the first site of the day, you will have a stop to have breakfast. Already at the destination, you will know the Tulijá river that descends in its limestone bed by steps forming a series of impressive waterfalls that create natural pools contained by limestone dams, and thus give shape to the famous waterfalls of Agua Azul. You will have an average time of two hours to walk along the river or take a refreshing swim in its indigo blue waters, enjoy the breeze, appreciate the green of the surrounding vegetation or listen to the relaxing sound of the water that makes this place one of the most spectacular in Chiapas.

After the visit to this magical place, you will continue the route for an hour until you reach the Misol-ha waterfall, a waterfall of thirty-five meters high. The stay at this site will be fifty minutes on average but will give you time to take some pictures or enjoy the tranquility and beauty of the place. For the final part of this experience of approximately ten hours, you will continue for forty-five minutes more on the road until you reach the city of Palenque. Your guide will drop you off at your hotel and you will have the afternoon free to stroll around or have dinner at the place of your choice.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Misol Ha & Agua Azul - 8h | serviceDescription: Misol Ha & Agua Azul | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Chiapas
Location: address: Palenque, Chiapas, México | locations: Palenque

unique_selling_points: ["Hands-on regional cooking experience","Learn to prepare traditional mole segureza","Visit a mezcal ranch with local varieties","Cultural immersion in Miahuatlán's traditions","Interaction with local mezcaleros"]
one_line_summary: Hands-on cooking and mezcal experience in Miahuatlán, Oaxaca
bussines_description:
Supplier: Mezcouting
General Description: Title: Traditional seasonings of Miahuatlán, Oaxaca | Description: Today, your local guide in English will take you on a hands-on experience of approximately nine hours, where you will cook some regional dishes of the area traditionally through your teacher’s knowledge; you will learn how to prepare something as simple as corn tortillas and even something more complex as següeza, a not well-known pre-hispanic mole eaten only within certain communities or specific events. Enjoy this experience in a mezcal ranch with different typical corn varieties of the region, delight yourself with the flavors of the different types of mezcal, learn about the city’s history, and spend time with the inhabitants in the natural environment of Miahuatlán, home of local mezcaleros, cultural traditions, architectural history, and cultural richness.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Cocina & Mezcal in Miahuatlán - 9h - ENG | serviceDescription: Cocina & Mezcal in Miahuatlán | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Oaxaca

unique_selling_points: ["Sustainable sailing using wind power","Visit to the iconic Pirates Channel","Exploration of multiple cenotes with vibrant waters","Bird sanctuary visit with diverse species","Educational focus on mangroves and ecosystem importance"]
one_line_summary: Sail through Bacalar's stunning seven-color lagoon with eco-friendly activities
bussines_description:
Supplier: Veleando Ando
General Description: Title: Sail on a catamaran through the lagoon of the seven colors | Description: You will begin your tour at the Bacalar dock where you will board a catamaran sailboat accompanied by your local guide in Spanish. This shared experience lasts 3 to 4 hours, and you will start sailing towards the south of the lagoon. During the tour you will enjoy fresh fruit, fruit water, water or beer while observing and learning about the importance of the mangroves. It is a perfect opportunity to connect with nature in a sustainable way since you will only need the wind to navigate and avoid polluting the ecosystem.

You will visit the famous Pirates Channel where you will have the opportunity to swim and snorkel. You will continue to the Cenote de la Bruja or Cenote Negro, here you will also be able to explore its waters and enjoy the colors of the different depths. You will also visit the Isla de Los Pájaros, a locally declared sanctuary, where you will see several species of birds and the famous shades of blue of the Bacalar Lagoon. Finally, you will venture to Cenote Esmeralda, an area of great beauty where the crystal clear water flows into the lagoon.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Collective Premium tour - 4h - SPA | serviceDescription: Collective Premium tour | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Quintana Roo
Location: address: Veleando Ando, Carretera Federal 307, Bacalar, Quintana Roo, México | locations: Bacalar

unique_selling_points: ["Encounter with whale sharks","Reef snorkeling","Conservation-focused sport fishing","Marine biodiversity exploration"]
one_line_summary: Exciting marine adventure with whale sharks, snorkeling, and fishing in Nayarit
bussines_description:
Supplier: Nayarit Adventures
General Description: Title: Discovering the Marine World from Puerto San Blas | Description: Embark on this shared adventure of approximately 10 hours as you delve into the wonders of the marine world from the historic Port of San Blas. As you set sail for the open sea, a journey of discovery awaits you in the company of your local Spanish-speaking guide and a group of travelers. If luck is on your side, you can marvel at the presence of playful dolphins and giant manta rays gliding underwater. But the real gem of this experience is the encounter with the whale shark, an amazing species.

You will also have the opportunity to enjoy sport fishing, an activity full of excitement and adrenaline. You will experience the gratification of releasing it, promoting the conservation of marine species. To complete this aquatic adventure, you will have the opportunity to dive into the reefs and enjoy snorkeling. Explore the underwater world as you swim among schools of colorful fish and unique marine species.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Swimming with whale sharks - 10h - SPA | serviceDescription: Swimming with whale sharks | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Nayarit
Location: address: Sebastián Lerdo de Tejada Pte. 23, Centro, 63000 Tepic, Nay. | locations: Puerto Vallarta

unique_selling_points: ["Private transportation and local guide","Exclusive visits to emblematic sites","Tasting traditional Mexican food at hidden stalls","Visit to one of Latin America's top museums","Discovering secret spots in Chapultepec Forest"]
one_line_summary: Comprehensive cultural tour of Mexico City's historic sites, museums, and hidden spots
bussines_description:
Supplier: México a pie
General Description: Title: Treasures of the Capital: Historic Center, Anthropology & Chapultepec Forest | Description: Your private transportation will pick you up to take you to the Historic Center of Mexico City, declared a World Heritage Site by UNESCO. At the meeting point your local guide will be waiting for you to start a walking tour of approximately 4 hours through the streets of the Aztec capital. During this experience you will learn about the history and gastronomy of Mexico while visiting the most emblematic places of the historic center such as the Metropolitan Cathedral, the ruins of the ancient Aztec city, the Palace of Fine Arts and the Postal Palace, you will also make a few stops at local food stalls and restaurants that only your guide knows and taste traditional Mexican food including tacos and a dessert. 

You will continue with a guided tour of approximately 2.5 hours to one of the most important museums in Latin America and the world. It was built in the 1960s by architect Pedro Ramirez Vasquez and has 22 rooms designed to preserve Mexico"s rich indigenous heritage. You will tour the museum"s main collections while learning about the history of pre-Hispanic cultures and appreciating some of the most important pieces of pre-Columbian Mexico such as the Aztec Calendar, the Olmec Colossal Head, and the famous Mask of Pakal. Finally you will walk through parts of the Chapultepec forest discovering some of the secret places of this place. Return to your lodging.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Historic Center, Tortilla Crawl, Anthropology M - 8h - SPA | serviceDescription: Historic Center, Tortilla Crawl, Anthropology M | serviceType: Operadora local | destinationName: Mexico Area
Location: address: Mexico City, CDMX, México | locations: Mexico City

unique_selling_points: ["Private guided experience in Cobá","In-depth exploration of Mayan architecture","Learn about the cultural significance of Cobá"]
one_line_summary: Explore the ancient Mayan city of Cobá with a private guided tour.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Micaias Canche
General Description: Title: Guided Walking Tour of the Arqueological Site of Cobá | Description: Today, you will meet your English-speaking guide at the meeting point to begin your approximately 2-hour private experience. Together, you will head to the Coba Archaeological Zone, where you will take a tour of this site of great historical importance in Quintana Roo as one of the largest and most powerful ancient Mayan cities. You will visit architectural structures such as the Nohoch Mu Pyramid, the Coba Group, the Macanxoc Group and the Chumuc Mul Group and learn about their history and cultural impact. At the end of the tour, your experience will be over and you can return to your hotel on your own.
Service Details: fullServiceDescription: Guided walking tour of the AS of Cobá - 1h45min - ENG | serviceDescription: Guided walking tour of the AS of Cobá | serviceType: Guía | destinationName: Quintana Roo
Location: address: Cobá, Quintana Roo, México https://maps.app.goo.gl/resXEJcZaChzD8ef8 | locations: Cobá

General Description: Title: Lake Bacalar romantic tour in Quintana Roo | Description: Today, your local guide in Spanish will wait for you at the meeting point to go on a tour of approximately three hours through Lake Bacalar. You will leave before sunset to appreciate the sun going down during the journey and enjoy this natural show accompanied by the water tranquility, a musician who will support you to liven up your evening, a cheese board, a wine bottle of your choice, chocolates, and strawberries. Next, you will navigate through calm and less known places; or visit the most emblematic of the lake. Finally, the photo service will capture the beautiful night"s memory, which you will never forget before finishing this experience.

one_line_summary: Explore a family-owned coffee plantation with hands-on harvest experience in Chiapas.
bussines_description:
Supplier: Cinco Lagos
General Description: Title: Tour of a coffee plot | Description: Today, you will have the opportunity to embark on a journey of approximately two hours through a family-owned plot dedicated to coffee cultivation. Your transport and a guide, who speaks Spanish, will be waiting to take you to the plot, located about 30 minutes from your accommodation. Upon arrival, you will start a walk during which you will have the chance to observe the coffee plants in their natural environment. Your guide will explain the complete coffee process, from planting to harvest. If your visit coincides with the harvest season (December to April), you will have the opportunity to pick the coffee beans yourself. At the conclusion of the designated time for the visit, the transport will take you back to your accommodation, marking the end of this enriching experience.
